SFpbm0VjgswuCiGu1vikKQ.text: I dine here for lunch about once a week because of the convenience of its location. Food and service is consistently good, but could be better. I am a huge fan of their ahi tuna salad, and truffle fries.

photos.caption: Photo of Umami Burger -  SLS Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Roasted butternut squash &amp; quinoa salad with ahi tuna
Photo of Umami Burger -  SLS Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Truffle fries and their array of sauces

7LHEIGfHnuJjf5DnMQUeWg.text: Seriously, this place sucks.  Get over the hype that this chain is from LA.  Get over the fact that Las Vegans want to be Los Angelenos, and eat whatever they eat.  This establishment still rates high on the suck-o-meter.  2000mg glutamate-ridden burgers.  Fries that even Ronald does better. And what is this? No milkshakes?!?!  What kind of burger place doesn't offer a milkshake? Ah they have pre-packaged ice cream sandwiches from CoolHaus though, come on!  Here is why Umami gets one star instead of none...because I can use their outside entrance to gain access to the SLS quicker.  Milkshake, figure it out...it's ice cream, milk...and a god damn blender.

oFp5LWrshhoU0pVhYwyOYA.text: We didn't eat at Umami proper, there was an hour and 45 minute wait because the World Series was on, but was able to order some of their food at a casino floor bar. We had their Manly burger, which had house beer cheddar, bacon lardons, smoked salt onion strings, ketchup and mustard. Burger was mediocre. First, it came out lukewarm. Second, the burger tasted like it was previously frozen with no flavor. Thirdly, for $13 it was small and unimpressive. We also had their fries, which I thought were pretty good. Almost McDonald's like but still decent. But, again, $5 for them was fairly steep.

dqcUJQBmWMQiY6zV3HGffw.text: I wanted this place to be better, but as my 3-star review suggests, it's A-OK at least. It's a restaurant/sports book, and I wouldn't say one step's on the other one's toes too much. There's something about the food though, it doesn't taste the same as other locations. Granted, I haven't been here since they opened, so maybe I need to see how it is now. I expected this place to be a regular spot I'd frequent, but the first visit just didn't wow me enough to come back. Our server was great, but he actually wasn't a permanent employee here, they were still sorting out staffing at the SLS and one the hotel's departments had workers that were placed here. You could kind of see confusion though with the other servers at other tables. Our burgers, fries and dessert just weren't as good as I remember the SF location being (I even took the day off of work to make the venture into deep SF to indulge)... and it just didn't.. umami. I think anyone who hasn't gone to previous locations though will like this place well enough. The SLS itself is all kinds of blah, so that probably has something to do with my overall aversion to coming back. Vegas has a ton of burger options and this place needs to step it up if it's going to survive (which I really hope it does, Vegas economy doesn't need another hotel closing).

vjDIQGms-56nrXftkECE3g.text: Good food, and outstanding beer selection, and terrific service. What's not to like?  Sure, the prices are a tad higher than I'd like, but the Cali burger I ordered was terrific and the truffle fries are addictive.  My server, Sonny, was likewise super.  Great please.

booEcI1RLPKScLvEv_4GTw.text: We stayed at the SLS and saw that they had an Umami Burger so we dropped by for a quick late night bite. We came by around 9:50pm, right before closing and we're graciously sat by the friendly upbeat manager. Service was quick, efficient and friendly. The Manly Burger and Truffle fries were great. The Truffle cheese on the fries were just right and the burger was cooked to a medium rare perfection. I definitely recommend Umami Burger!!

n5zvF2aL7QmfhvuaxoHmzw.text: First time trying the so called famous burger place , a little disappointed I was , thought it would wow me. Definatly tasted like a normal burger you get from any local burger place just a lot smaller and more pricey. The truffle fries ain't all that either. Hands down the best burger place in Vegas is Gordan Ramsey BurgR and order euro  . Ps I'm a guy that loves my burgers lol.  BurgR  Shake shack  Ketchup  FukU  The best places on the strip .

STXN3T24SZwD-CtsX0-cZA.text: Amazing burgers here, I got the manly burger. Even their fries were amazing! It was a bit loud in there though, I sometimes had to shout to the person right across from me. Otherwise, still a great place to eat, staff was really nice

r-HmGT_FX9Uf6LprnQ_j-Q.text: I love Umami so I was excited to see this in the SLS.  It is visually different than any other Umami I have visited before.  I get it, it's a sports bar but I think Umami could have been as successful if they kept their modern design vs. the "Man Cave" vibe.   The pickle platter was bomb!   I love funky flavors and each item brought a flavorful kick to my palette.  The pickles were very craveable. My husband and I shared a burger, hot dog, and onion rings.  Onion rings are good but eat quickly or else you will see a pool of grease.  The other thing different at this location is the lack of homemade ketchup.  We received regular ketchup in a squeeze bottle and not the brownish red homemade stuff that we are used to. I would definitely go back and recommend it!

4n3uDe63cAV3FlS6Wsetfg.text: Been to this place several times. I think they should have a sign that say, "we don't want to make money" out front. Random people sitting around watching sports at tables, maybe 30 people in the place, 10 might be ordering food. Random servers walking around talking to each other and sometimes some people sitting around get a menu. I came in to bet and maybe get some food.  So this happened both times. Sat around watching a game for about 30 minutes. Asked for a menu from one of the servers that seemed to be just randomly walking around. Got one after a while. Then waited for someone to take my order, oh for about 45 minutes? This last time I just left.  Food is pretty good actually. Burgers are juicy, chicken wings are tasty and prices are just fine. Just whoever manages the place obviously has no clue what they are doing. Just managers and servers walking around, looking around with no organization or idea of what's going on. 2 stars still because of the food, sportsbook and nice TVs, but they are gonna close up..I mean, that's easy to see after about 10 minutes in the place.

4MJTZH1XgFXuf5_Xq6bpoQ.text: Umami Burger is one of my favorite burger joints in the heart of Las Vegas. You can taste the quality and flavor in their burgers, not that big or with a lot of fixin's (maybe you have to request?) but just right to fill you up.  Fries are normal but the apps are good including the nachos.

fbi8gsQMTuYkecDCEhyj7Q.text: I always love coming to Vegas because the food is worth it. Umami at SLS is definitely worth stopping by. From service to drinks and the ultimately; the food, this place rocks!

phw1mDNSrWOw_1yzjhh0yQ.text: The burger was tasty but it was small and pricey. I watched an NFL football game there. It was a nice atmosphere. The best thing is that there is a Sports Book inside the restaurant.  You can collect your winnings when the game is over.  I did.

RPBKKMpsFhWj5yxnSLu_hw.text: A-OK is the name of the game over at Umami Burger. Everything I tasted was good, but not great and for the most part, wouldn't warrant a return visit unless I was staying in the hotel. The seating itself is a bit wacky, as it's combined with a sports book and outdoor area, so make sure you get there at the right time if it's Sunday or Monday night. People are staying at those tables for a loooong time. Items ordered.. Buffalo chicken loaded "potato nachos" - chips with cheese and chinks of buffalo chicken on it. Hard to get a piece of chicken onto the chip. Finger food time!  Black bean burger (chipotle black bean patty, Cotija cheese, guacamole, street-cart pickles, cilantro) - Very, very average. On the dry side and quick to crumble.  Truffle fries - Good fries, with or without the truffle cheese. Came with three dipping sauces which were all unmemorable.  Beers- not a huge selection but some nice stuff. Check their webpage for drink specials.   Bonus: There's a good manager in the house and the truffle fries are comp'd with Yelp check-in

19gy67Wfdb0sabYenQ26VQ.text: The burger was good but not as good as the California locations I've tried. Also we ordered our patties cooked differently but they looked identical.  Good but not Umami Burger awesome.

xGF7Lhb4puJWJ7EabAS7MQ.text: Ok, I don't usually give bad reviews, however I had my father-in-law with me from out of town and told him of a good sports bar.  However upon arrival, the waitress named "Natalia" gave us attitude from the get go and said that unless we inserted $20 in the bar machines,no drinks could be Comped.  Mind you I had already spent $40 and my father in law $60.  This made no since, until a party of 8 women sat next to us, then she was elated to serve them, even though they had not played any of the bar machines.  I guess "Natalia" only serves those who order directly from the bar.  Not good for locals trying to show relatives a good time.  Thank you "Natalia"

abYipYxnVP8AQhYdUa4-NA.text: Talk about amazing service! Megan was so attentive and knowledgeable. She made the lunch experience even better, thank you for that. Also the manager Joe is really funny and nice, so kudos to those two!

HI6JqqrIiJgffgjWOG-efA.text: Umami Burger sucks. They only have like 4 burgers to choose from, the rest is a drink menu. The Cali burger was so mushy. Garbage. The service was good though.

YZfGlZsrJmczdu4oRuh2nA.text: Great place great food had the truffle burger was so good it melts in your mouth I also had the beet salad as appetizer was so tasty will definitely be coming back here again. The staff was friendly and gave us good info on what to order

bEy59Dwce4slNF3Of1pKYQ.text: Great drinks, service and food.  Truffle fries. Yum.   Courtney did a great job!

5q3idINM6VCY8QKkH7oxzA.text: Came in for Monday night football and had great service from our bartender Liz. Great drinks and food. Had the manly burger. Soon good!

photos.caption: Photo of Umami Burger -  SLS Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Manly burger

oOKpeT6zZ5cQ7NYRqyAi2A.text: Food was tasty enough. Small portions for what you pay for, and the $13 burgers don't even come with fries! Some claim "double patties" but it's really just the single patty cut in half. With a group of 6 people, the waitress tacked on a 20% gratuity tip without informing us, and the receipt still had a place to fill in an additional tip. I would say 20% or more is what we usually tip for decent service, but our service was pretty subpar. The waitress came by to take or order, and drop off the check. Busboy brought food and drinks. When the waitress was asked almost anything, she was very attitudinal with us for no reason. Not worth 20%. They don't have a basic burger for, say, a ten year old. Instead of informing us the cheapest option is to take a couple things off a fancier burger to make something simple, they wanted to charge us per topping. Good thing I asked before she put our order in - got the same burger for dollars cheaper! Probably will not go back.

msg4UmkJ0CgdCK2PnvyCoQ.text: I was lucky enough to have Umami Burger via Room Service, so I can't really speak to the service. As for the delivery guy, he was super friendly, and the food came quickly.  I ordered the Truffle Burger Royal (the one with the egg on top), the sweet potato fries, and the pickle platter.  Everything was just the right size, not too small, and not too large where you feel like death afterwords.  The fries were a little cold, but delicious. Really delicious.  Plus the temperature was totally forgivable, given the fact that I was able to enjoy them in the privacy of my hotel room.  I found the burger to be something truly special, and would order it over, and over again if I could.  The meat was perfectly cooked, the egg was perfectly runny, and the compilation of ingredients was quite spectacular.  The only reason I can't give Umami Burger 5 stars, is because much like other people, I found the ketchup to be pretty gross.  I don't understand the reason for that exact recipe, or consistency, but I felt like it actually took away from the meal, rather than added to it. I'm a pretty big stickler for ketchup, so I really hope they decide to go another route.

MU3iCMNx3WGuq6MbzU2Ohw.text: Love this place! I've been to Umami Burger in NYC and it's excellent; honestly, no different at this location. The service is great. Our waiter was very friendly and attentive. I had the Greenbird Burger - delicious! The fries were a bit over salted but still really good. Drinks are good; I had the Black Raz Mojito which wasn't overly strong but still pretty good. Prices are high.. that's the only drawback to this place (seems more like NYC than Las Vegas). But if you're just visiting Vegas and need some good food and beer (they have quite a selection), then it's worth it!

2RozrbhEgbY3kmYOBw1V0g.text: Very friendly staff. Great Burgers. Unique menu for a burger place. Umami stands for savory taste. Savory Taste is one of the five basic taste. The ketchup with truffle is something you don't experience every day. Definitely will come back. This is my 3rd visit, Never disappointed.

photos.caption: Photo of Umami Burger -  SLS Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Game Day Specials. Not a bad seat in the house. 97.1 set up at umamiburger at SLS

itY2rVch0VYd1EO7xo4YnQ.text: Tashja was an amazing waitress. She helped us out with the menu and was able to go over everything in terms or ingredients and sauces. Awesome!

oOPwsjIH3Esk-Wj-dG6TLw.text: Customer service was rude, food took over 60 minutes, still didn't come out  SO WE WALKED OUT   Warning:: MENU IS DIFFERENT THAN UMAMI BURGER IN LA!  Had FOX news on blaring over what was supposed to be GAMEDAY.  Fox News guys really?!  Asked multiple times before they put the football audio on   Didn't even bother to bring the appetizers before the food or refill water until the check came? What sense does that make?   HORRIBLE HORRIBLE

dB-TSBPFwCVbD2_vZrJ62g.text: 1.  server was nice but the service was bad.  food took a while to arrive and was broken up (ff showed up after i was finished the burger). 2.  the burger was average.  I had the umami standard burger. overall the burger was not juicy, rather dry.   could not find the mushroom that was supposed to be on the burger.  the sauce was really ketchup,  the sweet potatoes were undercooked.  had the dessert of warm cookie with ice cream.  if by warm it meant room tempature, well it met expectations.  the ice cream tasted like ice cream you get when you buy 5 gallons for a dollar.  too wast of money 3.  speaking of money, this place is way overpriced.  take an uber and go somewhere else, it may end up costing the same but the quality would likely be better.   4.  if you are a nonsmoker, you get the enjoy inhaling smoke. 5.  lots of tvs but you only get to watch the games they want on the tv.  i asked to have a specific game on the tv that is situated inside my booth. "we will see what we can do"  nothing was done.

4UGyqZd5xsTm4wlZjPkFuA.text: I was really excited to try this place out. Burgers are one of my favorite food groups and I am always interested in trying something new. This place was just so-so however.   Pros: the meat in the burgers is really well cooked and super juicy. The beer cheese on the manly fries is superb. I also really liked the sweetness of the Umami ketchup.   Cons: too much bun in top and not enough on the bottom. The buns get really really soggy. The fries also get pretty soggy from all the sauce they put on them.   Flavored were very good, but in all aspects I have had better. It's a solid restaurant though. The wait staff was very attentive and friendly and food came out quickly. I'm just not crazy about any if that food.

6vBDVmqHJrrjf9VkAnpwhg.text: I really want to give this  place 4 stars but I just can't. When we arrived and said we wanted to watch football, eat and drink, we were told if we sat inside it was a minimum of $50 per person. Wait, what? Outside there was no minimum. Being a gorgeous  Vegas day, the choice was obvious. Outside was a pleasant roomy space with many TVs. All the games were on, and our server was super nice. She was so nice that I really don't want this review to reflect on her. Now here's where the stars go down. Apparently there were some flies around (um it's outside) and so they turned on some fans to dispel them. Normally that would be fine, but these were super turbo fans( seriously it sounded like we were next to a jet airplane) and we couldn't hear  the games or each other. They did turn the one over us off after we said something.  I did enjoy the truffle beet salad and the ahi burger was very good( and very messy), but our orders took forever and were sometimes forgot. I'm not sure who dropped the ball but they do need to work on these problems.  After getting the bill it was very obvious we were on the strip. We could have sat inside after all. Will we come back??? Unfortunately, I just can't say for sure.

photos.caption: Photo of Umami Burger -  SLS Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States

gxX2dNGEx19oBq60EVDGzg.text: Mandy was AMAZING. She was informative, and explained every item that we asked on the menu. Great experience due to her. Thank you Mandy!!

5_ASGLP-vCoQW-L3RHtaDQ.text: Dog food would be better.  The nachos served with cheese from a pump.  The burger was dry and weird.  The fries were... fries.  Two stars because they had beer.

IV9EYe-zHRjw2QvxrwRAcg.text: Solid beer selection, a million simultaneous sports ball events on the televisions, more umami than you could possibly handle. AJ was our server, and she provided perfect service, but more importantly, some clutch Pokemon Go advice. Come for the umami, stay for the Pokemon Go tips.

P0uJkzDKZjWn_GfMSseURQ.text: My favorite restaurant! I've been to Umami Burgers all over the country and each time leave feeling full and satisfied. The food is always on point but what made my visit above and beyond was our waiter Carlos. He was super friendly, fast, and attentive. This establishment is doing everything right and hiring quality employees. I'll be back next time I take a trip to sin city!

0hbiO9ZVSk6JEZYJBfTQlg.text: Umami Y-Umami!! Umami burger is the burger to get! The truffle fries are thin-cut with a cheesy sauce and fresh herbs, the sweet potato fries are sweetened and seasoned with cinnamon! We also got a warm gooey chocolate chip cookie with a scoop of smooth and creamy chocolate ice cream! AJ was our server and she was awesome!

FSMXCTnTjgH0X4n6UH89dg.text: Updating my review... I came back to vegas and stayed at the SLS again and couldnt wait to come back here. To my disappointment they discontinued their onion rings. The onion rings were the best part about this place. Also their kale salad has changed, nothing like i remember it. Probably wont ever come back here. The giant pretzal was good though.

Ed_8At1mOJWNn14qVI2suA.text: This is my favorite burger of all time but the service might be the absolute worst. Combined with high prices (it's a casino location). Try the truffled fries and truffle or hatch burger. Also, coke comes in a glass bottle! My wife's favorite part of the experience.

photos.caption: Photo of Umami Burger -  SLS Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Truffle fries and especial burger.

Io-vxM_nohX11Qljlx7KWg.text: Came to Las Vegas for a business trip and decided to come here for dinner. Best burger I've ever had. You could tell the ground beef was high quality. The waiter was very knowledgeable about the menu and friendly. I ordered sweet potato fries as a side and a stella on draft. Both delicious with the Hatch burger. Wish there was one closer to where I live!

FjWHetZhZ3dcPysU_b0U5Q.text: The service here was good. This place had won "GQ burger of the year", so me being a burger enthusiast you have to believe I went in there with tremendous expectations. After I ordered their Unami burger, I was kind of disappointed because it was not as great as I expected. The atmosphere was good. Nice waitress, but decent food. Might go again, not sure.

C98y2EYsN5pYGSJ5Ypv4jg.text: Ordered to go and they had you wait standing by the reception desk, didn't even offer you to sit down..waited for 1/2 hour standing. My daughter was disappointed for the small burger she ordered.

vvTQikdeRlkzaccwel5jnQ.text: Good sports bar and definately a down to earth place in busy Las Vegas. Umami Burger has a wide selection of local beers and convincing burgers with exceptionally ingredient such as thin tacos, eggs or avocado. The sweet potatoe fries were homemade and crunchy without beeing burned or dry. The burger meat was jucy, the bread had been fresh and the whole burger was  harmonious. Check-in on yelp and you recieve a free portion of fries or a beer.

photos.caption: Photo of Umami Burger -  SLS Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States

px-2KmwKq6qsLX0yROAmdw.text: Great food. The service is good, but good be better in some aspects. Everyone is mostly friendly.   We ordered several items and pretty much shared everything. I really liked some of the spicy sauces that were brought out on the Chinese white spoons. The waitress explained them but I would have liked if she informed you what to pair them. I wasn't sure if went with something specific or if it was just for the table or etc.    My burger was delicious. I added one of the spicy sauces and that made it that much better. The pretzel was the biggest one I have ever seen. It was really good. Soft, fluffy and Perfect. I also really liked the fried oysters - it had a really great flavor. Truffle fries were delicious as expected. Umami, we will definitely be back especially since I work basically next door. Yum!

Photo of Umami Burger -  SLS Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Giant pretzel. Very good. Soft,  fluffy and delicious
Photo of Umami Burger -  SLS Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken wings were good and somewhat spicy.

3MxRWVrjvp0WQQ_YdOvUnQ.text: Food was excellent the slim garlic fries were insanely addicting and good. Sweet potatoes fries were awesome as well. Burger was on the money.

uujtemfwUpdT4Y4LMLGK2Q.text: Was surprised about this place. Though the name says sports bar and it is the food is far from standard bar food.     I decided to do a truffle night.  Truffled beet salad  truffled fries. Truffled burger.  I would put it in my top burgers ever.  Salad was huge and could be shared with 4. Fries we're awesome.   My friend had burger with lardons it was fantastic and Garlic fries  she liked my fries better   Are server was a stud.  Again a shocker that this place has this high end stuff.

Photo of Umami Burger -  SLS Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lettuce wrapped poke
Photo of Umami Burger -  SLS Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Truffle fries

Aq-QLQWNcmGhjLOwLUZs7w.text: These burgers are amazing! Definitely a must place to eat while staying at the SLS hotel.

Od15HlvNO9BZdUsGx8UWyw.text: So we were in Circus Circus and we we wondering what was nearby to eat at. It said this was .6 miles away. Liessssss. I think the GPS inside CC is kinda off... but anyways, we trekked our way to SLS to eat some burgers. If you enter through the Las Vegas Blvd entrance, just walk to your left and you'll see Umami quickly.  Got our seats and table quickly and our server came over and asked us if we wanted anything to drink. Water please! And he left us to go get us water while we looked at the menu.   I ended up getting the manly burger: manly $12.95  House beer-cheddar, bacon lardons, smoked-salt onion strings, Umami house ketchup, mustard spread.  and they also have a Yelp Check in offer, of free fries or a draft beer if I recall correctly, as we opted for the fries.  The server came by regularly to refill our water, but all our attentions were to the many TVs that lined the Umami "walls" (they're not really walls, as you can still see and feel casino of SLS outside). They even have a personal TV for each table. However, I do not know if you can change the channel of the TV next to you.  Manly burger- Onion strings. After taking a few pictures and enjoying the mix of bacon on medium meat, along with the addition of ketchup and the mustard, you feel manlier. Just kidding. It's mostly because of the bacon and onion strings, along with the flavor you get with everything else that makes it come at ya ;) Tasty but I don't know.. $12.95? :/   Their truffle fries were heavy but amazing. It did not make me sick like the ones in the Irvine Spectrum did. It's a good amount for two people to share (so make sure you don't get too many if you have the Yelp check in offer).  Service is attentive. Even with the college football game of the week going on, the server came to us and asked if we had everything, if we needed anything else, etc.  Maybe I'll try Umami again in Socal, because of the LV location~

MbbDVh2wcFnozh57DmML7Q.text: It is amazing that I live in Los Angeles and the first time I try Umami Burger is in Vegas. To tell you the truth, I was a little disappointed. Perhaps, it may have been my fault that I got a Turkey burger over a Cow burger.....but nonetheless I still got a burger.   Turkey burger: 2.5/5- The buns were fluffy and soft. I do have to admit that I thoroughly enjoy a great burger when the buns are fresh. I hate stale buns, what's the point of that. Secondly, I was mildly obsessed with the fact that my burger had sprouts on it. Double points. Thirdly, this is where I couldn't do it anymore. This green salty sauce was horrible. It overpowered the burger and it was extremely salty for my palate. UGH!  Truffle Fries: 3/5- I could go on about these. I love cheese on my fries and even better truffle oil. I must say that the truffle oil was a little bit on the lighter side, but the cheese made up for it.   Sweet Potato Fries: 2/5- Why is their sugar on these? You may want to let patrons know that it is covered in sugar. I was thoroughly saddened by the sugar on these fries.....  Poke: 2/5- My fault for ordering poke at a burger place. It just sounded good at the time. Too much sauce that covered the poke. Not the best poke ever.....

photos.caption: Photo of Umami Burger -  SLS Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Veggie burger
Photo of Umami Burger -  SLS Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Turkey burger

uwUuWwU3srRyMstPr3el8Q.text: Umami~~"the beautiful taste" and so it was! Went for lunch and was taken care of by "Charlie" our server who made for the best lunch ever by his friendly personality and outstanding service he gave us. He really went out of his way to make sure are glasses were always full and if we needed anything he would be more than glad to get it for us!   We decided to order one Green Bird "Turkey Burger" and one Original "Umami Burger" along with Sweet Potato Fries and onion rings.  The Umami was oooozing with flavor & well the Turkey Burger was okay I should know better.......dammit next time Im not playing anymore I only order BIG JUICY STEAK BURGER "UMAMI.      Charlie our server also brought out a complimentary birthday sweet treat for my bestie which was really sweet, I definitely will return for a  mouthwatering yummy, deliciousness "Umami Burger Binge" when in Vegas!

Photo of Umami Burger -  SLS Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sweet times with my bestie!
Photo of Umami Burger -  SLS Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Green Bird!

OONfuB4eTHr54g6XOpO5zw.text: What does Umami mean? Since I have never been there I googled it and this was the best answer.  Umami is a basic taste like sweet, sour or bitter. Umami comes from glutamic acid, which is an amino acid - a form of protein. It gives food a "hearty" or "meaty" taste to it. There are specific taste buds on the tongue to pick up on it.   So after reading this, it only made me want to go there even more. As luck would have it, the Umami Burger that is located inside of SLS was the designated restaurant for Social Sundays that day. It is an event every sunday where a particular restaurant takes 50 percent off its menu prices.   So me and two other buddies meet up there around 8:30. I was kind of surprised the place was not that busy given the fact that it was social sunday. Im thinking great service should ge a given.  Since it was my first time, I went with their namesake, the Umami Burger also known as the "Original" ($12.00) and an order of Tempura Onion Rings ($5.00). My buddies both got the Sunny Side also known as the "Truffle Especiale" ($14). They also opted for Korean Fries ($6.00) and Truffle Fries ($5.50). Note: These prices are what is in the menu so what we paid was half of what you see.  The Umami Burger has parmesan frico, shittake mushroom, roasted tomato, carmelized onions and Umami house ketchup. After the first bite I knew that I had picked the right burger. Definitely lots of flavor. The beef patty was very juicy and from the looks and taste of it, it was cooked medium. This burger might just end up being my usual.  The Tempura Battered Onion Rings had the nice crispiness to it just like how tempura is supposed to be. You can tell that it was cooked fresh and not frozen simply because the onion itself was still semi crispy. They cooked it just right.  The Korean Fries were sweet potato fries topped off with kimchi, scallions, goat cheese, and Korean ketchup. The sweet potato fries by themselves were already good but when you eat one that has the above mentioned toppings on it look out! It had a bit of a kick to it but very tolerable.  The Truffle Fries were shoe string fries smothered with melted truffle cheese. Nice flavor combination of crunch and seasoning of the truffle cheese.  Im glad we shared all three sides because we would of never gotten to taste the variety of each plate. Im assuming that their Maple Bacon Fries were really popular because that was the first thing we wanted to order but our said they ran out of maple syrup.  As for the service, eh, it had great potential when we first got there seeing that the place was not that busy. Our server took our orders and got them to us in a timely manner. Now thats where the service pretty much stopped. We didnt see our server for quite sometime and ended up flagging down another server just so we could get refills on our waters and sodas. One of my friends had already used up most of his napkin to so he asked for another one but never got it.  So overall, the fact that it it was 50 percent off and everything we ordered was delicious, that deserves 5 stars. But the lack of service after receiving our food kind of ruined my experience. So 1 star for bad service and 5 stars for great food which was half off. So there's your ok rating of 3 stars. Im hoping that the bad service was just a fluke and that my next visit will be better. If it is then I will update this accordingly.  Yelp 2015 Review #26 524 overall

LfeByg_4DP8GVOXc-rzt7A.text: My husband and I were fed up with the overpriced dining options available at the Las Vegas Convention Center during the Wizard World Comic Con, so we opted to dine at SLS instead and ended up choosing Unami Burger for our dinner spot. According to the online menu, there's a black bean burger available. The menu lies. There was, however, a vegetarian "burger" option that was pointed out to me by the hostess. Salvation!  SLOPPY MAMI ($12): I'd best describe this as a vegetarian sloppy joe. The burger was topped with tasty lentils (so tasty it made me wonder why I'm not including more lentils in my diet), a fried onion "haystack" (I hate onions but actually liked these), and slithers of jalapenos. Melted cheese held everything together. I was impressed with this Sloppy Mami. The downsides? Not enough jalapeno and it comes a la carte. 4/5   THIN FRIES ($4): You simply cannot eat a burger without a side of fries. Thumbs up for these fries! 4/5  BEEF NACHOS ($10): I loved that the nachos came with a side dish of salsa. Who does that?? No one, that's who. My husband super duper liked this dish. 4/5  SERVICE: The food came out within 7 minutes of ordering, but service was intermittent. There's room for improvement. 3/5   VIBE: The layout is kind of weird since the SLS Sports Book is inside Unami. Weird, I know. There's Unami diners, and then there's people lounging on sofas watching sports on TV. The restaurant was pretty rambunctious, noise wise.     Worth a Return Visit? I'm hoping to come back on Social Sundays to score a 50% discount!  YELP 100 CHALLENGE 2015: #96

y6Ep7fRnwc6zuc5p-fyj3w.text: Talk about amazing customer service!   We showed up interested in experience the much-hyped about Umami inside the new SLS. Immediately we were greeted by the staff, our server, Mandy made fantastic recommendations since it was the first time for us here. I had the truffle burger, it was really really good! EdCdivMs14lub86z37weRw.text: The atmosphere here is a little different than the usual Umami at the LA locations and I honestly didn't mind that all. It's a little sports barsy compared to the intimate/trendy vibe of the other locations. I have been to several Umami's and the U-mini (cheaper but still as tasty spinoff of Umami) in Westwood and I think consistency in their food has always been key at their restaurants. Their menu is exactly the same as the California locations as well.   Loved that we got seated at a massive booth right away, service was so also pretty good and our server took our orders right away.  We did get our waters right away.. However, we probably waited for about 20 minutes for our burgers to come out. It was a Thursday night and the restaurant was not packed at all.   -Truffle fries were on point, and the server did give me the options for all the sauces (pretty standard) - Truffle burger was great but I think is a little overpriced  - Manly burger was also pretty good with the lardons and the onion rings however it is again, a little overpriced imo..  Umami has really got the flavor of the burgers down but size has always been an issue for me. I've always thought their burgers are a little too tiny for 15 bucks.. and it does leave me a little hungry still after.. I may be a petite Asian girl, but I can sure down a huge ass burger when I want to.

acSyDavrbIrP_xb55iZUTA.text: My friend told me this was the best burger she ever had. As a burger lover, I consider that a personal challenge to eat that burger. We stopped at the Las Vegas location after 6 hours of driving on our way back from the Grand Canyon to Southern California. I was ravenous. I ordered the truffle burger (added roasted tomatoes) and we split truffle fries (blahhhhhh give me my own fries people! Friends who ask to split fries are bad food friends). NOM NOM NOM! o7_50-n8yWW_z95ynP_rpw.text: I've had the original Umami location in LA bookmarked for the longest time, and for whatever reason, we've just never had time to make it there when we're in town. So, when we booked our room for SLS, we knew Umami was definitely going to be one of our meals!  This location inside the SLS is quite large. Not only is it a full service restaurant, but it's also houses the casinos sports book and a beer garden. There's quite a bit of seating throughout the location, but the way it's set up is weird and there seems to be no real uniformity. Alongside seating at the indoor bar, there's small tables, high-tops, and couches for the sports book. Then when you walk outside, you've got more picnic table style seating, and another fairly large bar that's got to be a good 50+ feet long. There's just a lot going on and depending on where you sit, you may not be able to order food or just sit down to enjoy a drink while watching the games. If you are coming strictly for the food though, they do offer text notifications so you can go gamble or do whatever while waiting for a table.  Looking online, it seems like the menu is pretty much the same as at other locations, and there's a good amount of options too. If you're not feeling a burger, they have salads, "Un-Beef" sandwiches and even sausages. The sides are pretty typical for a burger joint and the fries can be customized in a handful of ways. There's 8 burgers to choose from and this Umami is no different from the others as their infamous no substitution rule is in full-effect. Although, they will let you request a different cooking temperature for the meat. Standard cooking temp is medium rare, just so ya know.  We decided on an order of fried pickles to share, and I opted for the Truffle Especiale burger. Oddly enough, after receiving the order, our waitress told us that she wasn't a huge fan of the fried pickles. I couldn't disagree with her more as they were definitely some of the better I've had. The batter was thick, crunchy, flavorful and stuck to the pickle completely. It never fell apart and I liked that the pickle inside wasn't so hot that you couldn't eat it. Adding to the flavor was a nice side of jalapeno ranch that was creamy with just a touch of heat.  Although a bit on the small side, my burger was equally impressive. If you're a fan of truffle, Umami does not disappoint! Topped with both truffle butter and truffle arugula, the flavor is immediately present without being overpowering. The arugula still had a nice crisp texture to it, and it coupled perfectly with the fried egg. Now, these guys are proud of their beef too...and rightfully so! The meat isn't smashed down like meatloaf and on it's own has hints of both sweet and salty flavors. It was juicy and cooked to a perfect medium rare.   With all the commotion going around on their first day, I admittedly expected less than stellar service. That was far from the case and I thought the service was excellent. Apart from her expressing her hatred for the fried pickles, after we ordered them, our waitress was extremely friendly and even a little funny too. I appreciate that she knew the menu well and didn't hesitate to answer a single question. And not only was she on her game, but other servers were checking on us and every other table to make sure drinks were full, etc. The team work and overall ambience was just great!  For a burger joint, the overall prices aren't horrible, but they aren't great either. My burger was $14 and even though I think this was more of a casino thing, I was pretty irritated about paying $5 for a soda. For 2 burgers, 2 drinks and a side, our bill was $55 with tip. I'm also not a huge fan of having all that stuff packed into one location. But the food and service were both very good and I definitely see myself coming back!

jdYv6frAkZhgTL5ahph_oQ.text: fam wanted to see what the umami hype was about...eh...i'm not a burger person, so it was aiight to me...not worth 14 bones...fam thought it was better than avg, but dunno about GQ's "Burger of the Year"...  THE VIBE  |  inside hipster SLS hotel...semi-loud, kool music...outdoor seating avail...sports bar w/ tv @ea booth...  THE FOOD  |  pix to follow...  - sunny side (aka truffle especiale): parmesan frico, fried egg, truffle thyme compound butter, truffled arugula  |  14.  - manly: house beer-cheddar, bacon lardons, smoked-salt onion strings, unami house ketchup, mustard spread  |  12. - side of maple bacon fries: sweet potato fries, maple-braised bacon lardons, rosemary aleppo salt topped w/ chives  |  6. ..actually really good!  - umami (aka the original): parmesan frico, shiitake, roasted tomato, caramelized onions, umami house ketchup  |  12. - side: sweet potato fries, signature sweet salt  |  4.  - greenbird: turkey patty, crushed avo, green cheese, butter lettuce, sprouts, green goddess  |  12. - side:  thin fries  |  4.  Draught Beers Flight  (choose 4)  |  14. - goose island 312 wheat ale - firestone walker union jack - brooklyn lager - new belgium fat tire  Dessert... - salted caramel ice cream in between snickerdoodle cookies  |  7.  THE SERVICE  |  a super friendly guy sat us ...later found out his name is dave...prob a food runner... our waitress was aiight...didn't come around enuf...we had to stop dave sometimes to help when she was MIA...it wasn't hella slow during a friday lunch...  lil bussing too...& that's alwaz annoying to me...  IN CONCLUSION  |  overhyped...skip the $12-14 burgers...  TOTAL  |  out the door for 4 during a late lunch: $120

g_84DwQ3wf0_aZsfk6okSQ.text: Burgers are always on point, sorry but here goes my little rant. While the server we had was amazing, when we originally arrived we wanted to sit outside, when we were rapidly approached by a "harsh" waitress that told us that if we wanted to sit outside we could, but we would have to go order our food and drinks inside ourselves and basically we weren't going to have service. Sooo we look around and there were at least another 4 tables outside with people eating and drinking. So we don't know what was that about, we went back inside and got a table there, so we get the menu, husband and son order beers from their menu and they were not available, so they pick a second choice and once again they were not available, were we not at a bar that specializes in beer and burgers? Anyhoo the server made it up by offering something similar to what was originally requested. Burgers were great but the french fries and the sweet potato fries were seasoned great, but they were cold. Overall it was just a weird experience. This was our second time here, first time we were impressed with the overall experience, that's why we went back. This time was a disappointment.

U4-a4vPQahVe9WKBAPu_zg.text: DO NOT GET THE TURKEY BURGER. It looked like rubbery pieces of white and dark meat held together with meat glue. It was so gross I had to send it back. A couple yrs ago I used to eat the turkey burger at Umami in Costa Mesa on the regular. It was so good I would order two! They used very good quality turkey, I think it was from Diestel farms iirc. Then they started changing it about a year ago so I quit going. This turkey patty they are serving now tasted like processed crap that I remember from the cafeteria in elementary school. I really wish they would go back to using high quality ingredients. I hate it when chains expand quickly and start focussing solely on increasing profits. Customers do notice the difference. The truffle fries were the only good thing we had here. My bro got the Manly Burger and he said it was just ok. The chicken wings tasted old.

uYolFJaNZmp2xMst0QBaqw.text: We went there on Saturday 11/11 after the Rock and Roll 5k. I had been dealing with a headache that was tolerable at the concert, in the crowds, and in the casino. It was so loud in the restaurant that my headache became a full blown migraine and I had to leave before our drinks even arrived. My mom asked for our food to go since I had to leave. The other half of our party got their food (that we had ordered at the same time) and were over half finished before our boxes were brought out.  The food was cold when we got it and despite my mom telling the waitress the checks would be separate ahead of time she only brought one check. In the end the burger was mediocre at best and the fries were inedible, so not worth the price.

ISOM5G2_-nKaCcMdjTgcGQ.text: Meh. Two of my friends ordered the man burger aka cheeseburger with bacon, they ordered it medium well and it came out bleeding, asked for new burgers and they were a little better. Didn't give us extra silverware or napkins. I ordered the turkey burger which was messy, it was good, but I was super hesitant because it didn't appear fully cooked either. Super expensive and sides are a la Carte. I'd rather go some place else

ZQJzMluI4sApBvJGJtZokg.text: Came here opening day last Saturday! Located on the left side of the casino if you're coming in from the main entrance of the SLS Casino.   Party of 3 lunchtime wait was about 45 mins. Leave your name & # w the hostess, get your gambling on, & they'll txt you when the table's ready.   Cocktails are $13. The mule that I ordered was alright. Seeing that it was opening day, I'm sure the kinks will be tweaked out.   Ordered the Royale ($15). Consisted of braised short rib, truffle aioli & truffle cheese on a med-rare burg. Taste and consistency were pretty on point from my usual go-to locations here in LA. Never had the short rib before so that was a nice tasty addition. Sweet potato fries ($4) were good as well. They had all the sauces displayed out on a plate per usual w the small pho spoons.   Service was good. Each booth has a tv that in the future, you'll be able to request a channel change for a certain game I'm sure. Layout of the place is nice. Very open w a lot of tv's & a small lounge area in the middle of the restaurant that reminded me that there's an actual sports book in the restaurant.   **PSA*** NO tots for at least a week!! Was very sad to find that out when I was there. Reason given from the waiter was that the training of the cooking staff had to be perfected before "secret menu" items were brought out. That also means no burger special for a while too.   Overall, it's your usual Umami burger restaurant w the sports book addition. Great burgers w a lot of other menu options as well. If you can't get to LA or NYC, this location will def get the job done for the Umami fix. ENJOY!!

Photo of Umami Burger -  SLS Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Royale!

F-efa65uZoQPs4DzkKAJ3g.text: Umami is new, and it seems that it's just not my taste. Gourmet burgers, maybe, but not my style.   Ambiance: 3 - Located in the Sports Book, Umami definitely has an active feel. It's loud and exciting, but not too busy..The place was organized, but the tables in the middle are TOO close together. We might as well have just pushed our tables together with strangers because it was basically like we were talking to each other. Someone please space the tables away from each other!!!!   Service: 3 - Our server was sweet, but the service was great and fast in the beginning...but very, very slow at the end. Not too fun to be waiting 20-25 minutes just for the check! And there wasn't even that many people around.   Food: 3 - Food was just okay. I got the Truffle Burger, Truffle Fries, and Onion Rings. It's a little sad and disappointing for me to announce that the best thing I ate was the onion rings..and maybe the sauces on the side they gave to us.   I did not like how the truffle burger was just --drenched-- in truffle sauce. It made my entire meal soggy, and that's just not what a burger is about for me. I think if they go easier on the truffle sauce around here, people might like it better because it WAS actually a juicy and well-cooked burger.   The truffle fries were way too salty. We had to constantly wipe salt off of ours. The truffle sauce and cheese that's on it is already pretty salty! Hopefully they will be subtle next time with that seasoning!   When I had wine tasting classes, they taught us that umami was a balance of the tastes on your tongue. Yet, everything was either too salty or too soggy. Find a balance, and you'll get better reviews!

gf1gatMrovQAwnRniy0Ctg.text: Overcooked burger for $15 no fries ? Are u serious, shack shack much better even in n out for $3,99 is better than this burgers. Also very slow service, 50 min to get burger. The cooks go outside and famble for sports instead of cooking properly the meat. Also there is no manager here at 1:36pm. Sad to visit a place like that and spend your money.

03n_vGuOnSOmr1xg6JQZng.text: My favorite burger in the world!!! I always order the truffle burger medium rare! It's the perfect blend of sweet, savory, saltiness, juiciness, umami, and texture. This is the second day in a row coming and I'm ordering the exact same thing again!! It's just tooooo good. I've had billionaire burgers at Holsteins, shake shack, bachi burger, and a few other gourmet burgers, but the truffle burger at umami burger is by far my favorite!!  Little tip: don't ruin the burger with adding additional sauces like ketchup or mayo. Just have it the way it comes from the kitchen. Guaranteed to amaze!!! Also thanks Carlos for being such a dope server!

xECD0l1rQX0xhbrwGE4EEw.text: Booked a booth and table here for Superbowl Sunday. 130 a person included a $20 food credit PP, open bar and the kicker... a nice comfy booth. I forget the hosts name, but big thanks to her as she dialed in our booth and table right next to each other. Also sat us right in front of the video wall which was great for the game.  Positives: - Lots of TVs - Solid Food - Good service (Wish I remember her name, but we did take care of her on top of the auto gratuity) - Sportsbook in the restaurant, which was great for mid game betting  Cons: - Location of the SLS in general. It's a bit off the beaten path - Umami Burger was fine, but walking into the Casino reminded me of some weird mashup of trendy LA and Fremont street. - Some interesting characters walking around the casino (and by interesting I mean sketchy as fuck). Security needs to be improved. - The DDR-esque lightup entrance to the casino was severely tacky and slightly depressing   Side Notes: - Had 800 Degrees Pizza after the game and it was delicious - Needs improvement overall on the casino front, but SBE knows whats up when it comes to restaurants

photos.caption: Photo of Umami Burger -  SLS Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Video wall

TBTic0zEDzLU1gEiZVt45A.text: 5 star restaurant for 5 star service from my man Carlos, truly knew how to keep us laughin!! And the food was phenomenal! Couldn't ask for a better experience at umami burger in beautiful Las Vegas!

CWbdcQ8xeEvUyAmEi0JHkg.text: Amazing spot! Great burgers, and our server Tasha made our experience so great. We came from Chicago to visit - it has a really cool sports feel and cozy seating.  Check it out --

_nLfgDURTXAtfFMYzm2F_A.text: We had stayed at SLS and were too hungry to head to the strip and decided to try this place. I had the Truffle Burger and it was absolutely amazing!!!!! I seriously cannot remember eating a burger that delicious! The only downsize is the burger is a little on the small side, so if you're really hungry, it will not be enough. And for the price and size, the burgers do not come with fries or anything. I did order the Truffle Fries on the side which were also pretty good. Their fried pickles was okay. The pickles are huge spears, which is hard to share, would be better if they were cut smaller like in slices. Onion rings were good too, the batter was pretty tasty.  The service could have been better. Our server kinda had an attitude problem so we weren't thrilled with that, Honestly though, the food was pretty damn amazing. If the burger was a little bigger than a kids meal size and came with fries I would totally give it 5 stars! So because of that, I will give 4.

rcvKu7pqPnk5spy1_At0jA.text: I finally made my way to the SLS, small casino, but the energy is different in a good way, I was craving a beer and a quick bite. So I stopped at the sports book to place a bet and to look at the Umami menu. I sat down in one of the couches and the first person that approach me was one of the managers. Super friendly and he had great recommendations, his beer knowledge was impressive, he suggested the Hawaiian beers on draft and he brought some samples over. My server was also great and the food amazing. I can't wait to comeback for football season.

zqS6oFdbhkrgt_njDRK-Mg.text: I haven't been to Umami in a while. I used to dream about going their to get two of their signature burgers because they were to DIE for. But today I feel like I'm dying because I ate one. Something happened to where the recipe for the burger completely changed. It was alright. It was juicy, it had tomatoes, and mushrooms. It wasn't delicious like it used to be. Bring back the old burger please!

H4KlirXR2vAHwUFif0_mng.text: Best burger in Vegas! Beef was perfectly cooked. House Made beer cheddar is amazing. Tashja our server was friendly, helpful and prompt. Highly recommend. Free pint of beer on Tuesdays! Sports betting also available while you dine.

lSGNYYXDRs09vHWxBPvAAg.text: Great service by Courtney! Awesome food. Great beer!! Management came by and said hello. Thank you Rachel for saying hello. I will come back for sure and have more!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Umami Burger -  SLS Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bearded night out!! With family and family beards. #duckdynastyeatyourheartout #whofeedsyou #familylove

xOFU-XoXZENMRE-a8CmZvQ.text: Have been a fan of umami burger for awhile now since I've been to the California locations so I was ecstatic when they opened one here in Vegas. We were given the option on sitting inside or outside and our hostess recommended that we sit outside since they had multiple televisions. We were seated very quickly. It took about maybe 10 minutes for them to ask what we would even like to drink, it wasn't even crowded either. Unacceptable. Took about another 10 minutes to actually get the waters and order our food. So all in all it took 20 minutes to place our order, crazy.  We both ordered the royale burger and my friend got the sweet potato fries while I got the truffle fries. The food was brought out in a timely manner, surprisingly! They bring out 3 different selection of sauces that were phenomenal. The royale burger was pretty tasty but I do like the truffle burger a little better. The truffle fries never disappoint and the sweet potato fries were good, but nothing mind blowing.  When we got the check we instantly paid and left. The meal was very pleasant just like California locations, just kinda wish the customer service was up to par like the other ones. I will be back in the future with the hope that the service will be better.

Ai89gt8y5MKL4e7JfGyxJg.text: Meh food. Bad service. We were seated with our toddler and the server took our drink order. We get some weird mix of juice mixers from the bar for our son because there aren't any drinks for kids (and that's OK really - we know it's Vegas). My son spills half the juice right away on himself and the booth and I use the napkins on the table to wipe it up. We never got new napkins, even after we asked. Server didn't seem to notice us frantically sopping up the spill on our kid. My wife was skeptical of the cheese sauce on the Hatch burger and asked for it on the side so she could try it out. This apparently annoyed the server. I got the Umami burger. We got sweet potato fries for our son. Food comes and my wife's burger is wrong - sauce and aioli on it which she wanted on the side. My burger is completely wrong - some other item entirely. We have no napkins and never received silver ware when we were seated. Had to ask for it. Our server proceeded to avoid our table for the rest of the night and help other tables around us. Various other servers and bus boys handled our requests for the right order, silverware, napkins, ketchup, etc. Food was pretty underwhelming. Hatch chilis had no heat or flavor. The burgers were nicely cooked and meat tasted good but otherwise it's just a heavy, fall-apart meal. Server finally comes back and we ask for the bill. Twenty minutes pass and we have asked a bus boy who bussed our table to get our server to bring the bill as well as another server who walked by. We ended up walking to the bar to pay. This might be the worst service I've ever had. Restaurant was pretty empty too, so it looks like everyone else knows to avoid this place as well.

8nruHaniFDFsBteLV7tOpQ.text: Amazing burgers for less than the average price!  Be sure to truffle your fries---it's ridiculously good!

photos.caption: Photo of Umami Burger -  SLS Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The hatch burger with truffle fries!!!

PUOMK7eVMCYNsA16aLYwDA.text: Was okay. I ordered the poke with chips and lettuce wraps and the fish was kind of warm. It was super mushy too. The service was good. The music is soooooo loud here though I had to ask someone to turn it down so I could hear myself think. It was 11am when I had lunch.

Zr4CAafawUGNzB3K_JiVHw.text: We had the Truffle burger and Turkey burger. The truffle burger was very tasty even without the usual condiments! The Onion rings were awesome with their tempura batter. Our server Mandy was great &  very knowledgeable about the food.

photos.caption: Photo of Umami Burger -  SLS Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Best Homemade ketchup !

L3dh9CfXllVxryA-z9YqUA.text: Food was good! Sweet potato fries were delicious! Service was awesome, Tashja was great and she's a cutie

_HtBj7ns0fiIfOUbvgeEiQ.text: Recently tried Umami Burger for the first time this weekend while visiting Las Vegas... Overall the experience was awesome! We ordered the Ahi Tuna salad and the Ahi Tuna burger with a side of truffle cheese fries. All of the food came out fast and had great flavor. Our meal was exemplified by our server, Abbi! She could not have been more genuine and attentive to our table on a Saturday afternoon that appeared to be fairly busy in the restaurant. I'd recommend checking out this Umami Burger to any of my friends looking for a casual place to watch a sporting event.

EMwmd2Qh3243CQB-JPnjRg.text: Eaten at this location and the one in Miami. DELICIOUS. Anything truffle has my name on it.  Had the Royale burger and truffle fries. Also had the Bloody Mary wasn't impressed but that's okay. Was good service and the food was spot on! #Truffle

SkrmGbUr_S2BcQBV2PQw0Q.text: Wish they had one in Houston the truffle burger is out of this world the fries are OK but it's hard to beat free with a yelp check in   Only negative the place says beer garden but not much on draft but oh well Tuesday was 2cent beer so another reason for bottoms up

KOpN-xMPVR-cQtQmE5LKug.text: Can't get enough of this place. Great quality burgers and fries, awesome atmosphere and a chill place to relax and have a drink (or 2 if you're like me) and of course friendly staff.  Conveniently located inside the SLS Hotel, after a little fun in the casino its a nice spot to watch games with friends.  I'll definitely be there during football season!

nCHvWJgg_vs8zkOvM7DUzQ.text: My server Mandy was Excellent two thumbs up I will go back but only if she is my server simply amazing. You don't get good customer service like that anymore it's was very refreshing. The food was delicious with a great atmosphere.

dpKknT16WNDHnNZFJLdVaw.text: My hubby loved his burger.  We both liked their onion rings.  I ordered my burger plain with lettuce wrap... so it was ok.

te06yNKJLDUa2-CNMX2HvQ.text: DO NOT EAT HERE. I ate here last weekend and after eating a Cali Burger, I was throwing up all night into the next day with diarrhea and spent my weekend in Vegas in bed which is NOT where I wanted to be. It completely ruined my birthday weekend with my friends. The hotel does not want to take accountability for this awful experience. If I could give this place zero stars I would. Never coming back here again. Thanks for ruining my weekend!

d_F1OePfms9dscUo4A4i6w.text: Fantastic service and the Truffle burger was amazing! I definitely recommend eating here. Thank you Casey

cVDA6Dwl9B68DETahGu3FA.text: My girlfriend and I went to SLS Umami Burger on the north end of the Las Vegas trip. First impressions of the casino itself is that it's very nice. It seems that they have a really good filtration system as we couldn't smell much smoke compared to other casinos. It could be that there was just not a lot of people smoking there. Now, down to business. I ordered the impossible burger. The cost was really high. It was about $18 just for the burger. The side of fries was another $8 or so. I did get truffle fries which were delicious. The burger was really tasty and it came with two patties. I also ordered a lemonade which was $4. My girlfriend got a salad and a beer. The salad was around $12 and a beer was $13. I would come back here but not often since it costs so much. But on a special occasions or to treat myself. Parking is complementary which is nice and I did like the ambience. Your options were sit in a booth, a table with chairs or you could sit on couches which is what we did. Our waitress was really attentive and anticipated our needs. Excellent customer service! I did enjoy my plant-based burger which tasted very good , the only issue I may have with the burger and the fries is that it is a bit more on the sa side then I'd like it to be. But it was still tasty.

photos.caption: Photo of Umami Burger -  SLS Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Truffle fries
Photo of Umami Burger -  SLS Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. #Impossible burger
Photo of Umami Burger -  SLS Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States

P6i6lPC9MAz-jFh_acz8SA.text: Umami burgers are amazing, they are cooked well and have amazing flavor. If, you like Umami type food.   The fries and other appetizers are good, but truthfully, the burgers are what make the trip worthwhile. Though everyone likes the truffle fries.   And if you're a fan of Vegan, their Impossible Burger is second to none.   A little more pricey than the usual burger fare, but the quality is usually worth it.   Great beer garden too, when the weather cools down it will be fun and packed and the best option on the north side of the strip (before downtown Freemont, that is).

MzyUNnTCORMgq-IUOrbpkA.text: Burgers were delicious!! They look a little small but they filled us up. I got the Greenbird (I substituted portabella mushroom instead of turkey patty) and my bf got the Cali; we shared an order of sweet potato fries. Quick, very friendly service! Casual, relaxed environment with lots of screens to watch sports. There are even multiple couches to sit at and eat!

CO4Tw9OeYDurTMzYt2dq7A.text: The worst! Your paying for your food I don't think you need to be rushed or beg for a cup of water. Ridiculous and disappointed!!!! I know you have to go home but this is probably the wrong field for you a customer is a customer and I know my meal ain't free! Never coming back for sure!!!!! ......................

4Vb1nj11wxb52SJkVkB1tg.text: Having been a giant Umami Burger fan from day one, I was so excited to see it in Vegas (where my in-laws live and where I have to visit constantly). This is my second visit here (staying at SLS), and this food is so mediocre - my husband described it as "even deader cow". The buns were cold and stale, the roasted tomatoes on my umami burger were cold, the burger as a whole came across as a pale comparison to the original Umami Burger, and even to this location from 2 years ago. Meh, disappointing. However, our server was attentive and the reason for 2 more stars (she deserves 5 stars). Food/energy/cost wise, there are so many more options in Vegas in general.

dD0Nf1UEWFXRlvoKTn8bKA.text: First time trying Umami and I had the burger with jalapenos. Burger size is average fits in hand, beef is cut pretty average. Nice place to try different burgers. Fries are thin cut. Cost is higher than an average burger. Could eat maybe two burgers. They brand their burger buns, nice hidden place in SLS. Customer service was very kind. Overall nice and tasty.

agBKYWRWs97e6P2CfHQJDA.text: This is a great place to get a simple but great tasting burger. The thin fries are great too. However remember this is a simple beer and burger joint in a hotel. The menu is simple and straightforward and so is the drink menu which only has five cocktails and three frozen drinks the rest is beer and lots of bottled beer. Great place to watch sports! Lots TV's! Service was quick and very pleasant.

cJzrIZWdnv3RE6wx51im_g.text: Nothing gourmet about the burgers.  Online menu varies from this location.  Sports bar but all the TVs were not connected to the satellite.  Matchstick fries were overly fried and hard.  Truffle sauce was tasteless and burger was over cooked despite my request for medium.

QuIcXVmGrUY3_WiokFrHnA.text: I had higher expectations for this place. My husband ordered the Manly Burger and it was hardly that. The burger itself was ok but for that kind of money it was a small burger. I ordered the Asian chicken salad which was pretty bad and they forgot to add the chicken on it. I barely took 2 bites because it tasted so fishy- ugh. Would have thought that our waitress would have noticed when she saw the uneaten bowl, but no luck. Son ordered the chicken sandwich and again just ok. Not worth money or time. Service was minimal. Not impressed.

and88Jshk_E9H3EQerhk8Q.text: Great burger place and sports book!  Ordered the Manly and thin fries. Great burger cooked perfectly. The fries were fantastic and addictive. Comped our drinks for playing and the bar service was very good.

15FFuPqwTR7Qg9g9Y1KK5g.text: The bar tender that served my friend and I did a good job and, if you are playing video poker you can get some free drinks (the specifics for what qualifies is on the bar).  The nachos that we ordered were okay but the problem was that, even though they were not very busy, it took a fairly long time to receive them (enough so that our bartender went back to check on the order).  That's what killed the review as otherwise I had no beef with this place.

EiS_T37D0_yGtiSfu4azOA.text: I don't know if it's because I have been drinking already or what but this place is pretty fantastic. Our waitress Reitze? Is sweet and very thorough.  The food is INCREDIBLE. Mozzarella sticks, tater tot nachos,  onion rings.  All divine.  The BlackBerry mojito is refreshing and the bloddy mary is fulfilling.  Thanks for an awesome St. PATRICK'S EXPERIENCE.

1FJPI-v03KB21kW_ElpBAQ.text: Food at Umami is amazing !!! Service could be a bit better. I found it amusing you could gamble as you ate, but there is a full sit down restaurant too.

photos.caption: Photo of Umami Burger -  SLS Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sitting at the bar

xezB8l3YnrwDF3XJHSvkyw.text: Located inside a sports book. Best rendition of an impossible burger. Tasted just like a traditional cheese burger. Only con was there wasn't any vegan cheese.

photos.caption: Photo of Umami Burger -  SLS Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States

65Bg6aekAmiw4WVW7-egWA.text: Came here today for a late lunch and had a great experience! I got the impossible burger which was perfect and my husband got the Nashville hot chicken sandwich which he enjoyed. We also got fried pickles and portobello fries which were the best we've ever had. Honestly best experience I've ever had at a Umami Burger and I've been to a bunch in SoCal. Also shout out to our amazing server AJ. She's the best!

iM-UGvXsO8BuE7emAsfKIQ.text: Been to multiple Unami burgers in LA and was excited to get my fix in Vegas.  Was surprised by the un comparable downgrade in quality and freshness from the original locations.    On top of that the service is sub par.  The staff caters to the bar, and drink orders, took a long time for our food to arrive, and the culture of the place is definitely Rude.  I don't know if it's the Smokey casino environment, or having to manage a full bar on top of the food.     The burger wasn't cooked rite, and the sauces seemed old, or off I guess would be the best way to say it.   In general I would say soft PASS on Unami, they just don't impress. Definitely will try somewhere new next time I'm feeling a burger.

iyD0RynNVZXYx3X3otjFUQ.text: Eat the Impossible Burger! It is probably one of the best Vegetarian burgers I've had. Even if you're not staying at the SLS, it's a great spot to come in and try it, our Sever Aj was friendly too!

kQhoUMeh0Sn_7-Fk10sr0g.text: The fried pickles  and the fried mushrooms were delicious. I  was pleased about the vegan option, since my daughter  is vegan. She really enjoyed  the vegan burger. I did not give a 5 only because the calamari  was prepared  differently  from what I am used to.

t7CptJFcWwW3l3MCScqjbg.text: Reserved a group of tables here for Apple Cup 2017 game. Service was good but prices are much higher than the quality of food & beer. $27+ for a pitcher of beer? Ordered nachos and sweet potato fries. Had to ask for sauces and fries were served with cinnamon/sugar but not described as such on the menu. Interesting sweet twist but was searching for savory. Bill came and was surprised with an unannounced $45 fee to reserve tables. Let me emphasize the place is huge and was empty that day. The servers even remarked they had nothing to do all day. Either the reservation fee should be discussed at time of reservation or waived due to inactivity in the bar so no reservation was necessary. Will not be going back.

__Pw14Or6IZ-36bZfwjQxw.text: We decided to try this place after checking them out on Yelp, however, must of the reviews here are a little too much.  When we got there, we were greeted and seated right away. The waitress, I believe her name is Casey was very nice and attentive. Food was good, drinks were on point.Is it like this everyday? Probably not, but be realistic about what you are saying of this location. Most of us that come to Las Vegas is to get away from our reality, have fun, perhaps do new things, pretty much experience something different from our norm. Most of the reviews are correct in a few things like its a sport bar, hundred percent correct. Every food joint is completely different from each other, so don't expect that the wings here are going to top Buffalo Wild Wings or the hamburger is going to top In n Out. We all have a preference, be open minded. Come check them out and be a judge yourself. If you don't like them, great! get some cardio in and walk to In and Out or go the very well known, commercial food joints and enjoy. If you like them, now you know where to come next time.

BisliQIa_akpHRl4-FU9bQ.text: Mandy was a fantastic server, and a very sweet, funny and tentative. The burgers definitely had that umami factor. The mix of the sweet, salty, savory was on point. The temp on the food was perfect. The fries were pretty decent.

yYwqMyXwnm1FIkSj7Gzmmg.text: Food was ok, beer was ok, server was ok, prices were high for the service offered, and the medium cooked burger was way over cooked. The fries were soggy...  Overall a very ok place, nothing more, nothing less

w856dEpfczHTzMAY7ygf1w.text: Ew I don't know how this place has four stars. Yuck. Limited selection and seriously crap service. Never again.

WG1DX4sREm_ONqLXqEA2zw.text: The food was great and our server Casey was awesome, always checking up on us and made sure we had everything before we even had to ask! Definitely coming back again because of the great food and service!

tqwfo3jCRlbXPR08ig6nkw.text: Walked here from SLS.  Nice sports bar and burger joint.  Busy for World Series game 7. Got Buffalo wings to start. Half dozen in order.  Great.  Ordered a Cali burger med rare.  Good quality meat and nice temp cook.  Truffle fries are great.  All burgers are a la carte so fries are extra.  Overpriced for what you get but it's Vegas.

rf4_hFQ_kx92E56lqzNYZw.text: Perfect patio weather!  Went to see a friend and watch college football!   Paid after tip $16.00 for a Shock Top with peach schnapps float!   Way over priced and not sure WHY it's called BEER GARDEN...they hardly have any taps :(

HTcyY6LK7hfUVmb5eX3pAA.text: This was a great experience. I loved the atmosphere and our waiter Megan was awesome. She was really sweet and had great customer service. The food was different but good. It was my sis birthday and they gave her a free kamikaze shot. I would definitely stop by here if I'm in the SLS.
