Photo of Umami Burger -  SLS Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cocktails !

dH_EnL-NR2Tswo9AeYilwQ.text: I went to an Umami Burger in LA and now I've tried the SLS Hotel Umami Burger in Las Vegas. Great burgers! Totally different vibes! The one in LA didn't have the sports bar component. The Umami in Vegas is located next to the casino of the SLS Hotel. Right beside Katsuya restaurant. Very close distance to the monorail entrance.  The truffle burger was just awesome! I loved the touch of the charred U placed on the top bun. The meat was tender. Branded burger! My mom loved the ahi poke burger.  We split the two burgers in half so we could try both. She took a few bites of the truffle burger and wanted the ahi half back! And I wanted my truffle burger half back as well!  My truffle fries are totally delish! The fries were super thin with some cheese and garnish on top. Very easy to eat. On the other hand, the sweet potato fries were so sweet they should've been dessert! I felt they were overly coated with cinnamon sugar. We actually treated these fries as a dessert at the end of the meal. I found the fries reminded me of the Filipino dessert kamote cue (deep fried caramelized sweet potato).  The service was quick and pleasant. I felt the prices were a little expensive but it is Vegas after all. I ended up spending about $50 for myself and my mom. At the end of the meal the waitress said a new menu was debuting that day! She encouraged us to come back. Next time I'm in Vegas I definitely will!

oJWXmImoIaskA-LdMs-Hag.text: checked this place out last night and it was alright. The place is nice with an outdoor Beer garden, huge TVs and comfortable sofas on one area. I had the Truffle burger which was ok and I have had better elsewhere maybe I prefer a unique taste. I will have to come back and try out more stuff on the menu.   The service was good.

aLDMR60g-9mMHR_oUg4hGQ.text: Great place to grab a burger.  A friend recommended me and it was not a disappointment.  My waitress, Mandy, was awesome.  She recommended the Manly Burger with an egg on top and it was perfect.   I've included a picture here. I also ordered the sweet potatoe fries which were nice and crispy and perfectly seasoned.  Great place to watch sports and place your bets too!

photos.caption: Photo of Umami Burger -  SLS Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Manly Burger with Sweet Potato Fries

_IdDCc79ugDKegzwrhZqbA.text: Service was good sitting at the bar. I ordered the manly burger. Came out undercooked and smelling rotten. The bacon pieces were pure fat chunks. I sent it back after trying to eat it and she took it off my bill. Food is gross service is well.

fd53pu90pASNH5mpoCkljg.text: I saw via a post from both Alton Brown and Umami Burger about a special collab burger and I wanted to try it so I go on down and then the server informs me they don't have specials after I mention the Alton burger. The reason I came is not there, disappointed I don't wanna feel like I wasted my time so I order their truffle burger and simple fries. Didn't take as long as I thought it would.  The patty was thick though undercooked (I like my steaks rare-med. rare but when it comes to burger I prefer medium+ normally.) I didn't mind that too much. Sadly the burger was overall disappointing. The meat was way too under seasoned and they amount of truffle  aioli they put on the burger was sad. I didn't even taste it. There was some on the plate and I tasted it and it was good. Shame they didn't put enough on the burger itself to lend any flavor what so ever. Patty, a slice of melted cheese and a thin squiggle of truffle aioli is all I got. No other toppings that could have helped impart the burger with some flavor.   The fries came out cold. They are super thin and while crispy seemed overlooked and hollow.  Overall my experience was very "meh." Definitely over priced for what you get. I didn't taste quality, poorly seasoned beef led me to tasting not much of anything to be honest. Just the burger and regular fries after tax was $19 and change and I left not satisfied. I suppose I should be thankful they didn't serve the Alton Brown burger as I am a fan of his and if I had such an experience trying the Alton Brown I would be even more disappointed.

photos.caption: Photo of Umami Burger -  SLS Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The truffle burger.

rCIhbHCaE7Sbh60gWrgMKw.text: First of all the service was very good.  Disappointed that you can't sit outdoors at lunchtime; they have no wait staff outside during lunch hours.  The food is nothing to write home about.  Just plain stupid that everything is ala carte.  Really?  The burgers are quite small.  the chicken fingers were apparently spicy, but not advertised as such. (I didn't eat them, my friend ordered them).  I won't eat there again.  There are too many great/fun places with great food on the strip.

811iG5H1ur04SrwPOOnIzA.text: It's very rare for me to ever eat at Umami, so I definitely had to stop by in Vegas before I leave back to SD! I had always had the truffle or the umami burger, but I tried the sunny side this time! The egg adds a great taste to it!   I can't believe just a small burger can be so filling! They're definitely different than most burgers. Truffle fries is a plus! And when you check in, it's free! Also, their sweet potato fries are good!  I love how clean and different the place is than others. They also serve there condiments on spoons, super cute!  Megan G was such a wonderful server. We were being somewhat complicated, but she was still amazing and didn't mind helping us out! She always had a smile on her face. We need more servers like her! Thank you so much Megan!

photos.caption: Photo of Umami Burger -  SLS Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Truffle Fries &amp; Nachos
Photo of Umami Burger -  SLS Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sunny Side

yH0W7S-GS2KP8YE8D-wgYw.text: While visiting Las Vegas my friend and I stopped through at Umami Burger, mainly because of the huge beer selection. The ambiance was great and the service was fantastic. I had the truffle burger and truffle fries and they were both pretty good. Also, the side portions are large so you can definitely share. I would recommend this spot to a friend looking for a nice casual dining experience.

photos.caption: Photo of Umami Burger -  SLS Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Truffle cheese fries
Photo of Umami Burger -  SLS Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Truffle burger (+lettuce, tomato and caramelized onion)

ro-p0_S0mYQ1XE3Ud8QpJA.text: We were here on a Monday afternoon around 1.  Wanted to eat outside but it was closed since they were cleaning the ceiling.    Back inside the sign says please seat yourself.    Sat there 15 minutes and watched several servers help the tables on both sides of us and walk by numerous times without saying anything or even making eye contact.   Can't say they were too busy because there was only 5-6 tables being used and the bar had nobody.   Never even got a menu so we left.  Being local I thought this was a new good choice to bring out of town guests for food and gambling. Super embarrassing.:.Beer Park please.  Lots of fun there.

MvyeMEzAUq8CFPs7lkF9Zw.text: Stayed at the Westgate, but ate ag SLS because, well, Westgate.  Serving staff gets points for honesty, we asked about the joint's namesake burger, but she directed us to the truffle burger (+ carmelized onions and fried egg).  Food is exactly as advertised, quick and completely covered in delicious cheese.  No pretense here, just cheeseburgers.

photos.caption: Photo of Umami Burger -  SLS Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States

5UMBZsfL_4NwjNbi4kJySA.text: My Cow-Workers and I choose to eat at Umami Burger after a long day at work... very good... Super goooooood !!

photos.caption: Photo of Umami Burger -  SLS Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mmmmm... goood goood

CAAx0Zf8qlG9xF4S4EtdNw.text: Love this place.  They have real live time betting on NFL games, which I've never seen anywhere else.  Plus the truffle burger and truffle fries are amazing.  I highly recommend coming to this place during SNF, MNF or TNF.

uzfg1ZJDPk8-htTiwfbNkg.text: Amazing! Great food and perfect service. Ordered a pizza and it took longer than expected, so our server Tashja gave us a free appetizer! Pizza was amazing, as was the appetizer and she recommended a great beer!

LSn5jegPJ_j6FOnHJPW3BQ.text: Was served by Jonnie at the bar.  Great food, atmosphere and service.  They also have mini TV's mounted in the wall at each booth which is a nice touch if you want to enjoy the game in the comfort of your own booth.  We had the truffle burger and it was great.

ZFHTEQ5n6ssLx9ygk5Cfpg.text: Great food, the staff was amazing expecially AJ, will definitely be coming back to try the rest of the menue

hARAmCVfYv5NZ3_zDKmiSA.text: Wow that's what a burger is suppose to taste like.  Fantastic.  Don't miss this place you will not be disappointed.

tqnHmCXSEOOgoACdrZGWWA.text: Ordered the green bird burger, ahi poke, maple fries, and a velvet mule...SO MUCH FLAVOR IN EVERYTHING WE ATE. And I wanna say that was one of the best burgers I've ever had. Thanks to our server...I don't remember his name I think Will? Anyways definitely recommend this place!

IPfldyY1vfIv15t5in3jxg.text: Had a phenomenal experience here! Our server, Sunny, was super attentive, nice, helpful and a genuine sweetheart. He definitely made our Umami experience a GREAT one! Will definitely be back on our next visit to Las Vegas. Yay SUNNY!!! Thank you for your amazing service.

9-tZdwadxzUzYMpadcUFTw.text: Went for Superbowl.  We sat in the outside patio area.  Although we felt a little packed in, and the tv's were to small, we had a great time.  We could not hear much of the game, so we gave up.  The Barbacoa nachos were really good as were the tater tots.  I ordered a Hatch burger and truffle fries which were good.  What made the experience fantastic was our awesome waiter Josh.  He was so attentive, remembered everything without writing it down and brought us everything we needed pretty fast for as crowded as the place was. He was amazing!

nulED2F4VBgH8oRxRxEesA.text: Ended up at Umami for a friends birthday, and I must admit that I am not a big fan of burgers but this place was mind blowing... I cannot wait to come back and try more stuff. Great place to watch a game while sipping on a beer. Hospitality was beyond incredible. The manager, Edgar,  introduced himself and was constantly checking on us and every table sight. Will be seeing you guys very soon!

YXJwjPUbmdpWY7c-zXLewQ.text: We just had a delicious burger at Umami! Perfect. Simple. Delicious. And our server, Mandy was so helpful and friendly!! Would def return

o9nJDwU1YEVHzuMmo2ae7w.text: The burgers don't come with a side. Mine was good, but it seemed like I was eating a plain burger on a bun for $13. The garlic fries were good but the sweet potato fries have cinnamon and sugar and we didn't like them. There is a huge TV so everyone in the bar can watch the game.

4k0d5BfrJh0BE7JVI5yT8w.text: We went back to Umami after our first bad experience. This time, the food was spot on. All the burgers were cooked perfectly. Fries were crisp and hot. Loved the parmesan garlic fries.

HoS-nzipzzBGmyqJS6Iqdg.text: The Manly burger was delishh! Mandy was a great server, super nice & very attentive! Definitely will come back

ORTp-VpIEdRNtvof8p0Sew.text: Best Hospitality I have ever experienced. After being in a seminar all day my mother and I wanted a good meal. We walked to Westgate nothing open. Then walked to SLS...not a short walk. We get to SLS and are so hungry we are starting to get angry. We find Umami but they are full 20 min wait. 1 seat left at the bar. Liz the bar tender sees our distress and goes and finds us an extra chair to pull up to the bar and brings us fries without us asking because she knows how hungry we are. WOW we went from angry to happy in seconds. The food was great and Liz was caring for us the entire time. I will be back the next time I am in Vegas! See u next year Liz!

txgEKtWCOLDal4Zytkv9LQ.text: The service from our waitress Tashja was great. The place has a sports bar feel but makes you feel at home if you choose to sit on the couches and enjoy the sports games they have going on. I ordered the nachos which were delicious. I also had the greenbird (turkey burger, green cheese; ricotta and spinach, sprouts). Food was good and drink menu is very nice gives you time to taste things you might not have had interest in before

DkDAWDQRQ1cq2fIyGg9jdw.text: Terrible service, terrible food, i was disappointed.   It was during a time were it wasn't even busy and there were tables open and it took 20 minutes to sit down. The hosts were talking and taking their time and ignoring people. When my family sat down, it took forever for the server to come. When he finally came my order was messed up and when I finally got the right order, the food was terrible.   Never again will i ever go this location.

Tpcd9_LDLddBGL2A4rPMCA.text: Great service and burgers. Would definitely come back again. Lots of televisions as well for sporting events

520p5BEET5e23-tghs5tGw.text: We've been wanting to stop by Umami and try their gourmet burgers in SoCal, so when I saw the Umami Burger Bar at the SLS, I had to give it a try!  The Ahi Tuna burger was so delicious, I brought my hubby the NEXT day before we drove back to CA.  The second lunch was even better than the first! Since we don't eat beef anymore, we split a "Greenbird" (turkey) burger and an Ahi Burger (seared with fresh ginger & wasabi sauce) and both were outstanding. The sweet potato fries were good, although they were more than we could eat.  Mandy was our server and she was great !!   Not only was she super friendly and attentive, she genuinely made sure everything was to our liking and the food was cooked to perfection. She even put our tea's in "to go" containers for our trip home.   Excellent service and innovative, tasty burgers,..especially for a chain restaurant in Vegas. Umami is definitely worth trying, and we'll be back.

fLA0pCZ6Rh_W8iMVFpcHxg.text: I have to stay at this hotel because of my company. Went to Umami Burger in SLS. Most other restaurants too expensive. Loved the fact I could substitute chicken breast turkey patty or portobello mushroom for no extra charge. Also found a Yelp check in for free fries or beer. Got the fab truffle fries. Amazing. Great service. Good food. Only complaint was I have wanted Ahi Tuna on my burger  but the server did not understand when I asked her if it was sushi grade she had  no idea what I was saying.  I overheard hear ask a server who said ""always say yes". I ordered the chicken. English was not her first Language.  Very loud but then again  I'm old.

q5Le-W6nD_44vIFrsOuWFg.text: This was my first time in Las Vegas and I stopped by this restaurant for lunch. The atmosphere was amazing I got a pizza or "pie" from the 800 degrees menu and some sweet potato fries. They where delicious. The manger Rachel was so pleasant and had a great personality, amazing time laughter with her and our server Tashja was a sweet heart, she not only was on point with my table but she gave some good tips on things to do while we where visiting. If you are ever in Las Vegas and staying at the SLS Las Vegas hotel you have to visit them.

7IYCVXcZxC3q7y8vTLxGLg.text: When I checked into the SLS I had no idea that there was an Umami Burger onsite.  I love Umami!  Mandy was my server and she was fantastic, I was in a bit of a hurry because I had to get over to the convention center for work and she got my order processed and food out super fast!

STgD-zca69CKsSNu1QY5pQ.text: I simply love this place. The truffle burger w thin fries were delicious. The treatment & experience were phenomenal. I highly recommend icoming here & will definitely come back. Thanks to our waiter, Kevin, who was awesome & the lady manager who took care of us!

_OSsnjZ_tEwJOildAstEAQ.text: Awesome time at Umami Burger at the SLS.  Safa was so polite and helpful. Great food. Great service. Cold beer.

uSZXKvkX-8gJJDfS5NdsGA.text: Not very diverse staff and horrible service they should try and pick better employees, i will never go back. Food was ok i get better food at red robin

QecGJ2tnvdIdfLGKo4MK2g.text: I was there last Saturday afternoon and not only were the burgers and fries amazing but Mandy was the best server I have had. Very sweet and on top of it and very tentative. Highly recommend!

WK26r1fvhdZwSQRTPQefcg.text: Started the day off right with a good meal and great service. Since the place is called Umami Burger, I figured the burgers would be the star. And they were good, but really it's the little things that made the meal stand out. Homemade ketchup. Yes. Ketchup. It was really flavorful and tasty. As was the diablo sauce that spiced up the fries nicely. Also, do yourself a favor and ask for the roasted tomatoes. Alone or on top of a burger.  You'll thank me. Finally, the whole meal was tied together by the buoyant and responsive Tashja. Ideal personality to enhance the meal and take the experience NL. We will definitely be back before we leave town. And we will definitely ask for Tashja!

SYL9Navl12TSw7vxx8vBVw.text: Was curious to try this restaurant, but should have taken the advice of previous reviewers and skipped it.  Service started out a bit slow and went downhill from there.  I had the original burger and hubby had the royale.  He said his was pretty good, but mine had zero flavor.  Thank goodness the fries were salty - at least it was some flavor!  Had to borrow the ketchup from the next table as we could not find someone to bring us any.  Our waitress didn't even come to check on us until we were nearly done.  Wasn't offered a refill on my tea until they brought the check.  The table next to us seemed to have issues with their experience as well.  For the money, there are far better places in Las Vegas.  Sticking to Bachi Burger!

klE6e2Pw_TuZlAULUQJOqg.text: Went to watch a game and both food and drinks were great. Staff was friendly and attentive to us for the entire game. Would definitely go back.

25HH9iZFmDfDDA4Up-hyMw.text: I love everything about this, a comfy outdoor sports book with great beer & food options. The staff was really sweetly accommodating and found a way to sneak my baseball championships up around the more popular football and in the area outside I really wanted to be in. Huge hat tip to Shane and his team.

N32zBWCfB84FFrZo4hVghQ.text: Fantastic service by hostess (Ali) the manager(Rachel) and our waitress (Megan) they all where very nice and willing to do anything to help make our experience the best!!  We also love the concept of a sports book and a restaurant put together we can watch the the game, drink eat and be on a comfy couch!! Defiantly a must be place when visiting Vegas!!

awxRwz3DZuWbzt3nJZUCMw.text: Extremely annoying! I called to see what time they where open till that day and they said midnight. (Even thow yelp said 2am but I called to make sure). My friend and I took a cab there exited to go because we've never been but have heard about it. We arrived at 11:20pm and they said they where closed....are you fucking kidding me? After I SPECIFICALLY called to make sure this wouldn't happen. They didn't seem to care that I was lied to and my trip over was a total waste of my time and money. Boooooo! To bad I didn't get the chance to try the food to rate otherwise :(

DMdxpxvCSjulNO8S7CGPgg.text: What is the point of a beer garden on an nfl sunday attached to a sportsbook if you are not going to have a bartender. its like tits on a bull.

EgDWqJwZss8DY9UMHJpb4A.text: Great service!!! Unami burger and truffle fries are awesome!!! Will be back for this!!

lhfURTiM1OLrTHqwfjgYwg.text: Go to Safa and Natalia. They were the best! The truffle burger is bomb. And the truffle fries are really good also

6vg88aKjUyjAhU3Gi4hjiA.text: Megan was great. Didn't even punch Homegirl in our crew for sweating her over some ranch

aNqXduiZEVyGF0qlTCnmfw.text: The caesar salad was okay. The vodka lemonade was okay. The service was excellent. I plan on going back for a burger and hope it's better!!

eJxuPOTTcK8Rt1oDDMMPbA.text: Regardless of the reviews, wanted to check out the hotel so decided to eat here since we were craving for burgers. Ordered the truffle burger, the ahi burger and the plain fries.  Got seated rt away but weren't approached immediately for orders, kinda got bored waiting....and they weren't packed.  Finally got our order and wasn't too pleased with the taste. I feel like it was missing something....!! Taste! Not worth the price. Beers were good, fries were good, but burgers from this burger joint are not. Needs improvement.

FsdRLSwI2xN1hKWFfYAh6w.text: We really enjoyed the food and the service here. Courtney and Leslie were amazing, funny and very professional.  We were celebrating with our friends and they made it very memorable for us. The Tuna Poke was Delicious! Highly recommend this place.

DPQBJmTvJG7ghGx5CKwgQA.text: Great food, juicy burgers with outstanding flavor.  I don't mind paying for top-quality beef, and this place does it up right.  They're not afraid to serve it medium-rare and drippy-good.  We tried a verity of burgers at our table, with the Manly Burger and the Truffle Especiale getting top marks.  MANDY was top-notch, had a solid knowledge of their impressive beer menu, and was passionate about taking the time to recommend pairings.  Great server!

pKNO8e70RMw-rNHiSHtiew.text: would have stayed to eat but game was so loud couldn't hear waitress talk. no dumb to scream at everyone at table. turn it down!

1duxlXeHuT_zpXwwIKTvnQ.text: Worst service ever. These waiters gave us:  serious attitude, terrible service, wrong orders, sub-par yet overpriced hipster burgers, and botched split checks. I'd rather die of famine than ever eat here again.

cypNaUWFLt9ifHF5R4H_8A.text: Bad, bad , bad! The burgers tasted frozen, the fries came out cold . The atmosphere was amazing but the quality of the food is some of the worst I have ever had. The allacart menu runs the ticket up. Which would be perfectly okay if the quality of the food matched it's price tag. 50 dollars later we couldn't believe we were paying for what we just had.

XsenceQmEiUb-dxi0gOleg.text: Ok. As an LA native I have generally high expectations because of its local reputation, but I think it's highly overrated. I had the turkey burger (named "green" something) and it tasted super greasy/fatty and fairly low quality. Of course the cheesy tots and tempura onion rings were great, but I definitely won't be craving Umami anytime soon.

nmH0OJG1cqIwDe2dhXAHoQ.text: My girlfriend and I were checking out the SLS so we decided to have lunch at Umami Burger.  I had read good things about the chain and was hoping for a good lunch.  Unfortunately Umami Burger did not deliver.   First, they tried to seat us outside in 105 degree heat even though there was plenty of seating inside.  You would think they would at least ask us before we are seated.  The next problem came when we went to order.  My girlfriend asked to add pickles to her burger but was told they couldn't do substitutions or additions because it would "mess up the flavor profile of the burger".    I've been to all kinds of restaurants in my life and that was a first.   I ordered the "manly" burger cooked medium.  When I got the burger the first thing I noticed was the size.  To call a burger this size a "manly" burger is a joke.  The next problem with the burger is that it had cubed bacon on it.  It was chewy and half of it fell off when taking a bite.  After taking a couple of bites I noticed that the burger patty looked pretty red for medium and was literally falling apart.   I took the top of the bun off and the meat stuck to both sides of the bun and was clearly RAW and room temperature.  My girlfriend's burger was cooked more but was still falling apart and mushy.  At this point was was done eating.   I spoke to the waitress and told her I wanted my money back.  She then proceeded to tell me that I didn't understand that their burgers just look raw because the meat is really fresh.  I was floored.  She took my plate and a few minutes later the manager came out and tried to get us to try the burgers again.  He gave us the same explanation about the burgers being raw because the meat is really fresh.  I have been to just about every high end burger place in Vegas and this was by far the worst burger I have ever had in my life.  I'd rather have a Big Mac from McDonalds. Then the manager has the balls to tell me that I just didn't understand their "fresh" meat.   At least my girlfriend didn't mess up the raw meat flavor profile with some pickles!  Eventually they comped us the burgers but still got $20 out of us for two Pepsis and an order of fried pickles.   If you're in Vegas and looking for a good burger do yourself a favor and go somewhere else.  There are plenty of burger places that will give you an excellent burger the way YOU want it.  At Umami burger you get a raw burger with a side of superiority.

eObX9VYJDwOAZI8tYw127w.text: Overrated, burgers are small and the prices are high. Truffle fries smelled super funky and definitely not that trufflie.

84A0R_jhManQtCCiKANHmg.text: We came here with my friend and the first time costumer service was amazing the second time we went our server was not really good. She wasn't checking on us. We had to be telling the other service because she would disappear. But I really recommended overall everything was good. Food was good, beer was good. I love the atmosphere this place have. For sure I'm going back. On I forgot to mention I try the "manly" burger and it was delicious, I love the bacon the best part.

cOgT6YKDIL_qSvgM-Sjouw.text: Great burgers & excellent service. Had Mandy as our waitress & she's fantastic. She recommended the Truffle Burger & she didn't steal me wrong. Great choice.

1S2N3jVpyvDduKrXG8JbTQ.text: Great service from greeter to adorable blond server. Original burger plus fries and onion rings. The only criticism is the fries probably came out too soon and therefore weren't hot enough by service.  Great sauces, including ketchup. Could taste the beer in the tempura onion rings.  Homemade pickles on SO burger also a plus. Recommend to go and skip the casino.  That part was totally unimpressive.

4Vz-MxIeEuiw7WW9HbUI6Q.text: While on vaca at the SLS we ate here looking to see the NBA playoff game.  The hostess was a little overwhelmed I guess I'd call it and it showed.  The inside was crowded due to the game being shown, so we opted to sit outside at the bar, which was okay, I say that becasuse the bar seats weren't that comfortable.  We asked the barmaid if sitting at one the tables was an option and it was, however we had to go back in and have the hostess seat us.  So we did as instructed, but the overwhelmed hostess expressed to us that there weren't many servers for the evening so sitting at a table would mean a long wait.  So we just went back outside and sat back at the bar.  We ordered drinks and our food.  Drinks were good enough and the burger and fries that we ordered were okay.  I truly have had better burgers and fries.  I had the Cali with Truffle fries and my husband had the Manly with skinny fries.  My burger was cooked good the fries were a tad over salted and the ketchup that they make and serve is not that good.  My husband enjoyed his food, but mine was just "Meh".  When the check came I felt that I was charged entirely to much for a Vodka lemonade made with Grey Goose and an extra shot $28.00! So I pointed it out to the barmaid and she was thoroughly pissed and bought in the manager to explain why it cost so much. The manager was gracious enough to take $10.00 off of the drink.  Not one of my favorite places.

0eO2dvRmaPpKMH4KzZqR1g.text: Wasn't as great as expected the burgers were very different . However I did love there chicken Caesar salad !!

ZytO9tw3oX2z5PxEKeiKhg.text: I tried to like this place, but didn't have a great experience. Went there for dinner, ordered an appetizer and a couple entrees. The entrees came out before the appetizer. One of the entrees was the wrong burger. They fixed it, and the server said she'd get us a dessert for the error, which was nice. Then the appetizer finally arrived and it was also the wrong item! At that point we just wanted to get the heck out of there. The food overall was ok but nothing spectacular. The kitchen needs to get it together and get their orders right.

rdO-aUzFs2M1g8NgLZu8KA.text: Me and my boyfriend came to Umami for our weekly date night and we LOVED it! Our server Brooke was very helpful and so much fun! I definitely recommend the LOLITA cocktail. AMAZING.

8Ns7SyVm0olRiezsaXH2RA.text: I recently moved to Vegas and have to admit was not very excited about another burger joint. . My friends had visited and highly recommended I give it a try.  We  asked for "Mandy" because we were assured she would take care of us. We were in luck because she just so happened to be working! She was also being requested by a party behind us... I guess she is somewhat of a celebrity in these parts ? She was very busy, yet very fast and gave us the personal attention as if we were here only table. I especially liked that she was not "over the top" and really was a expert on the menu. She described the cooking process, the choice of meats used and even what beverages would compliment each entree. The recommendations were all spot on as well. We each had selected something different so we could sample everything ( all 6 of us).  I Had the truffle burger... I CAN NOT PUT INTO WORDS HOW AMAZING THIS WAS !  I myself, am opening a sports pub/ lounge and tried to get our server Mandy to come and join my team... (she definitely would have a following) , she of course declined stating she herself would miss umami burgers  to much. I have since visited twice, as it is the spot I take family and friends when they come into town... Definitely exceeds its reputation !

25WhJx-bGCEDYED_cqV4cg.text: Delicious food, great venue, and terrific service by Mandy. Their ketchup is to die for :)

nGFXRCkNUBWl7xavCXSc5w.text: Nice, well lit decor with couches, tables and counter to sit. Patio opens to the Strip. TV monitors are plenty. Not many people on a Saturday afternoon. But food is not their strong point. The signature Umami burger was small and just ok in taste. The sweet potato fries were also just ok. The beet salad was so bitter I could not eat. Service at the counter was lacking, the waiter never refilled water and just stop briefly once to check on me. Expensive for the quality of the food- burger was $12. There are much better burgers on the Strip.

lM-7T1Anw1UKA-MVdkchmA.text: Umami burger in Hotel is a great spot for an incredible burger, drinks and service.  Lots of TVs to watch any sports games going on, full bar with lots of great drink offerings (mixed drinks, wine and beer).  You can get your burger bundles in a wrap (lettuce leaf).  Sunny, our server, was great in giving recommendations and service.  I strongly recommend Umami (especially if you can get Sunny as your server).  I look forward to going back for a great burger and drink!

lVjlZF431CATg-TUnRQV_A.text: We have been to the bar here a few times for drinks and I think the kindest way to describe most of the bartenders would be uninterested. Sunday we decided to give the restaurant a try. Our server, Tashja was great. Fast accurate and fun without trying to be our best friend. I had the original, cooked perfect and the mushrooms were great. My wife had the throwback which was also very good. We split an order of thin fries that come with three dipping sauces. A couple of less surly bartenders and this place would be a 5+. Oh, the booths each have a monitor which they will change to your favorite sporting event and with the sports book on site it's great.

Q-82Nx1hMErO3GAudpvZYA.text: I was skeptical about this restaurant when I read the fine print at the bottom of the menu stating "their need is served medium rare" I asked for my patty to be cooked well done. I ordered the Umami burger. I'm not a fan of mushrooms either but this burger was delicious. The thin fries were good too. Would definitely come back.

hjRPsj7YPdiNAcrsz2YOhw.text: Five stars for the Umami burger! It's delicious! Snickerdoodle, vanilla and chocolate chip ice cream sandwiches were delicious as well.

uhfe7QjiXoOlTobntMi8fw.text: I had pretty much every burger in almost every restaurant  this one of the one of the best Sunnyside burger and truffle fries I ever had and the service felt like a five star restaurantand .. I applaud the management for training  their staff  very very well hats off to a server Carlos great experience thank you

jrQ6FJkfpG-7c8lvSIHVZw.text: Terrible service for overpriced mediorce food. I would not recommend this place. The manager could care less if his restaurant makes revenue.  The food is not that great.

83NtdU7ksW7nLLHk2bhI2A.text: Not worth the money. This was the first place I found to eat when my husband and I got to Vegas and I was starving!  Issue one was it was $12 for just a burger, and fries or any other side that would normally come with the burger at any other place was a seperate cost. It took forever for the food to get to the table and when it did my burger was missing the Portobello mushroom.  It took me several mins to find anyone who noticed me to tell them about the mistake and by that time my husband had finished his burger. When i showed them about the mistake they pointed out two tiny black chunks and said that was the Portobello and it just comes with one mushroom... this was highly insulting so I explained i wasn't going to pay $12 for a burger that didn't come as ordered so she went in the back and brought out 2 Portobello mushrooms. The burgers them selves are nothing to write home about, honestly I could get a better burger at red robins or fuddruckers and pay less. Due to the issue the waitress comped our drinks which was really nice.

3wiyeyCuUCWLpau-cNETGg.text: Hands down the best burger I've ever had. Umami burger is so bomb i ordered two! Only $11.95, such a unique tasting burger and the patty was so big too. Highly recommended this!

GN5WzWItTVucUEycvoPepw.text: Best burger on the Las Vegas Strip award goes to Umami Burger!!!

Pzjt6OT57rhmg-F-Uh3Cjw.text: Mandy was the best server!! She was awesome. Food drinks all were served very timely and her recommendations were terrific!! Would definitely recommend!!!

mhUlnFtpB27fIJ3O08_gHg.text: Decent place. But quite expensive for what is on offer...$9 for a pint of beer? Come on! And the ultra hard metal bar stools! Make your customers a bit more comfortable! The burgers we had were decent. But you can do better...for example go to the absolutely awesome Izakaya Go in Chinatown. A much better application for your time and money!

DtIiRK-ZQzupHAe7X0N0-g.text: Good service and great set up. Food unfortunately fell short. I got the umami burger and it wasn't very tasty:( the truffle fries were delish though.

2qGtSjjJjvfUwHQt1s3-5Q.text: Great drinks, great food, great service! Amanda was my bartender/server. She was attentive to everyone and looked liked she was having fun. This is my third time here and I will be back.

U9bU3o9MVBAD6XdKdShGzA.text: We come here all the time, we live across the street at allure! Great beers and amazing food! Sofa is a great bartender and mike is awesome as well!!

w3Vhh1w4igm1SLtmMkTkMw.text: So today was our return back to umami burger with my ladies family from Los Angeles. We were well  taken care of Thanks to Rachel the General  Manager as well jeorge and Brooke  we loved you guys and thanks for everything.  My ladies family was very excited  to try it and were very satisfied with everything . I will definitely  come back our family has nothing but good things to say about umami. ywDHhF9serZeGDIuWb06bQ.text: My burger was iight. I think I would order something different next time. The truffle fries were bomb though and it was great to sit in their outdoor seating.

zVocSGJqd2Aanjv3pu2F0Q.text: Great burgers.  Great service. Mandy was our server and she made our eating experience a pleasure. She went out of her way several times to do us a solid. One of the best eating experiences we had during a very busy NCAA weekend. Plus, the catsup is awesome. Please come to Texas.

photos.caption: Photo of Umami Burger -  SLS Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Eating at Unami Burger.

YGJnUap6ek9nhHoWcR00kg.text: This place is located in the sls hotel and I had moderate expectations before coming here. I have to admit my Cali burger was prepared nicely and it tasted great! Our server, Carlos, was nice, courteous, and friendly. He gets an A+ for customer service.

Jo_XuhBGTMr1zxFgOgzP2A.text: Mandy was a great server! Got order right on, and really showed she cared to serve us well. Thanks Mandy!

xmA8TJgX7x77O2tutRl-OQ.text: This seemed like a great spot to grab some food and also watch sports. Beer selection is decent but not amazing. It's a little pricey but getting a liter at a time helps soften the blow. I had a manly burger and a side of thin fries. While I enjoyed the manly burger I would have to recommend the original umami. The manly is heavy and rich but doesn't have the distinct flavor profile of the umami burger. The things fries were well cooked and tasty. I asked for some ketchup which never came but as we were sitting outside all the way on the end service wasn't stellar. The bartenders were very friendly and attentive though. I had no issues placing a couple bets on the NBA playoff games though I was a little disappointed that the sports book closed in the middle of the late game. I was a little worried I wouldn't be able to cash out my ticket until it reopened but I had no problems getting my money at the cage after telling them the sports book had closed. It's definitely a great spot if you a casual sports fan like me who wants to have a couple beers and maybe throw down $20 on a game.

ENwe-7AOf33U0Nzz6_fRqw.text: Nice place in the SLS complex especially if you want to get off the Strip. Free parking in the garage which is getting rarer in Vegas. Loads of TVs with sports of every kind going on. Checked in on Yelp for a coupon of a free beer or fries with a $20 purchase. Wanted the beer but it was Rolling Rock so we got the truffle fries instead--delicious! Also got the wings--the appetizer. They were decent wings. Good deal on buckets of beer.

L-i0KQWwHWoTm8ZwC7QDWQ.text: We stopped in a few minutes ago, and ordered our burgers without onions. There was a mix up and my burger had onions on it. The waitress not only offered to replace it, but took it of my bill. She also gave us dessert on the house. The burgers were excellent, and the staff was very courteous and friendly. My waitress was Mandy, and she was great! I downloaded this app just to leave this review, so I was pretty impressed!

8EWpVHhaQ8-d23_aRt28Tg.text: Tashja was our server for a big group and she was fantastic! So friendly and fun. She did great and the food was great alsothank you!:)

aBPLE6YgF5I-DncXXlro2g.text: Came for my sister's birthday and tashja was very attentive and patient with everyone!

IuWjST9dRz9a0p3SBYDB2Q.text: Cool burger place! Mandy our server was awesome, real simple menu, clean cozy spot. How can you go wrong eating burgers and fries and being able to bet sports in the same establishment? You can't go wrong!

5SMucrEqk1yZ-0Eag0sMCA.text: So Disappointed.  Slow service,  very small portions and very bland. A bit pricy for a burger but that is what you get on the strip.

saDRw9EbmTi2kFQ1Y0zeTw.text: Best burger iv had in a long while i had the Umami burger but when i opened it it had ONE single mushroom in it i mean cmon its a 14 dollar burger and they can only spare one! I read another comment that said they got 3 so i guess they are getting cheaper. The thin fries were also kinda awkward to eat and the ketchup tasted weird.

LtDPeOWNmZiw6bjnxjCuNg.text: Eh. It wasn't terrible - quite edible and serves a purpose as an eatery in the sports book of the SLS Casino. Nothing special as far as menu items go .. To a point where I just went with the namesake burger, to get just anything to eat.. Fairly uninspired as a stand alone restaurant concept - just great as a sports book cafe.   We had a giant pretzel and chicken fingers to share and sweet potato fries and an Umami Burger. Heading to a show at The Foundry, we wanted quick and tasty. As I mentioned before, the food was fine. I just. don't see a lot of reason to ever go back just to eat .. We sat in the beer garden that is along Las Vegas Blvd and even still it was just whatevs.   The the pretzel was a large pretzel smeared with mustard. The chicken fingers didn't look worthy of Costco (who have very good chicken fingers available, btw:) the Umami burger was my favorite and it was still pretty basic. The Parmesan tuile was a nice touch - but the single shitake mushroom and single roasted tomato - makes for a "pretty" burger (see photo) but a semi boring burger.  I'm still mad about the chicken fingers tho. If they were made in house, which I highly doubt, they were made terribly. I honestly hope they weren't made in house ... So that drops it to 2.5 from a solid 3 stars. Not trying to be mean, they were just not good. Everyone was hungry and one was left uneaten. I couldn't do it so I left mine there. Cuz it sucked. Lol. Anyway.. Happy Eating!

w82VcVsIQ4cg3mTQzCJ0Gg.text: Stopped by Umami today. Everything was great as soon as I walked in the hostess was polite and sat me. My server, Casey, was great! Recommended the manly burger and I loved it ! I even got the cookie for dessert. I will be back!!!   Review update!! 06/21/17 Came back again and this time we had Lauren as our server. (Easy for me to remember. Lol) She was just as great as Casey, all the staff here is wonderful! Food still delicious! Add an egg to the manly burger, you won't regret it!!!!

VkQDhJ91IuxYY0hbOD7tGA.text: This place is supposed to close at 10 pm. We were staying in SLS and we got here around 9:30. There was no waiter or greeter around. We waited for few minutes, had to go inside and look around. Finally a waiter came and said they are already closed. We asked him what the working hours are. He said it is till 10 but the last call is at 9:30. I checked my phone and it was 9:33. If they were around at 9:30 we could have placed our order. Anyways it was a very disappointing experience.

-se13qeJZNbr_ztTVmokUg.text: Decided to try this place out since we'd been to Bachi Burger last Vegas trip and wanted to try something similar but new.  Well we should have gone to Bachi Burger because this place was nowhere near as good.  The food was decent but nothing special.  The maple bacon fries were probably better than the burger so that should tell you something.  I wouldn't come back here again.

fVPV-VuHAfFi9iFp4tSAow.text: Dont understand why its closed 3 days of the week. One of the only locations that has the impossible burger, been dying to try but the hours dont fit in my school/work schedule.

BX06pcRKP8P3ULiFXbsnOQ.text: I love Umami burger! The food is good and the environment is fun! Especially for sports lovers! I would have to say the biggest reason for my five star review is their server Aj. She is amazing! She is quick to serve every time I have been there, and always serves with a big beautiful smile. I love her bright, happy personality, and her ability to make sure that our experience is perfect. The customer service experience is on another level because of her, and I can't say enough how much I value that! Good eats, good staff, good place! As a local or just visiting, Umami Burger is worth popping into for sure. Be sure to ask for Aj for a top notch experience.

mfHBfzcwdvI2Cz3BWNRNlQ.text: Our second burger in Vegas. I'm getting disillusioned. The atmosphere was better here than at Fat Choy and our waitress was politer and more polished. The burger wasn't as good - a little dry and crumbly (overcooked for medium). Toppings were really good, though.  The fries here weren't homemade either. What is with Vegas and frozen fries? But I have to admit that they were good with the truffle sauce. Beer selection was much better. though no local beers. I probably enjoyed Umami better, but not enough to make me return. Hoping that the next burger place is better.

TC7HMjlQ5YfApeCs_8KSyA.text: Stopped in on a business trip and boy am I glad I did so. Service was great, Burger was awesome. There is not a whole lot more you can ask for. Will definitely be coming back next time i am in town.

4unstfkg2eFln7CPGvBpuQ.text: I stopped by for the NFL kick-off, which seems like just yesterday, to see the Pats-Steelers game. The place was obviously packed but we still managed to snag a booth. They had several servers walking around handing out free samples. Great for customers, but awful for the servers as many people probably didn't order food or tip well since there were plenty of freebies all night. I tried the skinny fries and sweet potato fries, both were tasty and crispy. I also tried slider version of their truffle burger and hatch burger -- the patties on both juicy and cooked to about medium. The former only had subtle amounts of truffle in the aioli, cheese, and glaze, while the latter had just enough heat to enhance the flavor.   As for the food we ordered, the Korean fries had a mild kimchi flavor paired with sweet potato fries while the chicken wings had to be sent back because they only gave us five instead of the advertised six. They corrected the mistake and  sent out a correct order. Each coated with a crispy exterior coated in a spicy BBQ sauce. The lone full size burger sampled was the Manly burger ($12). A bit small but filling with a densely packed patty topped with house beer-cheddar, bacon lardons, smoked salt onion strings, ketchup and mustard. The branded bun was a nice touch.  The quality and variety of burgers and appetizers lags behind the top burger joints in town, but it was a cool spot to watch the game thanks to the in house sporting book, large TVs scattered around the room and the smaller TV right at our booth.

mG8lE2VbnlTarEJZ-OBHIg.text: Only came here for the groupon deal they had. I say it's pretty worth it but had to pay a little extra more for tax of course. Went here with my girlfriend and we give the burger a 8 but we gave the fries a 10. Pretty good here and would come back when just Becuase of groupon.

6cTrMZCnJ8HMDmBswztGDA.text: I first tried umami burger in LA and it never really left me a good impression. And it's the same impression after today.   Our waitress was very friendly, helpful and accommodating to our large group. She explained the beer menu and took her time in taking all of our orders. She gave us our free yelp fries with a check in. She also gave us a free birthday ice cream sandwich.  Pretty much just because our waitress was awesome, I'm giving it another star.  The food was average.  I felt the same way as I did before when I first tried the food back in LA. The fries were semi crunchy. The grilled chicken nachos were sad and barely could be considered "nachos."   I ordered the grill chicken sandwich and it was alright. The parmesan cheese was a nice texture added to the meal, but it was nothing special.  Overall, I'm not a fan of umami burger at all. It's expensive, and you could get a better burger for much cheaper.

5_VJpDnSkNjiypaJHFA1Vg.text: Came here Sunday when they opened at 11am for some apps and burgers. The pretzel was very big and tasty with the cheese, the nachos had great flavor (although could've used a bit more beef) and the truffle fries were amazing. I had the classic umami burger and was very impressed. The meat was cooked to perfection, and the cheese was outstanding. I'll be back!

zylx1tEQ5iv1l275YkqGpw.text: Stopped in after an industry event and before catching my flight.  Open space with a lot of tv's for watching sports. Excellent options for beers. Ordered a Cali burger and regular fries. This was one of the better burgers I've ever had in 44 years. Healthy size patty with great toppings and awesome sauce. Fries were thin cut and very good portion.  Excellent place for a beer, burger and watching a game.  Will be back in 2018...

KdaVqq6OIW6ZKfmFe1KsLA.text: The food was good the food was slow to get to the table and a bit over priced so I won't go back but the combination of flavors was a good experience and I'm glad I went

X6qJSbKnSVa3UKxvY-URkQ.text: They have a good combination of burgers and sides. Huge solection of beer. I have tried most of of the menu items. Casey is one of the best servers in town.

CaMhun_MmX_xlY7u2fIKVA.text: Wow. This place is amazing!!! We are staying in the W Hotel and wanted a casual but delicious dinner and this place definitely delivered! We ordered two things off the secret menu - the spicy cow and the cheesy tots, and my aunt got the Cali burger and we shared the beet & goat cheese salad with arugula. Everything we ate was absolutely phenomenal! The spicy cow had a little bite to it but it definitely wasn't too spicy.  The cheesy tots were amazing and generally everything was just delicious. Also you must save room for the hot chocolate chip cookie with vanilla ice cream!!! The service was great too - can't leave that out right!  P. S. remember to tip your servers! 20% is standard!

fJWhHGVlbUp1kKZ09pueww.text: SLS had some deal with my room that gave us an app and 2 drinks for free with the room rate at any of the restaurants in the hotel, so we scoped them out and ended up at Umami Burger.  We chose the nachos - it just seemed like a simple choice. Definitely worth it. I would say that they are a smaller portion than what you would normally get - but delicious none the less.   Umami burger - yes. Just as described. Split one of these, the parmesan, onions, burger - combination melts in your mouth and I will be getting this again.  Beer selection - yes! they have a great beer selection and plenty of TVs to watch your games.  Definitely a great sports bar option on the strip.

anDozLzPRh7OdmEdnIve9g.text: Amanda was great!  We had a large group and she rocked it!  The burgers were amazing and the fries did not disappoint!

paWnZUz2kgvfrRvP_ZvV_Q.text: Food was amazing. Waitress was fine. Prices are $4-10$ extra because we're on the strip. I feel scammed but it's to be expected when you're on the Strip.

photos.caption: Photo of Umami Burger -  SLS Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. $87.68 was our total for two burgers, fries, cocktail, and portobello fries.

RudjAktZqV6MZVEwIFvaWw.text: Three stars because my "Mushroom" burger has only 3 shrunken mushrooms on it. Really? That truly irritated me which affected my perception of the meal. My husband loved his burger though and the service was fine. We came at an odd time, Sunday at 2. We waited 10 minutes to be seated in a mostly empty restaurant and no other staff member volunteered to help us, be friendly or simply tell us the hostess would be with us soon. It's not like the bartenders standing right next to the entrance were busy. Luckily our server was congenial and attentive; therefore, a lukewarm 3 stars overall when I feel like giving it less.

6UQXkpK47KFXknqIfSRzXw.text: I only came here because I love a good burger and that's what I thought I was getting here. So I was really excited to try the burger here because I had heard so much about Umami. I'm definitely a burger snob so much so I did a search for the best burger in San Diego and Southwest Riverside County.  Okay so I Yelp some burger spots in Vegas and this is one of the places that came up along with Chef Ramsey. I was in this area anyway and decide to check it out so in order to get here I had to walk through the casino which wasn't a big deal. I found it and was seated pretty quick because I came early evening. My waitress was cool so no problems there and she was easy on the eyes. I ordered the burger and when it came out it looked like it was going to be very good.  The burger was very simple but the ingredients made the burger seem like it was going to be fantastic. I was a little disappointed with the burger because the flavor just wasn't there for me and it wasn't that juicy either. Would I come here again? Yes because I give places second chances!

k0F_shmAMn37XPHHXHrbSA.text: My husband had the umami burger and it was nothing to write home about. The flavor was ok but the in n out burger he had earlier that day was better. I had the Nashville hot chicken sandwich the spice and the flavor were good but the chicken was severely over done. It was so tough and hard. We also had the sweet potato fries they were ok. They tasted like they were from the freezer section of your local grocery store. The highlight of our meal was the appetizer. We ordered the large pretzel and it was delicious. Our server was also great. Other than that this place is pretty overrated

sdsVtIjJYBuuOPzukp_2Qg.text: Came for dinner here because it was convenient for me before a night out at the club. Already familiar with several of the Umami locations in the LA area so the menu isn't really a surprise to me.  We were greeted and sat right away by the hostess. Our server came a few moments later and got us started with drinks and allowed us wayyy too much time to look over the menu. She pretty much disappeared on us throughout our dining experience. We asked other servers for help but they said they would call our server for us..not sure if they really did because it took her so long to return to us.  Food wise, their burgers are good.

BTbsR5q9OkFSjiGYILFDsQ.text: Good food. Good service. Gambling. The trifecta of Las Vegas. Came here for a quick bite and to watch some sports and this place provides on both fronts. There is food,beer,and many TVs playing sports to watch so you can enjoy the game or gamble because the betting station is right there. I had the 'manly burger' and 'manly fries' and they both were prepared well and was good.

photos.caption: Photo of Umami Burger -  SLS Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Manly burger &amp; manly fries

WwznH8XTGOzkxO_Uwsn7fw.text: This place just simply ROCKS!  Stayed at the SLS over the past weekend and went to this sports bar 3 times.   Mandy our favorite waitstaff was engaging fun and very attentive.  We had snacks upon arrival while waiting for our room to check in.  We had wings and a couple of drinks.  We then returned to watch the Duck game and were amazed with the all you can drink package during the game.  Yep I said it outloud All You Can drink for the duration of your game 2 hours and man we took advantage of that for sure.   If your looking for a great place this is it!  Good Food great staff and a fun fun environment!

As67KqO6k9Du2kyYprwU9A.text: They are an expensive burger place where you'll have a good, but somewhat over-priced hamburger served somewhat absent-mindedly, but with good intentions. We checked them out because they carry the vegetarian Impossible Burger.  The venue is lively and comfortable. It basically also serves as the sports book area. The service is adequate, but misses the target frequently. They may or may not know you've been seated and they may or may not bring you things you've requested. But they are friendly.  We tried their Throwback and Impossible burgers. The portions are good, but feel a little over-priced for what you get. Strip prices basically. The Throwback was fine. The Impossible was a very impressive vegetarian burger that tasted and felt like real meat.  All in all, you'll have a good meal and a good experience here, but we probably won't be back any time soon due to the high prices.

74cAZRM2sthS1ALM0tulmQ.text: The first time I came to this place a few years back, I absolutely hated it. Fast forward years later for a work trip and I happened to get placed at the SLS. The first night I was there I absolutely avoided it because I was scarred from the first visit. All I could remember was being disappointed because someone told me that they had the best burgers in Vegas. Still not True if you ask me but they are certainly good.  Anyway, my coworkers convinced me to give it another shot, so I did just that and to my surprise it was way better from what I remembered. I actually enjoyed the burger, fries, and beer that I ordered and I certainly felt that the pricing was pretty great.   In fact, i went there for a second night and enjoyed another burger. My only gripe was that the wings that we ordered left me unimpressed but I definitely recommend it for a cheap good meal at the SLS. If I stay at this hotel again I am certain that I'd go back for another burger.

B4AZFgaxb_loCAv3EPYcXg.text: The burgers and the staff are awesome.  We ate here the day after we arrived.  I ordered the Manly burger and my wife ordered the Impossible Burger.  She kept thinking that it was real meat.  It was so good that we had to come back to have lunch, before we headed home.  We both ordered the same thing.  Again, the food was awesome and Jorge was friendly, knew the menu inside and too really good care of us.

AlPJYts83QqyEhUAVicWTg.text: Best burgers in town. Highly recommend the Umami Burger and truffle fries. Also best service..... Rhitzie was quick to get our food out and she took care of my wife and I perfectly! Will be back just because of her most definitely.

VCO5pX87oGjQXOhZVtoDlg.text: I've been looking forward to trying a Umami Burger ever since I saw a TV special on them a few years back. I spike my own burgers with everything from fish sauce to marmite, so this is a burger I knew I could appreciate.  It was an exciting moment when I finally wrapped my hands around a $12.95 Umami Burger consisting of a 6-ounce beef patty reportedly made from American Wagyu beef and seasoned with soy sauce, ground-up dried porcini mushrooms, and dried fish head dust. Toppings included roasted tomatoes (tomatoes slow-baked in soy sauce), shiitake mushrooms, caramelized onions, and a round parmesan cheese crisp (referred to as a "frico.") The burger was served on a Portuguese-style roll.  Imagine my horror as the flavor of the burger tasted muddled going down, almost like the burger was not made of meat, but instead of mushrooms or vegan ingredients. To be fair, the after-taste of the burger lingering in my mouth after I swallowed was good, quite "beefy" -- but there was something "off" by a mile with this.  After another bite, I identified that the burger was waaaay under-seasoned, despite whatever umami infusions happened in the meat. The lack of salt in this burger was tragic -- think of drinking a can of Coca-Cola without sweetener (sugar or otherwise) and how weird and jarring that would be. Salt is nature's best and most powerful flavor-enhancer. It is bizarre that a restaurant so focused on achieving a big umami flavor would eschew salt, likely relying on the soy sauce for salt rather than seasoning the meat manually.  Another crucial element was lacking: one of the best ways to generate umami flavor is to invoke a Maillard Reaction (e.g. browning reaction) and generating a flavorful crust on the meat. Yet, my Umami Burger looked baked rather than grilled and did not go through this process, arguably the most important flavor-producing reaction within all of cooking.  Some of the toppings were more effective than others. The roasted tomato confit was good (yay! flavor!), but the caramelized onions were just barely discernable. The burger needed cheese, and the problem with the parmesan cheese crisp is that it doesn't hug the burger the way a melted slice of cheese would, and it seems very separate from everything else when I was chewing it all.  On the other hand, the thin Truffle Fries I ordered were very tasty -- salty and crisp, smothered in melted cheese and a well-restrained amount of truffle flavor. Best of all, they're free with a Yelp check-in. If I found myself at the SLS late-night and hungry, I may hit up Umami Burger for the fries, but I probably would not get another burger.  I'm interested in knowing what I'm missing here. Somehow this restaurant remains in business and is known for its burgers -- what am I not getting?  Food/Decor/Service: 2.6/2.5/3.5

W4sckzFhkX9_PBwbeQ5GUw.text: Service was the high point, burger was only Meh...hard to believe that it is "one of the best 25 burgers in the U.S." but it might be according to taste. I thought my spicy jalapeno burger was acceptable and the sweet potato fries were good but not at the price point they sell them at. Lesson learned, I probably won't be back, but again, the service and customer focus was well above and beyond.

U7mwNxpUizwibBoxtmO8OA.text: Too pricey for small burgers but it was good though! Ambiance is great and service was ok.

a4v7o52qKFHj5vlucZMKWg.text: While staying in the SLS we desperately needed food. Decided to stop for a burger and a beer.   It was so easy to walk from our room to still have a great meal. I tried to signature burger and it did not disappoint. We also grabbed some truffle fries and they were one of the best I have had before.   Pricing is average. It wasn't the cheapest burger I have had, but also wasn't the most expensive. For Vegas, I felt it wasn't horrible.  Half of their beer selections were not available, which made for wanting a couple of tasting virtually impossible. So, I had to settle on the only one I thought I would want. That was a major bummer.

SWAUoxoFjglNKpczqLHX0g.text: I was staying at the SLS with a couple of friends and we decided to find out what all the hype was about at Umami Burger.  There are some screens to watch a few sports games and eat. There is also a betting station nearby and video poker/blackjack.   The food here is decent, and a bit pricier than your average burger joint, but the service was nice during my experience and the food was delivered quickly.

ixYs9W9hBRanbopK2Gj0Dg.text: Wow!!!!!!!! Super Easy in & Out and the burger are better.... If you get a chance to request Mandy,do so, Great experience.  Enjoy.

2UuyKpDMXGlhOUWq8KSUJA.text: Hmmmm  12 bucks for 6 wings  They were dry and over cooked  It a sports bar.  Seriously? You're making money from my drinking habit. I'm ok with that.  At least give me a descent wing.  Holiday Inn has better heat and  serve wings  "let's face it guys.  That's what they usually are  at a hotel"  This is vegas   Jeezus  I'll give you money in slots I'll give you money in beer I'll  give you money in black  jack   Common Give me a reach around.   Ask your purveyor for better wings and increase the portion   ----- I'm an idiot.  Company put me up here.  Ordered sweet potatoes fries , RUINED WITH CINNAMON. , seriously. Cinnamon fries. Wtf!  Chicken strips. Frozen reheated. I gave them back.   Burger. .... after all that.  Was real good.  I've never had sweet potatoes fries f-ed up before.  Get em here!

kEsPj5wkgr5q5hCz9i23aA.text: I wanted to leave a good review for this place because the staff was SO nice! I sat at the bar and ordered a burger to go. I had never had umami before, and I didn't care for it.   The burger was cooked nicely and the staff was amazing but I just didn't enjoy the food. However, since it was new to me I am still glad I tried it. Definitely check it out and see what you think.

photos.caption: Photo of Umami Burger -  SLS Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States

XiHuznGg-XothN-2PDm8GQ.text: Pretty disappointing!  I came here expecting to be blown away by the word of mouth I have heard regarding Umami Burger.  I ordered the original Umami Burger with a side of the thin fries and a $8 draft beer.  I think the $8 beer was the best part of this experience!  The burger was quite bland and covered in a sauce which tasted like a bottle of Ragu pasta sauce.  Fries were mediocre at best.  Service was pretty slow especially considering I was there on a Monday afternoon and the place was not even half full. Maybe if I am in the LA area I will try one of the locations there but I do not plan on coming back to this location.

photos.caption: Photo of Umami Burger -  SLS Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Original Umami Burger with Thin Fries

zftMb2DNqAxvtaEgNH6jLQ.text: Hatch burger was one of the best burgers I've ever had! Not spicy but very flavorful with lots of delicious melt cheese. The truffle fries were also delicious! Cheesy with a good amount of truffle flavor! Got them for free for checking in too! Lots of seating so getting a table is pretty quick as well. Good atmosphere.

3hUmj_-FDsEwD6hlcdJMJw.text: After the reviews we were fired up to hit this place up when we rolled into town.  However......after ordering the Hatch burger and the truffle fries we waited forever.  When the food came both items were cold and uninspiring.  After about ten minutes we got the staff to pay attention to us.  We did get replacements for all and the second round of burgers were better.  The fries reminded me of gravy not truffle style, not sure what that was all about.  The 2 stars is due to the fact that they comped us the food.  TIP FOR the PLACE - WARM up the hatch chiles so it doesn't take away from the heat of the burger.

UgUdB78l6yngChS7HUwnzA.text: Great experience here. We wanted a quick bite because just got in and needed to catch a concert. They brought out food so fast. Excellent work by Sarah. She is an awesome waitress.  Timing was so good that we even got dessert.

photos.caption: Photo of Umami Burger -  SLS Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States

2J_F--NPFwOuwuJ1YhWcPA.text: Liz is so sweet! Love her. So refreshing to see a smiling face with my glass of vino after this long damn day!

Hkzpwg1eBvFhoIJF7uSfag.text: This is a great change to the Umami concept in LA now with more sports. They have all of your favorites if you have been to other locations.   Only thing that I can say that I didn't like was the buns. Which I have taken 2 stars off for since they are not the same as those in LA and they really do matter when it comes to a great burger.   If you have never been you will still love it though.

LZSD-GU2Yst68bv_524WHg.text: Food was alright. Service was ass. Didn't fill up my water, and forgot part of my order. We came as a large party and the waitress refused to split checks through the party. If you want good food and service then go to Batchi Burger.

rj7uwd1v2wz2i9C9tSkCTA.text: Delicious food. We got to meet the manager, Rachel, she is a real sweetheart and great at what she does. The food is delicious here, my favorite is the Truffle burger and definitely get the onion rings they are some of the best I've had! I had to stay in Las Vegas at the SLS for 2 weeks for work and ate here 4 times.

P5nmBUgs-PV53uErVBI9mQ.text: I had the beet salad which was a nice portion, light and very good.  My husband said his Throwback burger was also very good...not huge and over-bearing.  But the sweet potato fries was amazing!  It came with 3 dipping sauces and their special ketchup.  This was a perfect lunch!!  Our waitress, Mandi, was helpful in answering our questions and gave very constructive suggestions.  Glad I did not read Yelp before eating here.

rg7fqC4fH4iakPqCn013Bg.text: Amazing burgers! Left us wanting more. Meat was extremely fresh and the burger buns were soft with a toasted outside. We also had the ice cream sandwiches which were fantastic. All and all, great experience.

x50sIee4ojelwG5ZsuP6-g.text: We had our family in town, we enjoyed the different array of burgers. My dislike is no kids menu.

YViTktblDF9ezGZnIcM_OQ.text: I finally got to go there last night as part of a special event. I've driven by it several times and thought that it looked interesting.  I have to say the food and the service was spot on.  The waiters and bartenders could've have been any nicer.  The California burger which by the way is something I would never eat was to die for and their tater tots  were a meal unto themselves. I will definitely be going back here probably this weekend with friends!

6DAHhUkYJgQP_62SMvK9vA.text: Just had dinner here tonight and everything was perfect. The burgers were cooked perfectly and all the starters looked picture perfect and tasted perfect as well. Our server checked up on us consistently throughout the night and made sure we had everything we needed. It was a pleasant experience.

6vqO0ebyQHggx_O268NSfA.text: Sunny took care of 8 crazy women... was so on top of it... great food... Sunny made it special! 7/27/15 JANET Veloz

jn-eaLdM8VQIFFE4Unh3xQ.text: Been here many times, service always on point, super friendly staff, amazing food, great selection of beer, don't even let me started on the patio, best beer garden in las vegas. Family friendly and booze friendly too! Lol. Cheesey totz on the secret menu is a must have. Its your everyday american food with a surprising and unexpected twist

photos.caption: Photo of Umami Burger -  SLS Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cheesey totz on the right! Truffle fries on the left! House sauces in the middle :)

fLv60k0Jn-cFjKbeesTUUA.text: Best nachos and truffle fries in the city, I have heard great things about this place and I finally made it. Get the nachos they are the best I have had so far. Their tap take over promo is great , 2 for 1 on Tuesday. Service is awesome and friendly.

hQqbTxGmRjRJIrYIk-8Asg.text: Original burger is pretty good. Bun is a tad dry. Onion ring is well executed but nothing special. But the house ketchup is a must try.  The pork belly kimchi hot dog is downright disgusting.  It's too salty and tastes like eating week old feet.  (This is coming from someone that loves kim chi.) Service is just so so. It took them a long time to clear my dirty plates and there's hardly anyone in this restaurant.

zC0d1S1RRLxoNcIVhce5Pw.text: Manly Burger fantastic- Safa at the bar is very knowledgeable on menu and beer selection, friendly, and great svc overall from start to finish! Thanks and will come back w friends.

lRIXupnp92cJiRzmUoMLWA.text: I got the short rib burger and it was incredible. Very well prepared. The bread was buttery and toasted and the meat tender. It had a great sort of roasted flame flavor that really kicked it up a notch.   I had the truffle cheese fries. Those were really good but not amazing. A little too much cheese for my states. I ordered the salted caramel ice cream sandwich to finish and that was incredibly good. Simple but packed with flavor. Highly recommend.  It is a unique layout with one very large room with couches and leather chairs underneath massive big tv screens for sports fans. On the perimeter of the big room are booths with individual TVs.  I definitely think it's a good chocked for football and food. I don't know if I would make a special trip just for the food as the menu is a bit small. But either way the burgers are excellent.

LPQ-dFYfakB8mkVDs5U4Fw.text: Awesome food, not a bad thing on the menu, burger patties are fat and tasty... Tashja is also a great waitress.. I will be back!

0Nk0lKNcQTBBj3fpnHTmwA.text: The Burgers here are amazing! The truffle burger came highly recommended and that was what I went with. Let me tell you, it did not disappoint! Sooo good! We also tried the truffle fries which were also amazing. They have a "secret" menu as well and we got some of their cheesy tots, also good!! The burger was done medium rare and I recommend it to be prepared that way for maximum deliciousness. Oh yeah, I can't forget about the ice cream sandwiches we had for dessert. Very very tasty!!   The service was good as well. It took a little time to get a table for our bigger party, but our server Casey was on point. She was awesome! She definitely knew what she was talking about and seemed like she loved working there. She was super friendly and made sure we had everything we needed at all times. I'm glad we had her serving us!!   I've only been to a handful of burger joints in Vegas, but this place ranks up right at the top! Highly recommended to anyone looking for a great burger spot and a fun place to grab a drink and hang with friends.   Cheers!!

photos.caption: Photo of Umami Burger -  SLS Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The truffle burger with extra patty :))

RwrSiMa5Ue_XCb2yHlOxqw.text: Burger was very underwhelming and they weren't very clear about which beers qualified for the Yelp offer.  Perhaps my expectations were too high (given the hype/reputation of the brand), but I wouldn't recommend the lackluster food and average service.
