Photo of Umami Burger -  SLS Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Umami Burger -  SLS Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States

2-kItcgonYbab6Bpndnpmg.text: I was skeptical trying Unami Burger at first because of some of the low reviews. I had  a 50% off coupon because it was my birthday month so I figured , "why not"? I called ahead of time to the hotel's players club to see how to redeem the coupon and they told me to redeem it at Unami Burger. When I got to Unami Burger they told me to go to the players club to redeem it ....see the run around. Finally the players club had to work with Unami on how to redeem it. When I got back the fries were cold and the burger was warm but at least the problem was solved.   I had the Manly Burger which consisted of beer cheddar, bacon lardons (bacon chunks), smoked salt onion strings, house ketchup, and mustard. The burger was juicy and had a distinctive taste it didn't taste like a burger from Jack and the Box or anything like that. The burger was overall very tasty. The Make em Manly fries was a different story. In short they tasted pretty bad the fries being cold didn't help either. It had the same toppings as the burger but the taste differed in the fries . It was too salty for me to eat and the fries were not crispy enough to withstand the toppings. The fries ended up a soggy mess. I ended with Mintimalism for dessert. It's a double chocolate chip cookies with dirty mint chip ice cream. I wouldn't suggest this unless you really like mint like I do. It felt like Christmas in my mouth which was great because I wanted to get rid of the salty taste of the fries out of my mouth.   The service was very accommodating despite the birthday coupon snafu. They kept checking on us to see if we needed anything else. If you don't want to try Unami for full price the SLS offers 50% off one of their restaurants every Sunday. You would need to call ahead to the players club to see which one is being discounted on that Sunday.

photos.caption: Photo of Umami Burger -  SLS Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Manly burger
Photo of Umami Burger -  SLS Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Manly fries
Photo of Umami Burger -  SLS Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mintimlism

uFkJEGS2uW4NjIMYwJAORQ.text: After a long day driving to Vegas, I wanted to get some food close to the hotel we were staying at. Unfortunately, I didn't want the buffet since I had heard some bad things about it so decided to go to a better place (being Umami).  I know there are other Umami burgers (one in SF), but I definitely wanted to try it.   As a family we ordered the smother 'em fries and a some nachos. We had them to share. The nachos were good - like regular nachos with beef. However the smother 'em fries are delicious. Gravy and shredded short ribs are a delicious topping to fries. It's really like poutine without the cheese curds. Wished that we could just get the fries poutine style!   I ended up ordering the Royale burger - with short ribs, truffled aioli, and truffle cheese. All this truffle is delicious in a burger. My dad ordered the original which he enjoyed. Brother ordered the B.U.B. which was a big burger. 2 patties is quite a bit to eat, but he seemed to have enjoyed it a lot. Mom ordered the ahi tuna burger. Delicious!   Overall, decent service, kind of slow, but there quite a few people eating at 9, but then again it is Vegas. Burgers came before the nachos and fries which we wanted as an appetizer which was kind of weird.

photos.caption: Photo of Umami Burger -  SLS Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fries and nachos
Photo of Umami Burger -  SLS Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Royale burger

ksvCv3y5BX09OZci6QUISA.text: Mandy was our sever and let me say she was AMAZING. Phenomenal server.  Aside from that, the buffalo wings were the best we ever had. We also tried some of their draft beers and had 5 dollar shots. Great place, good ambiance, definitely would give it 5 stars.

okT9Z5ysgBADqQAhLy-auw.text: Got the manly burger and OMG!!!! FREAKING AMAZING!!!!  Our server Tashja was awesome! Made us feel very welcomed! Sweet as can be!!! Great vibes I got from here  I am DEFINITELY coming back on my next trip to Vegas!

4C8RD_duSe8n1yp03av_uw.text: OMG!!  This place is AWESOME!! We tried another upscale burger place while in town & Umami was SOOO much better! I had the Ahi Burger and my hubby had the Truffle Burger, they were both incredible. Great flavor and presentation. The drinks were good and service friendly (thanks Casey!). This is our new FAVORITE burger spot in Vegas FOR SURE!!

photos.caption: Photo of Umami Burger -  SLS Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States

i8DfJ35BqLdbgA-Q1rXAgw.text: Ok sorry I  know that as a Vegan I should not have any expectations of being able to eat something in a burger joint.  Serious I know this.  But when you travel with people that eat meat there is a certain amount of compromise that must be done.  So there I was at the Umani Burger - went all the way to vegas to eat at a chain, so disappointing.    Anyway,  I was pleasantly surprised to see that there was a portabella burger on the menu,  so I order this to share with Buttercup and then we find out that the bun has butter, so our waiter enthusiastically informs us that he can make it a wrap and will take care of us so we order the portabella and sweet potato fries.    Ok what comes out is the just wrong on so many levels.  it is a grilled mushroom and a couple leaves of lettuce.  no tomato, no onions pickles like nothing.... I ask for tomato or something he leaves and comes back to tell me the tomatoes are not vegan.  Whaaaatttt?  ok so we eat our mushroom and lettuce and them try to fries.  They are covered in sugar and cinnamon. super gross who decided this is a good idea.  So at this point our waiter is avoiding us,  I catch him because he can't avoid the customers around us and request regular fries.  He brings he takes away the desert fries and brings us regular ones.  They could use a little salt, but the table has none,  what every we eat this and wait for our bill.  The bill finally arrives and yes they charged us 12.95 for a portabella mushroom and a couple pieces of lettuce.  Really if the kitchen or our waiter had put any effort at all into making this decent then that would have been one thing but not so much.  The draft beer selection was decent. My friends enjoyed their burger so if you want a burger then it beats McDonalds and they have beer so sure go for it.

photos.caption: Photo of Umami Burger -  SLS Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Vegan food by Unami burger. Mushroom and lettuce.  They couldn&#39;t even bring me a tomato to go with it.

XL6ky4-Svkhg_Dbe6oQjZA.text: I love this place. It's chill and it's got one of my fav burgers in LA, flat screens at all angles to watch any game you want and lots of beer options. On Mondays, KU noodle is closed, and so are most the other "light bite" places at lunch, so Umami was the ultimate choice. We got the most lively waiter ever, being 1pm in the afternoon and hung over, he happily brought us everything we needed to remedy our ailments.    The burgers are on-par with the LA counterparts, but I still wish they would ditch the ketchup in a spoon concept. I need more ketchup than that. The garlic fries are bomb, but the sweet potato fries were a bit dry. The best part of the meal was the mint chocolate icecream sandwiches. Real mint leaves infused in icecream wedged between two chocolate cookies. B.O.M.B. Must try for anyone who hasn't had it.

photos.caption: Photo of Umami Burger -  SLS Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Ahi tuna poke appy

Ogy2O-TYl5HQUYnZVeiGHA.text: Meh. We decided on here because I've heard people rave about their veggie burger. Guess what - they don't have a veggie patty option here, LOL. The portabello mushroom was nothing special. We also split the regular fries and the arugula beet salad, the latter of which was extremely tasty. For Vegas, not so bad. In a fairly nice, modern, sleek hotel type (best looking type of people in Vegas I tell you), but much like many of the food options in Vegas, so whatevs.

Ars9lR-QtedsdIbVnrpdxw.text: This is my kind of place. Plenty of televisions, good food, good service, and a sports book that will give you money to pay your tab (if you happen to give them the right number). I've been here four times total, with visits for both lunch and dinner last Wednesday.  On Wednesday night, we came for game one Cavs/Hawks. There are plenty of televisions so you can catch your favorite baseball team also. For drinks, we had the bucket of 5 beers for $20. If you have your Code card, they offer drink specials for members. Ashley took good care of us for the duration of our stay. No complaints with our service this time or any time previously.  We had nachos and wings while we were there. Both were average. We didn't get any burgers that night, but I've had three on the menu. And while not the best ever, a few of them have some unique twists and I would rate them above average. I like the sunny side and hatch. We also received a free order of delicious ice cream sandwiches using a coupon which was in the discount booklet for guests staying at the hotel.  The biggest draw for me is the sports book along with the in game wagering if you're following the flow of the game. We were pumped that the Cavs took game one on the road. We were even more pumped that we took the +2. We took our $100 winnings after we cashed our ticket, gave it to Ashley, and walked out happy without giving away a dime out of our pockets. I'll be back for drink specials, to get some action on the game I'm watching, or just to hang out, possibly in the beer garden.

AjzCsMcOoXzTwaCTE2bMyw.text: So slow. We have been sitting here forever waiting for a basic hamburger. None of the tables have food. I would have expected better service at a nice resort. My husband ordered no onions, no mustard. He got both. I asked for ranch dressing. They didn't bring it. The menu says you get 2 beef patties, but you get one. Avoid this place.

P6tNEPYzKaFgR_ofOSnibw.text: Meh this location doesn't have the full selection as the other umami burger chains do. Considering the diverse selection of food that Vegas has there are definitely better options for burgers/food (mesa grill as an example!). The burger was fine, but honestly I would have been just as happy eating a meal from five guys for a little less of the cost. I think 3/5 stars is pretty accurate. They do have an awesome outside area though if the weather permits!

tN4dwyfg0wPTFgqwxQHl5w.text: Very yummy! I'm staying at the SLS this week and we decided to check this place out before we checked in. Sexy, swanky decor. We were greeted and seated immediately. Our waitress, can't remember her name, was really nice as she explained the burger concept to us. I was curious to know about the bacon londrons that came on the Manly burger and she did an excellent job explaining it to me. We got the nachos and we both got the Manly burger. When I tell you those nachos were DELICIOUS! And the BURGER! The actual burger was seasoned so well and it was so juicy. The cheese spread that was on it was so flavorful and those bacon londrons set it off real proper like! Everything is a la carte. Slightly pricey, but it's VEGAS!

GUbZhmNRqpbkgi2tMqhngg.text: Burger perfection! I was able to customize my burger and it was perfectly prepared. We had the tuna poke and truffle fries for apps. The truffle fries were a bit strong for our taste, but still good. The husband had the hatch chili burger and described it as awesome.   Service was great. The 14oz beer was described as a pint, but the husband just went for the big mug anyway. I expect this will be one of the best burgers we will have on the trip.

photos.caption: Photo of Umami Burger -  SLS Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States

rotvx9zdkOKTcrsACWwj9A.text: We came here for #SocialSundays when locals get 50% off the menu at a selected restaurant and obviously, on a Sunday. What a fabulous deal! I made a reservation through OpenTable and requested a table in their Beer Garden. The hostess couldn't find my reservation, but luckily, I resolved that through OpenTable. Fortunately, it wasn't busy yet and we were seated in our preferred area immediately.   Side note: They're open an hour earlier (10AM) on Saturdays and Sundays during football season. If you sit inside, there's a $50 F&B minimum PER PERSON during the 10AM games. This does not apply to the Beer Garden though!  The Beer Garden is their outdoor patio facing Las Vegas Blvd. There are several televisions along the walls showing multiple games. The seating is picnic tables and very casual. There's also an entrance/exit to street, but you can't just seat yourself. It was a great atmosphere, especially with the beautiful weather that day. They don't allow smoking on the patio, but some patrons thought that hanging their arm off the patio railing meant that they were abiding. Yeah, no. The smoke was bothersome and off-putting.  Our server was really nice and with supporting staff, everyone was relatively attentive to our needs. The manager was constantly walking around the restaurant and he was approachable. There was an issue where we were watching a particular game and it was switched abruptly (however, the audio remained on that game) and we spoke to our server and the manager to have it resolved. First, we were told by our server that they do not change the channels for anyone or any reason (Really?). Second, we were told by the manager that the games switch automatically during Half Time, however, the television did not revert back after the game had resumed the second quarter. It took approximately 15 minutes for the game to FINALLY appear! No explanation as to what occurred. I can't imagine anyone being happy if this happens often during big games.  Truffled Beet Salad ($7): truffled ricotta, smoked almonds, wild baby arugula, and truffle dressing. The arugula was fresh. The truffle wasn't too overpowering. Overall, a decent salad, but nothing special. It's missing something - I didn't get that "umami" factor.  Fried Pickles ($6): artisan-crafted pickles, jalapeno, ranch, and shaved Parmesan. The pickles were okay; still had a bit of crunch. The batter was light.  Nothing remotely worthy of a repeat.  Smushed Potatoes ($4) with roasted garlic aioli. These were good. The potatoes were nice and soft inside while having some exterior texture. Their roasted garlic aioli is great.  Thin Fries ($3): Nothing special, but not terrible.  Umamify Your Fries - Truffle 'Em ($3): truffle cheese fondue and truffle salt. This definitely made their boring fries much more exciting. Nothing I'd come back for though.  Hatch Burger ($11): Roasted green chiles, house American cheese, and roasted garlic. This was just okay. It wasn't cooked medium rare like we requested. There was nothing exciting or even good. I can barely recall its taste now.  The Original ($12): Parmesan frico, shiitake mushroom, roasted tomato, caramelized onions, and Umami house ketchup. This burger was terrible. The burger had no flavor and I didn't have anything remotely close to an "umami" experience with it. Oh, and you know how it says you get "shiitake mushroom" with your burger? Yeah, you really get only ONE mushroom and it had the circumference of half dollar coin! WTF?! How does that make any sense? Why wouldn't you slice the ridiculously small mushroom and attempt to distribute it on the entire burger? You get the experience of a shiitake mushroom, but only in one bite. You're SOL with the rest of the burger.  Spanish Royalty Combo ($35): Jose Andres Burger and Estrella Damm Inedit. The Jose Andres Burger ($15 individually) has a pork and cured ham patty, piquillo pepper confit, caramelized onions, Manchego cheese, and roasted garlic aioli. The Estrella Damn Inedit (750mL; $25 individually) is a malt and wheat beer created by Ferran Adria and his El Bulli team in 2009. So, you save $5 with the combo. Thank goodness this burger was good! It earned the additional star. The patty was juicy and the whole burger was extremely flavorful (or maybe just in comparison to the other tasteless burgers). I was happy with this burger. Ruben enjoyed the beer very much.  The food was extremely disappointing. We've been to Umami Burger in California and really enjoyed it, so this experience was surprising. The burgers are much smaller than the ones we had there. Even the Smushed Potatoes are smaller! Everything was hit with a shrink ray when it came to Las Vegas. The sides were decent, but the burgers (the Jose Andres Burger being the exception) were offensive! Also, I'm not sure when you receive the soup spoons with dipping sauces, but we weren't offered!

4ihW_EVJxQ1QmyUCw4MSGQ.text: Food was the bomb!!  Had the Cali burger and wow!!!   Our server name Tashja made it such a fun experience...best server we've encountered in Vegas that obviously enjoyed her job and enjoyed us tourist folks  Thank you guys for a awesome experience

rLVRe6ZKdOB2iTKeMaxQzA.text: We started with the pretzel, which is impressively large.  The beer cheese dip was so good I got a side with my chicken fingers.  My husband got the manly burger (also because of the cheese).   I had a Sahara Cooler which was ok...refreshing, but the flavor was a bit off for me.  Husband had the Original Sin apricot cider, which was ok, but I like their straight cider better.  The chicken fingers were indeed extra crispy and well done.  The jalapeno ranch dip was strongly jalapeno and the first bite was a little much for me.   When I added less dip to chicken it was tasty.   Husband liked the burger...saying the bacon lardons (like French fry sized bacon pieces) was weird but good.   We also got a flight of the beers...mostly from the local Tenaya Creek, which were pretty good (keep in mind we are not big beer drinkers).    Overall, a good experience, though the service when we first got here was a little lacking.

AY4ZbEZirw_iDlwkZYg23A.text: Don't believe the hype. I don't know maybe the one in California is way different and much better.  The layout was cool open concept, gets pretty loud since you can watch the game and  the sls sports book is inside umami. The service was ok, we had to flag the server down for some refills. Didn't check up on us frequently how he did his other two tables.  Food was not the best! The burgers were plain no lettuce just meat, cheese, and a sauce. I got the the classic and it had a roasted tomato I felt like I was eating a meatball sub. The truffle burger was better but still plain. Fries got soggy real Quick, onion rings were over battered and soggy. The only thing I liked was my jasmine green tea. I did not feel like I got my money's worth. I spent $50 for nothing. All a hype. I won't return.

photos.caption: Photo of Umami Burger -  SLS Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Looks better than it tasted..

97AZLSWNCM1eCOzhldOMAQ.text: Burgers were good.  Like the large TV, would be a great place for a quick game and food.

YcPIlQIkF_n1_M-jdpqhkA.text: We Stayed at sls and saw the umami sign so wanted to try it out. We were greeted and given the menu to check out. This is located inside the sports book. They are lots of huge television showing baseball for entertainment. I browsed to the menu and decided umami burger and truffle fries. Carlos our server said the umami was good and he recommended truffle fries. He also gave us free cheesy tater tots. Burger came out excellent and truffle fries was on point. There is a slight tanginess and sweetness to the umami burger that I liked, definitely one the tastiest burgers I had. Carlos is awesome and this place is great, would recommend umami burger.

photos.caption: Photo of Umami Burger -  SLS Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Truffle fries
Photo of Umami Burger -  SLS Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Umami burger

C4kwCPh9AoDouqNaHO8IMQ.text: I vouched for Umami in my BurGR review, only knowing what existed in LA. Since my visit to Umami in Las Vegas I have gone ahead and altered that.   It's been years since my visit to a Umami, but I remember the trendy vibe they'd have going on. It's a negative here, it's got the feel of a Hooters.  The sports book? They have a guy in a polo taking bets with lunch order style betting sheets.  The service was moody. One second they smile with your greeting, then they don't at your order taking, then they do when they bring you your food and then they...you get it.  Umami Stuff  The burgers were the only thing that I could close my eyes to and feel like I was on Cahuenga Blvd.  Truffle Burger: The truffle everything gave it a melty taste that faded into your taste buds quite nicely. The meat was cooked how I ordered it. Another solid one at Umami. 4/5  Sliders: I love caramelized onions. So to pack that in a bite size serving was nice.  The overall was nothing short of what I would expect but nothing above. 3.75/5  Truffle Fries: I'm such a sucker for the word truffle. They were alright. I wouldn't say that their truffle cheese is the best match for everything but the fries were well fried and that didn't hurt the topping. 3.75/5  Boring Review  I felt no energy writing this and it might be because I pictured myself there all over again. The burgers are Umami burgers but the ambiance and service just did not feel like it has in the past at other locations. I would not recommend a stop at Umami Las Vegas but I will say their burgers are a must try. It makes sense, believe me, it makes sense.

photos.caption: Photo of Umami Burger -  SLS Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. They&#39;ve got you covered
Photo of Umami Burger -  SLS Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The art of the bite

kj2kLWl6tHR2wBGnJPtc4g.text: Worst Poke Bowl I have had.  Pretty much lettuce with counted bits of Tuna. Avoid this plate and do a burger.

UDyg3v-C18u6rNV65S2d9A.text: Though portions have gotten smaller, the food is still excellent and the service was superior (Shout out to AJ )!!!! This is the place to be of you can't be at the T-mobile for a Knights games.   The menu has gone under yet another renovation, but my tried and True favorites have remained - the truffle beet salad and the Cali burger. I tried the impossible burger for the first time and it was amazing and I can understand how it got it's name... drool, for a non red meat alternative... it really established what vegetarian can taste like.   YUM!!!

R4LrTVOzdiEnIlyG8j1fLQ.text: Before heading to the airport, totally spent from a few days of "conventioneering" and a little late-night indulgence with friends, I needed some some lunch...hello Umami Burger!  Turned out, it was a great spot to relax, watch some sports, have a beer from their excellent selection of brews and eat good food with friendly, efficient service.  My wife ordered a pretzel to get started - YES!  A giant, yummy pretzel showed up with two dipping sauces (a cup of dark mustard and a cup of melted cheese.)  Loved it.  I ordered a turkey burger with sweet potato fries for lunch. Oh my, it was delicious - all of it!  The burger was not giant, but sized appropriately for a normal human being.  It was beautifully presented and tasted delicious.  The sweet potato fries showed up in a sizable bowl sprinkled with sugar & cinnamon (they were delightfully good and complimented the tart green sauce on the turkey burger.)  In all, a rewarding lunch experience.  I'd like to return sometime and have a few brews in the beer garden.  4 stars

photos.caption: Photo of Umami Burger -  SLS Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Greenbird Burger (turkey burger). Tasted as good as it looked!

4WQrCMHnQTXdpnE8SPjuvw.text: Service was ok.  I can't even remember which burger I got, it was either the Truffle or the Manly.  And the truffle fries.  It didn't take long for my order to be done.   So the fries looked yummie, but wayyyy too salty.  So the burger was dry, so I had to ask for more sauce.  As I was eating it, it seemed to also be way to salty.  Com'on Umami, ease up off the salt!  Let people add there own salt to it.  I couldn't even finish my burger or fries.  I only ate 1/2.  And if anyone knows me, I try and eat everything on my plate, and I couldn't do it.  Even 1/2 was a bit much.  Heck I guess we broke even, because I used the local speciall they were running.  Locals eat for 1/2 price and that's all I ate was 1/2.  I would have been pissed if I would have paid full price for this burger, it wasn't worth it!

photos.caption: Photo of Umami Burger -  SLS Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States

G7-fuGezQ8RLSc4Z5F97gg.text: Some of my sorority sisters and I stopped here for a late lunch between our meetings on Saturday and I was quite surprised. After reading some fellow Yelpers reviews I wasn't expecting much but the food ended up tasting pretty darn good.  I opted for the Hatch with a portobello mushrooms rather then the burger just to mix things up a bit. The flavor was great! It was a bit messy to eat since the chillies kept sliding out and the bun was a little bit bland, but overall very good.   I also went with the side of truffle fries, yum. They had a cheesy topping on them as well as plenty truffle flavor. I personally love skinny fries so these were right up my alley.  I must say it was a bit pricey for a burger joint, but it is technically the strip after all so you kind of have to expect that. My bill came to around $30 for a "burger," fries and pear cider.

photos.caption: Photo of Umami Burger -  SLS Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Portobello hatch burger
Photo of Umami Burger -  SLS Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Truffle fries

4k8Gfb4bYeMY0PWyCrjgtQ.text: There's an Umami Burger at the SLS Hotel! This isn't fast food and definitely a great spot if you're looking for a gourmet burger. They have various specialty burgers and always have the logo on the buns. They're fries are amazing!  The have shock top on tap!  The restaurant is pretty big and can accommodate large groups! We fit a group of 15 people when I first came here on a work trip.   Definitely worth checking out!

M2jyq0A3f_PSd6nNtFHf4w.text: Had a Cesar salad, umami burger and truffle fries. Truffle fries were to die for and I give the burger and the salad a solid B+. Service was meh at best and ambiance left something to be desired. Wwere told there was going to be a fifteen minute wait when half the place was empty and continued to be empty and when the bill came out we were overcharged. We told waitress bill was wrong and she kind of shrugged her shoulders. Also on the negative side was two flat beersI'll be back though... the chicken fingers looked ahmayzing!

photos.caption: Photo of Umami Burger -  SLS Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Umami burger
Photo of Umami Burger -  SLS Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States

4rbpRqyHtHuFylwzryiRgA.text: Nope. Came once and got horrible service and unremarkable food. Came back, and was again completely ignored by staff in this area. The SLS is involved in the Rock N Roll 5K event, and had several participants staying at their hotel. I came here prior to the run, and my BF stayed here while it was going on.   Arrived to a fairly empty restaurant area, despite the busy casino floor and many race participants around- BF approached the bar to order a beer,  placed a bet at the counter, and watched a game. After being gone nearly an hour, I returned. BF stated he hadn't been able to order anything, because no one had come by. At all. In almost an hour.  We stuck around a little longer to see how a game ended, then went to another property to dine. This is now the second time we have tried to come here and apparently the staff do not have any interest in providing service. It's not due to lack of staff: there are plenty chatting away to one another. I have no idea how this place stays open.

pwtBCmoFkojanmNJM0wKiQ.text: The service is horrible. Expect to be ignored. This is my third time here and I consistently have to try and get a server's attention to get menus, water refills or to even order. I would not recommend this place.

RGM3XdCVGr9Z-pbMmDaAiw.text: After reading most reviews, I was excited to visit this burger joint. The environment is amazing, allowing you to feel as if you're in an extra chill sports lounge (thumbs up). Shout out to Megan who provided excellent service, and was very upbeat!    I definitely recommend this place when in the area (or even when not in the area. Well worth it).

lqmGvgcfAeK37RtBuaFecA.text: Umamimamimami! Excellent experience!  Staying in SLS/W and upon checking in around 11pm , definitely needed lunch!   Umami is a sportsbook as well, so it was pretty lively on Sunday at 12pm with plenty of people in gear rooting for their team.  1. Ambiance is lively. There are hightops, tables, booths with personal TVs, bar with games, AND comfy coaches in front of HUGE screens. 5/5  2. Drinks are good. Upon checking in we redeemed free 16 red rock beers. The other option is free fries. I purchased two additional ones at $7 each with an additional whisky shot $5 each. They have many size options available to accommodate all sizes of thirsty. 5/5  3. Food was AMAZING! My date had the manly burger. He is quite a big guy himself but was full for hours after.  I did not taste it, but he raved about richness and amazing taste.  I had the ahi tuna seared burger. WOW! This was so delicious,  a must try! I had lettuce and tomato added.  I really like that it was a full leaf, not shredded.  We added some tasty wings and truffle fries , so delicious! 5/5  4. Service is solid here. We were welcomed immediately and sat without wait. After our server took orders, another waitress brought waters and place settings.  Despite it being a packed house , service never lagged! We were never left empty handed and they took all empty plates and cups during our meal. Perfect! 5/5

XxV7i_XJRTBNAAnGqpCfZw.text: The restaurant was very nice and clean, while still having a rustic appearance. I ordered the Barvarian pretzel which was very delicious. It was piping hot and made fresh in their bakery. The pretzel was ginormous and was one of the best ones I've ever had.  We also ordered the green burger which was very healthy and made with a turkey patty. It could have used a little more flavor but I appreciated their healthy spin on a burger.

G19DCvhTzro8mIXwWQWEjw.text: Bought an NCAA viewing package for two for $275 which got us a table and drinks. "Full menu available" means they allow you to order food not that food is included with the package. Why the f is that even mentioned? Am I buying the option to buy food here that's not available to the general public. Caught a bad server but I don't think that's representative. It kind of sucked. Pretty disappointed.

bttWm7-CLiOUshjP24mD0Q.text: After reading friends reviews I came in with low expectations.  Like others I have had Umami Burger in LA and enjoyed it.  I ordered the Truffle Burger, hubby ordered the Manly Burger and we shared Garlic Parmesan Fries.  He had some kind of cider and I had a soda.  Soda is only available in bottles.  Can't get a fountain drink even though they have fountain at the bar they get the rest of the drinks from.  Burgers were cooked perfect.  Flavors were on point.  Service was excellent.  We came in for lunch during the week and there were only a handful of tables occupied.  Loved the sports bar atmosphere.  TV's everywhere including in our booth.  Fun place to place a bet and watch a game.

photos.caption: Photo of Umami Burger -  SLS Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Truffle Burger, Garlic Parmesan Fries

Xae8zYT5RIxbhIb1risF3Q.text: Got to try Umami Burger since I stayed at SLS Las Vegas. I always hear about this place upon their delicious burgers! My boyfriend and I decided to eat here before we headed back home. We both sat down and look through the menu. The menu threw us off with the very limited selections. "That's it? Hm... ok!" Lol. I definitely thought it was more to it. We shared our order of chicken tender, umami burger, and sweet potato fries. The chicken tender was just perfect and crispy! Umami burger was juicy with great flavors. The crispy cheese! Yum. It's different, but good. Sweet potato... meh. It was way too sweet. It taste kind of like candy or maybe too much cinnamon on it? *shrugs*  -1 Star: Service was a little slow since I think there was only 1 or 2 waitress on the floor.  Overall experience, it was gooood. Must try, if you get a chance. Chill spot to hang out and watch the game too. I dig the set up with the couch and tables! Great atmosphere.

LRmh1QXKcxlt6v3LjohnkQ.text: Service was poor. Pricing was deceptive.  Burgers were meh. Avoid this place and go to in and out burger. You'll be glad you saved the funds

7NEQOb-0-cqPzVG1nRVgIA.text: Bad experience: There are plenty of welcoming restaurants in Vegas. Don't waste your time and money at this one.  A friend of mine stopped in to grab a late night meal. I had just won big on the slot machines and we wanted to celebrate. We opted to sit at the bar. My friend asked another customer at the bar playing the game, would she mind switching her purse to the other side so she wouldn't hit it or get any food on it. The customer, in an escalated voice, said no, I was here first and I'm not moving anything. So as soon as more seats became available, we slid down a little from the customer. We proceeded to order our meal with a nice male waiter. Then a female waitress that apparently knows the customer, started chatting about the brief incident rather loudly at the bar. We interceded and explained that it wasn't an issue, we just didn't want to hit her purse and at that time, the bar was packed with people. The female waitress started saying that gamers are the priority and she was there. We continued to explain that it wasn't a big deal. But the waitress became irate and started screaming at us. Then she placed a chair in between us and the customer. Which wasn't necessary. We were minding our business and eating chips and queso by this time. Then, a security officer comes out of nowhere and tells us to move to the other side of the bar. By this point, we are frustrated because we just wanted something to eat. We have no idea why we were not wanted at the bar. We paid with green money just like the gamer who was friends with the waitress and should have been treated equally. Once the security officer came, I chose to pay for our appetizer and beverage and cancel the rest of our food. We should not be giving our money to a business that treats customers this way.

H5BtgxNtm35AyEyBxwr3uA.text: Since I can't give zero stars...I would have to say I don't understand the point of this establishment.  I came with a few friends expecting to watch a football game.  The place was practically empty and we were greeted by our server explaining to us that we had to reach a $30 minimum per person for everyone who was going to watch the game.  When we explained not everyone would stay for the whole game she looked at us and said "that isn't how this works". Annoyed we went to a different Area to enjoy the game and again before even getting a drink order we were being told there would be a minimum per person.  I fail to understand how a sports bar with no one in it could have the audacity to try to dig into our pockets when the place isn't that special.  We took our services across the street to PTS instead.

-D7ApJHgY5760Eit_gbPYA.text: Local's perspective.  The sunny side burger with the sweet potato fries, WOW! SO. GOOD!  Ask them to make a spicy margarita.  It's not on the menu but the server had the bartender make it (after a little bit of attitude first) but wow did they come out good.     This place has a MASSIVE outdoor patio with ample seating, lots of TVs, and great exposure to the strip.  The service was okay but nothing great.  Hostess walked off without telling us to follow him.  It took much longer than it should have to get our food and drinks.  It was a Saturday morning and hardly anyone in the place.  That's my reason for 3/5 rather than a 4/5.   Other than that though the food was good, great presentation, decent portion, and a good experience.   Will be back again in the future.

LgA9ryZSPL16Qnbsfwappg.text: We tried Umami on our way to the Stratosphere. The waitress was friendly, but the food was just okay - nothing I would have to come back to when I'm in Vegas. The truffle burger was a little sweet but okay - it needed something else to complement the burger. The manly burger was delicious, though. It had a great flavor and taste to it! The truffle fries were too ooey and gooey for me. Again, it was an okay restaurant with friendly service. If we do end up going back, I won't get anything with "truffle" on the menu.

D7kQF2hYnXGxuR9MS__CTw.text: This place is absolutely one of the best on the strip. THE best burger I've ever had! Came in here with a friend for dinner and right from the start the service was top-notch. We sat at the indoor bar and our bartender was Charisma. She was very knowledgeable in the menu, gave us some great suggestions on drinks (Try the Packard Clipper, it's delicious!). She checked up on us to make sure everything was good. When our food arrived, she made sure everything was looking the way it should. You don't see that kind of dedication to the meal presentation like that anywhere. Overall, this was an amazing experience and I will be returning here on the regular! Thank you Charisma!

dnuSdtUtTLw5iWnpni1Myg.text: This place is terrible!! The hamburgers look and taste like they were frozen at some point, yet they're $11-14. I had the Cali which I couldn't even finish. The buns are so soft before I even took a bite it was so soggy. The tempura onion rings are lacking in flavor, actually so is the burger. And they call themselves a beer garden - the beer they offer is bottom shelf. I'll definitely not be coming back.   The service is good though.

f-x0Um0fGTNn--lEAOfNBA.text: We had the best experience at Umami Burger!  Came in town for work and needed to host about 40 coworkers for dinner on our last night in vegas and I am glad we picked Umami. From the moment we called with interest to the time we paid our bill everyone was really nice and accommodating. Josh Ambrose and Rhitzie Legaspi were the waiters for our party. We ended up having a few food allergies that our waiters helped us figure out and get them food they could yet. Our team is a bit rowdy so after dinner was done we turned the tables into beer pong tables and had a blast! All in all this was a terrific event and venue for large parties. We sat out on the patio and the ambiance was fantastic. Book your next event here and ask for our waiters! Our waiters were the best and never made it feel like I had to work the dinner/event planned.   Thank you!

rABGFe2_BRDQIO-_e7DXTw.text: I finally got a chance to check out SLS.   Pros-Came here on Thursday night football, and WOW! They have like a 150 4K foot screen and it was beautiful! Surround sound was incredible. Restaurant is built different then what u expect but it was cool.   Ordered the manly burger because quite frankly I'm a man. Lol it was very tasty. Wasn't blown away by it but it def did the job. The sweet potatoes fries are INCREDIBLE! They add like brown sugar to them. It's heaven In your mouth! (Pause) lol Server was really sweet and pleasant. My burger didn't come out to the specific temp I wanted and they took it off my bill. I didn't even complain! That was a huge plus I just upped her gratuity .   Cons- good beer list but some of their beer was over priced. 12$ for a Octoberfest? 14$ for a Duval? That's ridiculous lol. Maybe more menu items in the future it was pretty limited. If you don't like sports don't come here during game time (I do love sports by the way) but it gets  pretty loud.  Overall I'm glad I waited to come here. I will def be back!

1NR6K0CI0PMBDO_55A-VBA.text: Went to Umami for dinner. There were 3 of us, no alcohol, and the tab was $74 without tip just to give you an idea of the prices. Burgers are about $12, but do not come with any sides. I think that's the new trend following the lead of the pricey steakhouses. Everything is a la carte, so what you think is a $12 burger actually becomes a $15 - $20 burger once you add some fries or another side.  I had the Manly burger with American cheese and bacon. The bacon chunks were tasty, crispy on the outside and chewy inside - just right. I was hesitant on trying this place because of the negative reviews. My burger was very tasty, meat cooked right, and overall and above average burger. My wife had the Original and she loved the Parmesan frigo on it. Her cousin had the Truffle Especiale.  He loves the fried runny egg on the burger. I should have added a fried egg on my Manly burger. That would have been awesome. I have an issue with them charging $5 for a soda. I don't even know if the soda is bottomless because they only serve bottles. A Pepsi is $5, really?  Desert is an average size cookie sandwich for $7. It was OK. We tried the salted caramel ice cream with snicker doodle cookie.  Ambience - a sports bar with booths around the perimeter, and tables in the middle. Each booth had a small TV, but you can't control what is on your booth TV. That really doesn't make sense with all of the channels they have available. We wanted to watch a different game. The waiter made up some story that the "guy" with the remote was walking around and would change the channel to whatever channel we wanted. We never saw the "guy" with the remote. The people ranged in age and style from club goers having a bite to eat before hitting the club to an elderly group grabbing some burgers. There were some couples there as well. The middle of the floor has a living room type setup with large screen TVs and leather couches around some coffee tables. You can sit there and have a beer and burger, and bend down to eat over the coffee table like you do in your own living room. My wife didn't get it why there were a bunch of guys using the couches to eat. Gives you the opportunity to stand up and walk around if the game is stressing you out.  Service - sub par. I think it was just our waiter. Everything was soooo slow with him. He spent 90% of his time standing in the kitchen. I could see his bald head through the window of the kitchen door while waiting for water, to order something, desert, the check, etc. I actually gave the lowest tip I have in a long time (15%). I usually give 20% without question, but wanted to make a point. Hopefully, he gets it. He was a very nice guy, just very frustrating to have to wait for him every time we needed something. Waiter, try walking around to your tables more and ask people how they are doing. Make yourself available. The restaurant is charging premium prices for burgers. The service should match. This isn't McDonalds. Charge me McDonalds prices and I will happily get my own napkins and ketchup.   Summary - get the burger of your liking and one order of thin fries to share between 2-3 people. Burgers are good if you get them medium. Drink water or a beer (somewhat overpriced at $8 for domestic). All sodas aren't worth the price.  Skip the apps. The fried pickles ($6) taste like Vlasic yellow pickles with some breading that falls right off on the first bite. They were overly sour, and not like good deli pickles.  Skip desert as well. If you must have, split one cookie between two people.

NQ5KnzFVZZZEQuyhEFxcRA.text: Place is a lot of hype but no flavor. I didn't think the burger was all that great compared to the chains in California.   I will say that the service was top notch though. The staff were very attentive. The atmosphere and outdoor area were really nice. Good place to catch a drink at the bar and catch a few games

rchJbTMXHBHRFRTSsQ39dw.text: 5 stars for Carlos - this guy is a rockstar. any restaurant establishment would be lucky to have a guy like him on their team. excellent service  4 stars for food - ordered medium rare as recommended. burger came out a solid medium.

mkTOZpK4aj_sg8eNJln5Qw.text: Got the manly burger and my girlfriend got the sunny side with a fried egg. We split the truffle fries, everything was delicious and the outdoor seating was perfect on a warm Vegas day.

photos.caption: Photo of Umami Burger -  SLS Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Manly burger, sunny side burger, and truffle cheese fries. Yum!

5zsXiQDqx8Ckun0jUnremw.text: Love this joint. I stay at sls when I come to vegas. Carlos, is an amazing server. He hung out, chatted and listened. Didn't even feel like we were waiting on food. Good guy. And the food is always spot on.

7UsZCrbEKwtrvBIvD_lnfQ.text: Best waitress ever.  Thank You, Ritzy, for all your info.  We are so glad we decided to stay and have a burger.  If it weren't for your help we would have left.  The burger was amazing.  We'll definitely be back next trip.

l84r3ClxLme2G6fXocza4A.text: Shout out to the bartender Charisma who held it down for super bowl 2016. She served us well and happy all day long. She was super busy with all the bar patrons. I appreciate her patience. Thank you Charisma!

a27MZ4NiXkUgkMFNGOZULw.text: Great burgers. Great service - thanks Tashja! My favorite are the sweet potato fries as they have a cinnamon sweet flavor!

TvdLd6nGWXkx9DNq1rmi5g.text: Horrible service. Couldn't be worse.  That blonde worker, too bad she was the only one I saw in that bar area.  Perhaps she needs more help with taking orders and serving customers.  I checked the time I placed my order on my receipt, and it took me over 40 minutes to receive my burger. Turns out the burger has been ready for some time now.  Of course this place puts lots of sauce in their burgers, so mine was soggy and gross.  I definitely will not order if its that blonde lady taking orders.  If this is a common problem, they need to pay more attention or rethink their system.

TCrJ5j5dib9wX5sw_IE7zg.text: Good selection of beer, too bad we didn't have more time to try some others but the Union Jack was an excellent recommendation from our waitress.  We had a Truffle Burger and an Original and both were really flavorful but I have had sliders that were bigger than these burgers.  Hate paying $13.00 for a slider.    Not the best value for your buck even in Vegas, but was pretty good.

5TIz9l5qVazasBDDC_6nLA.text: We were pleasantly surprised. Came Sunday for lunch on Memorial day weekend.  Service was attentive and spot on. We got the Manly burger, maple sweet potato fries and a couple of beers. I agree that they need to update /expand the beer selection, but the vibe is great and we had a really nice lunch. The three additional dipping sauces were a tasty unique touch.  I'd come back.

photos.caption: Photo of Umami Burger -  SLS Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Snickerdoodle salted caramel ice cream dessert! Yum.

A8JlDnKk91nXv4WefUJ3EA.text: We went to have a snack we were so hungry it was good we got all that fries on the menu.  And nachos they need more more to them. I did not like that.  Either did my group.

ud3ETtSKVC5TyR3XeSapvA.text: Food was great! Our server carlos took good care of us ! I had the umami burger.  If you are ever in vegas , I would definitely recommend this place! Thanks Carlos!

z0K8PQcWC8IAu2ORYJnfSA.text: This is probably the best burger ive had in a really long time. I had the manly and it was perfect for my manly appetite. The truffle fries were also steller. Would come back if im ever on the strip again. (Also, ask for Carlos)

8OAt3Sh2DL9K77Km9APmeg.text: Best part of our stay at the SLS was our experience at Umami. Our waitress Courtney was so lovely and accommodating. We felt so well cared for here, which is NOT what I can claim of our overall stay at this hotel. Manager Joe made sure we were taken care of and even helped us manage a promotion we purchased from the hotel.  Love Umami, food and their wonderful staff. Thank you for your kind service. Highly recommend.

tzefhsn0mZLlQZUUvKaU3Q.text: I took advantage of a discount coupon (spend $50, get $20 off) to check out Umami Burger a few nights before Christmas.   It was my first visit there, & first time dining at a restaurant inside the SLS.    Things can be somewhat deceiving -- the gaming floor inside SLS at about 7PM on a Thursday night was absolutely dead.  I felt sorry for some of the dealers, etc. as they just stood there.  Some were just looking at the floor, one was actually filing her nails(!!) and when others made eye contact with you, it reminded me of volunteering at the local animal shelter, where the dogs all gaze up at you & beg you with their eyes to take them out for a walk...    Anyway, my friend & I were seated promptly (no reservation), and a waiter quickly stopped by to take our drink orders.   My iced tea was about $4, so when it showed up not filled-up to anywhere close to the top of the glass, I was rather annoyed, but thankfully, they had free refills so it was a non-issue.  My friend ordered a burger, as a vegetarian, I the one burger I could have -- the "Sloppy Mami" burger.   We decided to share an order of Battered Onion Rings, Smushed Potatoes &  Thin Fries with the Truffle treatment.    The best way to describe the atmosphere & ambience of the SLS Umami Burger -- at least at the time we were there -- is SPORTS BAR!   There were dozens of TVs all over the place, *plus* the SLS 'Sports Book' is just there on the other side of a rail -- its basically part of Umami Burger, whether they describe it that way or not.  Seems like if you're wagering at the sport book, you're basically going to sit at one of the tables used by Umami Burger.   The place was loud -- so loud that my friend & I really couldn't carry on much of a conversation.  I have no idea if it's always like that, or perhaps there were just some particularly 'important' games going on that evening (I'm not a sports fan...).    My "Sloppy Mami" burger was, despite the name & list of ingredients, actually pretty tasty so I was pleasantly surprised.  A lot of 'upscale' burger places just glop a bunch of vegetables together into a patty to make one token burger for us vegetarians & that's what I was expecting, but the Umami people actually seemed to put a lot of thought & effort into designing theirs, and it was very good.   My friend said his burger was good.    The onion rings were just OK -- not a lot of flavor to them unless you dipped them into the ketchup, and them they tasted like ketchup.  Come to think about it, onion rings at most places are pretty bland.  Umami was no exception.    Thankfully, the thin fries & Smushed Potatoes were great -- mostly thanks to the truffle flavoring.    All in all, food & service were very good.  If I was big into football, I suppose I may have appreciated the atmosphere, but there's a difference between showing some sports on TV & being a sports bar, and at least during prime-time hours, Umami Burger is absolutely a noisy sports bar.    In retrospect, they do have outdoor seating -- a semi climate controlled patio looking out onto Las Vegas Blvd.  I'm not sure if it's only open seasonally, and I know it does have TV sets in that section too, but it may have provided us with a quieter environment.    It can be a lot of fun to people-watch along the Las Vegas Strip but the Umami Burger patio area is back a couple dozen yards from the Strip/sidewalk, plus the SLS is on what at least these days is considered the far Northern extreme of the LV Strip, so there's not a lot of action to watch.    Would I go back?   Maybe in a couple months, if I had another coupon, yes.   But without a coupon, I can get food I like better elsewhere, cheaper.    If I was into sports & staying at the SLS, I'd go there to grab a beer & watch the game.

F4o6pcrT-uAsCcVXDHiGrw.text: Had the manly burger with a fried egg.  Absolutely Amazing!!!  Sarah was an excellent server as well.  I would eat here regularly if I could.

5XGT9Awn0ls_rMU9-tSyUw.text: I returned into town with a couple of my girlfriends for a birthday. We had a last minute dinner our party of 8 walked in and the hostess was able accommodate our party in a large comfortable booth. We had the Nachos and Cheesy Tots to start off with, along with a 100oz beer tower to top of a hot summers day! Our burgers came out at perfect medium rare temperature. The server was amazing. The manager checked on our table as well even sent out a birthday shot for our friend! Can't wait to return again!

OAOX5Ry_u4awLm9PzCTFSw.text: We came here for lunch and ordered a burger, onion rings, and wings. Of those, the burger was the winner and the main reason for my 4 stars since it was the main part of the meal for us. It was soooo tender, juicy and flavorful. We really enjoyed it. The onion rings were breaded nicely and fried, but not greasy. Unfortunately they were totally flavorless. We told our waitress, but it wasn't taken off the bill or anything despite us clearly eating less than half of them.   The wings were ok. I felt the bleu cheese dipping sauce was really a detriment to the wings as it was nearly bitter and a runny consistency....rather odd in my opinion. I love dipping my wings in bleu cheese, so I was really let down on that one  I also ordered a Pepsi because my hypoglycemia had badly kicked in, so I was really surprised to see it come in a bottle. Definitely trendy, but honestly, I prefer it from the fountain, especially for the price and no refill.   The presentation was really impressive, the atmosphere was really fun and laid back, especially for people like us who had literally only been in town for maybe an hour. I enjoyed finding my hometown pro team stickers on the wall, and cheering on a few teams on the huge tv's. I really like how they have so many games going so you get a nice variety. We really liked the SLS, so it would be a place we'd gladly try again

SWUSrVS0XpudkqbUxVz_Sg.text: Boy. Do I hate this place. But before a concert where else is there in this hell hole to get a drink?    The outside bar was closed because "it was too hot". Hmmm. I thought SLS was supposed to cater to the locals.   So I have to sit at the gaming bar.  I put my $20 in the machine and then the bartender informs me that the large beers r not compted when u play.  Isn't that nice?  After I ordered.   After I said something she did fix the issue with a smaller beer. However I was already done once again with this place.   I guess the only way to c a concert at SLS and get there early to enjoy a pop or two is to bring your own.   That's what I will b doing from here on out.

-H59sqF55AxCciqeJy2U5g.text: This place served me a generous portion of food but I was here mainly to chill on drinks with some friends. The beer garden is a pretty good spot to hang out but the service sucks in a bad bedside manner kind of way. Our server was attentive and delivered our food and drinks promptly, but this woman had an attitude. She was not friendly and pretty much acted like we were an inconvenience. I'll be honest and say we were a little slow to get our orders in, but more than half of our group consisted of European nationals and half of them with spotty English. You'd think someone who works at a place that caters to tourists would have a little more patience.   I'd wanted to try this place for a good while. Now that I have, I can say I am unimpressed. I'll give it two stars-- one for prompt service and another because the security guys manning the entrances are helpful and friendly-- but I don't care to spend money here again.

KJurnSbuNfjJgHURuhr0eA.text: I wish I was back in Vegas right now just to grab the amazing Ahi Tuna burger at UMami!  Absolutely hands down the best thing I had eaten in a long time!  The restaurant had been plenty of room and seating inside and outside.  Wide range of beer selection and very nice staff.  The only thing I was a little unhappy about was how long the service took. I will definitely be back for the Ahi Tuna burger for sure!

Everything was great from the burgers to the appetizers to the selection of brews. All of the employees were super friendly and courteous. You can tell this is a well run establishment. We will definitely be back the next time we are in Vegas.

crmxVwOBLQxl3Cu8-33Kfg.text: We did go eat here before we went to freemont street. A very nice experience. They have a great outside place and inside area.   Nice diffrent burgers to try. I had the sunny side and this one was a blast. With truffle butter..delicious!  Also the service was friendly and nice. Gave some reccomodations for the menu and also asked for refill our bucket of beer.

photos.caption: Photo of Umami Burger -  SLS Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sunny side burger.

pkQp3j0z2iVfTZ3NCODDlg.text: Ate here at the recommendation of a friend who said it was the best burger they ever ate. Ordered the chicken fingers appetizer--absolutely nothing special about it. My husband ordered a Guinness that was all foam and the waitress told him to just "give it time."  It ended up half foam still so we sent it back. I ordered the hatch burger and my husband ordered the manly burger. We also got a side of sweet potato fries. The burgers were good, but definitely not the best burgers we've ever had. If I'm making a trip to the strip for burgers, i would rather eat at Gordon Ramsey Burgr or Burger Bar. Atmosphere is cool--would be fun with a group of people to watch a game. Prices were decent for the strip.

mU33wuoLIcMf5uaNPOQfbA.text: What can I say other then I love this place. Not just because of the great hand made food made to order but because when you're located in Vegas, you get sectional couches to relax on and tons of TV screens located throughout this fine location. Oh did I also mention that you can place bets on any sports games there while you eat.   Umami burger is conveniently located with the beautiful SLS casino at the end of the strip. So because it's a new casino what better way to pull people in then to build one of the best burger joints to eat at. The layout of this place is awesome! The have a bar and bench area that overlooks the strip but puts you right in front of this wall size TV screen. That's almost every mans dream right there, to have huge burgers covered with truffle cheese sauce and a cold beer.   I will say they also have extra dishes on there menu compared to the California locations. So that was a pleasant surprise. So the first time I was there I ordered there standard truffle burger, (I love truffles) so this burger was packed with flavor and a side of oozing and rich truffle fries. On day two I ordered the 12oz. double patty, caramelized onion infused B.U.B burger. If you're on a diet or squeamish, I suggest you not order this burger. It will keep you set for the rest of the day.  So when in Vegas or staying at the SLS, stop by umami burger. It's never let me down and hopefully it won't for you.

photos.caption: Photo of Umami Burger -  SLS Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States

AJT52mB_KvgvNf-at8fEYw.text: Pretty tasty burgers. I ordered the truffle burgers and truffle fries and they were truly something special. The ahi tuna burger was a little weird for me and didn't mix well in my stomach. The ice cream sandwich was also a little strange since it used buns instead of cookies, but I'm giving them four stars for outstanding truffle recipes.

bAFXgXB5EjUjWpuVNaOEJA.text: I was so happy when I heard Umami burger was opening here in Vegas. Ate at the California location and i was in love. ZKPMNklSL9KH6tyCuiRmCQ.text: Tashja service was excellent! The Truffle burger is a must... You will not be disappointed oh the sweet potato fries are awesome............

qsz2ww-xdeD6gzk9LiwdIQ.text: Tashja was an awesome waitress! She was so helpful in helping us decide what to purchase off the menu! Love her personality! Thank you for being great!

51YVgHhDkfbb0JKQ9pSTLQ.text: I stopped in last week for a quick bite between meetings (I was in town for a conference), and I was PLEASANTLY surprised. I really didn't know what to expect, but everything ended up being phenomenal.   I had 2 great IPA's that my server, Abby recommended to me. She knew I was eating alone, so she was extra sweet and chatted with me about my conference and suggested some local things to do that evening.   I told Abby that I suffer from celiac, and she helped me pick something out that was gluten free. I ended up with the fabulous Turkey Green Bird and a side of Sweet Potato fries. YUM! Great suggestion, especially for those of us who love a turkey burger.  I have nothing but wonderful things to say about this place all around. It was a great spot for lunch, and the service was exceptional. I will definitely be back on my next trip to LV!   Thanks to the great staff, food, and BEER! :)

9w12yqZN2oa-Kul34xa3vA.text: What a nice surprise! Great, clean spot to watch your favorite games! Delicious food, definitely get the truffle fries. Service was fast and friendly!   I've definitely found my new place to watch football!

dUNp4bEOe4rawaLzQSy_fg.text: Small menu with no flexibility. The burger was tasty but nothing memorable. I regret not being more adventurous.

GGVdaifr3A2r1DYqOfGidQ.text: Amazing. Live in the bay area and love the food. Noticed one popped up in Vegas and its 10x better with that vehas feel. Has sports book, full bar, couches, TVs.. etc. And TASHJA, our waitress, was amazing!

eLd200Z5DXSoqCXbI0dOcg.text: I'd give this place between 3-4 stars. I think you just have to experience this place for yourself after reading everyone else's reviews...  Our waiter was super awesome and came to our table several times. Hostesses sat us right away. Not too busy for a Monday night.   They are known for their "Manly" & "Truffle" burger which we enjoyed :)   This is a great place to sit down and watch a game on TV. They have many TV screens playing diff games.

V8FCV3GfFu_N-OXWn9_POQ.text: Sooo good. I don't meat and I've gotten this in 2 different occasions while staying at te sls. The truffle burger with the portebello mushroom patty as a substitute with the truffle fries, and another one that comes with a white sauce that was just delicious.

FGgBjWN5AXhZJUPXIrer5w.text: OK I have to admit the Umami Burger was a great burger. You can tell the high quality of the meat they used for their burgers. It was perfectly cooked medium and it was juicy and flavorful. No fillers here! It was topped with a fried Parmesan cheese crust that they call a frico. It was also topped with shiitake mushrooms, roasted tomato, carmelized onions, and house ketchup. The top bun is seared with a letter 'U' for Umami! It was accompanied with sweet potato fries, which were also good. I'll be Bak!

kSAsKYQ2AmcZ25s6tPotoA.text: Sat at the outside bar and service was stellar. The bartender was attentive and suggested different items on the menu. Great beer selection. I ordered a baby daddy ipa. Hoppy and bitter like how I like my IpA  We ordered a truffle burger and it was consistent to other Unami in terms of taste. However it was overlooked, asked for medium, came out pretty well, no pink in the center, but we didn't send it back. Was just hungry from the pool.   The thing I did not like at all was the maple bacon frites. It was too gooey (too much syrup). You can't even taste the sweet potato fries and it was greasy. They give you about 3 pieces of bacon bites, you have to search for it. Just stick with regular fries, onion rings or sweet potato with nothing on them.

FewJbgTqnkq1DS81AhCu8A.text: Meh.  When it comes to fancy burgers I'm looking to be wowed. I don't feel like Umami burger lives up to the hype. If I'm in LA I prefer Fathers Office and if in Vegas Bacchanal is hands down the winner.   I prefer the beer garden outside of Umami it's great for people watching, playing foozeball and drinking.

The noise level is ear piercing, and the service is decent but they were slammed.  Can't wait to try their San Francisco location, hoping for a better atmosphere there, but the food flavor?! UMAMI!

k3Lb5KbnRz-OlcQfdBWHeQ.text: Umami has always been my favorite burger joint since I had it in Santa Monica for the first time. California was always a place I loved to drive but I had to go to umami once I was there. Now Vegas has it at the SLS hotel, of course I ordered the Ahi Tuna Burger and my favorite tempura onion rings! Definitely worth getting. The only thing I'm disappointed about is the service. the ones in California are always busy yet the service is good, but here unless you are a big party be prepared to wait for a bit.

z6vK-VRUaQZVQj7oFQq6Dg.text: The truffle burgers are amazing!! We tried two different ones and they were to die for. Truffle fries are so thin and delicious also. Yum yum.

nWn0G2VP2sEGuolar7s9Cw.text: First time having Umami burger, & honestly, I think people just live for the "hype" of this place.   First, customer service was terrible. For a very slow night out waitress's only came to our table once to refill our glasses (which were empty for 20 mins). The restaurant only had 5 tables occupied & a couple people at the bar. Not only was my boyfriend & I waiting for our glasses to be filled, but also the table across from us. Before we got our food, I noticed my knife pretty dirty. It seemed like there was still food residue on it. I asked our waitress if I can have another knife, & she came 10 mins after we got our food to give me the knife. Which was useless.  Second, the food came at a good time, we didn't wait too long. The burger I got was the sunny side burger, which had the egg in it. I enjoyed my burger very much. The meat was juicy & not too much crap in it; just the greens, cheese, patty, & the egg. My boyfriend got the regular burger & his was just plain bland. We even put a onion ring just to have some type of crunch or flavor, but nothing. On the sides we had onion rings which were pretty good with their homemade ketchup. The fries, we ordered from the secret menu & had the "manly" fries. It had truffle sauce, cheese, & bacon bits on it. The fries were cold and did not even taste like it came from the fryer. It wa soggy and had way too much sauce. The fries even tasted like stale potatoes. The bacon bits were real bacon, but it was so hard that I'm questioning if that bowl of French fries were sitting out for awhile before it was served to us.  Overall, place is alright & they're burger... Well the sunny side burger was good.

e4--Zics8cvMkvAm4ijInQ.text: No this place is not good the waitress was rude and very hostel for no reason she charges me twice on my card and when I called to express my concern the management made it seem as if I deserves to get charged twice and hung up. Push come to shove I had to cancel my card and wait for another one this is nothing like the one I went to in the bay area do not get your hopes up high !!!!

D5keU--5wQJ9Z6Rg1hzMdw.text: Sent to eat here with my family.  1st of all they had a locals discounts for 50% off. Well it only works on certain days and weekends, but know one knows when. We had 13 people and 9 were locals!! food was average. Only good thing was the truffle fries.

2FncrwPSC-9CLYvI0D-E5Q.text: The burgers itself are delicious.. The truffle fries are nothing short of GODLY.  Unfortunately the service was quite the opposite..  the first time we showed up we had placed an order at 11:00PM for a few of their signature jose andrees burgers.  we were standing around waiting, they said they could text us when it was ready so I left my # and we hit the tables.   a few heaters later, no text.  some more heaters, still no text.  no text, no calls, no texts. you get the point..  we went back and had inquired about our burgers through an employee who said she would go and check, she left.  inquired again through another employee, he left.. never came back.  we saw them bring out several to-go orders and leave them on the bar counter and we had asked if either of them were ours.. the waitress said not yet and she, just like the others said she would go and check.  at around 12:15AM my friend said forget it, he hopped the line and started checking bags. WHAT DO YOU KNOW? our order was sitting on the counter and the completed ticket said 11:30PM.  Our burgers were sitting on the counter for 45 minutes, cold as a pair of rock solid fake silicon implants.  ***we asked the girl at the bar, she said sorry, I can get you guys a free round what would you like? **I asked for a Hennessy on the rocks and she said SORRY, ONLY WELL-DRINKS. OR A BEER. I dont want to sound like a snob but keep in mind we paid $40 for two burgers and some FRIES?!?  the manager said sorry, ill see if they can make you a new set. after eating they were just nuked a bit because the bread was softer than a pair of real.. well, nevermind.  he apologized and said if we came back he would take care of us.  we ordered $220 worth of burgers to the rooms and the truffle fries were delicious. we also came back and dined in to watch the sunday games while gambling away our life savings and the waiter wearing the packers jersey on 12/14 was phenomenal.  either way we didnt get the manager, didnt want to be disappointed.

Xzn1gKwWwCidDWO5Ue__cg.text: It was my fellow Yelpers who convinced me to come here, and there's a lot I like about this place.  First, I like the design overall because it combines a little of everything. It is right off the casino floor, there's a two-sided bar with gaming machines, a neat dining room, a place to make sports wagers and a huge outdoor bar and patio.   Honestly, this is not your "traditional sports book" and is basically a window to make bets adjacent to the restaurant. They have a handful of high top tables reserved exclusively for sports book patrons, but I much preferred sitting elsewhere where you receive bar or table service.  A new manager named Drea took a ton of time to answer my questions one night, so I planned a return for the Sunday Night Football game and a bartender named Natalia also provided exceptional service and conversation.   There were a couple beers on good specials for the game and they went well with my Manly Burger, which was cooked perfect and served quickly. This burger featured a really high quality meat and I enjoyed how all the toppings complimented the meat, but did not dominate the overall flavor of each bite.   Others here on Yelp seem to question the size of the burgers for the price, but I do not. Sure, I can find a bigger burger at a better price somewhere else, but couldn't that be said about virtually any food/restaurant if you really think about it?  This would also be a fun place with a small group if you can get one of the couches surrounding a coffee table that is set up like a living room in front of the televisions. The outdoor patio is another good option with how they set up the tables and the bar outside is very long with plenty of additonal seating.   Oh, and it is significantly louder inside than outside. So pick your noise level accordingly.  On a lighthearted note, way too many servers and bartenders were wearing Seahawks jerseys. I'm just guessing most of these were purchased within the last year unless Umami Burger imported 25% of their employees from the state of Washington. If it looks like a bandwagon, it usually is one.

qriIs6HAqTX8G49-5eeXGA.text: I'm a local who tried calling the number on the Umami Burger (UB) SLS website to make a reservation for a large group. After fifteen minutes of being bounced around (five minutes of being on hold then transferred to the concierge only to be transferred back to UB only to wait for another five minutes then bounced back to the concierge only to be told I had to be transferred back to UB then waited another five minutes to have the operator hunt down a manager and relay back to me that the manager said they don't take reservations... I guess the left hand doesn't know what the right is doing and they have False advertising too. They must not want the business of a large local group. If I could give zero stars, I would. Why do they even bother writing in big orange letters to call the number on their website to make a reservation if they don't take reservations?
