Ihrs9dvhXMvpGhp-GXhDvQ.text: Food was Great, service was amazing  thanks to Rhitzie our servicer she's  the best... The truffle fries are on point

ACDLA5Z9OTKsZOO55Ct5fA.text: I called the front desk of the restaurant to ask about the Impossible Burger, which is a vegan patty. I wanted to make sure that there was some sort of substitute for any of the non-vegan sauces for the burger, I'm fine without vegan cheese. The hostess confirmed the burger was vegan and they could leave the cheese off to make it fully vegan! Awesome!!! Went down to eat, asked the waiter and they said the bun isn't vegan, so they could just do a lettuce wrap... lol. Imagine paying $20 for a burger wrapped in lettuce when you're on vacation and not in LA. I let them know about the misinformation the hostess had given us and they said they would let her know but come on, y'all. The other places that had vegan options were closed, so we were out of luck.

DpDUa90gf4ZXSCIVRD_XBQ.text: AJ was great.  Catered to my vegan wife. Impossible burger was delish!  Loved the sports vibe.  Great booze selection

DnOI_Z1wRi5BkHuA2fk82g.text: While staying at the SLS with my team we ate dinner Tues night after a convention. The food was fantastic and our server Mandy was great. She went out of her way to make us feel welcome and appreciated. Thank you Mandy, you were awesome. Will be back soon.

pFgVUhYEH4KQmz7egYm5SA.text: This was almost a BAD BAD review!! Walked in on a Thursday was seated with a smile, waited no server.  We asked to be moved outside, still no server.  We left.   Came back almost an hour later and we were seated once again.   3rd times a charm!   *****Attention***** Ketchup is NOT plain ketchup!  I repeat!!! Not average ketchup! It's garlic and if you dig in without knowing this, OMG the shock! Lol You've been warned.   The impossible burger is vegan and the best burger I've had to date! Easily.  Hot fresh Shoe string fries.  Nachos with no chicken. Decent.  Water, lemonade and sweet waitress.  She redeemed our experience.   We returned today 45 minutes before close. Will was more than fantastic!! Will gets 5 whole stars!!!  Seated immediately!  Orders taken immediately!!! Food out immediately!!!  Ordered another Impossible burger.  Fresh and HOTT!!!  No complaints.  So glad we came back!

photos.caption: Photo of Umami Burger -  SLS Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Impossible burger, nachos with NO chicken and fries
Photo of Umami Burger -  SLS Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States

VobkdamleNk4o8vCQvv6jA.text: Pretty good burger and a great atmosphere to watch any sporting event!  I had mushroom burger which only had about three mushrooms on it because they are some kind of special mushrooms?!  My husband had you mommy burger enjoyed it.  Server was excellent!

photos.caption: Photo of Umami Burger -  SLS Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Umami burger

QvUmzIcaMcteGqaeR4HqmQ.text: The manly burger was sooooo good. Burger has great flavor, onion straws, and the best chunks of bacon ever. I would definitely go back to get it again. I cannot day enough good things about the umami ketchup, it was so delicious and I wish I could buy it to take it home with me.

photos.caption: Photo of Umami Burger -  SLS Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Xc5s7bKTp5Vxc_Qm7509mw.text: Excellent burgers.  I had the Truffle Burger and a friend has the Impossible Burger and he says he'd never have known it wasn't meat.  We also had the Tuna Poke Nachos which were excellent.  Nice beer selection (but pricey) and good Video Poker at the bar.  William Hill sportsbook in the restaurant and nice view of the Strip.  I will be back.

photos.caption: Photo of Umami Burger -  SLS Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States

mGQld5culBAwUvvTw_PkDA.text: Clean restaurant with friendly but overworked staff. Very slow service but they were working as fast as they could. I had an umami burger and truffle fries. The sauce on the fries was overly salty and glue-like. I only ate a few. Burger bun was dry and had much less flavor than i anticipated.It was edible and better than fast food but left much to be desired in all aspects.

RIdN-wgKTL6mzNN0-7hJ4w.text: Stopped in 20 June planning to just go to the sportsbook but ended up staying a little longer after striking up a conversation with the friendly, welcoming & ALWAYS in the best mood bartender/back Carlos! Frequent visitor! I love just about everything on the menu but my favorites are the nachos, truffle cheese fries, Throwback burger, Asian chicken salad!

j1OjfyqZYy4niH7sgOEHyw.text: My sister and I got the Umami burger and the tuna poke salad with thin fries and a side of mozzarella sticks.  The Umami burger is TO DIE FOR honestly haven't had such a good burger in my whole life! Fries were okay.  The salad was great too! Has a kick of wasabi that didn't hit you too hard at all.  HOWEVER, the mozzarella sticks were... An embarrassment. The marinara sauce was of lower quality than Little Caesar's pizza. The sticks would fall out of the breading when you ate them so you'd be left with empty carcasses of breading (which weren't worth clearing the plate). The breading was also way too hard and make it feel like I was trying to crack open a coconut just to get to the cheesy goodness.  Everything else on the menu was amazing so I just don't understand why those sticks were even on the menu. It's almost disrespectful to the rest of the menu to keep those on there with the rest of the food which was amazing....  All in all great place to eat. Just very confusing to start with low quality mozzarella sticks in a great fusion place called "Umami" burger.

6Y90z6GF19B97ILr-nMvow.text: My husband and I ordered the truffle burgers and I loved it! I was skeptical at first, but the burger did not disappoint. I would definitely come back to get another one. The chicken fingers were also good.

-hay7ikFUITkV0YGcYNoZg.text: umamiburger.com We eat here today they advertise a vegan impossible burger the price tag is 17.95 can't get the cheese, sauteed onions, or ketchup because it has fish sauce, mustard has honey. So you get a patty, one tomato, lettuce, three tiny pickles for 17.95. No fries I have never felt so ripped off I would never eat here again.

YufMr81Qm8ZW4hjLQyWZ2Q.text: Came here on a Monday with some friends to watch the hockey game, our server was pretty good in the beginning but the service kept getting worse and worse. We ordered drinks which took oddly longer than it should have. We had to flag her down to let her know we needed more water and new plates.   We barely even saw her for the last hour of our stay here. Casey could have provided better service by being more attentive. We even ordered a second beer with nachos and had to flag her down after 25 minutes for the nachos and the beer never even came. The entire place isn't even packed, doubtful il be back.

JjkiMOYQJb6bULA6eHCbOw.text: Visited a Umami Burger in LA a few years ago and didn't really love my burger then. Recently had to make a visit to SLS so I thought I would give Umami Burger a 2nd chance. Sorry but this place is weak. The "umami" flavor simply makes the burger taste as if it was drenched in soy sauce or just a pile of salt. Fries were totally uninspired, barely hot and without any distinct flavor. Lunch special or discount? Nope. Burger + fries + water -- no alcohol, no Coke, no appetizers -- was $20 before tip. It's not a bad meal for the price, it's a bad meal at any price.

VrVG7kNX47NpwqXi_Mrwfg.text: I had the poke salad and it was really good. The server was attentive with our table and friendly. Thank you. I will be coming back.

m8gHecVjKRH-EFScPbDoVg.text: Was here a few weeks ago and it was disappointing to say the least.  We went around lunch time and there was hardly anyone there.  Should have been clue number one.  We seated ourselves and then sat there for almost 15 minutes waiting for the waitress to acknowledge us.  We ordered 2 drinks, and shared a umami burger and maple bacon sweet potato fries.  Underwhelming to say the least.  I've always wanted to try this burger and coming from the East Coast we don't have this restaurant there.  Not missing anything.  The hamburger itself tasted freezer burned.  Not fresh at all.  The tomato jam or ketchup was a gloop of inedible grossness.  Even the fries were yuck.  Waitress never came back to refill our drinks or ask if we needed anything.  Other burger places in Vegas, sad I wasted my $ on this one.

photos.caption: Photo of Umami Burger -  SLS Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Umami burger and maple bacon sweet potato fries

g-luYKZBc3VKj9QzXQaSow.text: Must have sold out. No original hand mate tots. Which were bomb. Nashville hot chicken was simply a buffalo chicken sandwich. The beet salad changed and wasn't nearly as good. Bummed. One of my fave spots is nothing like it used to be. What a shame.

ipU3DupLQrHb8CQSF32fJQ.text: Loved the burger. So much to choose from Just wish the fries where hotter in temperature was a bit room temp

photos.caption: Photo of Umami Burger -  SLS Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sweet potatoes fries and an Umami Burger

5aquXPJMvIvRi8zReb6mwQ.text: Dang it..... my boyfriend and I came back to Umami Burger again because we had been here about a year ago and umami was so bomb the last time we were here so we were really excited to come back. Sadly this time the burger was not the same it was juicy but was lacking flavor and it's hard to describe it but the meat tasted extra chewy and to make a long story short I only ate a quarter of my burger because it just wasn't right. Im not one to ever complain or send things back unless I'm acknowledged by my server that something is wrong which my waitress did not. My boyfriend only ate half of his because he felt the same way about the burger. Which if you don't know you ONLY get the burger it doesn't come with fries and it's $11! This is usually fine because the burgers should be bomb dot com like they usually are, but when the burger is crappy with no sides I feel your waitress should see there's a problem. We paid our bill and left and within an hour my boyfriend and I were super super sick and had a terrible case of food poisoning for a complete 24 hrs from their burger!

photos.caption: Photo of Umami Burger -  SLS Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Great deal for two people! Love the burgers and the beer
Photo of Umami Burger -  SLS Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Best burger  with the most handsome man I have ever seen
Photo of Umami Burger -  SLS Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Unami menu

9pmxQMQQnjL8fsUO4pTQYA.text: The manly burger with chicken was delicious! However, the rating reflects the level of service we received from our server. She was rude and inattentive.

f0Iui3iO1QZ4BUkh191C3Q.text: Umami burger has been hyped up for me, so this was disappointing. It's in the SLS, which I thought smelled odd. It's connected with a sports bar, which threw me off. It made me wonder if I was having a True umami experience.  Our server was wonderful. She was the only server on Christmas eve, and you could tell she was working hard. Kudos to her.  I had one of the truffle burgers and tempura onion rings. The burger comes out looking visually stunning. I enjoyed eating it until about halfway through. After that, the truffle oil felt overwhelming and I didn't want to finish it. The tempura onion rings were huge and so light tasting. They were delicious with the house ketchup.  I'd give umami burger another chance, but maybe not this particular one.

BtXyjfxmRSPePv5g8VTJKQ.text: Tired Umami Burger when I was in LA so when u heard it opened up here in Vegas I had to try it.  Food was same taste as the one in LA so consistency was good.   The only thing that bothered me was the drinks were pretty expensive. I don't mind paying 6-8 on an alcoholic drink but it was $12.   I would come back however, I would just drink water or soda cuz the alcoholic drinks are too expensive.   It prolly was busy but the waiter was neither nice or rude. She was basically doing her job. Nothing really stood out on the customer service.

photos.caption: Photo of Umami Burger -  SLS Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Famous Truffle Burger
Photo of Umami Burger -  SLS Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Q2Ytq1wQaMHs1fRTwXz0UQ.text: It took me over a year to give this place another shot and I am glad I did!  I was craving the Truffle Fries and I could not wait until I went to California again.    The service overall is mediocre at best.  It took a good minutes to get my cider and my boyfriend's beer, and the server did not stop by very often....but at least we were not forgotten about again.    The food is delicious!  This is the place I do not mind paying a bit more for a burger.  The truffle burger is by far my favorite.  It is very juicy and flavorful.  The bun they use is perfect and it does not get soggy with all of the cheese!    While the service still needs improvement I will definitely be back for the yummy food.

7an3nz7RO1dDQIN4p1uaqA.text: Very convenient to where we live but unfortunately the positive stops there. Service was very slow but that's okay as long as the food is awesome. Having had experienced and loving Umami Burger in several different Southern California locations, we were so excited to find one in Vegas and so close to where we live. This is absolutely not the same, unfortunately. It's more like casino bar food. Nothing was great about the experience. I guess being in a high tourist area, repeat business may not be high priority.

HW20RZIveYnCpuBYr4wi4A.text: Interesting to get asked by a server at the bar how they could help me and then get told they'd closed out for the tonight and I should go to a different bar

M5bhUTKHApXicniEtrBttg.text: Had the burger here with an added egg. It was bomb. The thin crispy fries are a perfect complement. I've also had the nachos and ahi tuna salad here for appetizers. Those were just so-so.   Service is hit or miss, depending on when you come. One guy was on point with his service game. The other time I came, the waitress was swamped, covering way too many tables to provide quick service.

uKl4fkZXIKInlUJDhNluDQ.text: What a meal! I had the Manly Burger, House Made Tater Tots and the best Buffalo Wings I have ever eaten. I got the Hop Knot IPA which is made by Four Peaks Brewing. They do "Tap Take Overs" which is a great way to try out different beers. Amanda, the bartender was super friendly and quick with great service. Umami is the Royal Flush of dining on the Strip!

photos.caption: Photo of Umami Burger -  SLS Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Buffalo Wings, Tater Tots with the BEST dipping sauces and the Manly Burger

CMpRybp6F_lzAtM-N-tEQw.text: There are two things I take into account when eating somewhere, the price of the food and the quality. I've heard a lot of good things about umami. However Vegas has a great rep for taking restaurants, franchising out to the strip and poorly executing it. I ate here and paid 14 for a burger and 6 for some fries. Price to me isn't a huge deal however to me the meal was not that great. The burger had no flavor, the fries were alright. However there are way better places you can go for a good burger on the strip.   I will say that I usually have a bad experience with female servers and my server a bubbly blonde if I remember correctly, did however make the meal quite pleasurable. She was a great server and I will note that.

photos.caption: Photo of Umami Burger -  SLS Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States

o3LGkGrqH2YT7qOyMer-4w.text: This is my favorite burger joint in Vegas. Great food and staff is amazing. If you go ask for Tashja. She is amazing and has the beat 'off menu' ideas for you to try!   Thanks again Tashja. We loved getting to know you.

M5nY7SnkGmfW6EK12zGhkw.text: Ok I'm trying to understand the beer garden, it's on the outside patio and smells terribly of gas from the heaters. It's really bad. Too bad to sit outside for sure and I can smell it from the corner across the street! Yuck yuck yuck !

Fwg47lr4Zhutj4yo6W0FQQ.text: I purchased a Groupon for Umami since my friend and I were staying at SLS Las Vegas for a few days. The deal included a choice of two burgers or greens, and a choice of two sides. For $25, that seemed like a steal! My friend and I both ordered the truffle burger, complete with truffle fries (clearly we were indulging). The burger was cooked to a perfect medium, per my request. The burger was delicious! Thankfully, the truffle flavoring wasn't overpowering (some restaurants tend to go truffle-crazy). Presentation of the burger and fries was very clean and minimalistic.   It's been a couple of months since my visit, and I can't remember what we ordered to drink (may have been due to drinking beforehand). However, I do remember that they were off of the specialty cocktail list--and they were amazing!  I will say service was pretty slow, but our waitress was very apologetic and nice. There was a larger party being tended to at the restaurant, causing a bit of a lull in the arrival of our food and drinks. Considering I was on vacation and not in a hurry to go anywhere, this certainly didn't detract from the overall experience.

photos.caption: Photo of Umami Burger -  SLS Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Truffle burger with truffle fries. Delicious!

fjg6m83e0FlKZSjyuNDRBw.text: The ketchup tastes like it is very fresh and made by scratch, their jalapeno ranch dressing is tasty, not too spicy. The beet salad was excellent. My boyfriend got the original burger and I got the manly burger.  I ended up sending mine back because I don't like the fondue type of cheese that came on it... Nor did I like the bacon lardons- they are too thick and not as tasty as real bacon. I was frustrated... I just wanted a bacon cheese burger with real solid cheddar cheese or solid pepper jack cheese on it. Unfortunately I learned that Umami does not have any solid cheeses. I decided the next best thing to get would be a Parmesan cheese crisp minus bacon lardons. The bun was cute with the U on it. At first I thought the burger quality was good but it just fell apart in my hands and started breaking... My boyfriend said it was because it was too juicy... Not sure but it made it very difficult to eat. I felt bad that I needed to send so many things back...   Even the diet Pepsi because it tasted flat. So I got iced tea but there was no sugar on the table and it didn't come with a lemon. Our server was sweet but way too busy to check on us enough, perhaps due to poor staffing. There was indoor and outdoor seating. I loved the open layout with couches, our booth was comfortable, there were televisions everywhere for the sports fanatics.   The sweet potatoe fries were a little too sweet, like they had excess sugar on them. I am a sweet potato fri expert:)  Conclusion is that Umami in my opinion is better than a fast food burger but nothing compared to Hook (located in Woodland Hills). I thought Umami would be very similar in quality compared to Hook. If Umami used a pretzel bun my burger never would have fallen apart. If they used solid cheese and plane jane bacon I think they could accommodate more customer requests. I don't think I have extraordinary tastes when it comes to burgers.

photos.caption: Photo of Umami Burger -  SLS Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Original fries
Photo of Umami Burger -  SLS Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sweet potato fries
Photo of Umami Burger -  SLS Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cali burger with onion strings

pcXLGngZhfL0_dCyA5VYyQ.text: Meh. Not worth the hype or prices. The burger bun was soggy and the chicken wings felt greasy and over battered. It also would have been nice to experience the patio and beer garden but it was closed during our entire stay.

jZEQTb4Mb5cNdtIwBSnT2w.text: We have heard good things about Umami but we won't be back. We walked in the door at 9:30 and was told it was the last call for food and drinks. Got our food. Fries were almost cold. At 10:00 all TVs were turned off as in: Customers go home!!    This is absurd that restaurants close at 10:00 on Saturday night!!!  Sorry, won't be back. It's almost too dark in here.

dKL1IJuE5evJjWmKfJz64Q.text: Tony and Jessica hooked it up for my industry group of 6 during one if the NBA finals games. Comfy couches and armchairs if you reserve them. We got a great deal - a special package incl. unlimited draught beers and wings. Only reason I deduct a star - the wings were average, but I'm fancy so don't let that put you off! Tv's everywhere, good atmosphere, friendly staff, and free easy self parking. Great hospitality for local industry people. Thanks for the patron hangover Tony!

NoKgd_lB5UYW3sQJ0rT36Q.text: This place is awesome.  They have Mexican Pepsis, these out of this world food.  Ben our server is one great listener.  Oh, by the way.  You can go meatless or bunless! They have portobello mushrooms for the meatless option.  I didn't try them but oh that sounded so good. I got the lettuce wrap.   We had tater tots for our starter (Ben suggested them).  They had these sauces you could try.  I fell for the Jalapeno Ranch. It wasn't spicy at all.  They're not on the menu, shocker. They should be.    I had the Hatch Burger $11, no bun but I cracked and had the bun on the side. It's a portuguese roll. I'm portuguese so I couldn't turn it down for a few little itchy hives. Besides it reminded me of home (Rhode Island). The bun wasn't overly sweet. It was just right.   Very filling. Locals should come here.  It's a nice sports book to grab a bite at the same time.   The bill came to $24.86, they took the tater tots & Pepsi off the bill. So we left a 32.5% because we felt the service was excellent.

photos.caption: Photo of Umami Burger -  SLS Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sweet potatoe fries,  amazing!
Photo of Umami Burger -  SLS Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Onion rings
Photo of Umami Burger -  SLS Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Truffle Fries $4.50

_h6_iojdQS-QU0gQcd2Eqw.text: It was my first time at Umami and I was surprised at the scene upon arrival - loud and totally packed with football fans.  I did not realize that not only is it a restaurant and beer garden but sports book as well - and we were there the first Sunday of the football season.  I'm not a sports bar type of girl - I enjoy watching sports but from the comfort of my own couch :p  And it was too loud for my liking.  We were reserved a table inside but were shown a table outside and allowed to choose whether to dine inside or out.  The only tables available on the patio were out in the hot sun, so back inside we went!  It was very loud in there, and it looked like my sister and I were the only ones there for the food and not the games, but I couldn't complain being in a room full of guys and the 49ers game playing on all the TV's :p  Service was good and the food even better.  I ordered the Manly Burger (fitting for the day we were there lol) which is basically a bacon cheeseburger with onion strings.  My sister got the Truffle Burger, and we split some Tempura Onion Rings and Truffle Fries (like we couldn't get enough of them in our burgers lol).  I liked all the food, especially the burger and the onion rings - soooo good!  I was afraid the burgers were going to be on the smaller side - they look like sliders in pictures - but it was plenty of food.  I couldn't finish it all.  We split an ice cream sandwich for dessert, the one with snickerdoodle cookies and salted caramel ice cream.  I like both snickerdoodle cookies and salted caramel ice cream but this ice cream sandwich was just "meh."  Sounds great on paper but really not all that spectacular.   While the dessert was underwhelming, overall I was definitely not disappointed by this place at all, and while I wasn't too sure about the loud sports bar atmosphere it ended up being a fun time :)

photos.caption: Photo of Umami Burger -  SLS Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. From top left: Truffle Burger, Manly Burger, Tempura Onion Rings, Truffle Fries, dipping sauces, and ice cream sandwich

ghTyJsJGh7hLOjBhS-A5fQ.text: I wasn't a fan of Umami Burger when I lived in Los Angeles but this location is more of a bar rather than a fancy burger spot filled with hipsters dressed in overly priced grungy clothes.   On Thursdays wings are 50cents and beer is a dollar!  This is great place to watch football and place sports bets!  *check in and get a free order of truffle fries*

photos.caption: Photo of Umami Burger -  SLS Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States

dTkCTHGwWNDA26vJXj9qWQ.text: Pros: $ 2 Bud light during games and a free order of truffle fries with a Yelp Check-in.   Cons: ...the rest of our dining experience. It took 9 minutes after we were seated before a waitress came to our table. She didn't know about the Happy Hour specials from 5-8pm that are clearly advertised all over the property.  The burger was meh..   Check out other burger places on the strip. Won't be missing much here.

W9JYbU7c3tRkWi2VugA2Tw.text: Pleasantly surprised. Was expecting it to be more hype than anything, but enjoyed the food and atmosphere during lunchtime.

2XbW5ANot6t_gW6R9Vaq7g.text: Great Ambiance, Awesome burgers, and Liz the bartender was super friendly. If you are military, police, and/or a Paramedic, you can get 25% off your meals. Awesome way to be recognized. I can see SLS becoming a major hotspot on the Vegas strip. I will definitely be back.

go8qjFbn0rauiKByOyda9Q.text: Would have given Umami burger a 4 if it was just me - My burger (with Hatch chilis) was awesome and the truffle fries were fabulous. That said, hubby thought his burger (a double of some type) was dry and uninspired. Overall I would go back.

06gztfmwsETOj1iMb1p6-g.text: I was looking forward to eating a great burger. Wow was I disappointed. From the start the waitress had a real dry unfriendly personality. Never really made eye contact and looked l

TAJj6iO7qTb3SJL5vy7NVA.text: The food and service was really good. Try their truffle burger or truffle fries. Nice outdoor patuo. A little loud but a nice environment otherwise.

isbEUqReQDg4tl_v6RFStA.text: Ordered the Ahi burger and redeemed a free truffle fries to go (I hate casinos, cigarette and slot machines.) Upon arrival at my hotel, I found out that they gave me fries without the truffle oil..  Major disappointment as I love its location in Palo Alto :(

dRGxihjd26y0e4xglxOc4A.text: I came here 3 times during my stay at SLS. My girlfriend and I sat at the bar twice and in the restaurant once.  When we sat in the restaurant, our server went on break in the middle of our meal and informed me someone else would be over to take care of us. A blonde girl walked by once and asked if we were ok and quickly walked away before we could even answer. We had finished our meal and were waiting for the server to come back over and deliver our bill/check in. In the mean time we went to the bar to gamble and grab a drink and our server still hadn't of come back. Finally I had to walk to the hostess stand and tell her I just wanted to pay since I had finished my meal over 15 minutes previously and wanted to leave. Maybe it's just me, but I feel like I shouldn't have to practically beg someone to come take my money. A server should be eager to get customers out, get a tip, and have that table sat again. From an operational standpoint, a restaurant shouldn't be sending servers on break when they have tables they are responsible for still, and throwing the table onto another unwilling server. The manger Jessica was very apologetic though and comped our food when she realized what had happened.  The food it's self was pretty good. I recommend the barbacoa nachos and pretzel. The Ice cream sandwich wasn't something I would recommend though. It was Ice cream in between a bun and not something I personally found appealing.

d9cfRL5vOASmRl7IrghHgw.text: Delicious burger and cool ambience, check it out.

1NoGbuz9_COk7hB2KGKKXQ.text: Umm how does this place only have 3 and a half stars?! I get it, it's not the original umami but STILL. I have never left disappointed from here. Hands down my favorite restaurant of all time. Ordered the seared ahi salad, maple bacon fries and a truffle burger cooked medium. 5 stars for everything. Food is rich and delicious. Service is a little slow but hey, it's a busy place. You pay for what you get for. :)

1iyZzDCHogK3Sk3pF1aegQ.text: Ordered the Manly burger and recieved free truffle fries for checking in. Omg they asked me if I wanted it medium rare. This is my kind of burger place! Not those pussy places that are afraid of their hamburger being tainted. Got the food burger was spot on nice and red in the middle, very moist great flavor! Awesome burger. I'll warn you on the truffle fries once  you start you cannot stop until you are scraping the cheese on the bottom of the basket. Service was very good. I would of gave this 5 stars except for the cost $30 for 1 drink and a burger seems very high. They get it and the place was full. The worst part of the entire experience was watching the MN Vikings let another game slip away.

C7mA0PAUzvOtZzzgEPGwYA.text: This is our first visit to Umami and Mandy was our server, she explained the menu very well plus she had bubbly personality that made our meal more enjoyable.  We will definitely come back to Umami for their great food and hope to be seated and served by Mandy.

TJZaSUfe5dR44o6lfwoPbw.text: There were four of us. Two of us are very picky eaters and the other two are foodies who just live for food. We are Las Vegas locals and we decided will check out this place . All of us were impressed. The food was great. I couldn't eat anything with onions my partner had a lactaid problem. They made perfect changes for both of us to have a great meal. Raves on the onion rings. I could go on and the burgers and the great salads and the drinks wow. We will be back. And Joshua was a great waiter.

5RUqQEnU-4-9k2IGr-deEA.text: This is the third restaurant I have tried at SLS. I am a huge foodie and have searched high and low around town for the best burger. What is Umami up against? Fukuburger, Badger cafe, Burger Bar at Mandalay. These are all great burgers and all cost less. We ordered the "Manly Burger" and an order of fried pickles. S O asked for regular ranch instead of jalapeno ranch for the fried pickles. Waitress said "we don't have regular ranch". Ok, kinda odd at a multi million dollar new casino trying to impress but we carried on. The burger arrived and it was tiny! This is a freaking slider folks. The nerve of calling it "The Manly Burger"! Before I took my first bite I thought to myself for $14 this better be awesome for this price. It wasn't :( It was average at best. The fried pickles barely had any batter on them and tasted like warm soggy pickles. I got 5 pickle spears for $6! Come on guys, really? I have no problem paying high strip prices for a premium product (I.E. anything at the Wynn) but you gotta deliver a premium product. The waitress noticed we didn't eat the pickles and did take them off the bill.   Atmosphere was ok and the service was good. I just can't figure out why people would pay these prices for micro servings that aren't amazing.   General lesson for SLS and any other new business. You can't charge ultra premium prices and not deliver 5 star food and service. I have now eaten at Cleo, Umami and The Griddle and I wouldn't recommend them to anybody for now. As a long time local I want The SLS to succeed. We need jobs and great showcase properties. Come on gang, pay attention!

yZ9ntWe7XWDthmUfXwgayQ.text: Five stars only because my server, Tashja, was fantastic.  Otherwise prob 3.5 to 4 stars.  I sat for 15 min before flagging down Tashja.  It wasn't her table but idiot that had my table was too busy paying attention to the NFL games than customers.  Managers on duty were not attentive to floor.  Tashja recommended the truffle burger which was fantastic.  Their two big screens are huge but one seemed to stay on the betting odds instead of a game.  Regardless huge screens and no smoking from what I could smell.

yklGEuk1EsA5PvE9Gl8v6Q.text: Great atmosphere, and a good place to come and watch the game. The food is pretty much on par with every other Umami restaurant - which is a good thing. Our server (Mandy) went above and beyond to accommodate our group. Overall, we'll definitely be back next time we're in town.

GN9PBR-PdnnIzSrrY7FFsA.text: Loved everything from the hostess who seated us...to the waitress that served us.  Great variety of food for a sports bar. The beer patio is a great addition to this restaurant.  The onion rings were delicious.  Corona light on tap and they salt the rim so every drink is delicious.  Best service at the SLS is at the Umami burger.  Other areas of the resort fall short.

j7m4Y1Z07JNuwd25Pajyng.text: Very conveniently located in the hotel. Came in for brunch. Our waitress was Tashja, she awesome everything she recommended was delicious. Will never come to Vegas again without coming here.

N32x7FNUtQQlF-mbnuqdEw.text: The customer service was excellent. This is definitely a sports bar/restaurant. I was overwhelmed by how many televisions were in this place. Every booth has it's own tv. Yikes. So the food comes out. The french fries were good. I thought the taste of my turkey burger was just ok. My boyfriend hated his turkey burger. Later on in the evening we both ended up with bad stomach aches. Never eating at Umami again.

IuaJ9j1S3Bq5hOE4ykJNQw.text: This place hit the spot after a karate tournament! I had two hungry teens and a hungry boy and we had an awesome lunch! What made it the best was our server Sunny. This guy is friendly, prompt, funny, and all around a perfect waiter. They should make him a manager or at least give him a raise because he made the whole dining experience fun and enjoyable. The maple fries are also A1! Thanks again Sunny for a great dining experience.

__tO2Qx3SmOqylptM9Yy5Q.text: This is by far the worst experience I've ever had at a restaurant. We waited one hour prior to getting waters. The manager even came over to the table and all he offered was the measly water that we had been waiting for for more than an hour. The food was subpar the service was ridiculously slow. As being a Vegas local, I thought this was a poor indicator of how service is in this town. Although, I probably will come back again because I live so close I hope the service will be better. We also had to get our own drinks from the bar because they were taking so long to get to our table.

9CDiiW0vpE7q3nc4Tm5vgg.text: Literally.. Best hamburger ever!! Ordering medium -rare was a mistake! Could not eat fast enough!! Do not skip this place!!

6tlYyl6LWSe4V_iZgtoRMA.text: I visited this establishment and want to say this place is  the best burger joint I have ever been to and the service I received from Mandy had alot to do with the experience she was amazing very happy and outgoing made my visit that much more memorable if you live in Vegas or are visiting make sure you come here and make sure you ask for Mandy you time  will be that much better

Zo2BZnEc4fTwhQ7FUVuQ6A.text: The service was good, the cocktails were primarily spicy like they over ordered pepper or had something to hide. This would have had a 4 star review, but the $9 nachos were disgusting.  Cheese like you get at the movies,  jalapenos from a can, fake tasting guacamole, overcooked bland beef, and canned beans that would have looked much more appealing had someone bothered to rinse them before putting them on the nachos.   I'd rather pay $20 for decent nachos than $9 for .....that.

gl6D4TaCEIemdXxXl6Fj_A.text: Very good. Perfect. I got the greenbird and it hit the spot! The best part was gambling while you eat and the blackberry mojito got me the perfect buzz.

qGW6A2w5E0rfQV-0f5jrVQ.text: Service sucked !13$ soggy so also sucked. Sad I was looking forward to this place wonder why people rave about it. Stick to in and out...and they charge 20% tip so I guess service doesn't matter...

DtM1GLD5CnCK1mc_7iK3Wg.text: Im happy to be writing my first ever yelp! , honestly it was my first time going here with my husband thanksgiving day as we waited for my parents to come down from the hotel room. It was surprisingly not busy. The food was great! Did not take as long to come out , I had a tuna burger honestly when it came out I was scared to eat it , but taste way better then whats it looks like ha , the vibe in there was fun , are server was fantastic really friendly and sweet I wish I could remember her name to give her credit she deserves , the young man that brought are food was so helpful and topped off are experience by just having personality he was very big with tattoos , made sure we had are napkins and condiments. Etc before he left. Overall great experience. Thank you umami

8T1gguQMmSoXlTRDMqOsgQ.text: I've eaten at Umami Burger twice, and my server both times was Brooke N. She was super friendly and went out of her way to make sure we had a good experience. The food and service were both on point. I'll be back again for sure.

0YCYDMHkA4qnD-V4CwGNyw.text: This place is awesome! Amazing atmosphere inside and out and the waitstaff rock! Their food is so delicious! Now this is NOT your average burger joint.... It's better. Very unique flavors that pair well with a good beer! Definitely a must to check out!

photos.caption: Photo of Umami Burger -  SLS Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. These burgers are not your average burger... Super amazing flavors that pair well with good beer. So yummy!
Photo of Umami Burger -  SLS Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Super delicious sauces to dip your fries in, they make their own ketchup too! Watch out the spicy one is really spicy!

BQRZx9ErAn89J8QTYZQ2ag.text: I ordered a chicken Cobb salad. Probably the worst salad I've had in a long time. Hard chunks of bacon fat found only two small chunks of chicken in the whole salad. The wings were drenched in sauce and had too much breading on them. They looked like they came straight from the freezer to the fryer. Nothing screamed fresh about them at all. Being at such a nice hotel I expected more from here. I was surprised to find they do not carry a regular ranch dressing. Who doesn't carry such a basic condiment? The other two ranch flavors were not up to par for me. If the salad wasn't already a fail it was after I learned I couldn't get my dressing of choice. Drinks were ok and a nice place to watch sports, place bets, and relax. I will not cancel this place out because everyone else's food looked so good maybe I just made bad choices but u expect everything on the menu to be good. Hopefully when I visit again I can try something else and update this review.

4QmP1knKGD0-nw5Q2RYpeQ.text: We were here with my friends last time. Service is really good and the hamburger is amazing!!  Get the fried pickles and the Manly Burger with a pint of Stella Artois :)

joGemHCUwvau165Dm8_5tA.text: I love the food! It's getting better comparing to when they started. I had a vegetarian sloopy joe and it was fantastic. The ahi tuna salad was very delicious too. Beers are very good. The only downside is price, it is expensive for what you get. Drinks are expensive. Other than that, food is delicious and service is great!

HnUGMEQTiv2BhzFNR9jU5g.text: This place is super cool! Food is amazing and our server Megan was just better than sliced bread on a Sunday! She is just the sweetest, most bubbly thing and made our day even better than it already was. Go to Umami and ask for her! And tip her well!! You can even bet on sports while you eat because it's a sport book too! Amazing. Thank you :)

axfRgTNVNYNYbQwgbAZuOg.text: Just ok.  Understaffed. Came in post lunch, few people in the restaurant, four of us at the bar. Bartender running around frantically trying to keep up.  Ordered the Classic, short rib smothered fries, and a beer. Charging a lot for pretty pedestrian draft selection. The burger's bun and toppings were good, but burger itself was small and lacking any real flavor, maybe overwhelmed by the toppings. At least was cooked properly. Fries were good, but not wow.  Looks like Burger Bar, Bachi are still my go-to luxe burgers in town.

_j2UDgdl1AlPFfYIg32Q-g.text: This is an easy place to like.   Food - This place takes its hamburgers seriously.  They are carefully prepared, well cooked, and well presented.  The french fries, sweet potato fries, and the salad we ordered were also all quite good.   Atmosphere - This is a sports book/beer garden, and yet it was family friendly enough that I could have dinner with my 15 year old son.   Service - The waiter was very attentive and responsive, and even took the time to explain how the mechanics of the various different kinds of bets that were available on basketball, even though that's a separate company in the same space.   All in all, it was a very pleasant, tasty, and fun experience.

yHwofsOSsngXPg9NBGxk0A.text: Went to the "Big Game" event Yesterday. My experience was amazing. Loved the vibe, food, drinks, and the giant TV screen they have.   Food: Food was great. My friends and I had a few  orders of wings, which were great. The sauce was really good, we also had some nachos which were amazing. When I ordered them I thought it was going to be an OK amount of nachos, but when we got them I was like "Oh sh*t! That's a lot of nachos." it was a mountain of them. We also had some burgers which were pretty good too. All the food came out to us pretty quick, considering there were a lot of people there.   Drinks: We had that all you can drinks package which was pretty good, so it was worth it. Got to enjoy a lot of drinks while watching the game.   Service: Service was excellent! Food didn't take too long, neither did the drinks. Our server's was Eddie, I think. He was good, quick, and very nice, didn't take long to get our drinks. Always checked on us to see if we were okay with food, water, or drinks, which was awesome. The bussers (Joe and Eric) were real nice and attentive as well, we never had a bunch of stuff in the way because the bussers took everything we didn't need right away, so our table wasn't a clutter.   This place was really cool, I love the amount of TV's they have, they're literally everywhere. No matter where you turned you couldn't miss a part of the game. The vibe was real nice, and hype. Seemed like it was the place to be! Only thing that could have made it better would of been a win for the Seahawks! Will be back.

gYb-qYIbj_aOqFW-WdLsQg.text: The food was good but the service was terrible.  The host took our order, the waitress introduced herself and then we only saw her again when she brought us our change - we had to get the host to bring us our tickets.  I think we were seated away from her other tables since no one else was around us.

5jCsaRwBjZNtjf5QM4Kr0Q.text: Burgers were awesome. The pickled plate is so original. Don't skip the truffle fries. YUM! Our server Mandy was terrific!

BH5o6QZgEvprBngvTZb7zw.text: Wonderful team. Very comfortable seating available with a beautiful outdoor patio. Mandy is a wonderful waitress and deserves a raise. She was very attentive and had a great personality. Even the owner stopped to say hello. Pickle platter was our favorite!

7eHWKpV9o1i2mzz8tZlTOA.text: Ordered food for delivery from our room. We walked over. Order was even started when we arrived. Had to wait an additional 20 min. Never again. Nuff said.

a3hYtrGoA1OtSOaasWrM1g.text: Ok so previously I rated Umami 3/5 stars because I just wasn't all that impressed by the food. (I had the ahi burger) Well this time I had the manly burger & added an egg to it.....phenomenal! One of the best burgers I've had. The beef was cooked beautifully, the egg was done to perfection, and the bacon lardons just made it. Now I can't wait to try their other burgers!

photos.caption: Photo of Umami Burger -  SLS Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The manly burger with an egg on top!

YTCDmYQNWexBdw2j-HHptQ.text: Great place right inside the SLS, the burgers are good but this review is for the service. The server, Mandy, handled our group of rowdy guys really well having fun and being attentive. Enjoyed a nice bite while watching our Cubs leading the Indians in the World Series!

5tIj9HgoZg0rH-ADDnshdw.text: This place was fairly good. I wouldn't go out of my way to eat there again, but if I were at the SLS and didn't have better plans, it's worth eating.  It wasn't good enough for me to remember exactly what I got, since it was a couple months ago, but I do remember that it was fairly good. The food took a long time to come out though, especially considering how relatively empty the place was.

pXhpKBu_0EWDqoR293cNvA.text: 3 visits, 2 great meals and 1 so so, but 5 star service all the way! Can I just say the staff here is fabulous?! I ate on the patio on my first visit - the Beer Garden (which is basically a let down of a name btw). I ate inside on my other visits. On all 3 occasions the staff were patient, attentive, offered great advice and even remembered us from prior visits.  My first visit I sat on the patio. It is referred to as the Beer Garden, but I can't figure out why. It seemed nothing like a beer garden to me. Seating consists of big huge picnic tables, which is great for large groups - a little strange for small groups. There are tons of big huge misting fans hanging, which help keep it nice and cool. My date and I shared the Sunny Side Burger, the Manly Burger and the Truffle Fries. The Sunny Side was by far my favorite, I can't generally pass up a fried egg on my burger. It was big, flavorful and worth the $14 price tag. The Manly burger was good too, lots of onion straws - but I don't think I'd order it again. The Truffle fries were TO DIE FOR! Shoestring thin, covered in truffle cheese but not soggy - perfection! If you like truffle you must try them!  My second visit I sat inside. There is a variety of seating, from big plush booths to leather arm chairs and sofas. It's what some might call a sports bar, but really it's a sports book! You can watch the games and bet on the sports, all while eating or enjoying a beer or cocktail. I had a Caesar salad with Grilled chicken. It has anchovies, which are optional - but I usally like that. The meat portions however were very small (my date had the same salad with Salmon) and the salad was just ok, maybe because it is kale, not sure why, but I didn't love it. I didn't finsh my salad and I definitely won't order it again.  My third visit I had the nachos with beef. The beef was shredded and marinated, it was amazing! There was plenty of guacamole which I appreciated. Strangely though the salsa came on the side and the cheese was a sauce, not real melted cheese so that was a big let down.  I will totally eat here again, but I don't think I'll branch out beyond the burgers, fries and beer next time however. Stick to what they are known for!

nDdQISyj5dnZYQQPlDw6Pw.text: Food: very good (Ahi tuna burger) Drink: average (local brewery flight) Serv: above average speed Music: average Price: average Other: located in the sports book

zF5R6nreE8hK31k1KCL-ww.text: I don't understand why this place got horrible reviews! Since we stepped in, the service was over the top. Our waitress was very friendly and takes her time to explain the menu.   I ordered truffle fries and cali burger. I fell inlove!!! I love the unique taste. Makes me want more and more! Our glasses of water never got empty.   For dessert we had salted caramel and peanut butter ice cream sandwich. Both were very good!   I will definitely come back!!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Umami Burger -  SLS Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Truffle fries and cali burger were very tasty!!!

t4io_dUlXR7loBq-EZJz_A.text: I was so excited when I found out Umami Burger was coming to Vegas and better yet right ACROSS the street from me! Being that I no longer eat meat... I always get the ahi burger that is always a win with my taste buds & for dessert I get the caramel ice cream which is bomb! 1 of two good things inside of the SLS casino! Definitely worth a try

photos.caption: Photo of Umami Burger -  SLS Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Ahi Burger
Photo of Umami Burger -  SLS Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Ice Cream

R4NbjtgQXTAXK9DykX7ucQ.text: This place was amazing, service was outstanding and the food was delicious. Two words: truffle fries!

3ia5oAtgsMdk6jqq1Q01mA.text: Stopped in for a quick lunch. Our server Tashja was amazing! Very friendly personality. I watched her handle the entire area with ease and she was attentive to all of us. She suggested little tweaks to our burgers that made them oh so good.... I had the seared ahi burger with a lettuce wrap instead of a bun. It was fresh, light and flavorful. Excellent choice! We will be back!

FCOYD0gNDXEHtB_uJQYutg.text: Liz was the best! Outgoing, professional, and so knowledgable. She made me excited for the food haha!  Great atmosphere, love the hotel, and love the food!

ZNqO8o0GiPt3sL9MX_U3TQ.text: My first trip to Umami was pretty stellar. The burger was perfect and so were my truffle fries... I'm honestly not sure what happened in the 3 months that it took me to come back, maybe my palate changed? That and perhaps the service... no, the service definitely changed.  I'll start from the beginning. On my second visit to Umami, we had originally wanted a booth but were told that three guests were waiting ahead of us (still unsure how that one booth remained empty during our time at Umami)... we were also told that a private event was being held in the Beer Garden so we couldn't enjoy the nice weather either. We ended up taking the table that they offered us instead. The table was in the middle of everything, it seemed. Not only that, but in one of the more crappy locations to view the TVs. TVs were important during this particular visit considering that football was on. This table was also the table of a server who was either swamped or due for a break.   A host dropped some water off for us but it took about 15 minutes for someone to actually greet us and take our drink order. We had ordered chips and queso to start, pretty simple. The chips and queso actually arrived before our beers. Chips were pretty bland, not sure what exactly I was expecting out of chips, but they were that bland that I feel the need to address it here, ha! The queso was also lacking some flavor. I was pretty hungry though so I gobbled it down mindlessly.   The burgers were the main thing that we came here for. We had found a Groupon that offered dinner (a burger and a side) for two ($40 value) for $25... yeah, not really worth getting at all. The burgers were tasty, per usual. This time around we ordered the garlic and parm fries... they were simply okay. It would have been nice to have the parm cheese melted... but it was not. Simply sprinkled on top; the fries weren't even warm enough to melt it.   My biggest gripe this time around was the Groupon situation... the deal said that it was a $40 value but they split the bill and only applied $25 to our bill! We basically just went through Groupon to pay $25 of our bill. What in the world? The server was nice about explaining that the deal was specifically for 2 burgers and 2 sides, and I understand that it was out of his control. Seriously though, Umami? Why list that you're getting a $40 value for $25 when you're really just getting $25 for $25? LOL!   Overall, the service ended up being ok, after we finally got a chance to put our order in. The food was ok, nothing stellar like our first experience. This place has potential to be awesome (again)... just gotta go back to whatever it was they were doing 3 months ago. :)

7UCCh0m3TwDpLH0ehbrNOQ.text: We arrived a bit late so the beer garden was closed, however we did have time to grab a few beers off the menu and guzzle them down before closing time.  The service was friendly and attentive, that was good.  The menus were crisp and well-laid out.  The selection of beers, however, contained a lot of superfluous, turgid descriptions of trash beers like Miller or Bud Light alongside a raft of garden-variety beers you see in just about every bar in America.  There was a small selection of higher-grade rarities, but the premium charged for these was laughable.  Also, the souvenir beer bong thing you get for $24 is a plastic lip-murdering beast that is best left behind.

OXYw-l4xm2fCP_XoJZ8mhA.text: With so many options in the SLS hotel and surrounding areas it was hard for my husband and I decide where to eat (although we knew we were going to eat a lot, and often) We stopped here as we both were craving burgers and were delightfully pleased!! Megan L. was our server and she was wonderfully sweet and a great server! I had the Sunny Side (which is pictured) and I am telling you right now, this is a burger you want to have! My hubby is more of the veggie/white meat lover and went with the greenbird. Both were so scrumptious and we swapped back and forth. Add a side of truffle fries and two cold beers, pure bliss!

photos.caption: Photo of Umami Burger -  SLS Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Sunny Side burger and it was everything you&#39;d hope it to be!

eq_3_W-FTV88dJPnLomx-A.text: All I got was an apple martini so this review is based on just that :) Apple martinis are my absolute favorite so it's hard to mess it up for me :') It had the perfect amount of vodka, they didn't skimp out! It was garnished with a cherry and was sweet enough without being unbearable. Overall it wasn't EXCEPTIONAL but it was decent It was $12 in case you were wondering! I'm so sad I forgot to take a pic :'( Sorry this review is everywhere I'm tired and I need a drinkkk ;)

0l_wnEomwkrbE8cGaTcRiw.text: Was in town on vacation & a friend told me to check it out... Upon arrival one of the managers (Jessica) greeted us and was very accommodating... She went out of her way to make sure all of our needs were met... Very hospitable & the attention to detail was superb... The Truffle burger was out of this world... Extensive beer list quenched my thirst... Will definitely visit again next time I am in town & will highly recommend to friends & family!

kBDX1S1zktfa6F8Jg0kJSw.text: Went here for lunch yesterday and our server was all in our face the minute we sat down, very pushy and motivated to take our order 3 seconds after sitting down. We ordered a beer to start and before they came she even stopped back to ask if we knew what we wanted to eat. Geez ... slow down. Then we do order, food comes, our beers are finished .... 20 minutes later - still empty beer we flag down another server to get our check and that takes another 5 minutes. My biggest irritation is that she lost revenue for the restaurant and thats not the person you want on your team.  Food was OK, I wouldn't go back.

eVkE0hDL5mwVnTVMH_vXrw.text: The burgers were very good. Every thing else not so much. The frys are thin and bland and for $5 very disappointing. The worst though is the chicken fingers. The look and taste exactly like the frozen ones sold through Sysco. Most disappointing chicken fingers I have had.

_YLcHJ1eqqB2EN5sfhPnGQ.text: Good burgers and good beer. What more can you ask for. Def a cool place to sit and have a meal. Hip atmosphere. The music/game was a little loud for my group but we were ok after we got used to it.

6RhbEHkktErQDwsEFOnj9w.text: Got the truffle burger and cheesy tots (not on the menu) per Tashja's request. The burger was insane and the toys put it over the edge. Great burger and great service! Thanks Tashja!!

9IduQUa3Ip3RKitwDYMd8A.text: I dont yelp a lot as you can see....but i have to on this one! From what this place 1st was to what it is now is a complete rip off for what you get and the quality just is lousy..And yes its in a hotel but serve better quality food.  In n out burgers are better, and cheaper.  Chicken fingers from US Foods doesnt cut it either when your paying 12 bucks for frozen chicken fingers.  Truffle "fondue" didnt even taste like truffle but more like swiss cheese, and came out cold.  But you can charge more when you put the word truffle on a menu...we came here cause a friend was stayin ast the stratosphere so it was convenient..but never again.  Sorry guys if you call yourself umami it should be better.

UDVWhqDbuXCZuZVe1EjKYg.text: Excellent atmosphere and burgers! Was with a group of 4 people and we all got different burgers and they were all awesome!! Would for sure recommend to anyone looking for a great burger!

y7EDwtoCD9s-fZmNLvxX4w.text: The food was ok, the service was great. The manager came out with our food and checked on us twice.  He also brought us a complimentary desert because the food took a little longer than he thought it should have.  We had a coupon from the Starwood Hotel for a free beer.  We were told that it was only good for Rolling Rock... which is fine if that is what you like.  However, the hotel coupon did not indicate the beer type was limited to Rolling Rock so I was somewhat disappointed. I also tried using yelp for a free beer and we were told we would have to spend $40 to use both the yelp and hotel coupons.  When it came time to pay, they gave us credit for both coupons (and I did not drink Rolling Rock). I had a burger and fries which did not sit well with me later in the evening.

3toXIaUZzc72aJrV09_JhA.text: Vegas local here, but my first time to Umami. First off, our server, Mandy, was phenomenal. Very friendly and attentive. Her recommendations were spot on and she even surprised us with an item from the secret menu! Both the truffle burger and the B.U.B were amazing. Oh, and the B.U.B is HUGE!! The Salted Caramel ice cream sandwich for dessert was just the right size. Forget the haters, come try this place. I know I'll be back.
