sozmky5WYEejw1BSYCd5AA.text: Umami is pretty good. Was staying at SLS and didn't feel like wandering off property. Met my co-worker here for dinner. Pricy and since my good friend is a meat scientist and told me all about ground beef, I order my burgers well done. They brought out medium rare +.   After letting it sit a bit to cook more, it was pretty good. I could only eat half - good sized portion.  Sides are extra. Got the Brussels sprouts - they were VERY good.   They have two types of red wine, a Pinot and a Cab. Got the Cab. It's alright.  Service is slow. There were games going on, place wasn't very full.   Overall it's what I'd expect from a sports bar, but with Vegas tourist prices to match.

vHAZvuu3qa5MbSr57rhtEw.text: First time here, great food, great atmosphere and Mandy, our server, was AWESOME!  Really enjoyed our experience here and will definitely be back the next time I'm in Vegas!

KktxawCTODpFVlU-A5sK9g.text: We were there for a birthday party last friday. There largest group in the restaurant and other then that it was pretty slow in there. The fooD was average.  I expected a lot better per the name... Service was a bit slow and when we asked to split the check they said they had computer issues previously and basically didnt want to do it because it would take them 20 mins or longer. Finally a female manager said she would do it for us which was kind of them. They did however provide an ice cream bar for the bday boy. Just guess I expect more being in Restaurant Management for years this was just okay and wouldnt recommend for further reservations.

UJdHW9f9TlgcWrVZJjtB3g.text: If I could give zero stars, that's exactly what I would give this review.   We stopped in for a quick bite and beer before heading to a wedding. We figured sitting at the bar would get us pretty quick service since that's been our result at other places. We sat for probably 10 minutes before anyone asked us for our drink order, and then our server left. Everyone else at the bar had attentive service, but we were blatantly ignored. I would've understood if the place was on and poppin busy, but there were literally only about ten of us seated.   The food was average. We shared a caesar salad, chicken fingers, and a pretzel. Pretty basic bar food.   I'm sure others have had positive experiences with Umami Burger, but this was honestly one of the worst service experiences I've ever had. I would not recommend anyone come here.

btg6l0FGjGfC5hneyybCDg.text: I was recommended to dine here by a friend and was told it was next level. My burger was absolutely minuscule and fries are separate and don't come with it. For the price this is scandalous. Overall it was just OK. I've definitely been to better burger joints that were a hell of a lot cheaper. Won't be going back here and I feel like they need to stop trying for a Michelin star and just do a good old fashioned burger without breaking the bank

sIsZNuAjIIRa05SlyOHODQ.text: So unfortunately umami burger did close down. But the location is still open just with a new name and menu named Beers and Bets. We are open same hours and definitely opened for NFL game College football games too and all sports. Come on in and check it out. Thanks for the support Vegas peeps

5bSMe6ZW3rBv-Fb9VqeKSQ.text: Mixed reviews on this one.    We were looking for a place in that area that wouldn't have an hour wait time.   I called the number, that wasn't really their number, it was the concierge or something?   It was weird.  So my husband called the number,too, and same thing.  Lol.  We had a group of eight so we just decided to wing it and go check it out.   20 minute wait.  They called our cell phone when our table was ready. We sat down and were served our waters and drinks.  Ordered burgers, impossible burgers, fries, chicken wings, and carnitas (?) nachos.  Food was average, not great, for us.  Service was good and very friendly.  Lots of screens for sports.  Fun place to hang out.

PATL6-gBtb0OKJtjI_McWg.text: The atmosphere is great. Everything was awesome. Definitely try the Greenbird burger. It was so good.

S56b7TJwDPQ_-8R3kONV-Q.text: Great place to come for sports viewing and great food. Came during monday night football but I also wanted to watch a certain NBA game. Lucky for me we had the best server ever, Tashja! She made our dining experience very enjoyable. Not only was she extra friendly, attentive and very personable, but she hooked me up with the game I needed to see on our very own tv at our table. Burger and fries were very good and the nachos were bomb! Thank you Tashja for a great evening and we will be returning soon!

lyz5pljLFsHAq1WKvRw9Wg.text: This is my first time to Las Vegas and we were looking for a a more casual dining experience and this spot was amazing.  The burger was outstanding and our waiter Sonny was great.  Super attentive and a great personality!

eAHWVOD5Tc53rUplYKQvRg.text: Umami Burger definitely has a great deal of potential, but it's not anyway good enough to currently compete in the Las Vegas Market.   First of all, having a waitress who didn't know what a "Manhattan" cocktail was is a bad sign that they are hiring the worst of the worst to work there.  I ordered the Hatch Burger, and from the start when it came out, I was underwhelmed. The food looks a lot better in the photos, and frankly, the preparation of chopping the chills up -- with the seeds still in them -- shows they aren't aware of how to properly prepare a hatch pepper.   The burger was cold, and nothing about it was remotely hot. The meet had clearly been sitting out by itself, and then the toppings added to make the burger. My client who enjoyed eating there the previous night, also complained about the same thing.   Clearly the service is not up to par or consistent. Probably will not go back there again.

0s9kei28FGzAT72faGQYug.text: We had a great lunch! Bucket of beer, watch the games and thanks to Tashja and her awesome recommendation of the Truffle Burger and truffle fries, we are happily stuffed. Service was great and the booths are so comfy and every spot has a view to watch the games; we will definitely be back.

udwwNvOlHjpa7InzHJkIyg.text: Awesome place to eat a good burger! Our waitress Tashja was so pleasant and attentive with a smile. Awesome service! Cookie dessert is to DIE for!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Umami Burger -  SLS Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chocolate Chip ice cream dessert! Amazing!!!

NHTlHJ8vMDFRioWepSBa3Q.text: I went to Unami Burger for a burger and beer last night.  Ordered the Manly Burger and Blue Moon.   Their burger is always comes out fast, juicy and awesome.  Western sauce with the onion rings kills it every time.    Highly recommend.

6PXKFOfimzjaUXaYPnBWYQ.text: Mandy was awesome!!!  Great service!!! Great food!!!  Our group of 20+ people had an amazing time!!!!

M492OwSMq2QpZPBs6CxKjw.text: No complaints. The burgers are ridiculous. I had the Hatch Burger and truffle fries. AMAZE AMAZE. Our server Ben was cool as sh*t too.

photos.caption: Photo of Umami Burger -  SLS Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Hatch burger. Delicious.

kqZkAdThOBhCZmbbaTNemw.text: Very good food! Something for everyone. It's the first place we've eaten in the week of being here where we can actually hear each other talk. Atmosphere is great and clean. Doesn't smell like cigarettes and the food was very fresh.

MbYTXaAx_dAV2H53kycxZw.text: The atmosphere, food, and staff were amazing.(Ask for Sunny, he was exceptional, J/K..! He's a great server!)I would definitely come here for a big sporting event!

DlpyrTX8R6AxSA-oUFLnfw.text: Checked this place out for the first time last night. And I have to say I was very pleasantly surprised! We were able to sit outside in the beer garden, and the weather finally allowed for that! It wasn't packed, there were cool picnic tables, and an awesome bar!  Our server was super cute and sweet! We had the grapefruit beer! Delicious! Then the food... We went all out!!  Bavarian Pretzel 5/5 salty warm and perfectly cooked!  Tatie Tots (not on the menu) 3/5 I wanted them to be cheesier, if you can believe it.  Truffle fries 5/5 delicious skinny fries covered in truffle cheese!  Manly Burger 4/5 I have to admit I hate the name but i ordered it anyway! Bacon, cheese, onions! So good and juicy! The bun fell apart that is why it lost a point.  Truffle burger 4/5 truffle on truffle on truffle!!  I gave Umami a 4/5 because I was up sold on a shot a vodka which ended up costing $13 alone! So that was excessive but other than that I loved it! Great place inside the SLS.

kjoEL1vWFDaNvPS1OtB74g.text: I wrote a review directly on Adam Fleischman's Facebook page in the middle of eating my burger! This was the BEST DAMN Burger I have ever had!!!! I had the Truffle burger with truffle cheese and truffle sauce and truffle fries! Deeeeeeeeeeliscious!!! My Mom and I along with several others will be back!!!! I highly recommend this place! Sarah was our waitres and could not have been any sweeter!! Jesus the manager, awesome!!!!  Michele T. InsuranceLadyLV

vdDpwmICNkBJd0rvcHF3pg.text: I'm becoming less and less reliant on reviews as I'm seeing the ones already posted.  This place was the horrible, the crazy expensive food sucked and so did the service.  That's all I can say.

iVNEhKfEjo6fWa7X_Ypidg.text: Food is pretty good but the service moves at a snail's pace.  I ordered the Umami Burger and it was incredible. Perfectly cooked. The only problem was how long it takes for the food to come and the drink I ordered had sat so long it was watered down.  now, the ambiance and the tv's in the booth are incredible arbitrary elements.

pHBiE6mqMZfp_2x4Vx23uw.text: So excited there was an umami burger here in Vegas!! Truffle everything, that's the way to go.  Service was awesome, Tashja is an amazing server!  She was quick and made sure to check on us multiple times. Took care of things we asked for right away and didn't have to wait long at all!

iKHKWVMTQrBeWBU5j_cjHQ.text: I got the turkey burger and it was good but not great my husband got the umami burger and he liked the hamburger patty but not the rest. The truffle fries are ok also. The server was good but the waiting for our food took a long time.

KPQfQt1CFU0lhFUpps6eCw.text: Came in for a drink but decided to grab some food as well. I started with the black razzmojito, so good! Then ordered some sweet potato fries and the simple salad. Lauren was a fantastic server and had a great personality! Ask for her if you are planning a visit!

YP_i2qD9sJWAKEh65Eg8FA.text: We are staying at the SLS and decided to make a reservation and give this place a go! I ordered the sunny side up burger and it was perfectly cooked and really juicy. All of the flavors worked well. Our waitress told me I could check in and get the truffle fries for free, which I thought was super sweet of her to suggest. We had a salad and my hubby had the original burger. We each had a 2 cent beer from a special they had going. Everything was awesome and the atmosphere was great!

photos.caption: Photo of Umami Burger -  SLS Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The sunny side up burger!

kRTW5LIFOqNulRKS1baOaQ.text: SLS? Seriously Lacks Satisfaction.  This is no more obvious than at Umami Burger, destination for our latest foodventure. But foodventures are not always successful, as Umami (Japanese for something) would prove. When Mama R wanted a burger for her birthday, Emijandro and I found it as our opportunity to try the much talked-about burger spot at SLS and off we went.  My thoughts on SLS itself are... sub-par at best, but this review strictly focuses on Umami Burger, which we found along the wall fairly easily. Walking in, there was a very... recycled... feel to the place, which I thought was supposed to be an urban hipster sports bar vibe. But one glance at the CHECKERED FLAG CEILING ABOVE revealed they just gutted the NASCAR Cafe and didn't bother to redo the ceiling.  When we were seated, we were handed small, trifold menus. Mine was dirty.  Seriously, your F&B department could have printed a ton of those, but you're giving me a dirty one?  Maybe it was to hide the fact that the basic burger was $12. No fries. NO GAWDANG FRIES. **flips table**  I ordered the Manly Burger, without the beer-cheese (?) as I don't care for cheese on my burger. The (dirty) menu said it had "bacon lardons" on it. "Ryan," you may be asking, "what in the Sam Hill is a 'lardon?'" I didn't know either, but it's somehow related to bacon, so I took the risk ($$) along with an order of Tempura Onion Rings ($) and water (HAH TAKE THAT CORPORATE MURRKA!). Emijandro ordered the Jose Andres Burger ($$$) and Mama R ordered the basic burger. Well, basic according to Umami's standards.  The burger is an art form. I know. I'm a burger connoisseur. A burger gourmand, if you will. Its art is found in its simplicity. A patty made out of some meat, toppings-a-go-go, and a bun. Delightful. But at some point Umami just made it all too fancy-schmancy. First off, lardons are apparently cubed bits of slab bacon. I suppose that's fine, but some thick strips of bacon are just as tasty and probably less expensive for the restaurant so they can lower their prices. Secondly, would have liked some barbecue sauce on this type of burger (also had onion strings), not their Umami Ketchup (Japanese for something ketchup), which really was just ketchup, nothing really different.  The burger was too pink for my taste -- apparently my waiter heard "medium rare" instead of "medium please." Or he was just dumb or hated his job -- the service was unsatisfactory, he spoke too quietly for a sports bar atmosphere during the third quarter of Monday Night Football, and dropped items repeatedly  (fortunately not our food). When we could hear him, he was being pushy about us ordering dessert.  Listen, dude, I know you're supposed to upsell, but when my bill is already about $19, don't give me a look when we say no to dessert.  Which I could have gone for, by the way, because for that type of money, the burger was small. To be fair, I didn't leave hungry, but I didn't leave with that OMG NO MORE FOOD IT WAS TOO GOOD kind of feeling. It just left me with a general MEH. I shouldn't leave with MEH for $19.  A few positive notes: The onion rings were tasty, though I could have used a dipping sauce beyond the four tiny little ladles of sauce they provide, one being the Umami Ketchup (something ketchup), and one being HOLY CRAP MY BUTT WILL REGRET THAT TONIGHT kind of spicy.  Umami should be Japanese for "overhyped." If you want the best burger on the Strip, it's still at Holsteins at The Cosmopolitan. Or stay off-strip and you can find a lot of high-quality burgers at a much lower price point. Either way, maybe SLS stands for Satisfaction Low, Sorry.

SzSN-o2-rDbN8bDYSNKJlQ.text: This place is awful, we were there for like 20 minutes,and nobody even offer us drinks or anything and, we were like we just want leave and never go back to this places again. Like horrible.

0P1DNZ-lrNqFCnV9nstpNw.text: Fantastic! I think our table tried about half of the menu!! Ahi salad was delicious. Can't even begin to put the burgers into words just have to try it yourself! Nachos were a great starter! 100% satisfied. Stop in and ask for Mandy everything she recommended we exactly how she described.

ScQG0Y05-G7smlI301A0vQ.text: Nice place, no line no wait we were seated immediately. Has a sports bar look and feel, decently priced for a place on the strip. T.V's everywhere, staff is very friendly our server Ben is great explains everything in detail told us about there off menu items and was very accommodating with my girlfriends food allergies.  Drinks as far as soda are pricey but they are imported from Mexico meaning no garbage chemicals they use in fountain drinks. Food is amazing came hot and fresh on a sweet Portuguese bun absolutely delicious. Good food great service worth the price of eating on the strip and will definitely compete with Gordon Ramsay's BurGR.

eJiYcLPAY8_UklJG_j0eSg.text: Back at Umami watching my LIONS whoop up on the Jets! This is such a great place to watch the games and hang out outside w drinks and great food!! SO GOOD!!! Everything's coming up Lions today!!

KeQHw4ZECMboQT2rv4xcLw.text: We were there last week it was fantastic service and even though we were in our sleep for three hours the waiter was more than kind enough to keep refilling our drinks and asking us what we needed.  Even though we are locals we have never been here before and we would recommend it to anyone whether you're a local or just visiting town.  I had the Ahi burger and it was absolutely fantastic !!

hb4tBk4-4Gsj3Vm0z-cKcA.text: I am usually not a burger girl but they have a really good turkey burger. It's probably the best turkey burger I have had!! Mixed in some sweet potato fries and of can't go wrong.   They have an outdoor section with games like air hockey but they apparently can't find the puck which really sucks.

DBapKrRx6qjyC10aesAEsQ.text: Once again Umami and the staff delivered amazing food and service. The truffle burgers came out hot and delicious. Due to a new diet we had to try the lettuce wrap version and it didn't degrade the burger's flavor. The pickle plate for an appetizer was a great surprise. Normally 1 pickle is enough but the this assortment is amazing. Amanda our server is an All-Star also!!

Fctc8iyMd-WRyQadKDKfBw.text: The beet salad was fantastic and twice the size I was expecting, the burger was perfect (I got the Manly) and the service was great. I definitely will be coming back.

p9kc2atyRu8NdBmT_jRssQ.text: Food was amazing! We especially loved the beet salad and the ahi tuna burger. Our waitress Mandy was wonderful and very helpful about drink selections.

SontTPVAxuo2kQasFCV1lA.text: Service was slow and our order was wrong. The burger was actually really good just wish it was bigger. I was still hungry after we left. Being a server in the past it would be nice to interact a little more and instead of saying no we don't have this or that make a recommendation.

6EhbdSQazbBNjUU49Wwe6w.text: I was here last year for football season and loved service and the food. I think it was the truffle burger which was a great comfort food. Unfortunately my team lost but it could be soaked up with the beef nachos and great variety of bottle beers. Keep up the great work!

YxaBT-XYKd0E5kOTKOTyuQ.text: Awesome burgers, cooked to perfection. Truffles make all the difference. The restaurant is located inside the casino and has plenty of tables.

gKv4zKoPXzTghNSnop36xg.text: The Truffle Burger was good.  A decent sized burger that was juicy and tasty. The truffle aoli sauce was oozing out.  The Bun had a big U logo toasted on top.  Nice touch.  Had it with the Panko Onion Rings which were light and crispy.  Awesome home made ketchup for dipping.

rAyHYiKZhXDApexqXzxxyQ.text: Hatch Burger is out of this world!!! Umami Burger is so good.  Love the Korean Fries and Truffle fries!!! And nothing better to start it  all off than the Truffle Beet Salad!!!! One of my new Fav places to come to in Vegas!!!!

RTvshnIoWbwLjWO3SKeZuA.text: I loved the service by staff and I received my meal quick. Plus it's in the sports book.

LStnC7twW_JYoLcKG3fKdQ.text: This place had very poor burgers!! Very disappointed and is would highly suggest you don't waste your time.

C5RqyGo3q5SN4GKaPgVwGg.text: Well this is an OK place. Nothing special in my opinion. The Burger are mediocre. The staff is nice and friendly. The Tv's are way too loud. We had to yell to each other. I was disappointed because they were not able to bring the correct beer. The first round was correct but after that they always brought the wrong beer. I mentioned it twice but they were not able to fix it. They made me pay for all beers. Not a good example of fixing a problem. Again this is convenient if you wanna get a quick bite while staying here. Holsteins has way better Burgers for sure.

ETtvLZ8NKKVLZSl9FD1YxA.text: The food was good but the service we had was not the best. I was there for lunch and the female server we had  did not have proper customer service etiquette. We informed her that we did not receive one of the dishes that my friend ordered. Instead of apologizing her comment was "I asked you and that's what you told me" rather than saying "My apologies, I will get that order in for you right away". They need to work with their staff on proper ways of speaking to customers but the food was good that's why I gave three stars.

tf44poPbLAOShNG1UCq5Wg.text: We were tired, hungry and getting a bit jaded with flashy Vegas restaurants. We went to Umami because everything else in SLS was either closed or unappealing.  We were seated in a booth that was comfortable and immediately greeted by a refreshing friendly voice and face. Our waitress AJ was a breath of fresh air. She gave us plenty of menu advice and time. She was genuinely concerned with our enjoyment of our experience.   We didn't want to watch basketball on our booth TV. As soon as we let someone know we'd prefer hockey, the game was switched.   The food:  ahi burger - amazing!  Big, well seasoned and perfectly cooked. Throwback burger - solid traditional burger, substantial amount of beef and a very tasty bun. Truffle burger - just excellent, a wonderful grown-up mix of flavors.   A choice of three sauces plus house made ketchup is offered up to the table - these were a great compliment to everything we ordered including the tempura battered onion rings, cinnamon seasoned sweet potato fries and truffle fries.   Then there are the cocktail and beer selection. Amazing!  Try the Le Freak brewed by Green Flash!  I'll sum up the experience like this: this is the only restaurant in Vegas we went to twice during our trip. Loved the drinks, the food and especially the staff. Go there!

IM0lVK0jFfh40-TF6LWUKA.text: AJ was awesome!! Food was great, Pokemon advice was even better! Definitely coming back!!

Eeagi96XVKoL5XCkYCqsng.text: Came here as an out of town guest on a referral from a colleague.  Best Burger! Highly recommend the "Manly" burger, and don't forget the Cheesy tots; they are not on the menu until YOU ask for them....oh my the secret menu.....love this place!

iAajyWFXix9Q9VYnXJ9vZw.text: By far the worse burger I have ever paid for.  The meat had no flavor and the sauces did not help any. It's cool to watch games and drink there but hold the burgers.

ls3Gid_8FuIvLg34XrVrUQ.text: I have to say the service was great because we changed our seating 3 times, and each time the servers and hostesses were very accommodating. When I asked the spiciness of a burger the server told me about the Diablo Burger, which isn't on the menu. It comes as a turkey or beef burger, with beer cheddar cheese, onion straws, diced hot peppers and Diablo sauce. I got the beef - it was very spicy but not some much that you couldn't taste the flavors, and it was delicious. I also got sweet potato fries which weren't very good, I got them with salt instead of the cinnamon sugar, that might have made a difference. My husband got the Parmesan fries which were just ok, the Manly Burger which he said was a really good bacon cheeseburger. The fries were a good portion and enough to share, I expected the burgers would be bigger but they were still filling. We used a Groupon for 2 burgers and 2 sides so this was a great bargain, as well as a good experience.

photos.caption: Photo of Umami Burger -  SLS Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Diablo Burger from the secret menu

6PjbYw1taw2E4AxnpI2ovg.text: Went in for their recent #socialsundays for Vegas locals deal. I do have to say that while I didn't not care for my burger there were a couple others on the menu that I would still like to try. I opted for the Cali Burger. It had caramelized onions on it which I love but these were disgusting. I don't know if they made a huge batch of them early in the day & then just popped some on the burger each time it was ordered but they  tasted gross. They also made the top of the burger slide off in every which direction. Loved the truffle fries & the sweet potato fries. Tried the onion rings & while they were as big as a softball there was absolutely no flavor what-so-ever in the batter. Not even a little salt.Glad I hadn't ordered them. They were very accommodating to our party of 12 that included a child which technically they couldn't seat where they original sat us but did accommodate us by moving the sports book lines since there wasn't any one actually sitting in that area. Server was frazzled but she still did a great job.

photos.caption: Photo of Umami Burger -  SLS Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Umami Burger -  SLS Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Umami Burger -  SLS Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States

IndgDwT8fVMLmtpmFkW3rA.text: Although we absolutely love this restaurant we were so disappointed when we arrived yesterday for lunch.  The restaurant was CLOSED.  We were informed they would only be open Friday, Saturday, Sunday and Monday.  WHY?  Being local we love to go to the SLS at least twice a week, do a little gaming and have lunch at Umami.  The restaurant always looked busy, including the patio.  Apparently the hotel has new owners and no decisions will be made about anything regarding the hotel/restaurants until the deal is done. If you want to have lunch at the SLS there are now only two options, the pizza place and the cafe, neither of which appeals to me, my wife or our friends.  Guess we will have to find a new favorite hamburger place until such time as the future of Umami is decided.  Just an FYI, we do not go to the Strip on the weekends.  That time is for tourists. Hopefully the new owners will realize that locals can and do patronize the restaurants on the Strip.

6oRRlj1ES_4eXvgaWdqDGg.text: Sitting outside along the strip was quite enjoyable! The burgers were delicious. We ordered a beer tower and when we poured the beer we noticed absolutely NO head on any of the beers. We tasted the beer and everyone thought it was flat. We told the server. She came back with a manager and the manager asked "what's the problem with your beer?" We told her that we all thought it was flat. She immediately responded "oh yah! We have been having problems with our CO2"... if you know there is a problem, then why would you ask us "what's the problem with your beer?" Anyway, she quickly offered to get us something else and offered to upgrade to a more expensive beer.  I definate would go back!

IXubTnYJIOBs4f6c-Spx4w.text: Hands down one of the best burgers I have had in my entire life.. The burgers are a perfect size and they fill you up without being full.. The atmosphere is awesome.. The beer selection is amazing too.. They always take care of locals too.. When you go inside ask for Mandy.. She is my favorite server inside and she takes care of you.. Also try the cheesy tots.. Heaven

cNaSYQHXVjeU6xckDOLRng.text: Ok I've been hearing rave reviews about this place so while we were on a staycation I said let's try it! We got it to go and ate in our rooms. The food was packed nicely and I like that they brand their bun. This burger wasn't bad but didn't live up to the reviews. Although they paint a pretty picture with imagery with the description of the "gourmet" ingredients, they actually sound better than they taste. If you want a comparable burger (or better) that live up to the hype. Go to Fukuburger, Bachi burger-or dare I say-Fatburger. Yeah I'd eat fatburger before I eat here again. So overall not a bad burger, but waaaaay over-hyped.

QIwPFLsquv0usGexqIN0YA.text: Visited today for lunch... there were 7 of us.  The food was just okay.  I had a truffle burger and we all shared side items including French Fries (shoestring fries that are HORRIBLE and cold), a house pickle plate that includes a variety of pickled items (carrots, mushrooms, beets, etc., also YUCK), and were supposed to share a plate of fried pickles which were forgotten and never brought to the table.  Aside from the crappy food, soda is served by the bottle (so be prepared to shell out $3 for each 12 oz bottle you drink).... and the real clincher: on top of the 20% gratuity they automatically added to the bill, they added AN EXTRA 20% SERVICE CHARGE simply for being a party of 6 or more.  Nope, sorry... never again!  Good luck surviving in SLS where the hotel smell alone made me want to vomit!

UsJR_sQ10yM40cezT1c4TA.text: I have heard about this pace so many times but just had the opportunity to come in, and I have to say this place is amazing not only is the service unique and great,but the food is finger licking delicious !!! Officially one of my favorites in Vegas!

TsE0aaKPBxk_X8WK_ajAXw.text: As the name says burger beer bets, during any sporting event you can enjoy a great atmosphere inside or outside, great burgers, and great beer/cocktail selection such as union jack ipa or burning mandarin. We sat outside and the atmosphere and service were great as we always had what we needed. The manager on duty Edgar ensured the staff followed up and food quality was good. Keep it up!!!!

QostBGHt5uwpuZMRari5AQ.text: We liked this place while staying at the SLS.  GREAT turkey burger, fries.  Like the sports bar theme - did not do beer garden in back.  Prices weren't bad.  Two burgers, two fries, one beer - $40.00  Perfect portion too.  Awesome server.  Too bad it's in the SLS and at that end of the strip.  Just not a good location at all.  5 stars for burger and server :)

uIqGmWnU9NHUuetSqqLjRA.text: With its great reputation and high prices, I expected a little more from the food. There wasn't much flavor going on in the burger or truffle fries. The texture was great, it just seemed that the flavor was watered down. Service and setting was great though.

Gn6D4SprYct7bkdIuR121A.text: I'd eaten at one location in San Francisco.  This location was much nicer!  Plus Tashja took really great care of us.  What a great final lunch for our trip to Vegas!

X42smZ4IRlHcvIMuBpM8uA.text: My wife and I were lucky enough to be at the Umami Burger sports book in Vegas.  Great place to watch sports!  If you are there ask for Mandy, she does a great job of taking care of you.

z1S6NtmMBzq3jFnUwwirEw.text: I always wanted to try this place from the first time I stood at SLS but didn't want to try it alone. So after a night of debauchery and a late check out, the miss and I decided to finally eat and we chose umami burger. I am a big burger eater and I take pride in being a carnivorous fool so my expectations were high. All I can say is that I was not disappointed. The burgers here are compact and pack a big punch of flavor. I am extremely satisfied and am happy I finally ate here. I ate the manly and she ate the sunny side. Both were amazing. I took a bite of hers cause I can. LOL Staff is friendly and very attentive. I highly advise you try it for yourself. GQ magazine got it right on this one. I still have no clue what umami means but if I had to guess I'd say it means yummy goodness. Holla!

e5H9QdipQw3lj9hdDGcPHA.text: We had some friends come to town, and they wanted to get burgers from here.  I had the truffle burger with sweet potato fries, OMG, this burger melted in my mouth.  The bun perfectly fit the burger, the cheese was melting on the burger.  It was so good, and the sweet potato fries were amazing.  Sweet and crispy.  If you have never been here, it is a must to visit you will not be disappointed.  We are local, and we will be back.

8Esia3Re9xYqXfYXgWPjPA.text: Loved Umami Burger in LA, and so happy to have Umami Burger here in Las Vegas! You must try the truffle burger - and the hatch burger, and the Cali burger.... Sitting outside is nice and the outdoor section is nicely done. We had a small issue with the seating, but the general manager reached out and addressed it. Megan was our waitress and was great. We will be back!

uo50TL4jEFVKn7t8qpdEEQ.text: After my last review the GM from Umami Burger contacted me. The GM was very concerned about our negative experience and extended their sincere apologies and invited us back to give Umami Burger, Beer Garden & Sports Book another try.  I was really impressed with the customer service, so we'll try this again.  I do have to say that my experiences at the SLS as a whole, have all been very pleasant and positive.  The SLS is a new hotel, and there are growing pains - I hope they can grow from our feedback and make the upcoming experiences wonderful.  They get 5stars for doing the right thing and offering a make-good.

eg45PR9ySQMEZcAJGBu9Hw.text: Seriously the BEST burger I have EVER had.  It was perfectly cooked and soooooo delicious!  Was skeptical at first but the food here had more than exceeded my expectations!   Do NOT doubt AND DO NOT miss!!!  Don't forget to try the cheesy tater tots... they are part of the secret menu and are served wit a jalapeno ranch! SUPER FANTASTIC!

odeOBZrcRH8XxGcJ7pKzXA.text: Amazing burger place. I'm all about sauces and all of their sauces are made from scratch. Roasted garlic aioli, fresh ketchup, jalapeno ranch and spicy hot sauce. Order the truffle fries! The burgers are not too big, not to small. All yummy! The buffalo wings had the best tang to them! I had black bean burger! Delicious!

6J9u1E1Al6xyPvMr5bmVbg.text: Joseph was a fantastic server. He was very patient with our questions about the menu, and his friendly energy was a great pickup! The food is great as well. Try the Brussels sprouts, and then get the umami burger. Definitely a great spot for lunch before going out.

TcqyKOiUgO9iov33Hnp4iw.text: The food was quite good but the service was exceptional!  Rhitzie was our waitress and she was very attentive and super friendly and helpful!  She made the experience even better!  Thank you!

cARylzwYWmg3WRjHSrza2A.text: I think the sportsbar environment kinda makes this place a little underwhelming. However, there were some really unique concepts on the menu. I really enjoyed the truffle fries. Of course, the prices were high for a burger place but it is Vegas and here we're some pretty unique ingredients used in the burgers we ordered. But it wasn't a place where I felt like I had to revisit.

photos.caption: Photo of Umami Burger -  SLS Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States

53OKFOrBmdHVl_vLW69MKQ.text: Too bad Umami is so far from Houston!!   Booked my hotel at SLS and a friend heard this place has really good burgers.  Turns out, it was fantastic!  If I ever run into another Umami Burger I am down to go in a jiffy! The place looked really nice, I think it's one of those places that take down bets and has those super huge screen to watch sports.  Waiters were fairly quick and attentive to us. We had: --Truffle burger (5/5) (added bacon) :D --Truffle fries (3/5)(didn't taste the truffle much, but it was still good) --Ahi Poke (2/5) (it was alright, wasn't that much of a fan)

photos.caption: Photo of Umami Burger -  SLS Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Truffle Fries (didn&#39;t taste much truffle, still good!)
Photo of Umami Burger -  SLS Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Truffle Burger (wish i opened it up to take the picture) YUM YUM, I&#39;m in love!
Photo of Umami Burger -  SLS Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Ahi Poke (better off at a sushi restaurant)

fBUgdT7gLKXCvBm77chFBA.text: Just had the tuna poke salad. It was delicious! My husband's burger was also very good. TV's at the booths so you could watch the game and friendly servers . Would definitely go back!

_Ia_epbUQA2Fzbxa3LAG7Q.text: I have never been to any Umami burger joints in LA, since we stayed at SLS hotel, there weren't many choices for lunch, I wanted some ice cold beer, so Umami burger it is.  Glad to see there are veggie appetizers, ahi tuna burger and vegan burger. That's all I can have on the menu. The Belgian draft beer I tried was pretty good, very tasty and strong. Had a glass Stella for second one, couldn't finish it, poured it in a plastic cup and took it back to our suite.   Appetizers: House pickled veggies, Thin fries.   The assorted pickled veggies were delicious, sour and salty, great hangover snack. They provided three dipping sauces for fries, the yellow jalapeno sauce was extremely spicy, loved it.   Burgers: Umami burger in medium rare and Vegan burger.   Hubby liked his burger alright, he said it was tasty but nothing spectacular for being their so-called signature burger. My sloppy mami was really"sloppy", it was open faced and impossible to hold, also hard to take a bite, the stuffings made the buns so mushy, tasted nasty, but the stuffings were very delicious, liked the onion strings so much.   Food was good but not great, portions were huge, our waitress was friendly and fairly attentive.   This place is great for watching sports on the leather couches in the mid section, a few enormous flat screen TVs hanging up high right in front of those seatings, those are for reservations only. A great way to kill some time in the afternoon hanging around here.   Unless we want to have drinks and watch sports, I wouldn't come again, just not my type of food.

photos.caption: Photo of Umami Burger -  SLS Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Umami Burger -  SLS Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Vegan open faced burger
Photo of Umami Burger -  SLS Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Medium rare

Nk6hpvixyWivZ0N3qB6aPw.text: Always love coming here! The food, drink and atmosphere never disappoint. My server Casey always goes above and beyond to make sure my dining experience is a great one! Not only is her personality fun and outgoing, she is also very attentive and knowledgeable of both the food and drink. Not sure what beer to choose? She always comes in clutch with the perfect recommendation based off your likes. I'll keep coming back because of Casey and the outstanding service she provides.

4fWOSbeQ-qg9b_vA2MdFTw.text: My wife and I had great burgers here! We loved the atmosphere and the look of the restaurant. Aj was amazing and energetic. She gave us a lot of recommendations along with beer pairings. We definitely will be back and hope she will be there!

kcU75m4dj2F5RrwbM_94Cg.text: Located in the SLS hotel and casino. When you enter, to the immediate left there's what seems like a fully stocked bar with usual gambling games. To the right of that a comfortable area with tables and couches to dine or watch whatever sports game playing. The high ceilings has a black and white checkered pattern. And to the right of that their sports book with a few tables and tvs. But wait there's more. Exit the doors and you'll enter their "beer garden" outdoor patio area with lots of seating, ping pong table, and an even bigger bar than inside. The staff are very friendly and welcoming. They were patient enough to explain the items and what the concept of Umami Burger was each time. They are supposingly a known business which I've never heard of and they prefer that you don't mess with the chef's creations and have them as is . It seems a like a place to hang out at and have some beers but I wasn't impressed with what I ate. Korean Style Brat yelp.com/biz_photos/umam... It looks great but I probably won't order it again. It was a pork belly brat topped with caramelized kimchi, their korean ketchup, sesame aioli, and green onion for $11. The pork belly brat was sliced like a hotdog bun it was thin and tiny in proportion to the other components. It was like eating a bun filled with just caramelized kimchi. The caramelized kimchi was kind of nasty tasting for me, maybe too caramelized not sure but I needed lots of water just to finish it. Manly Burger yelp.com/biz_photos/umam... Their burger topped with beer cheddar, bacon lardons, smoked-salt onion strings, their house ketchup, and mustard all for $12. I don't know if I liked too much. The manly aspect wasn't there unless manly meant tiny. It was like an over sized slider. I would've preferred the onion strings to be crispy. The U on the bun was nice. Also had the Truffle Fries. Thin fries with truffle cheese and truffle salt. Didn't like it maybe try the manly fries or something else next time. The fries were cold and were all stuck to each other. I've had way better comparable food for the price in Vegas. I was expecting something on the line of Bachi Burger or at least better than 1/2 of the numerous burger places here but got something far far from that. Other than that I like everything else about it the huge misters, decorations, the bar, the many TVs, customer service, the outdoor patio with view of the Strip and people walking or driving along the Strip which is why I didn't give them a 1 star. I might be back.

TiVXNHtuQS0oLstkhLPk9Q.text: I went to umami burger for the first time today. I personally am not much of a burger eater but, man this place is good! I didn't know what to order and I had a server named Angel, she was so patient and sweet and recommended the truffle fries with my burger. Best decision because the umami burger and truffle fries is so so so tasty. For sure going back sooner then later.

Jxcz0VcmLCNf6PY50E8xHQ.text: I was a little skeptical in eating here seeing all the reviews. However, I got the Truffle Royale Burger and the Truffle Fries and both blew my mind. That braised beef was such a great addition to the burger.   The only downfall of this place is the service and the prices. $5 for a sprite is beyond me. We also had to tell our waitress twice that we were waiting for someone else in our party to come but she proceeded to keep asking if we were ready to order so we ended up giving in to get her to stop. Then when it came to refills, she was never to be found.

-jCnWtVyR4BGRf9Qp8GTVg.text: I'm not a fan of Umami when I tried it a few times in L.A. years ago. My sister has never been and I can't say no to a free meal with family. You have to reserve a table (what?) or open-seating at the bar. I'd much rather stay at home and do homework than be here but since my sister already went out of her way to reserve a table, I showed up anyway.  Random thoughts: their house ketchup tastes like Filipino spaghetti; you only get 3g or protein per 100g (1 cup) of mushrooms which does not meet my protein needs therefore, I must stick with beef patty; I have low expectations of Umami Vegas thanks to Umami L.A.; Umami beer garden???; Umami buns look huge but press to deflate; they'll give you 4 different sauces: 1 spicy, 1 ranch, 1 garlic aioli that doesn't taste like garlic at all and house ketchup.  The Original: House ketchup, parmesan frico, shiitake mushroom, roasted tomato and caramelized onion. The frico adds crispness to an otherwise boring burger. 3/5  The Royale: Braised short rib, truffled aioli and truffle cheese. Again, not truffle-y enough. The short rib was a nice touch. 3/5  Truffle Burger: Truffle cheese, truffled aioli and truffle glaze. Sounds like a lot of truffle but it sure didn't taste like it. It had a hint of truffle and that's it. 3/5  Truffle Fries: I've had way better truffle fries elsewhere. The fries were soggy and lacked truffle flavor.  Get the smushed potatoes instead. 1/5  Sweet Potato Fries: Sprinkled with sweet salt. This goes well with the spicy dipping sauce and the house ketchup. 3.5/5  Mies Vanilla Rohe: Tahitian vanilla bean ice cream in between chocolate chip cookies. The cookie itself wasn't that great. The ice cream was ordinary. Hello, cavities! 2.5/5  At least in L.A. I've gotten better service, food was a bit quicker and my drink glass was never empty. Umami is a casual dining place but calling it a sports bar/beer garden and having that atmosphere is just blah. Flat screens everywhere with different football games on and Criminal Minds = headache! There are other better burger places in Vegas.

yTOqelIsJPY-3B-w_D5D5Q.text: Umami:  noun a category of taste in food (besides sweet, sour, salt, and bitter), corresponding to the flavor of glutamates, especially monosodium glutamate. ???  I wasn't sure what Umami meant, so my assumption was that this was going to be an Asian fusion burger. Nope, this is just a straight up burger with truffle oil randomly thrown in the mix. C'mon, you were thinking the same thing when you heard the name, "Umami Burger".   I came here with some friends and we started this meal off with a cornucopia of deep fried, carb loaded appetizers, Mmm Mmm my favorite. First up, the "Smushed Potatoes" these were ok, but a tad flavorless. They look like a mini-baked potato and be careful when eating, I tried putting a whole one in my mouth and nearly lit my tongue on fire. These little pockets of heat are best cut in half and dipped in Umami house ketchup, which I liked a lot. It's ketchup, but with a mix of truffle oil and something spicy. We also ordered sweet potato fries and tempura fried onion rings. The sweet potato fries were cooked perfect, crispy and soft and the tempura coating on the onions was light, flaky and not too heavy. Overall, deep fried goodness.   On to the star of the show. I ordered the Truffle Burger, the hat trick of truffle oil infused beefy eats. This burger has; truffle aioli, truffle cheese, and coated in a truffle glaze. This burger was super juicy and full of flavor and honestly didn't need any sauce assistance, but I still dipped it once or twice in a mixture called, "Diablo Sauce"? Plus the bun was super soft, like dissolving in your mouth soft. Cute side note, they adorn each bum with the letter, "U" which in the words of Ralph Wiggum stands for, "Umm-believable". After the burger entered the equation I completely forgot about the side dishes and went full carnivore.   To finalize the meal, like any good eater, we ordered and shared a dessert. This was an Ice Cream Sandwich. A snicker-doodle cookie with caramel ice cream filing. Sooooo good, a must order!   - Was this the best burger I ever had? Nope.  - Was it tasty and satisfied me? Yes - Would I come back? Maybe. Every once in a while.   Umami is good, but the prices are a little high for a burger place, but If you haven't been here yet it's definitely worth a try if you're any kind of burger loving American.   Cheers.

vkXYIaGFkdl-mk6dvAU06Q.text: I had heard a lot about Umami Burger from friends and relatives from California. So I was, naturally, excited to hear that there would be a location inside the new SLS Casino.   We had a party of 5 of us this past Sunday evening. We had the option of having a table or booth, so we opted for the booth. I was diggin' the layout of the space. It is attached to a William Hill sports book, so there were plenty of TV's around playing football(including in our booth!). You can NEVER go wrong with me by having football on the TV!  The service was outstanding! Our server, Mandy, was both personable and engaging and helped us with recommendations(including my tasty Stella Amber!). Our party ended up trying a little bit of everything. First we ordered appetizers of fried pickles and "manly" fries. I didn't partake of the fries pickles, but those fries were delicious! I had the classic burger, while my friends had the B.U.B. and the Truffle burgers. They all ranged in price from $12 to $14 each. The burgers were juicy and tasty. My only complaint would be that they were a bit on the small side.  It wasn't until after we were finished that we walked out to the patio facing the strip and took in the Beer Garden. Looks like a very cool set up and I do look forward to coming back and trying out some more menu items!  This was a pleasant experience and we will certainly be back once things calm down a bit at the SLS...  so I have to give it..  4 stars!

uZk2clfN6tlMiJ5KFnca4A.text: I want to give them 5 stars, but because they're so busy inside, the patio lacked prompt service. However.... the food is amazing!! I had the ahi tina burger, please get this. My friend had the Cali burger and she says it was totally worth it. Another friend for the nachos and she wasn't impressed, but she doesn't like beer and supposedly the cheese is beer infused. Last dish ordered was the chicken Cesar salad and she says it was good. Nothing as great as the ahi air the burger. Yum!! Also dairy free burgers. They melt in your mouth.

Rapq7mbpAfRJrNSOubFwGQ.text: I don't like to throw 5 stars out there unless the entire experience is exceptional. Here's why I'd give it 4....  the service wasn't quite up to par. Although the place wasn't packed for lunch, our waiter was a bit scarce at critical moments: Like after we were seated.  And after the great food was delivered and it became apparent extra napkins would be needed.  And when drinks were running low...  The burger I had was excellent- both flavorful and juicy. Price points are a bit higher due to being a hotel/casino restaurant, but by no means outrageous. Will hit this place again next time staying here.

T6DOUiggvb18tGSHzmPViw.text: Service great, food delicious,   and we'll entertained by all the television. ......  gourmet bar food I can't complain  !

dXCAaAsr7fYg89HG-wMFwQ.text: My first Umami burger: *perfect size *the truffle cheese is fantastic *loved the bun *great truffled aioli  The Royale was decadent.  I'm not a burger person and I'm sold.  I need a salad now.    Lived up to all the hype.  The wait was pretty excruciating.  25 minutes?  Ugh.

Fb0QyLUCMQJBy5zi3MuxzA.text: I understand why this particular Umami has horrible reviews, but the umami burger I ordered was delicious ( albeit small )   We came here for lunch time around 11:30 am, and waited about 30 minutes to be seated which I thought was ridiculous since the restaurant was not crowded at all. My group had 7 people so we were told beforehand that we would be charged addtl. gratuity which usually I don't mind but when we received the bill I saw that we were charged 20% which is ALOT! especially when the server freaking forgot our umami fries even though I checked with her twice that I had put in 2 orders of umami fries.   I ordered the umami especiale truffle burger, and we also shared the umami fries, fried pickles, and sweet potato fries.  I especially love the ketchup that they have here, it is the only ketchup that I will eat.  The sweet  potato fries and fried pickles weren't particularly worth it, since they only give you 6 spears of pickles for $6 so $1 per pickle wtf.   Service just took way too long, and it was pretty obvious the staff did not know what they were doing. I wouldn't mind the price for this restaurant if only the burgers were a little bigger.  I usually cannot finish an entire burger but at Umami I always can.   P.S. ONLY umami with a full bar.

cGGquZJ3U-2ylYe84JepNQ.text: Came to Umami Burger for the first time since they opened here in Vegas to eat and have some drinks.   Ahi Tuna Caesar Salad - Good, perfectly seasoned.   Fried Pickles - Nice and crispy  Sloppy fries - Good flavor  Sweet Potatoe Fries - Crispy outside, soft inside, sweet  Original Burger - Was just OK. Nothing great about it. Lacked flavor  Hatch burger - nicely seasoned  Cali Burger - OK  Mint cookie ice cream sandwich - refreshing, chocolate cookie was warm and soft. Mint ice cream was nice n minty  Peanut Butter Ice cream sandwich - Too peanut buttery for my taste  Service was great. Very attentive with good recommendations. Food was just ok to me. Nothing too special for me to go out of my way to come back. I along with many other people prefer Bachi Burger lol

VDPp2nXRYRyYMejPYSF8EQ.text: I finally got to check out Umami...I love me a boutique boujie burger and they've been on my list for a bit...  Umami Service & Ambiance:  The decor is sports influenced nascar (?) influenced as evident by the hanging football helmets and the checkered flag ceiling.  There's plenty of booths and tables in the open main dining area.  Flat screens are hung throughout the resto. The hostess at the front was very friendly as she directed my friend and I up the handicap access ramp.  Our server was friendly but it looks like they were understaffed as we didn't really see her through our visit.  She was making her rounds and trying her best it appeared  Umami Burgers+: We started off with the duck fat cauliflower and it was the perfect flavorful light appetizer.  This is a very creative dish.  The Yelp bff went with the Sam's Crispy Chicken and it was juicy and savory.  Truffle everywhere as I went with the truffle Burger & the truffle fries.  The thin truffle fries were on point and tasty.  This was a fantastic truffle burger: truffled aioli + truffled cheese + truffle glaze.  As much as I want to try a new burger on the next visit, I feel like I'm going to order this again.  Severe first world foodie problems.  I have a feeling I'll be back here when the NFL season starts.  There's plenty of monitors, beers on tap and burgers I want to try.  See ya at the bar, cheers!

w8cPuNBCysiMmgbVougUHw.text: Came here for the first time to watch the women's soccer game and ended up having a burger.  They're good but not the best I've had. It satisfied my burger craving. I wanted to try to Ahi Tuna Burger but they don't serve it anymore :(  I had the Cali Burger with the Cheese Fries.

Y31zPARZfWviyig8IA-O_Q.text: I wouldn't say this place is exceptional in comparison to other Umami Burgers. Service was abysmal the first night I came. Server took a while to take my order. It's "seat yourself" however, no one was really tending to the floor.  Food was the same, about 4 stars if I were to rate it. Had my manly burger medium rare with truffle fries.  My card took about 15 min to come back after having given it to the server. The gentleman who finished at the same time at the table next to me got his check, paid, and was out quite a bit before me.   Came back a day later so I could get lunch and work out of my hotel room. They charged me for sauces this time, where as yesterday, they did not. $0.50 per sauce. Ketchup is excluded from this. Not sure if it's because of to go or not, however it seems to depend on who is helping you.  Sit at the bar if you want to be served quickly and efficiently, but it seems as though the bar's standards and requirements are much more different from that of the floor. Checked my ID twice (once to be seated, second time to pay). Charged for sauces.

JpvXelk7Bi664xPiAb3sxA.text: I've had burgers at Umami Burger before in LA, approximately 12 years ago, and remember it being really good! Surprisingly I haven't had it again until my Vegas trip this past weekend.  They are located inside SLS, so it was convenient to just eat here for lunch. We were all starving and got different burgers without planning on it. I ordered the umami burger and thin fries for the table. The others got the sunny side burger, spicy jalapeno burger, truffle burger, and the ahi poke nachos.   Service was pretty quick, so everyone was happy. Everyone enjoyed their food, except my friend who ordered the ahi poke nachos. They were okay, but since they are known for burgers, I'm not surprised. She tried a bite of my burger and liked it. The fries were thin and very tasty.   The burgers were expensive for how small it is. You can eat a whole one without being too full. I like how flavorful the meat is though. I'm glad I don't have to go to Vegas if I want to eat this again. They have many locations in LA and Anaheim as well.

8I-BT4QqVppP9GfF7kKfrQ.text: A good friend has mentioned how good this place is on a regular basis. Never got around to trying it since it isn't too close to me, but today was the day!   I was expecting a fancy sit down high end burger place. While the burgers were delicious enough to be on any high end burger spot, the atmosphere was very much like a sports bar. Plenty of large TV's with Audio. Personal TV's in the booths and a sports-book inside the place.   Two burgers, tot nachos, and fries came out to just under $50. Super filling and good portions for the price.   The burger patties were thick and meaty. The cheese on both burgers was super delicious and they didn't skimp with a thin slice of cheese. They melted it all down the burger. Super delicious. They even paid attention to the ketchup which was spruced up with what I think was truffle something.   Definitely on par or better than every high end burger spot in town. Coupled with being a great place to watch any game and I will 100% be back. Highly recommend you check it out as well!

3WxQKoPiTAf5pcwcihk-pg.text: Just blah. Went here in hopes of a damn good burger only to be served a tiny underwhelming one. $14 for what I was able to eat in no more than 6 bites. Claimed it came with roasted tomato and mushrooms....I literally got 1 slice of mushroom on my burger. Not even a whole mushroom, just one sad slice. How ridiculous. And this is apparently their "signature" burger. This place is way overpriced for what you get. People might say that's what I should expect on the strip but seeing how I live here and have ate at many places on the strip, at least other places live up to their higher prices. Never going back, that's for sure

The burger itself was very flavorful and worth the price but ok priced for vegas. The bartenders were very nice and accommodating.   Highly recommend this place at the SLS.

K2BcNFGhFoe2g-U722JVOA.text: I love a great burger! After all if you're going to eat so many calories at one sitting, it better be worth it.  But alas, Umami didn't do it for me! I don't get the hype.  The onion rings were good, but the burger was just so so. The meat was okay (nothing to write home about). After all, the burger is about the meat. The bread was okay..maybe if it were a bit toasted it would have been better.  I always get the sauces on the side, as many places have a tendency to use too much sauce, thereby overpowering the flavor of the meat.   All in all, not my favorite burger. The price was also outrageous. $25 and change for a burger, onion rings and a Pepsi? Definitely not worth it.

We got an order of their loaded fries.  Neither the fries themselves nor the toppings were to my liking, though the others in my party seemed to really enjoy them.  Atmosphere was fine.   Service was very good.  You can definitely get a solid burger here, with some good beer choices on tap, but it did not wow me.

aNXDxbdmHEOkb9xGhX90VA.text: I was so excited to eat here because the menu looks awesome. We were surprised when we arrived and there was no line for dinner but hey that's good for us right? After our meal all 5 of us thought the food was ok but not great. The best part of the meal were the fried pickles which were done in a way I had never seen. The burgers were ok but under seasoned and the condiments all had something different added to them (ketchup and bbq sauce, ranch and jalapeno) which changed the flavor of the burgers and fries. I think there is a lot of potential here with the menu but there just needs to be more flavor.
