Hq5wuok7DpVTW83bNu8-rA.text: Our dear friend is moving to Florida , and wanted to have his friends get together . He chose Umami at the SLS. He had about 30-35 people saying yes to his invitation , but as you know this can't be counted on . As people began to show up , our waitress Mandy , and the restaurant manager were more than friendly and accommodating . As time went on over 40 people showed up , and Mandy was our only waitress. I've got to give major KUDOS to this girl!!! She was awesome , and believe me she ran her ass off taking care of the party . She did get help from the manager and kitchen server . All in all we had a great time . Mandy kept a smile on her face and never showed signs of frustration, impatience , or exhaustion . She kicked ass ! Thank you Mandy , and the staff at Umami for making our farewell party fun and running smooth . The food was awesome, and it was a good time for all.

VCJ3FG6MW3uBr2Qd9Vb1zg.text: I had the truffle burger and the truffle fries. Although they tasted delicious, the prices were way too high and the portions were way too small. In fact, after we left this place my family and I went to go eat at In-and-Out Burger. We ordered 3 burgers and one shake and it was less than the price of 1 burger at Unami.  Not hating just stating.

FIf_SdmeBUo5NIlezDweuA.text: Stayed at the W hotel, which is connected to the SLS. Was hoping this would come as room service, it does not, which was fine. Did a call ahead order for burgers and was really pleased with the result.   The truffle fries and the burgers were delicious! Would return.

SPpp-2NGBEqq57HS89JVGA.text: Got the throwback burger. Coffee was really good. And side salad was relatively fresh. Portions are puny so you'll need to order a bunch of stuff if you're hungry.   Service was great and the ambience even better. Great that this is right at the lobby of the hotel. If you're staying at the SLS, then this is a great place to hang out with folks or catch the game. There are tv monitors everywhere, including the one hanging at every booth.   Plus they'll sing happy birthday too, if you happen to be here for your bday.   Will definitely be back especially when I'm at the sls again.

Qz0Hs-SrRR2ZbStjsDqt6Q.text: Not sure why this place got such low stars but I think it's pretty awesome.   Their Impossible Burger is my absolute favorite. I'm not a vegan, but I love trying new vegan and vegetarian food. This is definitely THE best non-burger burger I've ever had. It's amazing how much it tastes like a burger. I'm not sure what voodoo magic they do to it, but it's impressive. If you or a friend are a non-believer in meat substitutes, this is a burger to change your mind. If you're still unimpressed, it's safe to say veggie burgers are not for you.  Their regular burgers are really good too, although whenever I come here I always just get the Impossible Burger. I mean, you can get a regular burger anywhere else. But if you come with a friend, have one of you get the regular burger and one get the Impossible Burger. Then you get the best of both worlds, like Hannah Montana.   The service is really good too. I often like to make modifications or special requests of my orders and the staff has always been accommodating. Also any burger can also be lettuce wrapped if need be - although their bread is pretty good!   The only downside is the menu is a little on the pricier side. My recommendation is to sign up for an SLS card. Even with a little bit of a gambling, you should be able to easily get a $10 dining coupon once a month. My husband and I each have a card and that's how we fund our Impossible Burger habit. Don't forget SLS also does a $30 off $60 purchase on the month of your birthday too. And with a $60 threshold to meet you can really go to town then!

photos.caption: Photo of Umami Burger -  SLS Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Impossible Burger as a lettuce wrap
Photo of Umami Burger -  SLS Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The actual Impossible Burger
Photo of Umami Burger -  SLS Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Truffled Beet Salad

NSawjzC50SN8t65YuunnFA.text: I had high expectations for this place, but it didn't live up to the hype.   For a 35 minute wait and having to sit out in the heat (even though the were many empty seats inside) the food was not worth it.   I guess they don't realize how many great burger places we have in vegas.   Food quality I'd say was better then fast food, but just a bit better then In and Out burgers.  Compared to some place like Bachi Burger, this place seems average.  Our server was a sweet heart, but I think she was assigned to cover too many tables.  I felt bad for her because I could see her trying to give every one attention but just not being able to keep up.  She wasn't slow either. She was quick and accurate, but there were just too many tables.  I have to imagine that the LA location must be better then this.

HxQSMOUgLnMj5Ijmzj5BEQ.text: The service was great.  Mandy took good care of me.  She checked on me to make sure that I was satisfied.

photos.caption: Photo of Umami Burger -  SLS Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. This is the Throwback burger.

IgbeKwIRP9UQ3Tjua4u2Dg.text: Not my cup of tea. My turkey burger was small and puck-like- for $15 it was pretty anti climactic. Truffle fries were not what I'm used to. Maybe it's different in my region of the country, but I found the truffle, liquid, cheese mess - I found myself trying to eat fries without the truffle goo on them. Staff and service was awesome.

VRZ54YKxVYlqJj4KScR87A.text: CUBS WIN!!! I had the best time at Umami SLS last night. Yeah they are Dodger fans but I reminded the Host that Umami Chicago is  rich with CUBS fans.. He laughed. The service at this location is some of the best in Vegas ( super sincere). I relaxed after a long day of meetings. Enjoyed great cocktails and of course the Umami Burger with Truffle fries . I definitely binged on Truffle flavors by starting with the Beet salad... Killer good!( got to love arugula) . An associate met my about half way through the game and he was raving about his Umami experience to others at our meetings today.

photos.caption: Photo of Umami Burger -  SLS Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Umami Burger -  SLS Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States

eLNboPbu7yULEHghPQ-Jvg.text: Had such a great lunch here today. My boyfriend and I thoroughly enjoyed the truffle burger, truffle fries and sweet potato fries! Thank you Tashja for the wonderful service!!!

T7EIS8xL8IxKa7GfDJ7aoA.text: Went on a Saturday night and had a great time! Our group was made up of exclusively of locals, and after checking our ID's the waitress brought us free apps on the house! Not too many places give out nice little extras for locals, let alone point it out to them. Very much appreciated the quality service from hostess booth to the table.  I got the choose-for-me combo with beer. For $22.50, you get an entree, fries, and a beer. After being assured I was not going to receive a Stella or Bud Light, I went ahead and gave it a shot. Was glad I did!  I received even more sweet potato fries (one of the apps we initially got, along with truffle fries and onion rings), which were seasoned just right with brown sugar and salt. The entree was the Hatch Chili Burger, and living around Carlito's Burrito's I love them and this burger! Was well cooked, chilis were well roasted, and the bun on the burger was just firm enough to hold things together, add some texture, but not get in the way. Finally, the complimenting beer was Old Chub Scotch Ale, a pretty good micro-brew. All in all, loved the pairing, and look forward to ordering the dining world's equivalent of the "I'm feeling lucky" button again soon.

uQvelEND1PVY3PxbPmlwTg.text: I have been looking forward to this burger experience for quite awhile, and sadly I was let down.  We actually didn't even get our burgers.  Apparently they lost our ticket!?  Seemed disorganized from our arrival...  Twenty minutes waiting for a table in the restaurant, but noticed at least six tables wide open.   They will text you when your table is ready, which I think is cool.   Sat down, got the beverages in a pretty timely manner.  Fried pickles were tasty, full spears served with a garlicky jalapeno ranch sauce (too runny, but flavorful).   Then it just went downhill.    Our order of Cali Burger, Manly Burger and Manly Fries seems simple enought, right?   Well about 15 minutes after our pickle app, our fries arrived (very delish thin fries with beer cheese and bacon!).    Burgers should come out at the same time or shortly thereafter, right?   Waiting....waiting....fries gone... Have been there for an hour now....no burgers.  Got tired of waiting and just left frustrated.  Staff was apologetic, and Management offered to comp a full meal for us and our friends on the next visit, which I appreciate.   I'm not rushing to get back, maybe give it a month or more to iron out the kinks.

by_Jv24j6ZZgJWj0Tle42w.text: The food and drinks were good but the 5 stars are for Sunny, the best waiter ever! Our dining experience today was awesome, especially  because of Sunny. SLS should stand for Sunny Leads Service! We will be back as soon as we can.

photos.caption: Photo of Umami Burger -  SLS Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States

L8tIOSgow7O1ucxJBT6p-A.text: The SLS Hotel/Casino is amazing, and this a fantastic place to have beer, food, and watch NFL.    I am not much of a carnivore, so I had a caesar salad which was delightfully fresh and had delicious anchovies.  I also sampled fried pickles which were very lightly tempura fried.    They have an impressive beer list and the overall scene is very fun.  NFL football is shown in the beer garden allowing the opportunity to watch patio style.  Always appreciated.    Fun times and nicely convenient when on strip.

l7PmiwLeU7nGNQ-jNQvGDA.text: I  had the green chili "hatch" burger with the bacon sweet potato fries - and the lolita cocktail.   This place is YUMMY. Love it - my husband and I will be back - its a little loud, and in the SLS and we went during EDC, so it was a little extra crazy...   Great service, great good, good prices, just a little loud - but again, this is a casino. So, you're forewarned.

kHpvu2iqI04T1-h4qWfZzA.text: It was my first time here and it was amazing! Our server Courtney was very helpful and friendly and gave us really great recommendations. We had the truffle fries and the truffle burger. It was to die for! I definitely will come back again in the near future.

X4z-UIdiMXatTzFFQljC1Q.text: On our way to our table the hostess said they were not busy and they sent servers home.   Based on our service tonight they sent the wrong servers home.  There was only one thing on every tv, basketball. We were watching hockey, but before the third period started it was done.   I ordered a pear cider which was served luke warm with a warmer glass.   My husband got the ahi burger that he enjoyed more than my umami burger.  The garlic fries were not worth the title.   We waited 15 minutes to get the check, then twenty to process the payment.   Overall,  pretty disappointing.

lWZePN9rP5GmMeRECck1MA.text: Good atmosphere, great burger, and the single greatest waitress of her generation - Abbi. Ask for her.   I had the manly burger and a mule, but I've never been disappointed by anything on the menu.

BuZcXX9M2yCtrKzaqkXl4Q.text: Mandy is the type of waitress that you wish that every time you go to a restaurant you can  get her to be yours.  She is very engaging and knowledgeable about the menu and the options available.   My wife had the Cali burger and I quote "it melts in your mouth " I had the truffle burger and it was amazing. The flavors were perfectly balanced.  Sweet potato fries. I got mine without the sugar/cinnamon.  Mmmmm mmmmm good.   When I come back I will try Mandy's suggestion of adding an egg to my burger. Along with the Spaten Octoberfest.  Thank you Mandy for a wonderful experience.

UtMsV4CPO2ecDDL4UWS43g.text: I wanted to like this place, because it's a very nice place to watch a game, with plenty of TVs and good view lines.  But... the food!  Just not good enough.  The burgers are missing a key ingredient - taste!  Really overpriced, and the chef needs to figure out where to locate the seasoning.  Lastly, I don't think the waiter every made eye contact with the group.  Flying around, all sweaty and gnarls.  I have been rushed out of nicer burger places (read: In N Out).  Go for the game and a beer, leave before the burger arrives.

dpklo-nvIdNROaOCM0nxpQ.text: The food was good and the service was even better! Ask for Mandy, she'll give you great service and talk football with you.

mEglvO67zWONrYad0bTx6g.text: The burgers were good, but the portion was small. This would be 4 stars if it came with a side or if the service was better. One Umami burger would not fill up a hungry man or woman

photos.caption: Photo of Umami Burger -  SLS Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Hatch burger

tf2xEmb1Cu01l_oWkqF_yg.text: Terrible service, okay food, good drinks  Umami Burger is basically a poor man's Bachi Burger, or a dressed up overpriced burger where you over pay because it is on the strip.  Combine this with a total lack of competent service, and you're in for a disappointing night.  As to the service, SLS apparently stands for "Style, Luxury, Service," but Umami Burger contorts that to "Severely Lacking Service."  If you're local, eat at Bachi Burger before going to the SLS and you'll get a superior burger at better prices.    While I can appreciate that the restaurant just opened and it may be working out the kinks, the service was incredibly disappointing.  To top it off, a marketer for the restaurant went to the adjacent table to see if they were locals to give them information about local specials.  When we looked at her to catch her eye, she just looked at us, then ignored us, and walked away.  This was pretty much on par with the terrible service we also had from our server who had nothing but attitude and rarely came back to check on the table.  That said, the server was cognizant enough to smile and tell us that she hoped we had a great dining experience when she was dropping off the check.    Umami Burger, you just lost 8 customers who will never eat at  your establishment again.  From looking at the other reviews, it looks like you will be alienating your future customers.  At least you're consistent.

xlTkB1VA4nsC6suIwib-Sw.text: The food was subpar and the service was lackluster as well. French fries were served stale. Burger was nothing to rave about either.

tyIHt4nJO0MKh-yfS2oPwg.text: Food is great, though the house ketchup is a little over powering for fries. First time we went they allowed me to get Heinz, second time the woman at the bar says they don't have it.  Both times service was slow and uncaring.   Get it to go.

Gw-8cYhd1_pPB7Iyq4uNng.text: Hubby and I had a great dinner at Umami Burger.  There was a short 10 minute wait to get a table for 2 but we got it just in time, right before the 5 & 10k Rock-n-Roll run got out!  Sunny helped us out and he was the most perfect server, a F&B operations manager can ask for:  attentive but not overbearing, quick but not clumsy, made cocktail suggestions for my cold (yes, I was drinking with a sinus/respiratory infection. #yolo)and THE BEST thing ANY server can do, which Sunny did with finesse, is to fix mistakes rapidly without making into a huge deal to draw attention.  I let my hubby order food choices for the both of us because I always end up eating his dish.  He ordered the Umami & Manly burgers, a side of sweet potato fries and the Beef Barbacoa Quesadilla.  Sorry yelpers, no pictures.  The food was so damn good we inhaled it as soon as we layed eyes on it.

wF6ryaH1Hn-2JiU1OFB_3g.text: Place is awesome. Tvs everywhere. Insane beer list. Amazing food. Server was super knowledgeable over the beer list and helped me match a beer with my food. Blonde manager came up to the table to check on us and told us more about the brand and some history about sls. Really recommend this place if you're looking for a burger in the area. Staff is super friendly and very welcoming.

tYkvmC3JAKeFTmoBy96VJw.text: I always have a great time at this fancy burger joint! The last time I was there a server name Sunny took amazing care of us... I was extremely impressed by his menu knowledge and attention to detail. He made the whole experience that much better because the food is already amazing on its own.

TtEbkJwzaNAvcDa4ry-uXQ.text: Part of the Sports Book at SLS, Umami Burger has a sporty yet comfortable feel. A short menu of appetizers and burgers (duh) but much more extensive choices of beers, wines, shots and bombs. Try the Clover Bomb, subtle and easy.  The chicken fingers were sizable and fairly tasty and so were the burgers themselves.  I had the Ahi Tuna burger with a side of sweet potato fries. Other than a flavoring in the avocado,  I enjoyed it. They do offer a cookie and ice cream desert but I skipped it. For a December Friday night,  it was fairly tame in the restaurant & casino which was a plus.

_T7I6FknwgncTFQ795-42w.text: As I mentioned I would in a previous yelp review, I visited this location yet again. I ordered the nachos but prior to ordering I mentioned I hadn't eaten all day. They made sure to bring out my food promptly and continued to ask if they could serve me anything in addition! It's a must go for every time I'm there!!

KMiAfnYhBtSyq8CMRSVN3A.text: I really dig the place. Although SLS isn't doing as well as it should, Unami was a good spot with great vibe.  The burgers are top notch and the truffle fries are delicious.  Service is good but not great. I will go back. Worth as stop especially if you're Looking to watch a game.

Ff4co3IDI6qq1L4IecOHaA.text: Horrendous food. It's a burger restaurant and their burgers are disgusting. They are frozen meat patty's with no flavor. Don't sit outside. The heaters on the ceiling drop black ash on your food the whole time.

tyshjhIvME70Dr2Orir_eg.text: I know it's hard to make a bad burger but it's also hard to make a burger my wife doesn't share with me because she actually eats the whole thing!  I went with manly burger she went with the truffle burger and we shared truffle fries. Everything was amazing and the fries were unlike anything I have had and I cannot describe the truffle cheese flavor it's completely different for the better!  My wife said her burger was possibly the best she's had and considering she ate the whole thing I believe it. The restaurant itself was pretty cool too with tv's at each booth and a couple very large screens overhead. Highly recommended and the casino itself was very clean!  Good job crew!!

CWXCqThcw2MJ-kdbcc2Z6g.text: Service was fabulous! Sarah was a superb server and was prompt and attentive. I already knew the craft burgers were top notch - but Chef Mo held nothing back tonight. We had the Ahi Poke as an app, Manly burgers with truffle fries and a snicker doodle ice cream sandwich for dessert. I also enjoyed a Velvet Mule as a cocktail. Great meal!

photos.caption: Photo of Umami Burger -  SLS Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Snicker doodle ice cream sandwich is off the chain fabulous! Thx Chef Mo!
Photo of Umami Burger -  SLS Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Truffle fries...to die for! Truffle and garlic favors...

Photo of Umami Burger -  SLS Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Manly - house-beer cheddar, bacon lardons, smoked salt onion rings, ketchup &amp; mustard spread! Thx Chef Mo for suggestion!

1Z7N8qu0LMTyhDoUULau8A.text: The hatch burger was in a word "disgusting"  The Caesar salad was sub par. Total disappointment. The only thing I truly enjoyed was the bottled ginger beer by fentimams.

sNYr5AD6jsVN-lSGTORQ8g.text: Stopped by here for lunch about a month ago. Not too busy, we were seated right away. The waitress, Mandy, was very nice and efficient. She recommended the Lolita drink and I ordered two. Very yummy.   I ordered the Cali burger and my boyfriend ordered the nachos. Both very delicious!! I would definitely recommend this place to friends. A little pricey but that's what happens when you're in Vegas.

8uSnN7vrRWWU7RsuEXYqtA.text: Nom! The Umami Burger is definitely one of my favorites, the Parmesan Cheese Crisp and Umami Ketchup make the burger extra scrumptious. I also really love the jumbo size Tater Tots.

08tEtq9UBLRJOvvsql2xzg.text: Every casino has a burger restaurant and this one definitely doesnt disappoint.   Umami is a popular burger joint and they are known for their Truffled creations. To me, truffle anything is a winner for me. Anywho, let me take you my adventure at Umami Burger at the SLS hotel.  The Umami Burger is combined with the Beer Garden and Sports Book. A dream combo for any beer fan and sports fan. With wide screens all over the place, this is definitely one of the casual hang out spots at the SLS hotel. Our server arrived promptly and explained the whole menu to us. This was my first time eating here, and if any server explains the menu to me, they are off to a good start. Two burgers that caught my attention was the Truffled Burger and the Jose Andres Special Burger. For those that are unfamiliar with Jose Andres, he is the culinary superstar chef behind the world-known Bazaar. A hint to all is that if its a Jose Andres creation, it certainly worthy to try out. Along with the burgers, we also ordered fries...truffled fries of course. The neat thing about this 3 hit combo establishment are the beers. Most places will have the typical everyday beers you can find from the supermarket. This place surpasses all of those expectations. This place has craft bottle beers and even beers that Ive never even heard of.  Beers are out, fries are out, burgers are out. Everything tasted great, service was prompt, and the dining experience was great!  If your low on a budget and want to eat something casual a the SLS hotel, lets this be your number one go to spot.  UNTIL THEN!! ^-^

photos.caption: Photo of Umami Burger -  SLS Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States

6Dga__ovUr6flRpv-SvAJg.text: Great food, and service! Liz, our bartender was funny and friendly! Food came out really quick for how busy things were. Burger was tasty and unique, $2 domestic drafts were a bonus. Will be coming back any chance I get.

QFHTRIiaeE02Cb8_uNjFqg.text: This place was perfect.  Great burger, great beer, loys of tvs, and wonderful service.  My server, Lauren, was on-spot with recommendations and everything was delicious.  Recommend the 'Manly' burger, truffle fries (request the sauce!) And the cookie ice cream dessert.  Really enjoyed my meal.  The ice cream cookie was perfect, ice cold ice cream and hot, melty cookie...

photos.caption: Photo of Umami Burger -  SLS Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States

s2Gx8dKmGRa8k5RhsgBFxA.text: Stopped by for a quick bite before catching my flight. Ordered the Hatch Burger and a Brooklyn Lagger. The food was great, and Sunny, my server made sure everything came out quickly so I wouldn't miss my flight. Excellent food! Excellent service.   A+++++

4HXshjIFsYLQyPOEnv7HwQ.text: Great atmosphere for any casual occasion, service was well and fairly quick. As for the food; the truffle fries were delicious! Nachos weren't the best I've ever had but they were good. The burgers: I had the sunny side with bacon and as far as burgers with egg it was pretty good and stayed together surprisingly well without getting too soggy. My friends had the Cali and the manly burger The Cali burger was very similar to an In-N-Out burger, it was good, but can't really compare And the manly burger was very flavorful and one of the more favored of the 3. $$for the price you can find much better$$

3hnVtrjzKqZns6zA8RMTow.text: This place is always delicious. Not my first time but my first time trying the truffle burger which I would definitely recommend. Also my waitress Mandy was fantastic! She gives great recommendations and is so attentive! A great and easy choice when in Vegas.

USNmf4er35itwY3WlKC40A.text: First time at an Umami Burger and may I just say that everything about this visit was amazing. Got the Throwback burger, Hatch burger, and the truffle fries. All the food was amazing. Like AMAZING. Our server, Ben, was awesome too. Exactly what you want in a server: customer focused, down to earth, and funny. Very good first impression.

photos.caption: Photo of Umami Burger -  SLS Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Throwback burger, Bub&#39;d up.

M_8mnwwdgtHN1eqmeQm1yw.text: We were staying at SLS and chose Umami Burger for dinner.  We were seated immediately.  There are TV's everywhere, even at your booth.  It would be a great place to watch a game and grab some food.  Our server was super friendly and we got our food very quickly.    I ordered the Sloppy Mami, a vegetarian sloppy joe.  It was served open face and was piled high with lentil sloppy joe mix and topped with fresh slices of jalapeno.  It was absolutely DELICIOUS!!  The texture was great, the bread was soft and the flavor was rich and perfectly spiced.   We ordered a side of onion rings.  OMG the onion rings were scrumptious!  They were huge rings with a nice, flavorful, crispy coating.  They brought out a variety of dipping sauces which I thought was a great touch.  I would seriously go back for the Sloppy Mami again.

We-lMVCgt9UogXyUHYd0Lw.text: Good atmosphere. Been here both for lunch and dinner. Casual. Fun and great place to watch the sporting event of your choice. Oh and the food. Killer fries and a truffle burger that will cause you to screw the diet just to have more of this wonderful-ness on a bun.

photos.caption: Photo of Umami Burger -  SLS Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Truffle Burger....melt in your mouth goodness on a bun.

m-wDy7kuEq1XAa7DTmezig.text: Burger and Fries on Point, Chicken Wings Tasted Great.  But the high point of dinner was the service.  Mandy our server was a totally sweetheart !  The whole team is always great but from her greeting, suggestions and follow up, Mandy was our ROCKSTAR !  Las Vegas has lots of great burgers but the SLS has great staff.   We will be back for more !

KD6Tbtxq4KIOLAjwSEGvZg.text: Amazing place. Mandy made it more memorable. She has an amazing personality and charisma; she would be a great bartender!!!! Thank you very much for your service Mandy. It was such a delight to be waited by you. We will definitely come back just because of you. If anyone comes and tried this place, ask for Mandy!!!

EmrazDeOPEBV6KEsHqXiUg.text: Omg absolutely delicious!!!! The wings were so good and crispy and the truffle fries & burgers  hit the spot! Will be coming back!

Th-rTkqhYHlvT-_fQ6fE-w.text: Great burgers and service. Tashja did a great job with her service to us, she was awesome to work with! I can't wait to come back to this restaurant just because of her! What an experience!! Thanks Tashja!

iCglE-h1zna_hCpWkn6wNw.text: Meh Had the chicken lettuce wraps and my husband ordered the Cobb.  Yelp checkin gets you free truffle fries.  The space is nice and large and our waitress was awesome - absolutely lovely, fast, and accurate.  The menu is rather limited and healthy options do not abound. The chicken lettuce wraps were rather lackluster - pieces of chicken and mushroom slobbered in ranch dressing and covered in a mountain of fried onions.  No intrinsic flavour to speak of.  According to my husband, the Cobb was decent and the fries were good, but were served in a porcelain bowl that assured they got cold within a minute of being on the table.  We will probably not come back.

X8FyXVIBjppHq6FAelGP2w.text: When this place first opened the food was amazing. Now it's honestly nasty and a waste of money. Burgers are dry and not what they used to be. Also got rid of some of the best food items on the menu.

CY_6Ze8cNnYSnTVvguS7jg.text: Worst experience ever. I fell in love with umami when I was living in cali but the umami restaurant in sls hotel sucks. Service was bad and especially the burger was dry. So sad!!! Won't be coming back.

photos.caption: Photo of Umami Burger -  SLS Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pretty much what the plate says.

dsGKLrVHFLQGsEPbUKVVug.text: My girlfriend and I were visiting from Miami when a friend suggested the Umami Buger located at the SLS hotel. As soon as we entered we were greeted by a friendly and welcoming staff. Our waitress was very kind and attentive! The food was exceptional, I myself am a huge burger man and the Manly Burger was delicious! A manager came by our table to make sure that everything was going well and up to par which it was. I had mentioned that we were looking for a place close by to grab a couple cocktails and they referred me to the center bar also located inside the SLS which was great! Overall a great experience, definitely recommending this place to my friends and definitely will be returning here during my next visit to Las Vegas!

NNEoXaNtlSnEfqUSCVrhRg.text: Liz was really the star of the show. The beer selection is one of best on the strip. Cool vibe and a great burger menu. Check this place out. Video poker at the bar. TV's pack this place and all the games are on. SLS is one of the newest hotels on the strip check it out.

photos.caption: Photo of Umami Burger -  SLS Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Liz is the best.

VCxqDWZEYhZt29I8tpwafg.text: I love coming to SLS because of so many good choices for a boutique hotel. I have eaten at all of the restaurants and Umami is one of my faves. Every time I come I get the Manly burger. The beer garden has so many taps and bottles to choose from! Every month they have a different selection of tap beers to choose from so it's . The manager told me it's called the "tap takeover!"  Don't forget et the sweet potato fries!

PGdleNaJQHsBUtj0eRa8uQ.text: Burgers were really good. We had a truffle burger and a manly burger that were quite tasty. Our server Mandy was very attentive and friendly. Good drinks, good food, good service, definitely coming back.

ATAQVRZFOn509_JJcatRAA.text: Had the umami burger; it was average. The truffled cheese fried with the cheese sauce was pretty tasty though.  Service was good, but the burger was just average. Wouldn't come back but didn't regret it.

9X6Kwa0Crby09LYBzLHuPQ.text: Ok it has cold beer which is a plus ( and you can smoke outside... Sort of) but as far as food goes- place can steady compete with McDonalds...service... Well, what you can expect from McDonalds ? That they will get your order correct ... Well, that was not the case... Taste wise... McDonalds but nothing more

LhOwTnfSywPOb2c8QEFQSQ.text: Enjoyed the sports atmosphere while watching the NBA finals.  Food was delicious and the Cali Burger the best.  Shout out to Mandy who was very personable and provided great service along with history of the building.

zJwG6xjSldLlIu87LCeU9g.text: This is my first time eating at unami burger and I fell in love with their truffle fries!!! I highly recommend! I also got the unami burger which was very tastey. I am also very impressed with the customer service, Tashja provided us with information about the food and also gave great suggestions!

ZyNQ5QCObVIqpKSEs7RLGQ.text: Umami in Japanese means 'delish'. We were staying at the SLS hotel, so we gave Umami Burger a try. The restaurant is like any sports bar, but it's more roomy & the seating is comfortable. However the 'Umami Burger' is a little disappointing. First off, the burger comes without any fries or salad. Fries & salad are extra. The patty was not very tasty; NOT 'umami' at all. There is not much of anything on the patty...maybe a sundried tomato & a little bit of onions. It is just not very appetizing. I expect a yummy burger, but this burger is really bland. You pay this for $12.95, without any fries or salad. I had better burgers  somewhere else.

GhHJiWtsk-SAhDhde5MuWw.text: We first visited Umami few months back and loved burger, had a great time.  So when we got a deal from Travelzoo we come for a lunch right away, but we are told they are not open during lunch time !! What a bummer !! We are pretty upset but decided to try week after for the dinner instead.  When we arrived at the restaurant, the hostess told us their kitchen is closed due to slow business !!!  OMG !!!   Our Travelzoo deal expire on 11/ 30.  Why no one took effort to inform us about restaurant hour change when we told them we are there to use Travelzoo deal. We could go on Monday ( they are open FRI - MON  we are told this time,  if they told us that last time, we could come on Monday easily !! ). I liked their food but very dissatisfied about this terrible situation.  Manager, you should do better job managing your restaurant !!

oG0s1bLbsVyYQ4WBtaYVcA.text: We have been to the SLS a couple times since it first opened...we are locals and wanted to see the new property.  Umami is an interesting space.  We had the fried pickles...very fresh..very crispy...good flavor.  I had a caesars salad...it was okay...needed more dressing.  For dinner I had a turkey burger....again it was okay...tye bun was delicious the burger itself needed more flavor.  Our server was knowledgeable and very efficient. She is the reason I will give it a second chance.

photos.caption: Photo of Umami Burger -  SLS Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fried Pickles

1EQHQVAtZ9NxZR9NGFej5w.text: Being from LA, it was a pleasant surprise finding an Umami burger tucked inside the SLS during our first visit. I felt my tummy growl as I was looking for the perfect spot to catch the Warriors game so I headed into Umami's beer garden and grabbed a seat. My server Sunny was awesome. I went with his cocktail recommendation, the Burning Mandarin. Citrusy with a little kick to it. The perfect Vegas drink.  My truffle burger was the bomb as usual. May have even been better than in LA (don't tell them I said that).  Also, I'm a sucker for antler chandeliers - so 5 stars all around

gU4dACyes6cZ5O19muHRLA.text: I kept seeing advertisements for Umami around town and decided to give it a try tonight. I have to say how much I enjoyed the burgers tonight. I had the Umami and the Manly burgers and split it with my friend. I could taste the charcoal on the meat and it was juicy inside (medium). Courtney handled my food allergy perfectly and stopped by our table just enough. The truffle fries were thin and crispy and the cocktails did their job. Ask to sit outside in the evening.

cKhBiLJVnuIgvZJaJC_1aA.text: This place is the bomb!! Carlos and Joel were our servers and they gave us nothing but the best service! Super friendly, helpful, and definitely made our lunch time better. About the burgers: my boyfriend got the hatch burger and I ordered the cali burger... All I can say: Amazing! We are definitely coming back on our next visit to Vegas!

N0-KCJ_XGUOLsPXZ_w5ptw.text: Best burgers in Las Vegas. The food never disappoints and a fun place to watch games.

nSI_1Gxm79sxHN0WKBmD7w.text: OK, so the burger is a little small and the price tag is kind of big.  It's one of the best burgers I've ever eaten though!  Love the umami burger-- its bursting with flavor and so craveable.  The beverage list is a big disappointment...  The beer selection is a joke for a place that's supposed to be a beer garden.  Too many mass market beers here, the few interesting geeky ones are marked up obscenely.  My usual go to is wine...  They have edmeades zin by the glass.  Service is usually friendly.  Comfortable environment.  Definitely worth a trip here when craving a burger.

pqp0pW8f1Xcu8g0v8rPHwA.text: My server yesterday was a sweet girl!  Food was good! Tuna burger and Green veggie one supper yummy!

AQ3vdqFwFJOwdxH5FUuzMA.text: Decided to try this place for a quick lunch. Wasn't very impressed, I'd say sub-par at best. If it weren't for our server, Casey, I would give it 2 stars. The atmosphere is more of a sports bar with couches, very laid back. Perfect for MNF!  I was really shocked to see that the menu was so tiny. What threw me off guard was the fact that it's a beer garden and they had Bud Light and Stella on tap...it needs a much wider selection! We had the Pulled Pork nachos: the flavor of the meat was great, the presentation wasn't there and besides the massive layer of meat on top it was just cheese sauce and cold chips. Turkey Burger: I ate half and pushed it to the side. The green sauce they put on the burger wasn't good at all. Burger itself was flavorless and the bun was so soggy that I had to eat the bits I did have with a fork and knife. Manly Burger: this was probably the best thing at our table. Full flavor and was gone in under 5 minutes haha Truffle Fries: the cheese sauce had alittle hardening look to it. It was definitely sitting in the window waiting on the rest of the ticket. It had the consistency of almost hard wax. The sauce was only on the top part and they sprinkled some green onions on top and called it a dish. The truffle salt was good but besides that we couldn't eat them.  This place has a lot of potential but it just seems to be executed in a lazy way

photos.caption: Photo of Umami Burger -  SLS Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Manly Burger

PGWFJxQ1J00wqLzcjpKSfg.text: Great meal! I got the truffled beet salad with chicken- very fresh ingredients! My friends both got the manly burger and said it was their favorite burger in Vegas! Our server Carlos was great, very knowledgable! Would recommend. Tip: ask your server about the $5 kamikaze shot!

P3BtMD293_IHrGuPSR8seg.text: Overhyped and under delivered. They will take forever to seat you even if it seems like there are open tables all throughout the restaurant. Ok, they are probably short staffed but still.  I ordered the truffle burger. Meh, I've had better. It tasted plain, not a lot of flavors going on, maybe because I like my burgers with lettuce, tomatoes, and onions. The truffle burger consisted of meat, cheese, sauce, and bun. The only item that I really liked was their ketchup, that ketchup was souped up with something. All I'm saying is for the price, I could go somewhere else and have a way better experience food and service wise. (_- )

4Pe_meEzehhoNwXFB0R4hQ.text: Concept restaurants are great and all, but you need to be able to execute without flaw to justify your ego.   FOOD: I get that at the flagship location that you don't allow any substitutions on your menu. Good for them. When i ask for something different on my burger, I don't want to argue or have to debate Stanford's Debate Team. I want a, "Sure thing!" and I understand I might get "That's gonna cost you a couple bucks extra" at which point I'd say "I'm worth it." OR if you don't want people to make changes, then tell them and own it.   Avoid the nachos and the pickle plate. The nachos were put on the menu because people were asking for it and even the manager understood why we were disappointed. Question: If the manager knows its bad why are you serving it. Issues: only a tablespoon of the braised beef accompanied a slave labor camp's output of chips with "beer cheddar" "fondue" drizzled on about 7 of the chips.   The pickle plate was also a let down. They obviously use a boiling method for the pickling and they over boiled the canned veggies. Carrots, mushrooms, beet, red pepper, an actual pickle and green beans. Pickling is an easy process, it just takes time. Why not just use better ingredients and something a little more exotic for your vegetable selection. Tried everything and pushed it away. Bachi Burger has a much richer pickle plate if you ever want one in Vegas.  SERVICE: Kinda touched on this already, pushy about their concept, but this location really doesn't have one so it comes off as misguided. Our server was nice, but I was noticeably unimpressed with her attempts to stick to her script of no substitutions even though this location allows them... and I think she was just not in the mood to have to put out energy to make the experience good for us so she gave us a lot of space... for a while.   The busser cleared our plates and even asked us how things were for the first time since we got our food and we were honest about how less than spectacular we thought it was. That guy winked at both of us about 22 times in the span of 30 seconds. It was magical, but not enough for us to change our minds.  The lead/manager/assistant manager/some guy with bill control powers came up and asked how our meal was, we were honest and he agreed that the nachos and pickle plate and the wings (he mentioned them, not us) should not be eaten here. He took those items off of our bill as we barely ate any of them.  OVERALL: There's nothing here that you can't find somewhere else, better and nicer. And if a place is gonna stick to its guns about no substitutions, then it better make sure EVERYTHING on its menu rocks hard the way it is.   And one more thing: you need to be a litte more Johnny-on-the-spot with the channels on saturday afternoon during football. I don't watch football, but i sure as hell don't watch Judge Judy for 20 minutes or need it broadcast over every speaker in the joint while i'm searching for some nacho meat.

liM0ojXEg-wDmbaM96m69A.text: So when I saw the prices on the menu I said what the heck $15.00 for a burger but we ordered anyway and let me say it's worth the $15.00 it was the best burger I've ever had too bad we didn't have time to visit again. My hubby says next time he'll order two just for himself

7wsHp-8LgAaxSLa8oYhJCg.text: Came to have a burger and it was great. The meat tasted very fresh which is what I like in a burger and none of that frozen for days stuff. The man who had the Mohawk  was very helpful and friendly I wish I knew his name.  I will definitely come back for that fresh burger.

b_hzOKUIhCc1YV4Yj9fNpw.text: We were looking for a quick, delicious dinner before heading out to a club.  Umami Burger was a place we had heard good things about, so we gave it a shot.  The service was above average, and the burgers was delicious!  We had the sunny side burger and umami burger with truffle fries.  Also loved the dipping sauces that came with the meal; can't go wrong with that jalapeno ranch on anything!

o8Je4qp_FNXVQqZv97zkdA.text: Carlos was the da bomb! Super friendly and attentive server.  The food was amazing! Truffle and umami burger was delicious, cooked to perfection, along with the truffle fries.  Come here and your belly will thank you.

h01S6mozcOSIBgd7fFoVeA.text: Horrible. Horrible service.  We're staying at SLS and decided to come here for lunch.. Wish we hadn't wasted our time. We come in, and it's not busy at all. We ask for a booth for 4 people, they seat us in a booth made for probably about 10. Huge table. Really? We asked for a smaller one but the hostess or whoever told us, "Well they're all dirty so.." there were at least 5 dirty empty booths at the time so I asked if they could clean one maybe? Hostess seemed irritated that I god forbid even asked of such a thing.. and told us that if we wanted to wait that we could. .. ok..   So we waited for them to clean the table. And waited. And waited. They finally do and we go to sit at the smaller booth, and one of the servers tell us "uh, somebody is going to be sitting here..." we replied "yeah, us." Totally rude. Eh, whatever.   We get our drinks after waiting for at least 7 minutes for anybody to even realize we exist. From the busser. The server comes later to finally ask what we want. We order, and I'm watching the tables around us being sat.. at least 3 tables we all watched being ignored. Waiting at least 10 minutes to even get acknowledged. Are you kidding me?  One table ordered champagne, and the server didn't even know how to open the bottle. Had to take it into the back. The customers seemed confused. The people at those tables were still waiting to order food, looking around for anybody to help.. seriously there's so much to type but I can't even deal with writing the rest right now. Just irritating that customer service has gone down the CRAPPER.

OFPP2h5QA2Gwus5uySqvrw.text: Great ahi burger !  A Must is to sit in Tashja's section I'd never met her before don't know her ,but she was awesome ! Great personality very nice and attentive. Which is Unusual lately  Thanks Tashja

mhzTwiR9XweMeFnsfSZskw.text: This is really all you want in a sports bar.  Awesome beer selection, delicious burgers, and giant TVs everywhere!  And you can bet on games in the restaurant... Whaaaaaat?  The manly, hatch, umami, and Cali burgers are all fantastic (actually all of their burgers are amazing).  Service was impeccable as well - get Charlie! He has a cool Mohawk.

spouzOgdRt0MF9LfVyUUUg.text: I'm sad to say that I am so disappointed in Umami. I was looking forward to eating here ever since I booked my stat at the SLS. I LOVE a good gourmet burger, but sadly this place did not live up to my expectations. I ordered the truffle burger and truffle fries. When I got my meal to my room, I tried the fries first, but they were...mehh. I've had excellent truffle fries at other burger joints (they're kinda hard to not do right), but these were just not great. On to the burger... it was simply ok at best. The flavor was just not what I was expecting, and I know a good truffle burger :/ I cant quiet put into words what exactly it was missing, but it just did not do it for me. Oh well, at least I gave it a shot.

photos.caption: Photo of Umami Burger -  SLS Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Truffle burger and truffle fries

UdKA7yjze4wQOHWFYA6O7w.text: I'm walking distance to Umami and I've really wanted to make it my go-to sports bar. Unfortunately, I've completely struck out here on three attempts.   The first was a week night at the indoor bar where my order was taken but never came. I left hungry and chalked it up to the busy crowd.  Grounder to shortstop, out on first.  On the second time around, I witnessed a lone waiter in the main dining area performing customer service heroics by juggling a dozen tables and very nearly saving everyone's Saturday night.    Rare triple to left field, but it's caught anyway.  And this last time and surely my last trip here, my order was completely botched during an off-peak Tuesday afternoon.   Pop fly to center field and that's the ball game!  1.5 Stars

XXgQ6E2DSvHknw8iemKMiQ.text: SERVICE: Something is clearly amiss here. After ordering our drinks and food at the same time, we waited for 15 minutes as we wondered which would arrive first. After deciding that we would give them two more minutes for SOMETHING to arrive before walking out, our drinks arrived. Our server seemed frazzled but was very apologetic. The manager caught wind of our situation (or maybe he just saw the stopwatch running on my phone) because he came over to apologize as well. He offered us some "complimentary sauces" to go along with our fries, but, not surprisingly, those never arrived. (And I was looking forward to those "apology sauces.") Oh, and our check showed up before being asked if we were interested in dessert (which we were)! I guess they weren't offering any that night. Oh well.  ATMOSPHERE: It's difficult to tell where the sports book ends and the Umami Burger begins, but maybe that's the point. Either way, I can't say I enjoy eating while ESPN commentators scream in my ear about college football, but that's just me.  FOOD: Not much to say here. The fries were okay and there wasn't anything all that offensive about the burgers, but nothing stood out. So, as Las Vegas locals with lots of other restaurants to try, we won't be visiting Umami Burger again.

ixZh5Y89KxbDd3nSPN-5eQ.text: Great food. Manly burger is on point. Watch out for coming around dinner time on a week day, under staffed, and those on staff are stretched too thin to take care of table effectively, constantly had to ask for a refills, ketchup, salt, ect. I went to dinner with 3 guys, our checks were separate. Upon checking in on Yelp, I was offered a Free Truffle fry with the only stipulation of 1 per guest. One of my friends notified the waiter upon ordering his fries, I presented mine after, when the check arrived. Because they are stretched so thin when I presented my coupon, the waiter said it was one per table and he didn't have time to re-do the check.

VAtsX_tduvi8LKD0BCMAOA.text: We had tickets for a concert at the SLS and wanted to grab a bite before the show. Three of the four of us in the party wanted to try you Umami Burger ( I really don't like eating hamburgers but I was outvoted). I substituted a portobello mushroom for my hamburger patty and went with the Manly Burger. Wow was that good. Bacon cheese and shiitake mushrooms on a delicious bun. Fabulous!! We shared a side of sweet potato fries. They put some sort of topping on it that made it incredibly sweet and Incredibly delicious. My buddy got just a plain hamburger ( bun burger bun with nothing on it). He also said his Burger was delicious. Our wives also raved about the Umami burgerrs that they ordered. The setting is like a sports bar with the Sportsbook at the far end of the restaurant. Tons of TV so you can catch any game that you're interested in watching. I will definitely come back when I am in the area.

photos.caption: Photo of Umami Burger -  SLS Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Manly Burger with portobello mushroom instead of chop meat. Delicious

3wN964BTM73Fa7kLduUZgA.text: I came here for the Impossible Burger....AND IT WAS AWESOME!!!! This was THE FIRST plant based hamburger that tasted JUST LIKE BEEF!!! I've had other plant based burgers, but, the Impossible Burger tops them all!!! And our server,  Casey, was excellent....service with a smile, attentive, and took care of all or needs be moment i walked in!!! I'm def coming back here to eat this burger again!!!

56whKv_lmi_2K2NCf2R_4g.text: Yesterday was Social Sunday at the SLS and Umami Burger was the place where locals got 50% discount on their orders.  This was one place I had yet to try at the SLS so off I went to have a burger and fries before going to a play.  I had looked at the menu online and I knew what I'd order before I got there.  It sounds like I had truffle mania but actually there was little truffle taste in anything that had the name truffle attached to it.  I ordered the Sunny Side burger which is also known as the truffle especiale.  The menu describes it having parmesan frico, fried egg, truffle butter,and truffled arugula.  Along with this, I ordered the truffle fries described as thin cut fries with truffle cheese.  I ordered my burger rare and that's just the way it was served.  That was great!  The burger was large.  I didn't eat the top bun with its U brand for the company.  The burger was good.  I ate it with knife and fork rather than the pick up and slop over myself.  The fries were OK.  They were limp which I gather is the way Umami always serves them.  They were like an 80 year old who hadn't taken his Viagra.  I also had a black iced tea--known as gun powder tea--that was refilled without needing to ask.  My server was Courtney and she was TERRIFIC!  She was pleasant, knowledgable, and good at her job!  I'm glad this place was the Social Sunday place.  It was not a $25 meal but for the $12.70 price, it was OK.

photos.caption: Photo of Umami Burger -  SLS Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Area to chill out, have a drink, and watch sports.
Photo of Umami Burger -  SLS Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The west wall and eating area.
Photo of Umami Burger -  SLS Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sunny Side (a.k.a. Truffle Especial burger).

JFEKTp-oHTqgzVtfpTDAaA.text: Great food, service. Go see Ritzy. She is the bomb.com! Fun atmosphere! I'll be back!

eYfAz0L7sBpqaKMoCGJYkw.text: $11.50 for 5 wings. Hmmm I've never paid over $2 per chicken wing in my life unless it was for room service. The wings were cold by the time they got to me which is lame considering I asked for them to be well done. The bar was nearly empty when I placed the order.  Burgers are small comparably here I saw. I also don't like the signs at the bar that say basically- "don't sit here and expect to get a complementary drink unless you are entering $20 per drink into the machine & betting max bet"  It's lame. If you sit and legit-ably gamble, your drink should be comped. Very stingey SLS.  That is the problem that I believe is that  Umami burger and SLS are separate entities and can't agree on a policy that suits guests of the hotel vs. walk ins?

Ub7hJXlOordPdJvP71a54A.text: One of the most important parts of a dining experience is SERVICE SERVICE SERVICE!  I cannot speak for the other days, but I went here with a group of 4 girls on Sunday night to take advantage of the 50% off the bill for locals. The restaurant is HUGE, and it wasn't packed. I believe they are understaffed, because the waiter took about 20 minutes to come to our table to ask for our drinks. That is by far the longest I've waited for water. AND, it was ONLY 20 minutes because I had flagged the waiter down while he was serving customers two tables away.   During those 20 minutes, my friend had even left her order with us to go use the restroom, maybe took a number 2 or the bathroom was far away, returned, and was shocked that we hadn't gotten our waters yet. Actually, we hadn't spoken to a waiter yet when she had sat back down.   Despite the slow start, the food came out within 15 minutes of ordering. I'm not sure if it had anything to do with us letting the waiter know that we were in a rush to catch a show.   I don't blame the waiter, as he was trying his best to serve the customers. Perhaps they were understaffed or didn't have the system figured out completely yet.   As for the burger--I"ve had Umami in L.A., and this was similar. The burger was good, but not out of this world.   Truffle fries- I don't like it when my fries get soggy. I did not like the gravy looking sauce that was all over my fries, and the flavor of the sauce was meh.   Onion rings-  VERY GOOD. I'll come back on another day for that, and try out a few other items. When I'm not in a rush, and have a good 2 hours to kill.

cq9fq0C6-ySH3zOHLir3IQ.text: It's pretty crazy how an experience can vary from one day to another.  We came in to just grab some dessert. We got a couple of ice cream cookies and shared it among friends. Amazing! The salted caramel is probably my favorite. More importantly the gentleman that served us was AWESOME. Even though we were JUST getting dessert, he treated us super nice, was super personable and even checked in on us to see how the desserts were.  So, we came back the next night. This time to eat....sure cookies were the plan, but also to grab a late meal. This time, shiz went south. Real fast.  Placed our orders...and even though it was pricey I ordered a frozen beer. I think they are only available in a few places so I said what the heck. Got SUPER excited...then....our waitress forgot my beer. Like never wrote it down, never came with it. Burgers came out. They were good....  I mentioned to the waitress my beer (after flagging her down ... since she disappeared for a while). And told her we'd like to take a look at the dessert menu.  5 minutes pass. 10 minutes pass.  She finally comes back! Alright, so do you guys want dessert? UMMMM...you forgot to bring dessert menu??? Oh, yea...here let me get you one. No, that's fine. We will skip dessert. At this point I was frustrated. She didn't bring my beer. She wasn't around the entire time. She forgot the dessert menu.   I asked for the manager and she came over. She gave me what I considered to be a pre-rehearsed speech. "We are going to take care of your meal." No, thank you...I'd like to pay. I just wanted you to know that your waitress really ruined the experience...and the guy the night before is AWESOME. "I understand sir, that you didn't ask to speak to me to get a comped meal, but we will be taking care of it since you were not 100% satisfied." It was robotic they way she said it. I reduced again. We went back and fourth a few times...then she finally brought my bill.  Listen, I'm sure they deal with drunk, angry customers all the time. But I was obviously sober (she forgot my beer, remember?). I genuinely wanted the manager to know, hey...this person is f'n up while also give props to the other dude. She seemed uninterested, and just offered a comp meal as a solution. I didn't want a comp meal.  So while the food is good - the service can really ruin the experience.

photos.caption: Photo of Umami Burger -  SLS Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Salted caramel ice cream sandwiches. Amazing!!
Photo of Umami Burger -  SLS Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Ice cream sandwiches! So good.

z0-sxJofrpzYOt5BaFzmVA.text: I give this 2 star. Here's why: the Brussel sprouts (according to server) are "hit or miss" well it was a huge miss. Then the Diet Pepsi was flat. The chicken nachos are just like the movie theaters, processed cheese and overpriced......and canned processed chicken. When your done eating the nachos on top the bottom of the plate is "watery cheese" due to the chicken juice and cheese. It was a miss and wouldn't recommend unless your here for the umami burger and the fabulous server and that's why I gave 2 stars.

jWSJ2XX-qFlT0gYBUQG4gA.text: January 30, 2015 Friday - 6:00 PM dinner 2 adults   Atmosphere - 5 stars Food - 5 stars Service - 4 stars  Background - Wanted an easy meal and in our hotel.  So I used my open table app to get a table.  After getting their clearly we did not need to.  But I got my points.  I could have made my reservation through my television in my room.  Atmosphere - Huge sports bar.  ESPN radio was taking their stuff out and CBS Sport radio was setting up.  I expected a bigger crowd for 6 PM on a Friday night.  But it made it easier for me.    Food   Drinks - Ballast Point Calico in a bottle.    My Meal     Main Course - The Hatch, a burger you would expect to have an egg with that name, but it did not.  I think it was the type of green peppers used, but the menu did not call that out.  The meat was cooked to order, and the peppers gave a nice amount of heat.  The bun was soft and held up to burger and toppings.      Side - Ordered a side of onion rings as everything is a la carte.  Our waitress told us the sides are large and one order would take care of us, and it did.  The onion rings were thick cuts and season well.  They came with three dipping sauces and all were excellent with the onions.  Sorry I do not remember their names, but the middle one had some serious heat behind it, the other was a garlic aioli.   Service - Out waitress cover a huge portion of the restaurant which made it difficult to flag her down.  But other team members were always helping out.   The only problem was when we wanted to wrap up the bill our waitress was difficult to find, and the manager actually delivered us the bill.  Future - sure.

XldsHqyl6oTJPlYaZXU_dQ.text: Not a great experience, waitress was in a rush and super rude. I don't suggest this place if your not ready to order as soon as you sit down, also she wouldn't give me a drink until a food order was placed! Just wanted a water

ADTo9cxaXo-X_p7mq54a2Q.text: What the hell?! They changed and shortened their menu and not for the better either.   My Royale (braised short ribs burger) and the Jose Andres burger are no longer on the menu.   They have a bigger alcoholic menu than their food menu!!! Argh..not pleased about that. There's seriously way better burger joints to go to than THIS place. Move on. Nothing to see here.

maejCSGth2dHvo6QbEQQBA.text: I'm a local and I wanted to watch the Yankee game so I went to sls sports book beer hall at umami burger in the Casino, I was drinking cold drafts watching the Yankees lose to Houston, I ordered their signature umami burger that was topped with a parmigiana frico  chip and their special umami ketchup, the beef was juicy and  delicious, a fresh bun great toppings at a fair price. The menu had about 6 or seven type burgers for everyone's taste, truffle fries and a few other sides available all great choices. The staff were friendly and all kept busy and just made sure the room was happy so when I'm looking for a special burger with  flavor building umami toppings on it and some cold drafts. I'll be back especially since I live a mile away from the place.

photos.caption: Photo of Umami Burger -  SLS Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States

F0-eYcLHYo_BVw5AzVON5g.text: Great place to hang inside the SLS.  They offer a great selection on the menu and they have plenty of good gaming along with the great food.  The service is good too. We came here and had a few burgers along with the cold beers.  Had a great time. Highly recommend sitting at the bar and playing the video poker.  The machine were on fire.  Everyone around us was winning and having fun while enjoying the food and drinks.

Rmz8JFIJsoX-xrspc101Ag.text: Staying at the SLS and stopped in to Umami for a burger and to watch a football game. Sat at the bar and the ladies working behind the counter were great. I ordered the truffle burger and sweet potato fries. Burger came out in a reasonable time and was fresh and hot. Sweet potato fires were delicious and seasoned just right. Overall I thought the price for the food was a little high. Not surprised, being at a casino. For the price, fries should have been complimentary. I'll go back again for the service and atmosphere. But I'll consider other selections for food.

YNQlrrjMafibAZ7xw2nrkA.text: First I have to tell you I am not a burger person.. I would NEVER choose a burger place if there is another option.. ANY other option. Just not my thing. But my man wanted to try so alright.. Let's do it! We got the onion rings and nachos to start.. He said the onion rings were the best he's ever had and I'd probably agree! Nachos weren't piled w/a ton of topping but it worked! I got to taste each ingredient including the super fresh chips! Then came our burgers.. A manly and sunny side.. We couldn't decide so we split both. Sunny side was good.. Manly was AMAZING! Best burger I've ever had! Going back for lunch!  Lauren was our server.. Great service!

photos.caption: Photo of Umami Burger -  SLS Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Nachos while gambling!!

EHm6ltaKLsGJLvOdDZkF2Q.text: This was my visit to SLS after much reluctance and disinterest on my part and it was even more lackluster than I expected.   We came to Umami Burger on a Monday night during Monday Night Football. The place was packed and loud, but we were seated quickly. The table was a little dirty and the sad little paper menus were stained, too.   I ordered the Jose Andres burger and a side of fries to share with my mom. The burger was a good size, but I didn't like anything about it. The meat was only good around the edges and the texture was a stringy, fatty and greasy. The flavors were just not what I was hoping for and was incredibly bland. The fries were even worse. They were dry, overcooked and flavorless.   I didn't enjoy a thing about anything I ate at Umami Burger. Even worse than the food was the service. Our waiter practically whispered every word to us and made no effort to speak up when it was clearly noisy from the football shenanigans happening around the restaurant. Refills were slow, condiments were in tiny portions and offered nothing to enhance the flavors of anything.   I don't have any interest in trying this place again.

J6xgj1NtTYESvmJXE54xew.text: With a large group tonight. Staff was friendly, but service was slow. Decided to get my beer at the bar since I did not want to wait long. We had the pre-fix menu. The salad was fine, decided on the truffle burger. There was flavor but the burger was dry. The sweet potato fries and truffle fries were good. Half our group left by the time dessert arrived. Overall, it's okay but way overpriced.

pqACR2v_jprMovbYZxB7JA.text: We went late about 9 pm. We probably shouldn't have ordered medium well with the umami burger and manly burger. They were little dry! The food wasn't very hot and the buns were so-so! I do like the truffle fries, very tasty. Also the fries seem to cool a little in the kitchen before they bought to us.

giW06OSDGlSuHr0o-smkeA.text: Really bad. The Unami burger had some cheese that has been solidified and tasted bland. The mushroom was the size of a dime and the burger was dry.  2 stars for the good fries tho.

dip60x4bGyhVb1Ayy2_L_A.text: We came here for post-race grub. I had just finished the LV RnR 5k which went around the SLS hotel and we decided to eat at SLS since we wanted to explore the hotel/casino.  Because we weren't dressed to impress and I was in my race gear, the quickest place we found with no wait was Umami. Good choice since they served beer and had the college football games on. TONS of TVs! YESSSSS  We were led to a nice table in the restaurant. The tables are kinda close together and you can literally talk to your neighbors. We were serviced by a really nice lady who was friendly and accommodating to our needs.   Because of our race, we had 2 for 1 draft beers. NICE! We started off with a couple of drafts and then ordered truffle fries ($6.5) to share. I ordered the Truffle Especiale protein burger (parmesan cheese, fried egg, truffle butter and truffled arugula ($14). The fiancee order the Cali Burger (butter lettuce, roasted tomato, house spread and house American cheese ($12).  Damn these burgers were pretty expensive and lacked flavor. IMO, needed salt (which are not available on the tables). Without the buns, the portion is small. I did enjoy the fries however. Thin and crispy.  We ordered the Mintimalism Coolhaus dessert ($7). Basically it's an ice cream sandwich. It was a nice treat to have minty ice cream with chocolate chip cookies. MMM  Great place for beer and fries and to watch sporting events in a kick back atmosphere.

photos.caption: Photo of Umami Burger -  SLS Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Ice cream sandwich!
Photo of Umami Burger -  SLS Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States

XjZafGbntkK-6ho1n8hlPg.text: Great vibe at umami burger. Service was very personable and quick. Ask for Tashja, she was very sweet and hospitable. We came in for a quick bite and sat on the couches to watch some basketball while we munched. Tashja got us everything we needed and made sure we enjoyed our lunch. Truffle burger and fries are delicious. My husband also raved about the ice cold Union Jack IPA. It's a must try!

poRRt6vN5VqQTIhPEIdxTg.text: Funny enough this is actually the best place to eat in the SLS and it has totally delicious burgers I would recommend the main umami burger for anyone that comes by and don't forget to try some of their fries as well

cuTF6zdK55sMYM3h_R7XBQ.text: Amanda is an awesome bartender so accompanying and great beer very knowledgeable she is also changing games so u can keep and eye on all the scores!

photos.caption: Photo of Umami Burger -  SLS Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States

ld8QCcaNx2zLZ8zC1dsjrw.text: I must say they have pretty tasty burgers. Service was ok could've been better but other than that I would recommend this place to others.

4nbnT_Is13BwiwlItlwHug.text: Nothing Special , actually kinda dissapointed because i was expecting more decent food. Burger is so small and patties are cooked dry. I wouldnt pay $12 or more for a burger  just go to Gordon Ramsay Burger

uS8hdD6qZXvSEeFqDrQsFQ.text: I don't know why everyone is giving such bad reviews...I went earlier today with my friend and all I can say is...THE BURGER WAS BOMB! Until now I'm looking at pictures of it..lol It was simple but the patty was juicy and perfect. My friends from Cali always talked about it so I was happy when we finally got one here. We made reservations a few days before so I recommend doing that especially if there's a game. Service was also good. She was very attentive and explained to us the menu and sauces. Overall had an awesome experience and will definitely go back..maybe next week..haha!

agwFZGyidEyUcN0Z-0_zjQ.text: Lunch with my coworker on our laptops was so easy here! Loved being able to sit outside and our waitress Mandy recommended a really delicious drink (Lolita) - we ordered it with vodka instead of tequila and it was so gooooood. Muddled cucumber and watermelon - the perfect combo! Of course the truffle burger was amazing as well!

TNB0a1STwqnC8IAQvLulFA.text: Told a friend about the great tasty burgers at Umami and he said he wanted to try it out. I had the Cali and he had the Umami, both were outstanding. Our server, Tashja, was very good. She was attentive and made a nice beer recommendation. Only minor negative was the sweet potato fries. They were limp and meh. Overall, I still give Umami a positive review. Best Burger in a long time.

1BD3Cl1rvmjUIAuZbEYNig.text: The sporting environment and TVs are nice and the outside seating area. That is all! Drinks are overpriced unless you like beer. I came to watch a football game and they don't have happy hour for the games. Beer only. Burgers are overpriced and average.

L3YP5uYGbxH-pAsNq90kCg.text: Mandy is the atomic bomb of all bomb diggities. Great service, great atmosphere and she never spits in your food. All you could ask for at a restaurant.

zOrde8s5jqz3WEwZMoSB-w.text: I highly recommend the seared tuna burger.  It was sushi-grade tuna and it was amazing!  So tender, so good!  We also ordered the "pickles" plate, which was a selection of different vegetables (mushrooms, carrots, beets, peppers, pickles, etc.) with different pickled flavors--different but good.  We got in late after all the buffets were closed, so we went here.  We were impressed.

KFnB3T19em7TbtoKxf4yXg.text: First time here and it's so loud you have to yell across the table if you want to talk also you can't hear the waitress and they can't hear you very poor atmosphere, probably will not come back I don't like that I have to yell just to talk at dinner. Very disappointed for my first time here.

gZoYEPPgORHpJtN7fPWQqg.text: This was the worst dining experience I've ever had in Vegas. The food was so-so.  The food is overpriced.  The service was just OK.   I do not recommend going here. However, I do recommend The restaurant bring in Robert Irvine to help them turn things around.

shKUhF3h3DZdYE3CrPsHdQ.text: The food was pretty good, but the service was mediocre. The truffle burger I had was good, and my father enjoyed the Umami burgdr. The fries came out cold, but the food runner replaces them with fresh ones. The pickle platter was a nice addition to the meanl as well. Cozy little spot with lounge areas to watch sports and a great selection of beers.

1coglCqmohnAsdx29cNFYg.text: Juiciest burgers I've ever had. I highly recommend this place. Went twice while staying at the hotel. 5 stars all the way!

WVwCP6DMBWaS5WYZkSMjMQ.text: Great place for locals, the beer selection is great, you can create your own vegetarian burger with a portabello mushrooms, their cider apricot is my favorite- highly recommended

PWGlkd44bzCpU9gozEXneQ.text: Everything was excellent ! My server, Carlos, was so nice he recommended the manly burger with truffle fries they were super good. Also from the secret menu the cheesy tots were delicious. I enjoyed the whole experience from service to food and drinks ! Definitely recommending and going back !

2vGUFTrq__Kxuxu2Yt2TyA.text: Came here for dinner for the first time.  They offer a 50% off special for locals so I thought I would give it a try. When I checked in,  the hostess said they were busy and it would be a 15 minute wait,  even though there were plenty of empty tables .... hmmmm. After we got our table,  I was relieved to find a cool atmosphere and a friendly waitress.  I ordered the Cali burger with a Portobello mushroom for the meat.  I wish they had a veggie patty - they only have a veggie sloppy joe. My burger was great despite that.  It was cheesy and the roasted tomato is awesome! They also have a house ketchup that was delicious.  My bf ordered the umami burger and said it was good.  Similar to the Cali.  So, overall great experience except for the suspicious wait and lack of vegetarian options.

AvcKY1YvTBxISnmo9RKshA.text: We were so excited to try a restaurant at SLS. What a letdown. Terrible service. The waitress never came by the table after the food was brought out so we couldn't inform her that our burgers were cold and our orders were wrong. Our drinks hadn't been refilled at all. You'd think at $8 a beer they'd at least offer to get you another one. I know they're new, but at $15 a burger, they should have great service to compensate.

CsFjXsILFxqyPZO6qML0Rg.text: I'd give it a solid 4 stars. I had the Hatch Burger and sweet potato fries and wasn't disappointed. I recommend asking for the Diablo dipping sauce if you like spicy.  I will definitely come back.

8n5R_Zyso56m_t9qOj6xHA.text: I've heard about Umami Burger in LA but since I was hungover in Vegas, it was an opportune time to try this hyped up burger joint at the gorgeous SLS Hotel. I'll keep this short: 1) awesome and knowledgeable service by our sweetheart server Mandy 2) my friend had the Manly Burger & I had the truffle burger w/egg and both were delicious. At first glance, they looked small but the flavors were rich enough that it filled us up (coupled w/3) 3) SWEET POTATO FRIES. ORDER THEM. I will come back to try a different burger & save room for a Kool Haus ice cream next time

j6zMjzH9HpC4jrd5iGnPfQ.text: Great food and great service. Good place to watch sports. Tater tots are good Napoleon dynamite would love these taters.

n2LeoPFQj_Bh5Y5hyr96lg.text: Worst burger I have ever had. Bread was stale and no condiments given on a to go order

5HNu043JgcaRw-RYUyftjg.text: Best burger joint hands down! Great service, great food, and a  great sports bar! Server Mandy was excellent!  Will definitely have to come back!

UyK4Y2rpohkORLEeE2s_fw.text: Underwhelming selection of draft beers for a Beer Garden.  Decent burger.  Tablemate ordered a can of beer.  It arrived after his food.    Had this been March madness and the place jam packed, this would be understandable.  This was a slow late Saturday afternoon.    Disappointing.

yQFij8n0Nzsw9d6hAzTBLg.text: The hatch burger was great. The chiles were perfect and the burger was cooked just right. My server AJ was very pleasant and nice. The place is great for a sports game.

D4u2kTh6gjPfbDfmT0g73w.text: This place was fantastic! We stopped in by chance, and were blown away. My sister and I both ordered the Green Bird veggie burger they had. After a long night of drinking the night before, we wanted something light, that wouldn't upset our hangover. It was incredible, surpassed any expectations! The burger was a bit messy but that's not something I'm willing to call a complaint. Perfect texture, the portions were just what we needed, and friendly service! Very attentive. We are at the bar, so we could play while we ate, and even with drink orders coming in almost non stop, we were still very well taken care of. I never felt forgotten. Defiantly put this on your lists of stops! Just outstanding.

unZZAUseBJA44n2eAk-QgA.text: Great food great service! Hatch burger was awesome! Ice cream sandwich was last meal worthy! Tashja, our server was fantastic. Every time we had a thought of needing something she was there with it! We will be back!

spIrKLnf0DWTIqtK5b_BFw.text: Cool concept. Give away the kids college fund by eating dinner in a sports book. I like it! Lots of tvs-good atmosphere. The burgers are on the smaller side. No chance of choking here. But the lil guys have tons of flavor. The truffle burger was so good make you wanna go streaking thru the quad. But the beer prices...wow. $10 for a cider? How can you afford to lose your sports bet when you paying that! Def worth a look tho!

mmkHyzdWxo2eJCFOFDmO8Q.text: Umami's Beer Garden was great! Outside but in the shade, great atmosphere and our server Mandy was fantastic! She gave great suggestions on food and her drink recommendation (the Lolita) was spot on - Watermelon + Cucumber deliciousness. We'll definitely be back!

O9PxS5CLXv0fgO_5P9kwOw.text: Food was amazing and the service was awesome as well!! :) We ordered the truffle burger with turkey and Manly burger. Both were amazing! We also got the truffle fries which was awesome. This place is a must try.

z4pa-CE16-J5Qjpo_JAYOQ.text: It was on Dec. 18th, 2014 dinner time. First time trying the brand, we ordered the Truffle and Umami Burger, with all due of respect, it nothing close to what we expected, really, absolutely not impressed by it at all, not sure it was the cook whom was on shift that particular day or.....perhaps other challenging issues, so overall the food is really so so. Cocktail was really not there, the bar folks is in need of more training, never return a drink in my life and this night was my very first time. Za3Lbd_1h9PthL-L--Ukow.text: My wife and I checked in with about five other friends at this bar and we had the most outstanding service by a girl named Liz who was bartending! I would highly recommend this place and especially having a trip outside to see Liz as your bartender!

I just wanted a Cheeseburger, but I got some super cute and fancy burger that lacked cheese, lettuce, tomato, a pickle or fries and had a bun falling apart after two bites. I got the 5$ side of onion rings-some of the greasiest ever. All-in-all, I wish I would've went to in and out burger :(  not a well spent 20$

They told us they were just waiting for people to clear out but we ate and left before the space even cleared out. It was nice out and we wanted to enjoy it.

We ended up just going to the bar bc there was no hostess seating the half a dozen people standing at the door. We get to the bar and it takes 20 min to sample only 4 beers, which were all pilsner type beers so very limited variety. Their bottle selection was small with only a couple feesible options. The rest of their bottled beers are anywhere between $20-$50. I'm sorry but for just opening, the service sucked and so did their selection of beers :'(

ulmIa_RD2y0BPRMRx4TlGw.text: BEST BURGER OF MY LIFE! The Manly with an egg was so on point!!! Are server Lauren was incredible,  her bubbly and genuine personality really made it a great experience. She is a ROCK STAR!!!!

DIF3AfGxgvfBKnl5SJCFdg.text: Words can't explain how inexorably horrible this pale imitation of an L.A. original the Vegas Umami is.
