nLXlaYdDAFk1qH5CCFQL0A.text: The food here at the Umani chains are subpar IMO... You try different locations and the food quality is merely the same, however the service separates each location. A few months ago I visited this particular location and this particular night the waitress spilled, no showered us with a glass of water and even said "I knew this would happen..." and I'm thinking well damn if you knew it was going to happen why not stop and pause before bringing us the waters... No discounts on the food, no comped meals next time, nope... Just soiled pants is all they gave us.

j23GHWLxbcGsBT48LDQUZw.text: Oh dear...the one in Santa Monica is one of the greatest places ever. Not here. I was ignored for 20 minutes before the staff even acknowledged me. And did I get a "hello, how are you? Sorry for the wait, how may I help?" No. I get a surly "Did you want something?" Well yes, obviously, you ignoramus. Anyway, won't be ruturning, I could die of old age waiting for a beer to arrive.

_MNF5EJfaZDxkMA-KX_Nbw.text: We are Las Vegas locals and saw a Groupon for umami burger.  Today is my finances birthday and we did a little running around town and figured it was the perfect day to use that Groupon. We have been to umami before and always have exceptional service and food. Today was no different.  Tashja took great care of us.  Attentive,  never had empty drinks,  chatted with us,  and it was clear she was that way with all her tables.  David who dropped our food off was so wonderful too! Everything came out quick and correct and he was so nice! Even as locals we enjoy this place and will Def.  Be back for the great food and great service!

FyvjrtZ3lbMROTTgUq8hDA.text: Been to Umami burger three times and probably would have rated it 4 first two times- pretty good burgers, always some sort of local special, or beer special, or whatever available. Service also delivered nicely every time, never had any issues anyone else is describing. In fact, it's probably one of quickest and most convenient "nice" burger spot on the strip.   But this most recent time I ordered Ahi burger. Holy cow, run and hide.   We all love ginger, I just think it should be a bit more subtle than thinly shaved strips atop your burger. And burger itself was absolutely inedible. It's as if a frozen patty was thrown on the grill in haste. Zero seasoning, zero flavor and it was still watery and cold! Come on, at least give it time to thaw out on the grill.  I'm the sort that NEVER complains. I pay, smile and don't return. Call me passive aggressive. Voila.   Why am I even rating it 3- my party's food was ok, service was quick and beer plentiful. Just wish Ahi burger wasn't such a bleh experience.

LcF_5QXJsLuiPo3XpF5uRw.text: As a local, it is not easy to park and just go into. The food is fair, the service was a little slow for my liking. The prices were higher than Id like, but it's the Strip.

hTiWVCrXBXq2SuAbQaOiOQ.text: Phenomenal !!!! Im impressed, great food And extraordinary service, you can tell those guys love their job, everyone is super friendly, we were greeted by the manager at the door, super friendly, he walked us to our table and offered some of their craft beer. Also suggested an appetizer. Yes i will be back!

OzbUN7I97Vlwe_YPuuO3RQ.text: It was just an O-K experience for me. Personally the burgers and hot dog were decent in quality but still overpriced. $10 for a hot dog that really wasn't special... I am not a picky eater but I am also not a crap eater. Their signature sauces didnt exactly hit the spot either. The only sauce was decent enough to eat was the aioli. The house salad dressing was awful... They dont describe what's in it but I dont think I want to know anymore. Their signature ketchup has also hint of spice in it, it was ok. The only thing I did enjoy was the sweet potato fries and the buns... I will not recommend this place.

DZX8_dCIKhm86tVL1rWdLA.text: Truffle burger is the best burger there is! Server Carlos did a fantastic job and provided outstanding service. Second time here in my four days in Vegas and plan on making Umami a must visit any time I come to Vegas!

hUX9WwGFfmrvxbKS3dW4UQ.text: Cool atmosphere, lots of TV's. Service was friendly but terribly slow and lacking. We had to ask for extra place settings, napkins, plates.. Our waitress would disappear and nobody got their water or drinks refilled. I wonder if she felt like she didn't need to earn her tip since it was automatic with our party of 6. I don't feel like she deserved 20% for showing her face twice. I spent more time watching the server interact with the booth next to us than actually seeing our server.  Food was good, the only thing keeping a third star. Although 3 of us ordered the same burger but cooked differently, and when they were brought out they passed them out as if they were all the same. It was never indicated which was which. Not sure why they asked if it didn't matter? They also brought a bunch of different sauces with our onion rings but never said what was what..   Everything is a la carte.   Sodas come in old fashioned bottles except diet.

GKx_o8AJm0nrB6f9zWnuQA.text: A unique place to be around friends. They have a neat beer bong. It is big. Nice atmosphere! I can't wait to try the burger. The Umami burger.

gDDyNdqodvoYRMNh59Kk3g.text: Sooooooo.... I had the ahi poki burger and I think I wanna pay them to take it back and if you order  to go I suggest not putting the fries in the brown box container. They ended up tasting like mash potatoes but I'm having fun!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Umami Burger -  SLS Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. But that Mose is right!!!

AIDtFonUovlAS3yvhYHX2Q.text: I absolutely love this place!!! EVERYTHING you need to watch a game is right here (SportsBook, food, tvs everywhere, hot waitresses, and a comfortable environment). The waitresses, AJ, Tashja, Megan are great. The food is great, and comes out fast! I highly recommend this place!!

2GwaYLzWfo0-r4pTMD1-uA.text: I heard such amazing things about this place and then was underwhelmed...sad face.  Maybe I put too much anticipation into the restaurant.  The menu is small, and all of the burgers sound delicious.  I got the Classic, but when it arrived, I was surprised at the size of the burger (read: small).  Having been to Bachi Burger and Burger Bar and even Yard House, for the $12 price tag of the Umami Burger, I was expecting a nice, huge, messy burger.  But it was about the size of a McDonald's double cheeseburger.  Worse, my burger was dry and flavorless.  My husband got a burger with beer cheese, bacon, and all sorts of stuff on it, and that one in contrast did have a lot of flavor.  And then came the fries.  When you order "smothered fries" you expect them to be SMOTHERED.  What we got was a little bit of gravy in the middle of the bowl and dry short rib on top of that.  I mean...put the gravy on top of the short rib to keep it moist.  It was hardly smothered in anything.  Things I did love: the patio has great misters and a great environment, our waitress was wonderful and perky and attentive, and the jalapeno ranch.  Oh damn that jalapeno ranch is good.  One last note.  I ended up getting a tequila based cocktail for $13 (yes, that's right, the cocktail was more expensive than the burger).  When we went next door to The Sayers Club, the EXACT SAME cocktail was $18.  As a whole, I think the SLS hotel has the most expensive drinks on The Strip, and I was shocked at the mark up from one restaurant to the lounge just next door.

Dw_R9SAftWi_zIsocUFDIQ.text: Second time eating here this trip. One of my top 2 burger spots in the world. Menu sounds simple but tastes extraordinary. Give it a shot.

6pKLsQa4RVU4EOjD3pg35w.text: Incredible food , amazing cocktails ,service was prompt and all over us. Different type of sports bar! Left stuffed and happy will go back for sure once in Vegas!!!!

Xzqh455SJXDsTEvZ85vnBg.text: Got the unami burger which was really good! They have Both sweet potatoes or regular fries! Love both and also a pretty good selection of beer. Out door seating and overall different atmosphere compared to the other locations.

photos.caption: Photo of Umami Burger -  SLS Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States

FR_kmYl2X4t4T_ETtbtcgw.text: Overpriced teeny tiny "Burglettes" served,, and don't even attempt going for lunch during "March Madness" without taking out a 2nd on your home... Sheeshhh!  More seats "reserved" (empty) than available for paying customers.

zQuN8tJxJ4QDtu63YX89_A.text: Amazing!!! Try the Ahi Tuna Burger! A party of flavors in your mouth! The drinks were phenomenal!!  Our waitress was fantastic! And love the outdoor sitting.

UrtzEiK2QUvz5PF5WeNyJg.text: My daughter and I went to this restaurant last night. We were greeted promptly and seated. We sat at a table near a big party who was checking out of the place. No one came by. The busser came by twice looking at us each time. There were 2 waitresses who were around but never came by . We sat there for a good 7 minutes with no one even stopping by. The place overall was not even busy. As a local who has lived here for over 10 years, I was very disappointed.  On our way out, I spoke to a manager who apologized and offered to take care of us but we decided not to take him up on it. We ended up eating at another establishment at the SLS and had a wonderful experience and meal.

JZ2rcPUKCcOv1Sjzw2DeVQ.text: I would like to rate this place as one of the best burger joints I've dined. Gourmet burgers for reasonable prices.  UB is a hidden gem...tucked to the side within the hotel.  I felt compelled to give this place a high rating because of the menu variety and excellent customer service.  I enjoyed all the TV's in every booth and inviting fresh, fun atmosphere. UB focuses on quality and intention.  The buns are soft. The burger patty is flavorful, juicy, and the portion is generously perfect.  I was really stumped on what to eat  because I wanted all the burgers.  But, our server, Lauren (with the pretty dark hair), made it easy to choose.  She was very knowledgeable and friendly.  The Manly Burger and Truffle Fries were delish!!  I enjoyed my trip to Vegas earlier this month and next time I visit, I will be sure to return for another delicious meal at UB!!

lOIy3qb1gy_982py9zOciA.text: Living in Los Angeles, Umami Burger at The Grove was my favorite burger joint.   The truffle burgers are amazing! Also the truffle fries.  I got the B.U.B. this time, although it was really good, I still absolutely love the truffle burger.   Service here was fast and friendly. Our server Matthew was always there to take care of us, and our food came out fast.   As good as this place is, it's not as great as the location in The Grove. I feel like I'm at a sports bar but I guess this place is a sports bar too. In Los Angeles the Umami Burger feels more upscale.   I'm still giving this place five stars because as I've said, service is fast, friendly, and the burgers are so yummy!

photos.caption: Photo of Umami Burger -  SLS Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. B.U.B.
Photo of Umami Burger -  SLS Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. I love Umami burger! This is my favorite burger place.

9O8Ymiu92MiS9VMZBto0KQ.text: You know what you're getting here. The burgers are good but not great and the service tends to be on the slow side.

8BMGhoGAdxo4lDh3bm5kHw.text: New favorite dipping sauce... Jalapeno Ranch. Omg Delicious.   Umami Burger is a nice place I have to say.  I really enjoyed the interior layout. There are a lot of TV's, nice open bar area, and everything is new and clean looking.   The staff is very very pleasent.  Everyone has a smile on their face.  One thing that perplexed me was when we arrived (Like 9 at night) they told us there was a 30 Minute wait for a table... as I looked into the dining room it looked empty? I am assuming they didnt have enough servers on for the late hour? (Thus the 4 Stars)  However we were told that we could go out to the beer garden area thats open aired to the strip for immediate seating if anything was available.   The outside bar area is fantastic! Very modern looking, plenty of seating.  Very artsy with the lighting.   Shout out to Chris the bartender.  He was extremely nice, and took care of our needs.  Our drinks did not go empty.   They have this Frozen Beer there.. ask about it. It's simply genius.

photos.caption: Photo of Umami Burger -  SLS Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. B.U.B Big Umami Burger
Photo of Umami Burger -  SLS Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Outside Bear Garden Bar
Photo of Umami Burger -  SLS Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Interior dining room

gmFQVH3Wf0i8N5otlcWMFQ.text: Disappointed with the burgers. Overpriced and small with no distinct flavor from the burger. I know it is on the strip and this price is not really pricey, but the food quality is beyond me. Maybe if I ordered medium rare burger would taste better, but who eat undercooked burger, only people who wants to get sick that's who. The truffle fries and sweet potato were pretty good, but I've had better and cheaper. The waitress were nice, which was a good thing.

K2FGoe0empTKmruxSSe3qw.text: Although I did have to wait at the exterior walk-up entrance for about 5 minutes before anyone noticed me and asked me to be seated (albeit signs do tell you to wait there, but staff said you need to go to interior entrance to be seated by host) the rest of the service provided by Liz who is an exceptional barkeep and the burger was one of the best I've had. It really was that delicious and it reminded how great a burger could be when done right. I had the Manly burger, fries, and $2 Bud Light draft pints!

photos.caption: Photo of Umami Burger -  SLS Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Manly burger, friends and $2 Bud Light pints!

cZONTIN75copVTGbhldSmw.text: Came to Umami Burger after a trade show at the convention center. I was staying at the W and ate at Cleo the night before, this night I was wanting more of a place to go to the bar and grab a beer, eat, watch sports, and head back. When I got here the bar was already full (good sign people were here) so I got a small table for myself. I kept catching myself looking in all directions at all the different screens there were, there is also a sports book with people betting so that was neat (if only they had a blackjack table in here).  I ordered the Umami burger because 1) the place is named after it 2) it had a crisp Parmesan cheese 3) shiitake mushrooms. The burger was great. Only disappointment was I think they shorted me on the mushrooms since I only noticed one shiitake mushroom, nonetheless it was a solid burger with soft buns and cool logo burnt on it for a nice appearance.  I also ordered the Truffle Fries. These were great as there was not an overwhelming taste of truffle and the cheese was good. What really caught my taste buds out of everything was the sauces! ASK FOR THEIR SAUCES. I believe this is one hidden gem of this place. I got their jalepeno ranch, buffalo sauce, diablo sauce, and BBQ. I'm a sauce guy so I was excited when my waitress brought all these out after only asking for ranch and buffalo. The ranch is more of a homemade ranch that they make in house, the buffalo is fantastic if you're a buffalo fan, the diablo is exactly how you imagine it tasting, and the BBQ was a smoky tang flavor. LOVE the sauces.  Lastly I had the cookie with ice cream and it's a perfect dessert in the desert...(good luck to the people who can't read the difference between those)  A warm cookie oozing the chocolate chips as you fork through it to the perfect scooped vanilla ice cream on the bottom. Not too rich!  Other than the food the service was prompt and respectful. The beer came cold, the burger came much quicker than expected, and the waitress was very nice.

x3zr--LWfhplKgZlS9QSmg.text: Abby our waitress was awesome. Hatch and manly burgers were very good.  Great place.  We watched a couple of baseball games and gambled. Life is good

photos.caption: Photo of Umami Burger -  SLS Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States

C1tXsREByZOo-EjrZQqLSQ.text: Great food and waiters but please sort out the grumpy and inefficient staff who make you wait and feel unwelcome whilst waiting to be seated!  The vegetarian options are great and was glad to see they offer to replace all beef with portobello mushrooms. Try the Oscar Blues larger with fried pickles, absolutely delicious!

KaiUmmY_OafgZH9TYAwK5Q.text: My four stars are mainly based on the food. I've been here several times and everything is consistently delicious & cooked to perfection. Never a disappointment. Service on the other hand just keeps getting worse! My husband & I aways sit at the bar and there are a couple really good attentive bartenders there....if you're lucky enough to get them. Otherwise it's a challenge to be taken care of. They need to work on customer service skills.

Z4YTsMuSs_WTk57z1unfRA.text: This was a very nice restaurant and the burger was truly savory as the name would have it.  I had the manly burger and it was so yummy and messy.  Very flavorful and the juices just oozed with every bite.  They put thick slabs of bacon chunks on top of the burger so when you bite into one, you just get a big chunk of chewy, moist bacon flavor.  Each bun was branded with the "U" logo which was pretty cool.  Not too pricey, but everything is Ala carte so fries are separate. :(  Looks like a great place for parties.  Very trendy, but when I was there, it was not too busy so although it was a nice atmosphere with large screens everywhere, the room lacked the buzz.  Nice drink menu.  Even offered frozen Kirin beer, which sounded yummy, but too cold for this Hawaii girl in Vegas!  Overall it was a great dining experience and would definitely go back for my manly burger....Yum!

photos.caption: Photo of Umami Burger -  SLS Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States

650wLpXZMxZNLWFSg30j1w.text: After reading the reviews and accolades about the burgers here we decided to give it a shot. The restaurant itself is pretty impressive with plenty of open space and an abundance of screens to watch sporting events.  We were seated quickly but then waited about 10 minutes for a server to arrive. We ordered our food and appetizers and unfortunately both arrived at the same time. The food was average. It wasn't great and it wasn't bad. You could tell our waitress was handling more than her share of tables, so I don't blame her. I had the ahi tuna burger and it was good, just not great.

bVrCwSdIv0mwWVw5iC0iMw.text: This place was great! Outstanding food and outstanding service! Our server Tashja was amazing! She never let our drinks run dry and had a great personality. Super friendly and helpful. Would definitely recommend eating here!

7osKnkaH4RMKCiyFbwrtvw.text: Came into SLS to place some sports bets but decided to grab some food while I was there since the sportsbook is inside umami. Had the manly burger and truffle fries. Manly burger was cooked to a perfect medium temperature and was so juicy. Truffle fries had a lot of flavor too. Lauren, our server, was amazing with her recommendations. Will come back soon.

F5xRdzXwZkWaZ3Sqbwobhg.text: Staying at the SLS, called in a burger and an order of truffle fries to go, they said 10-15 mins, got there about 12 minutes later and they said, oh we just put the order in it will be 10-15 minutes. Really annoyed but ok fine, said ok.  Go back 15 mins later, get my order from the bartender who had an attitude and didn't say a word to me but puts my food on the counter and said, sign this, no thank you, have a nice day, nothing, get to my room, regular fries, not truffle fries and the burger was just ok. Very dissatisfied, this place is way overrated.

z3QeT9kjuVeOvHo8OLzOGA.text: who doesn't love a burger? The menu is amazing, the service even better. Our server Brooke made the meal even more fun, she is funny and fantastic. her suggestions for our lunch were terrific. Brooke rocks. and the Burgers are great too

Obkt-sVEi-ZJaKkLCvUx5w.text: Wounderful experience with the most amazing bartender! Martha, changed our mind about this bar! The menu has changed and I would recommend if you were here before and not happy, come back when Martha is here, she's something!

YREH2CJ6s5JVU12MFbsgOw.text: Our meal was fantastic.   The pickled plate was yummy and interesting,  our burgers and fries were fantastic,  and the service terrific.   Thanks Mandy!  We recommend this place.

emPAvvSwVLMXmjbk8T0jyQ.text: 10 min wait for seats. Food came pretty fast ....Manly Burgers, Sweet Sweet Potato Fries, Onion Rings and the Kale Salad....but the fries were cold. We informed our server who sent them back and fresh, hot fries appeared 10 min later, along with the manager who apologized and comped us the fries. The server was very friendly and convinced us ( quite easily) to try dessert Snickerdoodle cookie, salted caramel ice cream sandwich from Coolhaus YUMMM!! We ( 4 ladies) enjoyed our meal. The restaurant is in the SLS Hotel on the far end of the strip, but worth checking out!

lURb_wAEVN_GOjJjntJ6dQ.text: Burgers and service were amazing. Coming here 2x a week! I loved all of their beer suggestions and how fast the food cane out. Over all 10 out of 10!

Ku_xHl7ztYhbZVzq9Za38g.text: Really good burgers.... but retardadly slow service,  maybe if I dress up in a clown outfit and jump up and down they'll notice me. Flat beer didn't help

iNSPa3EgFeMpEXkwSVRPTQ.text: I want to say this was a very nice restaurant Mandy was from Memphis service and I really enjoyed it and I'm coming back

oDjqi-0fcbA2Q_dt7qaz5A.text: Food is too small. Used to he bigger. Half off for locals apparently ever other week and we came in on the off week. Better off going to mcdonalds. A whopper is bigger than this burger. Weird sauce flavor. Dislike.

2p1RZADl1oKRL7tjPoTuvA.text: Imagine yourself sitting in the middle of a of the redock sports book and then have your booky cooking your food, that what this place is. The Manly burger was a horrible burger and was more of a burnt slider that a cheese burger our smothered fries were cold and the bacon cheddar hot dog was absolutely disgusting. Way over priced we just told the waiter and left

nWWTyWOGEwubX_MEcbYHMA.text: umami burger was fantastic.  liz was extremely friendly and helpful.  the food was amazing and we will be back again.

uv1J9UK_yfYTc_-fG1-icQ.text: My wife and I tried this brand new LV location for lunch, I ordered the manly burger, honestly I was very disappointed, it was slightly bigger than a slider, not worth $15, taste and quality average, I've had lots better that were less $. The big problem we had was with my wife's order, she got the Korean style brat, as she was digging into this brat she found the casing which was as tough as a rubber glove, couldn't even cut it with a steak knife, our very nice waiter was concerned and helpful and offered her another item, she ordered the Boring salad, not quite boring, after a few bites of this salad she noticed a few leafs and jicama had black gritty dirt on them! Our waiter felt really bad and got the manager. The manager offered to take both items off the bill but was hardly concerned about anything, she was more interested reading her texts on her phone, she didn't even ask us what was wrong and took no initiative to bring my wife's food back to the kitchen and check with their staff, absolutely no concern and no people skills. Not coming back to this place

nSONmuLV1CtgZunHGnpdLg.text: When you fail the fundamental basics of customer service, you're going to get a 1 star. Looking for a bite to eat before meeting friends, I decided to try Umami Burger, as I'd heard good things about it. I waited patiently, since the place had a handful of tables busy, and the bar was half full. 10 minutes went by. Not even so much as an acknowledgement that I was there, let alone any hope of getting seated. The final straw was this guy in a Manziel jersey (all the staff except the bartender had football jerseys on, due to it being an NFL Sunday) who walked lazily past me four times, looked at me directly twice, and ignored me. At that point, I'd had enough and walked out. Rule #1 of any service industry - acknowledge that the customer is there. Needless to say, I won't ever be eating here voluntarily. If you can't even get the first, most basic rule right, that speaks poorly of the business as a whole.

1gyUWjt46Jx_e9qg_CkyQA.text: this place would get all five stars if it were based purely on our experience at the bar. we first got here and left due to our game (angels playoff) not being played. but came back to the bar where Liz  went beyond the call of duty to serve us. we will be coming back again because of the Liz and the bar!!! good beer, good company, and GREAT SERVICE!

gUf48BfvFeytZ0Dpabh0nQ.text: hi, we went here dec. 18th , a party of 8, i agree with the other yelpers their burgers are WAY below avarage..... for the price $12.00 to $16.00 they are very small with a very very small patty, who caRES IF THE BUN HAS A "u" ON IT???   THE BUN WAS RIGHT OUT OF A BAG :(  the fries are $8.00 extra, theyre soggy, the onion rings are $10.00, the batter was thick, cold and soggy, very gross when you bite into one. one person ordered their chicken wings, very soggy with icky sauce... Why is everything so soggy ???? the patties had no flavor, the green chile buger was awful,  they also charge $3.50 per pepsi NO FREE REFILLS, ice teas? $3.50 NO FREE REFILLS.... you dont find out until you get the bill...... bad restaurant policy :(  everyone in our group said they were the worse burgers they ever had !! save your money......... yes......... we did order their apple dessert..YUCK...............right out of the micro wave.. the crust was tough and chewy... what a disappointment....weve never been to another location and sure wont...for VEgas??? terrible save your money:(  fyi: for a third of the price Smashburger has a great, tasty buger!!

FlQW3eHYT_hqF5IcYMgC0Q.text: The food was great but our waitress sucked....it was if she assumed that we wouldn't tip cuz she never gave us her full attention....always cut us off before we were done....wasn't happy at all

3Or0pet-TMQwCqbkHIjLpw.text: We ate here at dinner time and were seated quickly. Our server, Lauren, was very friendly. The food arrived fast and it was delicious!  I had the manly burger and thin fries.

photos.caption: Photo of Umami Burger -  SLS Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Manly burger

9W5JsJ1jAAPDvKrgOTu-vA.text: Umami burger trifecta was great!  Got there before 9am on Sunday and people were already claiming seats and making wagers.  Leather couches are reserved so get there early if you want a decent seat.  $50 minimum food/drink each person if you want to sit in the booths all day, otherwise will be automatic 20% gratuity if at the tables in the middle.  Friendly staff with manager who totally tried to make everyone happy by running around to set all the different TV's up for all the different fans.  Outdoor patio is awesome and wasn't crowded.  I will be back.

3wo9OwMrOVoILl3Iob4LDw.text: Tashja was absolutely amazing! The service was efficient, and fast! She made sure we were well taken care of. I may even come here for Christmas and leave my family behind. I will recommend this place every time!

EwvK3bePXY3fIG42DrrOdw.text: Good burgers, great customer service, was seated pretty fast. Highly recommend if you're staying at SLS Las Vegas as one of the restaurants to try since most of the strip hotels are overpriced and average food quality.

46wA0xhflP0A445AK57btQ.text: tashja was the absolute best!! very pretty, extremely helpful, great service ..she made the overall experience fantastic [ everybody take notes ] honestly, truly lol

N8bttfmzZ44bqUA7nriD2A.text: We went to Umami realitically - we were walking for water/gatorade and saw a huge billboard with a delish looking burger so we figured - lets check it out tnight. I went on line/ they didnt take reservations which was fine- there was room when our party of 4 arrived. The menu has alot for everyone but we came for a burger. Our group each picked a diff one based on our likes.  I had the Mindy Kaling burger-spicy deliciousness: my hub had the Manly with the bacon lardons. He didn't speak for 20 minutes telling me he enjoyed it. Our friends ordered the Umami burger which came with an awesome parm/cheddar crisp and home made ketchup. We all enjoyed it. Including the tempura onion rings and deep fried butter pickles. Our server was also delightful. Very helpful and fun as well. Great spot.

Wm4kEu75a8GZjyb_nZ7jxQ.text: I'm not sure how anyone has anything bad to say about this place.  We live next door and frequent this place regularly, and it never loses its appeal.  I have a neighbor that says you don't even have to chew the meat because its so damn tender.  Everything we have ever ordered is awesome, the Manly is the best burger I think I have ever had.  The service was spotty a couple of years ago, but they have certainly worked that issue out. I highly recommend this place.

CddP8WAoC5G5gePaYOXe_g.text: Food was awesome and so was the service! Our waitress Mandy was super attentive and her recommendations were on point!

viAlJ4jKrQXYqFhSSrKzTg.text: Amazing burgers, amazing salad, and amazing waitress, Mandy was awesome! Super helpful with making decisions, would definitely come back!

17G1y3f-8ZoAJcc98XHOxw.text: In order to be fair, I'm going to say that I probably ordered the wrong thing. I ordered the truffle fries, with chives, cheese, and truffle oil. I've never had truffle anything before, so I figured I would give it a go. The fries left an extremely odd taste in my mouth, which i didnt really care for. I'm not sure if this is because its an acquired taste or if it was just no good, but I'm leaving this at three stars just in case. I ordered the Manly Burger and it was absolutely fantastic. I would come back here again, i would just be wary of the truffle fries.

6XIf50HkCpZ9BcaWg7e0ew.text: Wow. First time @umami and not only was the food unforgettable but A.J our waitress was AMAZING. could not have asked for a better first time.

YoD_kZ5wbf0ORka_usBG8w.text: Got garlic fries, umami burger, and a chicken lettuce wrap. Honestly it was really bad esp the chicken wrap the chicken was cold and the sauce they drenched my chicken in tasted weird. The fries were the best part of the whole meal. Not trying umami burger again.

gZx_ITAAV4N7GAEiUtDwTA.text: Great little place at SLS in Vegas. We had a flight of beers and the Manly burger. Great flavor! I really liked the Peach beer. The service was great and Mandy was helpful with both keeping our glasses full and giving these tourists some local tips!

Mk8x00b9tEBPIht4fGJxOw.text: Abby was an exceptional server. She helped us make our minds up with what we wanted to eat and everything was amazing. I want to add also that the hostess was very sweet and informative. I will definitely recommend to Umami to everyone. Even the food runner was nice enough to get us more napkins and more sauce is that we love so much. This is amazing! & I love all the TVs!

Iej654lGhJzG1b9tEUXDrw.text: The best burgers at the SLS hotel and in my opinion on the planet! The beet salad was amazing as well along with the maple bacon fries! We ate there a few times during our stay and since we were there visiting family as well we took them to lunch there was 7 of us and our waiter sunny was not only pleasant but a pleasure to talk with and seemed to take pride working there! We will be staying at the SLS again in Vegas and they will 100% be our first dinner or lunch spot!

jc-2fChGfN7J5Z70vU6iHg.text: The food was pretty good. I definitely recommend the Maple Bacon Fries. The prices were a little steep for the larger beers. You can get a full-sized Rogue beer at Whole Foods for $9 but here they charge you $30. They also don't have more than 100 beers on tap. The selection was slim and very overpriced.

n1oN25euqjoo8MW3R5Uh8g.text: I am not a burger fan, but I loved this place. I had the Ahi TUna Burger and it was delicious! The Korean Fries were excellent and I LOVED the sauces that they served on the side, as well as their own ketchup!!! Yumm

cQ05QXXHtjLs7RVh2CG--w.text: Was better the first time we were here... right after they opened.  They've since changed some things on the menu and now I'd say its good, but nothing special.  Beer selection is unique, some varieties you won't find elsewhere.

NNrAtNVtz0RXvZad12hDEw.text: We had a great experience at Umami Burger thanks to Liz Veloz, who was our bartendar!!  She was exceptionally nice and made our stay at the SLS a awesome experience!  She is what we expect of the quality of bartenders when visiting Las Vegas!  Thank you Liz for everything and we hope to see you again in the near future!   Our best, Don and Ernesto from  Melbourne Florida.

6seIhDspGvzuwJXmXuFj5A.text: I was excited when I heard Umami was finally coming to Vegas but my excitement quickly turned to disappointment when I actually tried this spot out.  A lot my review is based off a comparison of this location to the ones in Laguna Beach and The Grove in Southern California. If you've never been to a Umami before, its definitely worth checking out even here at the SLS.   Umami serves up some pretty good gourmet burgers and fries. The burgers are juicy and flavorful, and you can taste the quality in the toppings. The stamped buns are almost begging you take a picture and Instagram it. Plenty of sides and entree options means there is something for everyone. While the food is fine I take issue with the dining experience itself.   Each time I have dined here the restaurant has been virtually empty, but somehow there is always a 10-15 minute wait to be seated in a barren dinning room. The outdoor patio huge and overlooks the north end of the strip. The free ping-pong, air hockey and foosball tables are a nice touch and a good distraction while waiting on your food. Unfortunately, the massive size of the patio makes for just an awkward dining space. Rarely is anyone at the bar or eating out there and the backless wooden benches make for an uncomfortable dining tables.They merged the main dining room with the "sports book" and its a mess. Random people walking in and out making bets and standing around creates a weird dining atmosphere. Service has always been slow and disappointing. Its sad that this locations gives so many first timer Unami eaters a bad first impression of the franchise.

photos.caption: Photo of Umami Burger -  SLS Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Southwest burger with green chillies
Photo of Umami Burger -  SLS Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. unami!

jSsdDy9Dfvc30M6zqsHrtQ.text: Came here as the last day in town and wanted to go someplace by the hotel. Found this place on yelp and decided to give it a try.  Glad I did! We were promptly seated with our party of 6. Carlos was our server and gave great explanations and recommendations. We started with the truffle fries and the buffalo wings. The wings were crunchy and not soggy or dropping in sauces, the truffle fries were amazing with the truffle cheese. For lunch I got the Truffle burger medium and my partner got the green bird with a beef patty. Both burgers exceeded expectations. My picky teenager got the manly and devoured it. We also had the sweet potato fries from checking in here and those were also simple and amazing. I love the food and the atmosphere (think sports bar) and definitely recommend it for anyone wanting to catch the game, get a good drink, and really good food.

photos.caption: Photo of Umami Burger -  SLS Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The sweet potato fries
Photo of Umami Burger -  SLS Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The truffle burger

SWbSAKAvaQwmPjMDfNw0YA.text: It almost pains me to write this. I loved this place in LA. I've tried visiting this location in the SLS but they seem to have odd hours, catering to Happy Hour and Dinner. Finally visited and it's an odd experience for an upscale burger place. Maybe because it was around 6? Seat yourself - which equates to a 10-15 minute wait for service. Ordered everything once the server arrived to avoid future wait times - Hatch burger and Manly burger with sweet potato fries. Both burgers dlish and portion of fries enough for 2 to share, but no special sauce, just Heinz. The vibe was so off from the locations in LA and for the prices, I'd expect a little more service. Maybe the focus is different since the SLS was sold?

3MY00VNnfYXs1MO_1hFwHg.text: I came here with a few of my girls before hitting the Foxtail Dayclub. There was no wait and we were seated promptly at a booth table. Walking in, I instantly noticed how different the decor was from the location in Palo Alto. While the one in PA had a much more college library type of feel, this location has more of a sports bar type of feel.   Our server was Tashja. She was super sweet and attentive to our needs. I ordered the throwback burger which had two beef patties, ketchup, pickles, mustard, cheddar cheese, and minced onions along with the FREE truffle fries (make sure you check in on Yelp for this!). To be completely honest, I think the burger I ordered had too much meat portion. But that shouldn't be anything to complain about lol so to make it better maybe some produce like lettuce or tomatoes would make the burger taste even better. Also the burger seemed to have too much bread as  well, so it did seem like a heavy burger. You would think that since the order of truffle fries is free that they would be smaller in portion. But no, my order was heaping with fries!   I don't think I would go out of my way from the strip to SLS to come here, but if I am in the area; I would come back!

j8lhRFeGKb10TKWe_VwJMQ.text: Came here because groupon was having a really good deal, $25 for 2 burgers & 2 sides.   You have to park in the SLS parking structure and then walk into the casino. Umami Burger is on the opposite side of the casino floor. No worries though, because SLS is very small so its not a long walk at all.   When my friend and I first arrived, we were really confused. There were two lines, roped off but no host. So we went inside a bit, no one said anything to us, and walked back out to the host stand and was about to walk to the other entrance when the host finally came. I wouldn't have known she was the host because she didn't have a uniform, I just saw her ear piece and was like... maybe she'll help us. She didn't say anything to us, and I had to tell her seating for two people. Even when she led us to a booth, and set down our menus, she still didn't say anything.   Our server wasn't too friendly, but he was attentive. I added lettuce, tomatoes (which he told me were grilled), and onions to my truffle burger. I wanted to order the truffle fries but was afraid it would be too much truffle so settled on the garlic parmesan fries. My fried ordered the ahi burger and sweet potato fries.   Our food came out in a good amount of time. My friend said she could SMELL the truffle when it was brought out. Maybe my taste buds suck or something, the truffle burger had truffle cheese and a truffle aioli but i didn't really get that much of a truffle taste. The burger patty itself was very juicy, and cooked medium, just the way I like it! One of the RARE occasions where I actually get my meat cooked how I want it! I like my fries to be... not so skinny. So I didn't enjoy the fries very much, but they were crispy. The pieces of shredded parmesan was just sad. At least melt the cheese or use a different type of parmesan. A lot of the parmesan fell off as I was trying to grab the fries.   Overall, my friend and I enjoyed our meal. It was interesting to watch all the different sports on the many many TV screens that they had. Apparently, you can bet at the bar and watch whatever sport they have on the big screen. Trust me, the screen spans the entire wall. They had baseball on as well as football and boxing.   Don't expect to come here for a nice date night. Because of all the sports, it can and WILL get very loud! On the way out, we walked right past the host who just stared at us. I was watching the way that she seated other parties (without a smile), and wanted to see if she would thank us for coming in or at least say goodbye. Nope.   SLS is a pretty confusing drive from Henderson, our GPS took us in a weird route. I may be back but not anytime soon.

photos.caption: Photo of Umami Burger -  SLS Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Truffle burger with lettuce, tomatoes and onions added

3jn6hovwixh7jdAw-8Iggw.text: Love the Grilled mushroom burger since I don't eat meat. Would love if they actually would have a veggie patty. That is something to consider. Love the truffle sauce.

EYoEFQmW6b5G1kc1xoAvWg.text: We're locals, but we're attending a convention where we are given limited time for dinner breaks. We waited in line forever at 800 Pizza for them to tell us when we finally got to the counter that they were out of gluten-free crust, so this is where we ended up. (As SLS has a pretty shitty selection of restaurants and by then we barely had time to eat) Anyway, enough about us..  This place is a small burger joint that is directly in the tiny sportsbook, so you get to listen to the blaring sports games over the loudsystem while you to try and converse. The menu sucks. Maybe 10 items on the menu, and very limited toppings for burgers. Also, the burgers don't come with fries, everything is a la carte. I ordered a "burger" with truffle cheese, truffle oil, and substituted the patty for a Portobello, as I don't eat meat and had it wrapped in lettuce since I don't eat bread.  They don't offer a small salad or anything for those of us that don't want fries. No other sides, whatsoever.  He ordered a turkey burger, and one side of truffle fries. Soda water and iced tea for our drinks.  Server wasn't rude, but certainly not friendly. Acted like we were a burden. Food runner dropped the food and ran. Had to keep asking for ketchup, mustard, and extra napkins, as nothing is kept on the table. For one "veggie" burger, one turkey burger, one side of fries, a tea and soda water.. $43.00. He said his was just ok, however mine was delicious. The final straw, though, was that we were charged $3.15 for soda water!! I've never seen a place (yes, even on the strip) that charges for soda water. Won't be back.

N8w9GYjaeWLuVJOwiRKhiQ.text: Dont go to this restaurant. The food taste like a plastic. And also it is expensive for nothing. Trust me guys even if you are very drunk you will not like it. And also the salad smell like nail polish. Out of 10 I say 1/2 why? Because too many Tv's. Macdonalds is waaay better

NfvP7bYqYjIrA7NRiERwCA.text: My coworkers and I had an amazing lunch today...  We tried the Truffle Burger, Truffle Especial, BBQ Burger, the sweet potato fries, the truffle fries and the onion rings! The food was absolutely delicious, the decor is great and the service was pretty good. I would have gave them 4-stars since the service was semi-lack luster, but the food was easily 6-stars, so it averaged out! Lol   Our fat asses also got two ice cream sandwiches and they were both great! (Snicker doodle and mint)  This place is a must try...

B630xQD5NyS5w_Msu3PEHg.text: Great restaurant. Great food but what stand up the most was my server Tashja. She went beyond my expectations. She make me feel like I was home. Great personality and great customer service. I gave her 5 stars because their was no more to give her. But I think she deserves 10.  Thanks Tashja for making an espectacular fist time at  Umami burger at the Las Vegas SLS Hotel.

b_YCrGCHzj_4WTqXu2KVZg.text: I had heard good things about Umami Burger and decided to have lunch there while staying at the SLS hotel.  The staff were friendly and the food was great. I had half of the tuna burger and half of the umami burger, both were great, but the tuna was my favourite!  If you like onion rings, theirs is A MUST! Perfectly battered and crunchy, I fell in love. We ordered the buffalo wings as a starter, they were nothing to write home about. Just your generic wings, really, which was a bit disappointing.  I also loved that they have a "taster" option for their draught beers. Great for if you're not sure what beer you want, or if you just like a bit of variety!

7W4F2wIiDjd55xS-OtDzRg.text: Big fan of burger joints, so of course I had to try this. The atmosphere is was amazing (not sure if the age group that can be seated in the restaurant, first thing we were asked was if everything in our party is 21 and over). Food was great was as well. My burger has amazing taste and the onion  rings (which I highly recommend) are mind blowing.   My only thing with this place (that gave this place 4 stars instead of 5) was the amount of food for the price you were paying for. We were group of 5 that ran up a $80 bill, but not full/satisfied afterwards.

photos.caption: Photo of Umami Burger -  SLS Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States

H52WfxeDj7ME3YSJl0NB3g.text: I've been to the bar twice, I was met with high beer prices and unfavorable service. I'll never understand why a beer garden has a wall of vodka, but anyhow... We finally gave Umami Burger a try. The Code sent my husband 50% off for his birthday. It seemed like a good excuse to give it a whirl.  Service was attentive. Our waitress got started on our Union Jack ($9) and Mama's Little Yella Pils ($8) while we looked over the menu. We settled on the Manly burger ($12) for him and the Umami aka Original burger ($12) for me. Both prepared medium rare. We ordered two secret menu items: Cheesy Tots ($5) and Manly Fries ($6.50).  Prior to our food coming out, we were given house condiments: jalapeno ranch, mega spicy and garlic aioli. We were warned of the spiciness but didn't believe it would be as hot as it was. We enjoy spicy too. We didn't like the aioli at all, but the jalapeno ranch was the standout. It livened up the original burger and it was good on the tots and fries. Also, better than the housemade ketchup.  The Umami burger is topped with caramelized onions, roasted tomato and one shiitake mushroom, and parmesan frico. The burger to bun ratio is good, the bun was decent. I like the branding of buns - it's a good emphasis of their brand. The patty was of good size. All of which are good things, but why was it so bad? I wondered. It came down to the meat being overdone. It was dry and bland. There was no juiciness at all. The caramelized onions and parmesan frico were the only redeeming qualities. What's with one shiitake mushroom? You better enjoy that single bite.  The Manly burger is topped with beer cheddar, bacon lardons, onion strings and slathered with ketchup and mustard. It was not cooked medium rare, it bordered on medium to medium well. This was, however, the better burger of the two. Still, both were pretty disappointing.  The sides, though, were quite good. The tater tots were salty, potatoey, crisp on the outside and gooey in the center. I really enjoyed them. The manly fries were quickly consumed. Crisp shoestring fried topped with beer cheese, bacon and onion strings, kinda hard to go wrong there. I guess the secret menu is where it's at!?!   In the future, I'd order a beer and tots for snack, but I'd definitely skip the burgers.

jb42tXJxzT9MZ3FpKy6cYg.text: So Wednesday, I was sat outside with some of my friends. I had the delicious hatch burger and truffle fries; wow, those fries! It was better than BURGR's parm fries.   I wanted to say the service was amazing. Usually in Vegas you get those shit servers who don't really care... But That wasn't the case. My severs name was Sunny; he was so attentive, sweet and helped me pick my food, thank god cause I couldn't decide! I'm definitely gonna come back every Wednesday in hopes he's my waiter again.   Thanks Umami!

BfnSCmQr9zNIYW5Ra-L_KA.text: My boyfriend and I ordered the manly burger and the umami burger. They were both very delicious. The manly burger is your typical bacon cheeseburger and the umami burger had a fried Parmesan cheese on it. In addition I ordered the velvet mule which was equally delicious. My boyfriend ordered the ballast point dead ringer Oktoberfest which he thought was very delicious.  We also ordered the wings which I thought was pretty decent. AJ9bAJE90ybIVPlt8Hu9dg.text: Came in on a Wednesday night and sat inside, part eatery and Sports bar. I liked how each booth had a flat screen but there were flat screens and sofas if you just wanted to relax as if you're at home!  I opted for a booth but had great views of the entire place for decent people watching. I started off with a cold green tea which was flavorless. My waitress who was there physically but mentally absent took my order for BBQ wings , onion rings and the  B.U.B burger. I specifically requested the wings first and others to follow later but within minutes after the wings arrived the other two items appeared. When the waitress returned and I advised her what happened and her reply was the kitchen was caught up!  The food was decent but I was pleased mostly with the wings. The onion rings were too large, under cooked and a few had too much batter. The burger which contained two large slices of beef, bacon bits and contained another slice of bread which I removed. The burger was overcooked and on the dry side. I was ready to order peanut butter ice cream but the absent minded waitress didn't even bother asking if I wanted dessert and just left me my tab. It's ashame an establishment put this much time and money into this business and yet they have such a sad and unmotivated employee interacting directly with clients. I made sure I tipped accordingly which I thought was still generous.  Compared to my first experience outside at the Umami Beer Garden, this was a horrible experience. Such a disappointing dining experience. If I ever returned here, I will make sure and request not to be seated in the area of this waitress!

Photo of Umami Burger -  SLS Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. B.U.B. Burger - massive
Photo of Umami Burger -  SLS Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. BBQ wings

9lY8PiFplf3cYeqLbX8HsQ.text: Well talk about shocked only gets three stars...Or should say not sure why Umami not getting much yelp love except everyone has right too ones opinion. I feel that Umami Burger offer unique experience comes to watching games at a sports book. Trust me use to be one of those sports parley betting addict every weekend. Before realize the house always win. Lol. I can only think of handful of sports book that first off offers food more less quality food not just your normal fried everything bar food. Plus the ones that do offer food usually adjacent or may need to walk some ways get food then bring it back. Not like the sports books are made for food. The chairs made for parley sheet, drink, and sheet write down bets. If in front of small television booth in reality same thing. The thing about Umami literally you just walk up place bet (live betting; that new one for me) and go back too eat, drinking, or talking stories with friends. I came here watch MNF with friends visiting from the 808. I read reviews that need order certain amount on Sunday or on football days in general. Between the three of us ordered everything and the kitchen sink so we were good. We started with truffle fries, nachos, wings, and I had "The Royale Burger".  The truffle fries was Amazing! By far the best truffle fries had in long time. I had the ones at more fancy place like Olives that totally suck compare too Umami. The thing that makes them shine above the rest. The homemade truffle cheese that put over the fries, then add truffle oil on top, and nice hot right out of the fryer. Just the smell is divine. If not fungus person this not the dish for you. But if love cheese fries in general these truffle fries take tradition fries too another level. Rich. The Nachos with the short rib meat on top, fresh guacamole (one of the better ones had in town), jalapeno, fresh cilantro sprigs, and the chips. The CHIPS tell fresh chips nice thick corn ones. I could have just eaten chips and salsa whole game be content in life. Me my pet peeves with Nachos like mound of stuff on top but think excess not always better. I love the fact that really had the right amount that none of the chips got completely drowned by the topping that the chips on the bottom bottom still has the crispy crunch. The chicken wings we had six an six. Those were ok nothing really memorable about them.   The "Royale" Burger talk about gourmet burger! This one rivals any of the top gourmet burger joints in Vegas. I can honestly say hit the full list from Gordan, Bobby, Burger Bar, Holstein, Fuku, Bachi, and the only one missing is Guy. The thing I love is the combination of all the flavors. It heavy burger with lots of meat! The burger, short ribs on top, then got truffle cheese, and believe might put hint of truffle oil top it off. Messy burger. Those are the best one that all the good stuff comes out with every bite and gets all over your hands. The "U" on top of all the burger that nice touch that definitely  Umami style. The burger buns are on point. Few more reading description that need get me some next visit.   The service was five star for me!!!! Our server was on it. This was on FOOTBALL day or say MNF. Our server was friendly and during the game on it making sure never empty on our beers. Since first timers all around answered all our questions.   If one thing that had issue. Maybe only had one hostess working that night. Not sure if we sit ourselves down or go hostess stand get seated no sign. From the outside looks more like lounge then restaurant restaurant. I never checked out the Beer Garden.   Umami Burger is awesome. I look forward too trying more of the burgers next time.

Photo of Umami Burger -  SLS Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Short rib Nachos
Photo of Umami Burger -  SLS Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Royale Burger

Xy6wvtrs7i3OHsmZsUycfg.text: This is not my first time at Umami, but this was my first time at this location. My first Umami experience was at The Camp in the OC.  I wasn't impressed with the service, the wait, and my burger at the OC location. At the time, I thought Umami was just over-hyped.  After my experience at this location, I'm convinced...I know Umami is over-hyped.    Let's start with service. We arrived around 1:40 PM on a busy football Sunday.  We were fortunate to get seated right away.  Our orders were taken fairly quick and our waitress was attentive. The service and the wait at this location is 10 times better than the location in Orange County.  I just think we got lucky and had a good waitress.  The guests seating directly behind us weren't so fortunate. I noticed that no one was attending to them. After about 10 minutes, they left.    This Umami was packed with enough TV screens that there's no chance of missing any football action.  There's even a sports book right inside Umami.  If you're a fan of William Hill's Sports Betting, then you'll love the ambiance here.  I didn't place any bets because most of the afternoon football action was already closed.  Good for me. That also means I didn't lose a cent.    I thought that the food was less than average. We started out with their Smothered Fries, which is their thin fries covered with braised short ribs.  This wasn't bad, the burger on the other hand, was. If you've been to Umami, then you know that their burgers look better than they taste.  First of all, Umami uses a thick or high bun.  The bun alone is about 4 inches high. I think this is done intentionally to compensate for a weak burger patty.  I got the B.U.B, which is supposed to be 12 oz.  For a 12 oz burger, it was small, exceedingly greasy, and lacked taste.  The burger is so greasy and the bun so soggy from the grease that you're almost forced to eat your burger quick.  Otherwise, your burger will turn into an open face burger.  Yes, it gets all over the place. I wasn't impressed with Umami. I wasn't impressed at all.  Overall, I was disappointed with the food at Umami's.  The only reason this Umami gets 3 stars from me is because of their sports book and game day TV screens.

Wt6QIlfJxT61-idd8-qDTg.text: Just like pizza... burgers are all burgers to me. Aside from bachi burger they all taste the same!! UNTIL UMAMI. My server was SUNNY. MAKE SURE YOU ASK FOR HIM.. you'll thank me later. The sunny burger, truffle fries HOLY GOODNESS and I can't remember the name of the cocktail but mandarin something with a jalapeno undertone which was actually AMAZING.   UMAMI IS DEFINITELY THE NEW BURGER PLACE IN TOWN

L4hG2Eaqq4OkilvJFU5WJA.text: 45 minutes to finally greet me and take my order. Another 30 to make a burger. And it wasn't even a very busy time.  Burgers disappointed me compared to the hype as well.

vaZxvz3brTCHRge4_uExOg.text: I wanted to know what the addition of Unami  ingredients would enhance or compete with the beef.  After a couple of minutes the wet ingredients overcame the dry bun so I ended up eating it with a fork and knife.  Each ingredient was highly tasteful; portobello mushroom tomatoes carbonized onions and the parmesan"Frico" were knockouts.   What I missed was my idea of a burger:. Something I can hold in my hands and get a great burger taste, maybe with cheese.  What I got at Unami was almost a burger and a bunch of ingredients that didn't help the meat even t though they were good.  The burger itself was not hand made and I think that it did not have enough air in the ground meat which led to a tougher bite.   Overall it's good if you want to go for an alternative to the traditional burger.  At $14 I don't think I'd come back

IwCMbhWzt8-q-dqsm-dNGw.text: We stayed at the SLS and decided to try Umami after arriving from the airport and checking in. We were extremely tired from a day of traveling (I was practically closing my eyes at the table), and we were super hungry...so a burger sounded great. The restaurant was pretty much quiet and dead, but it was a Sunday night. I think we were one of five tables there.   We had a coupon from the hotel desk for a free appetizer, and I asked if there were any exclusions, and the waitress was a little snippy. My boyfriend ordered the Truffle Burger (she asked how he wanted it cooked, and he said medium) and I ordered the Greenbird, which is a turkey burger instead of beef.   My boyfriend took a couple bites into his burger and I could see on his face that something was wrong. This thing was super rare...way more undercooked than he anticipated. We're never ones to really complain about things, but he pointed it out when the waitress came back to check on us. She was kind of rude and seemed oddly confused about it. She just stared at him and said "well OUR medium HERE is red like that." He always orders medium, so clearly this place must do things differently, or the burger wasn't cooked long enough in the kitchen. He asked for a replacement burger cooked medium-well so that he'd at least be able to enjoy his $14 burger. When she brought it out, her attitude was a little better and she apologized a few times. Her words were "sorry guys, that was my fault" which caught our attention, because we didn't exactly get what THAT meant after all that trouble...  She also noticed my boyfriend's empty water and said "oh...I'll get you more water" but never came back for the duration of our meal, except for dropping off the check. (Like I said, it was not busy at all in there).   My turkey burger was also a little pink, which I didn't expect for poultry...but I honestly scarfed it down in like 2 seconds and was too tired to care. It probably shouldn't have been that pink. The greenbird is definitely a tasty burger though.

8uPbBYMNiQqQmTXBbutrkA.text: We stayed at the SLS last week and decided to try Umami our last day there.  I got the Cali burger which was really good, until it became soggy and I had to eat it with a fork.  Something about the tomato just threw me "off".  The sauce that they put on it was very tasty.  Not entirely certain what it was, but it was yummy.  We also ordered the Umami burger, which was very good (so I hear, as I don't do mushrooms).  To top it off we ordered the sweet potato fries to share.  They were good but the brown sugar threw me off again.  All in all, we would visit again if ever at the SLS, however I wouldn't make a special trip for it.   Service was good, not horrible but not great either.  The place was not super busy and they were still just opening, so I understand some confusion.  All we ordered was water due to it being 116 outside and having a plane to catch.

qIY7Ko-W95clVoMSQw7Jhw.text: I have to admit, I did not know anything about this place and I am glad I stopped by. I had the Chicken Cordon Bleu sandwich and it was very good! By the way, pleas ask for AJ, she is a good waitress.

24iejXIh4i1M4-FFgUqbnw.text: I am so sad writing this review, because I truly loved Umami Burger in Japan. The overall quality of these burgers were ok compared to the one in Japan. The burger itself was a little dry and the flavor wasn't as rich and indulgent, especially for the price we were paying.   On a brighter note, the drink list is pretty extensive and there is a sports book with a bunch of tv's.   Umami is tucked in a corner on the casino floor of the SLS Resort on the very north end of the Las Vegas Strip   We came here on a Friday and there was absolutely no line and very few guests dining. (Should have been an indicator)   All in all the burger experience was mediocre and would have gladly gone to in and out instead.

photos.caption: Photo of Umami Burger -  SLS Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States

fiwcMHcFgdHZV9RZizBmWg.text: This place was soo yummy and amazing service!!! They sat us right down and our food came to us very quickly! Our server was so sweet and nice! I highly recommend this yummy place!!

v76OcSCMvc1O6F9w7hsU7g.text: I wasn't happy with the bar service on several past visits, but since you have Liz serving what a great improvement! Because of her, I am visiting again. I'm a local who spends most of my free time on the strip. Love to visit my favorite sport bars, have some great food, place bets, game and have a few cocktails.   This property had it all except the great service.. Liz has changed that and I am happy to visit again.  Now here is where there is a problem. My last visit on Thursday.. how can you get rid of the special sauces for the burgers???? Isn't that part of the Umami burger experience? Jalapeno ranch.. gone! Aioli.. gone!!! Urggg.. I ordered fries just to dip in the Jalapeno ranch and what I got was' bottled' ranch... yuck! Please bring these back... I hate to know you corrected the service and now have missing special sauces. A few other patrons at the bar share my same opinion. I thought I'd wright this review on behalf of them too!

PRYJqFaR8UT5qegPY6tGKw.text: We took the monorail all the way to the last stop and ended up at SLS. Since we wanted a snack and a drink we ended up at Umami Burger.   Ordered the Hatch which come with Roasted hatch chilies and a roasted garlic aioli. I split it with my husband but wished I could have eaten the whole thing. It was yummy with a capital Y.   We also had the truffle fries. Truffly cheesey goodness!   I also had the velvet mule. It was a great take on a Moscow Mule with blackberries.   All in all a great afternoon treat!  I know they say what happens in Vegas stays in Vegas but this place deserves a shout out!

KW87YRwAvyUuemCwRaDCZQ.text: Very disappointing. Forgot our appetizer. Chicken in the salad and nachos was tasteless, any McDonalds would have provided the Big Mac equivalent wit better taste and at 1/5 the price. Nicest part- watching a football game on their screen. Summary- walk to the nearest McDonald around the corner and get as good a hamburger. Take it home and watch the football game at home. With the savings take your honey to the movies and to a better restaurant than this one.

Nw49uiRdyHP-ehpMHRecwQ.text: Was here on Sunday with 14+ friends - really good tv coverage - food was good - staff tried really hard but very busy.  Would go back - probably with fewer peoole.

fpo4gC5M2ikH1eTwtqwRyg.text: I haven't been here in about a year, but I've been craving this burger since the last time I was here. I had the Ahi tuna burger, I have it every time I've been to Umami burger and it never disappoints. I also ordered a side of their sweet potato fries which taste amazing with the sauces they offer. They actually taste good with or without sauce. For dessert I had the Frank Berry strawberry, which is an ice cream sandwich made with snickerdoodles and strawberry ice cream. It was just the right size for myself. I didn't feel too full or like I didn't get enough. I'll be back soon, I won't wait a whole year this time.

BMSk9baf1qBlxB9ckYSEaw.text: Walked into the restaurant at 8:20 pm on a Sunday and the Beer Garden was closed. So, that was annoying but the hostess told us we could sit at one of their couches and that actually was really cool and comfortable. However, we walked out of the restaurant at 8:52 pm.   The restaurant was not busy, maybe six tables all together. 10 minutes passed and two tables were sat after us and acknowledged by a server. So, we waited another 5 minutes and still no acknowledgement. I advised the bartender and hostess, they said they would send someone over and apologized. So, now it's 8:35 and it has been 15 minutes... not even a glass of water or a hello.   Finally, we waited and we saw a waitress come out, she walked right passed us, and went to another table that just sat down. At that point I was done... we sat there in an empty restaurant for over 30 minutes and we were not acknowledged once by any server.   We got up and walked out, and we will never be back. I have been to the restaurant dozens of times, and their beer garden was one of our favorite local spots. Well, not anymore.

IBsajiSJHscQASpbKiN6pA.text: Pretty tiny burger for $15, doesn't come with any sides. Umami burger taste was good but missing that extra kick. Just one mushroom on the whole burger just wasn't enough. That crispy cheese thing was rock hard and didn't make sense, I pulled it off. Nice atmosphere in here but did seem a little understaffed. Wouldn't go back unless if just for a drink.

VkppoHBCcv8d7wnjjV9OZQ.text: The absolute best burger and service ! The manager: Tony Penniman recommended the Cali Burger and I'm so happy I did . He made my first experience here at Umami one to remember I will  Definitely be back... I highly recommend ! Thanks Tony !!

gvm_DXYtflWJ-QaB1pDtyA.text: I was pretty satisfied with my experience at umami. The atmosphere of this bar was awesome. I was there during the NCAA tournament which made it even more fun. The crowd was really into the games, they were very upbeat and excited to be able to watch the games on multiple tvs while placing bets without having to be at the sports book.  Also the food was pretty good. I ordered the green bird which was a turkey patty with avocado and it was great! Very tasty, perfectly cooked. I added some truffle fries to my meal and I was pretty happy with them.  They offer several options for their skinny fries: the garlic fries, the truffle fries (probably the better option) and the sweet potatoes fries. They also carry a good selection of bar food in case you do not feel like eating a burger. Overall, a good place to watch sports, place some bets and enjoy good food!

Photo of Umami Burger -  SLS Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Wanna watch the NCAA tournament?? Tons of screens here

M-kj0VVSnTrgbeTipwZmCg.text: Great spot for a bite and a beer.  Inside the SLS and also has a strip street dining for cooler days.  There's more than just burgers here,  and They have any amazing beer list.  I would recommended this place for a group,  or for mixed company because there's a little bit of something for everybody.  Service was great and food is on point!

TC2o1WyLXh6fEhgLB9dqsA.text: We have been here a few times, overall this is the absolute best place to be on Sundays for football. Sometimes the service waivers, it is a busy place during the games. The food is always great, we havent tried the $25 ayce yet. Shishito peppers are fun if you're into spicy but not overwhelmingly so. I love the brussel sprouts, once they were a bit soggy and undercooked, regardless the flavor is amazing, definitely on the sweet side. We had an issue with our reservation but management did an awesome job correcting it.

wSKSjcSxj06vfS2bofmozw.text: Try the brussel sprouts! And the maple bacon fries. And the burgers. And... Just everything!  Sarah was our server and she was super friendly and prompt. We chose to split a burger, fries and appetizer and were not disappointed! It was more than enough food for us two foodies and we were very happy with the price, expecting a much higher bill than what we received.

CZ6h4XTiTae-5chf89WdkA.text: We had an amazing experience at umami today the food was on point, complements to the chef,the service was the best I've ever had thank you Liz!! I highly recommend umami.the manly burger is my fav, Looooveeeee the bacon !

8PoDyUAB6KtktIvsYu6R9Q.text: Second time going to Umami Burger and I haven't been disappointed! Tried something different both times.  Awesome place and resinable price.  Also the ketchup is GREAT!!

5htREB2HCq_TDYKsrtB_sA.text: Over priced Over hyped burger  $18 Fries not include , really? Expect snotty waitresses The staff seems to believe the hype about this place  Lol Save ur money, really !

Ko7VnjC-5-IjE6QcUaLqXg.text: They brought a great burger and service felt prompt and polite.  Environment was comfortable and seating was comfy.  Got seated pretty quick.

Ca_R9X4KePnifYoBqYr2Vw.text: Excellent service from Mandy.  I loved my Impossible Burger and my husband loved the Manly.  Beet salad dressing too sweet, but all else was A +

xvjaAdQgRkqmHhzwex0Z8Q.text: Haven't been here in a while. Forgot how good it was! We started with the Cheese sticks and Cauliflower. Both were good. Main course was the Cali burger with French fries and onion rings. Which were both very good. Our server Mandy was awesome and gave great recommendations. I would Highly recommend this place!!

FB_D6jXu3wW8-7ftwxLTUw.text: I can't explain how much I love Umami Burger. I first discovered it in California, and was so surprised to see it was in my hotel!  It's set in a sports bar, which is cool to have tvs to watch while dining. I of course got the fries and truffle burger; all excellent!

photos.caption: Photo of Umami Burger -  SLS Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Everything is so good!

YgA3uWZAXkdCqV_hsL5uMw.text: Umami Burger a deep step below most craft establishments. Although the truffle fries were very good the burger was dry and flavorless. The worst aspect was the lack of professional service. I ate at the bar since I was alone....and waited for 15 minutes for one of the two bartenders to acknowledge me. After ordering it took 20 minutes for the food to arrive. Part of the problem was the two bartenders having to make drinks for the full bar and for the table waitstaff. The place was jammed and management should have provided more staff. Prices were excessive but then it's Vegas, where everything is overvalued.

TZfvIqBUPoBawm_thEYCpw.text: I don't follow a vegan meal plan but if I did, I'd eat here DAILY. I first had the impossible burger in LA and mentioned to our group we had to try it out in Vegas. 10/10 hands down. We had a friendly server Liz who went above and beyond. She let us sample a few beers based on our preferences and she  kept our drinks full and had us laughing the night away.    Back to my favorite part, Liz put in the order for the impossible burgers and added truffle style. Again, I was incredibly surprised that it wasn't beef! Literally, the best burger on the planet.   Lastly, I'm so glad we came to this location. We had great service, delicious food, and will recommend it to everyone we know visiting Vegas.

XERRZDNQkzyoDdOetJwi8g.text: This place is rated four stars. I'll give it another shot next time I'm in town but I didn't get a four star experience. It wasn't a super busy night. I ordered the manly burger. It had onion straws, bacon and cheddar. I asked for it medium. It came out very well done and had American cheese on it. I realllly don't like American cheese but I couldn't tell it wasn't cheddar till about two or three bites in I was wondering why it tasted like plastic. So I didn't send it back. Also, make no mistake, this is a sports bar. It is not quiet. It is not pub-like. It's loud and there's tv's and sports fans everywhere. Also totally fine if you know what you're getting. But I thought it was a gourmet burger place. My mistake.

ptj9d_nzp7HJktYkiDCm8w.text: Having chicken loaded nachos tortilla chips chicken breast black olives house beer cheddar avocado salsa and cream. No to jalapenos. $13.95 alittle too much for its size, should be alittle under $10, had cut pieces of chicken...maybe less than half cup of chicken breast. And had a sunny side $14.95 Parmesan frivolity fried egg truffle thyme butter truffled arugula and truffled aioli burger. We will see how scrumptious these are. Enjoyed the burger more than the nachos. The fries were thin, alittle hot, alittle salty but the sweet waitress gave me ketchup, ranch, scirrachi and aioli sauce, making them very tasty...but it's leaving my tongue with an inflammation.

1nkMLCWrHuMmGCXpX4WUyw.text: If you're a burger fanatic, you must try Umami! Though it is somewhat pricey for the small portions, the quality of each burger is fantastic. My favorite would be the hatch burger since there is a little spice to it. The homemade ketchup makes a difference for the burgers and the fries as well.

N_1miBpHSgT7P0QUYRinQQ.text: Umami Burger is super accessible within the SLS Las Vegas with plenty of parking. Their garage is huge and I can almost guarantee you'll find a spot.   Umami itself has a really open feeling and lots of TVs. You'll get lost in many sporting events here. The patio is calling my name and I can't wait until the fall to enjoy some cold ones.   The food menu is somewhat small, with a few salads and burgers but their beer list is ginormous. Seriously though. It's 3/4 of their entire menu. Awesome. Pour me a cold one!   Our server was awesome. There were 6 of us and he rattled our orders back to us without writing a thing down. I ordered the Truffle Burger, lettuce wrapped and the plain fries. He asked me what temperature I wanted the burger cooked and I requested medium. The fries are shoestring and I'm a steak fries kind of girl, but they were fries and they tend to be good no matter how large or small. This batch was a bit saltier than I prefer, but I still managed to finish the whole batch. The burger was cooked on the med-rare side, so although it wasn't hitting the spot, I was starving and finished it without complaint.

photos.caption: Photo of Umami Burger -  SLS Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lettuce Wrapped Truffle Burger

rWCCszyQxQ2-IQLea8ViDw.text: I'm not a huge fan of burgers to begin with so that's that.   I like the size of the burgers because they're all humongous but they get you full. I like the size of the restaurant and how many tvs there are. literally a TV on every table so good if you're a sports fan this would be the perfect place. We stayed at the SLS hotel and deff wanted some food in our system before we continued getting our drank on (based on prior experience)   We got one order of the normal fries and another order of the fries with cheese on it. * Don't get the cheese on it. The fries are super skinny.  my boyf loved his California burger and I got the burger with the sliced green peppers I think it was in it. My brothers fiance I'm not sure which one she got she complained about how soggy it was because she added guacamole in it but I mean she finished it soo I'm sure it wasn't too bad. Id come again.

ESjGyAIY8coZXdxRFa1GUA.text: Fast and friendly service, clean restaurant and lively atmosphere.. it was my first time here my waitress Rhitzee was sweet,attentive and helpful she helped me figure out this new check in thing on yelp with the pictures. Ordered the Umami burger with chicken breast, Truffle burger and Truffle fries.  The chicken in the Umami burger was nice and juicy and all the ingredients blended together very well. The Truffle burger was tender,savory and juicy as well all the ingredients seem to compliment each other. The Truffle fries were great too food came out after about 15 minutes and was hot.  Only deducting one star because the portion sizes are kinda small and I thought it would've been similar to say like slaters where you could create your own burger but it wasn't really like that. nonetheless was good and would definitely recommend !

CybLMixJLC0vIZ-mMV0jPg.text: I live across the street at Sky Condos and I walk over to Umami Burger once in awhile the service is pretty good burgers are always pretty good. Tonight was really good my server KC was really good and helpful but most of all she was very helpful and cheerful. Instead of coming to Umami once in awhile I will try to come at least once a week. Thank you KC for a great experience.

1zqRf6uaEusMko_RpFD6Kw.text: After a long flight from Atlanta GA and checking in at the hotel (SLS) we went to have dinner in one of the restaurants. We chose Umami Burger, I had high expectations because of the reviews but really this place is not worth it. My husband ordered a Sunny and I ordered an Umami, meat was dry and overcooked ( in both burgers). We liked the fries and my daughter chicken tenders were ok. I'm sorry but this place is too expensive for a dry and overcooked burger.

4SJdDQwmAst85rPtcDuARA.text: More of a review of the Beer Garden located within Umami Burger.  Good spot to watch a game, place some bets at the attached sports book, and enjoy a cold beer.  For a beer garden the tap selection is underwhelming though but an overall decent selection of brews.  They have some outdoor seating if you feel like melting to death in the 100 degree temps. I preferred sitting inside with the cold air conditioning and multiple screens to view all the sports. Plus, the booths have their own tv's too. Video poker at the bar area.  Just had a beer here so I can't comment on the food, but my brew was chill, the service was good, and the Stanley Cup playoff game was on. Life is good.

sKdzfu1prU-JSzcnPzrFKQ.text: We enjoyed our Umami original burgers along with truffle fries that came with two types of sauces and our peanut butter ice cream sandwiches.  Service was friendly and helpful, plus Umami was one of the few restaurants open on SLS on a Tuesday evening.  If you are a sports fan, they have plenty of TV screens of every ball game going on at the moment.  They have a beer garden in the back and a full bar at the front.  Look for Umami coupons in the hotel booklets.
