u-3_yj6ahhpfM0_nZxqZ8A.text: When I was walking around the SLS Las Vegas Hotel while waiting for my hotel room, I was ecstatic to try out the Umami Burger restaurant. I sat inside near the bar on my first visit. Their alcoholic beverage menu had more items than the food menu. The first burger I tried during my first visit was the Throwback burger with two beef patties, white cheddar cheese, miso mustard, Umami house ketchup, soy pickles, and minced onions. I also had sweet potato fries on the side. Let me tell you, I was amazed with the Throwback burger that I literally wanted to order another one, but I was too full. It was juicy, not too salty, and a tad bit tangy. The sweet potato fries tasted more like cinnamon, which I did not mind.  My second visit to Umami was on the second day of my stay at the SLS. This time around, I asked for outdoor seating since I was in a group with five other people. I ordered the Truffle burger with truffled aioli, house truffle cheese and truffle glaze and a side of truffle fries. Out. Of. This. World.  My last visit was on the fourth day, in which I ordered the Sunny Side with parmesan frico, fried egg, some butter, a hefty amount of arugula, and truffled aioli as well as a side of sweet potato fries. The Sunny Side burger wasn't the greatest for me. It tasted more like an arugula salad than a burger. The sweet potato fries were great anyway.  The service at Umami in the SLS Las Vegas was outstanding. I even used the complimentary ice cream sandwich coupon from the coupon book that held my room key and tried the Peanut Butter Double Chocolate ice cream sandwich. Sweet and salty amazingness.  I'm just so glad that there are two Umami Burger restaurants in San Francisco. I just checked their menu and there is a wider variety than the menu at the SLS. Score!

photos.caption: Photo of Umami Burger -  SLS Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Truffle Burger with truffled aioli, house truffle cheese, and truffle glaze. Juicy, slightly sweet and salty.

MAIX8xP-xkW2Dzbioc9zkg.text: Burgers were ok; nothing special. Service was so, so, soooo slow. Then it took 30mins to get the check. I wouldn't recommend it.

Yo28eQp1LRoLMhiXSSchvg.text: Wonderful experience, we weren't sure what would be open in the middle of the night but I am so glad we ended up here, delicious drinks, burgers, and dessert. Jessica was extremely hospitable as well as the bar tender on staff. Would recommend as a must in vegas.

v48Xm4-U18AoPi821zMWLw.text: Uhmm I had previously been here with my BF, and we had a very good meal, chicken wings and tots included. Come in here today with my family today and the wings are off the menu and the tots as well. This is a sports bar-how are you going to take the wings off the menu?!!!!!

suVmO_JgjWwxW0AOBOSySQ.text: Service was great. Had a great waitress, very attentive. Food was lackluster. For Vegas fare I was really expecting a wow burger. The boyfriend ordered the Umami Burger. It lacked seasoning. I ordered the Manly Burger and it was decent. Again not the wow factor I was expecting for a spot that claims they won best burger in vegas. Big pet peeve they charged $1 for lettuce and ano$1

cUomvuQx1H4V39KIH2gzQQ.text: Umami fans in SoCal should know the drill here for the most part - for everyone else, Umami is a decent burger place that has some unique little spins although the menu doesn't seem to have really innovated all that much from many years past with a taste that is just okay.     The restaurant is primarily a beer/burger place with some side options like salads and such.  If you're staying at the SLS, make sure to bring down the coupon book in case they do have some interesting options for food (like free ice cream sandwiches).    Burger-wise, I tried the Ahi Tuna burger.  Presentation was fine.  The taste was simply okay.  The burger oddly didn't have much flavor although it had a ton of ingredients on it.  My friend said he enjoyed his onion rings and truffle fries along with their unique slightly spiced ketchup.  The ice cream sandwiches weren't bad but nothing too special.  Also had the beet salad side which was surprisingly big.  Didn't like the flavor very much this go-around for some reason though.  Prices will vary about $8-$15 per item.    They have a regular beer/bar menu with a sorta-extensive beer list.  Surprised that the beer flight was limited to just a few of the core beers that included such not-so-great examples like Coor's and Bud.  They do have specialty beers at the very least which is worth checking out if you like it.  They also have a bar area with video poker.    Decor-wise, you're looking at a very sports/bar setting.  They seem to have a beer garden in the back although when I was there, no one was around that outer area so we stayed indoors which had plenty of seating and tons of TV's.    I'm personally surprised it closes at 11PM - being a beer garden/sports bar in a Vegas location.  Perhaps it's with the lack of a crowd at night but feel that it's a restaurant/bar that should be open much later - especially for the late munchies crowd.    In the end, I'd give the restaurant about a 3 1/2 stars.  It's not bad by any means and hasn't lost much in the transition to the Las Vegas.  It just doesn't seem to have evolved much in its taste and even lacks a little bit in the wow/taste factor.

UyZwQL0KBvqVK-S8vgfSXQ.text: One of my fav burger places in LA finally made it to Vegas! Unlike many of the LA restaurants, this Umami burger is also a sports bar and beer garden.  There is usually plenty of seating unless there is a big game on. We've been here twice already and the burgers/fries are so consistently well executed. I'm not a huge fan of truffle fries, so I usually get the regular thin fries and Umami burger. The size of the burger is on the smaller side, but it is very filling especially with fries and a beer on the side.  This Umami burger is located in the SLS hotel, and they offer both valet and self parking. I would definitely recommend the burgers here for anyone looking for a casual dining restaurant!

72zZULIwhumKSXVKH00QHQ.text: I went to Umami for their NFL kickoff party! It was very busy but the hostess quickly accommodated my husband and I and seated us in the beer garden outside. There were 12 TV's outside that I saw, a lengthy bar area, and some table games as well. I would definitely recommend eating outside; however, they raised the window shades halfway through our meal which in turn raised the temperature about 10 degrees. Keep the shades down guys! The view isn't worth it unless you like looking at trashy souvenir shops.   I only tried the sliders and sweet potato fries (because they were free for the party!) but both were delicious. However, the Pepsi I ordered was very watered down and the menu was very basic with little variety at all.   I was impressed with the good service! Our waitress Rachel was juggling several rowdy tables but made sure to bring over drink refills and ask if we needed anything else. She had a huge smile as well. Take note, management! She deserves her tips tonight.   Overall, I enjoyed the kickoff party, food specials, and the football atmosphere but wouldn't return on a regular night.

jiB5po5BY7DxIMREN879dA.text: The dining area is pretty large with lots of TV's to keep up on what ever sport that is in season. There's a Beer Garden patio off the dining room if you wish to sit outside. Lot's of beer to choose from. Staff was friendly. I was lucky enough to try The Hatch burger, I wouldn't of picked this burger if the menu was presented to me. But after I've tried it, I'd get it again. The burger itself isn't huge but it was plenty flavorful and juicy.  I'm looking forward to coming back to Umami Burger and trying more of their fare.

xW-mQFDEERvLhS1Bf2or3Q.text: Food is great! Love the indoor Outdoor area. Staff was polite and great attitude. Enjoyed our meal, the ambiance and the game!

rXGRwKus-QqiAr3j9TgLEA.text: Still the best burger Ive ever had. And Ive been to two locations.  Mmmmmm. Buuurrrgggeeerrrr. Aaaahhhhhhh (in my Homer Simpson voice)

IVZp42bvQlWhvZVhpCnaQg.text: Little disappointed with size of burger.  Med  was rare- and who doesn't know what cave man style is ?  I wanted a BURGER and I got a burger.

DElyJnZzqVfXqQ1G0DLsGA.text: I had the pleasure of getting an invite to a private party here at Umami Burger, SLS where I was treated to comp burgers, fries, drinks, and dessert and it was OUTSTANDING.  Thanks so much to TouchTunes for throwing an awesome party and inviting me to come!  I have eaten at an Umami burger before and liked it and this time, I happened to get a truffle burger as the tray was passing by and it was so delicious.  Sometimes things covered in truffle oil can just be overwhelming and more hype than yum, but this burger was mouth-wateringly fantastic.  I paired it with some of their sweet potato fries which are sweet AND salty and thus, deliciously flavorful - hm.  Umami?  Luckily for us, they also brought out some of their signature ice cream sandwiches and we got to try each.  I liked them, but my first one was the best, chocolate cookie with peanut butter ice cream.  By the end, the cookie parts were getting a little soggy for my taste.  Overall an AMAZING experience and the people working the party and wandering around with trays of tasty treats were so polite and friendly, we really felt like we were at a friend's party.  A few days later, we found ourselves BACK at Umami Burger.  We were looking for somewhere to watch the Nascar race and I remembered that Umami Burger is also connected to the sports book at SLS and is filled with televisions everywhere.  Because it was the March Madness semi finals, I was worried about where to go, but no worries, we were able to get into a booth at Umami and have our private television in the booth tuned to the Nascar race.  Of course, no sound, but at least we were right up close and personal and could see all of the racing action.  Since we'd done burgers and fries, we decided to try some of the other fair offered and the husband ordered buffalo wings and I had the nachos (sans beans).  The nachos come with braised pot roast on them and it's really good.  I enjoyed the nachos very much... only thing that would have made them better would be MORE CHEESE.  Why are people always stingy with the cheese anyway?  We also ordered the pickle plate which is not pickles at all... well, there are a couple of bites of pickles, but it is a plate of a bunch of different pickled veggies, more of a giardiniera with beets, spicy carrots, peppers, etc.  It was tasty! I also actually ordered one of the ice cream sandwiches (the same one I'd like before), but it was surprisingly soggy like the ones I'd had late in the evening at the party, so I thought that was weird, and disappointing.  I wouldn't recommend the ice cream sandwiches due to that.  We milked a good 3 hours at that table and our server was very gracious, but we kept ordering and I dropped a 25% tip to make up for hogging the table.    Between these two experiences, I definitely recommend Umami burger.  The food is quite tasty and my service experiences were very good.  I'll be back.

7_2J457qtBKKtUukx8I8VQ.text: It's taken me to travel to Vegas to finally try an Umami burger and holy crap I should have done this sooner! The burgers are ammmmaaaaazzzziiing. Ok now that you know how good the burgers are let's talk about the service. Tashja took care of two weary travelers and made us feel at home. Her recommendations were spot on and damnit man I want more!!! Thank you Tashja!!

DMohIXP4BlQj0h_hAFpmcg.text: Best. Service. Ever. Tashja was our server and took super great care of us! Everything she recommended tasted amazing and the food came our very quickly. We were tired after a long day and she really went out of her way to make sure that we had an amazing experience. I will definitely be coming back to try more tasty food!

Nwx_YJeTQoNYcjisPQY8pQ.text: The staff is phenomenal! I suggest if you own a restaurant in Las Vegas to steal the waitresses from this place. I have been there multiple time and always have great service and friendly people.   Only one drawback, Umami Burger's menu is limited and not in a good way, but the staff makes up for it and I give it a 4 star.

xI9JiUb8qh8uxboKPBfyJw.text: Meh. Umami failed to impress. My friends and I came for a late lunch and we all agreed that it wasn't worth it. When we first arrived there was no one at the hostess stand. We could see the guy who was supposed to be seating customers was busy chatting with another co-worker. He then yelled over that he would be over in a minute. We should have just left at this point.   We started off with the truffle fries (which are free if you check in on Yelp). These were very tasty! And the three sauces they were served with were amazing as well. My favorite was the spicy orange one. These fries were the only reason I gave a 2 star rating as opposed to a 1.   Our waitress explained that since their meats are very fresh that the color of the meat may be more red than we are used to. Okay, no problem. I asked that my burger to be cooked medium and there wasn't any redness in the meat at all! It looked more like it was well done....Why give us that warning if all of our burgers came out dry and overcooked?

Great service highly recommend it will definitely be back again!

TORLgftpCYKoAkieJEtrFA.text: Food was great,most of us ordered the truffle burger recommended by our waitress and it was truly delicious! the cali burger ordered by my friend was delicious as well and omg the truffle fries you have to try them! i would skip out on the wings they were a bit cold and just okay

1RV67yy0MUmUPIhnbar8Pg.text: Spent much of the evening outside in the beer garden and Amanda, behind the bar, was great! The beer spot on the North Strip. Came back the next day and had the tuna burger. Amazing. A must have.

c9flVwIZr31n57zAULsY_w.text: The food was less than average. Overpriced. The bun on the burger was stale. The waitress had no knowledge of beer despite this place being promoted as a "Beer Garden". Even with all the IPAs and other brews on site she suggested a Bud Lite as the best pairing for my meal. Worst dining experience in Vegas.

RUV0B2WC0ZA0MLHFUL5oMg.text: Truffle Burger. Amazing. Hidden menu tater tots. Amazing. Great servers and great food. Would definitely come back!

0t_-YCCunVcIKdD-GKu7cw.text: The original Umami burger is the best burger I've ever eaten.  Get a side of nachos, any beer of your choosing, or the truffle beet salad and you're set for a grubulous meal!  The best meal I had on my recent weekender in Vegas.

fsa_wrSt4dOFJ4EjA_tjaw.text: Nicest place to sit and have a beer outside when you're this far North on The Strip.  The Truffle Fries are worth the hype!

jipTQgHhQ-ZZVkszqKO45Q.text: Wanted to try. Food was great! I would like to say we were told by the host the wait would be 45 mins. I looked around and saw 7 empty tables. I guess the manager Jessica overheard me talking to my husband and Jessica got us sat right away. We were served by Micaila, she was an absolute pleasure. Attentive to our needs and smiling every time we saw her. To top off the experience the manager Jessica bought us our wonderful dessert. Kudos Jessica and Micaila!!!

ZqSJRf2jPvpgKa9TV3qJ7A.text: This was probably one of the worst dining experiences I've ever had!  I came here last week with my family while we were on vacation and staying at the SLS; we wanted a quick bite to eat and decided to stop in here since we'd heard good things.  BIG MISTAKE!  My father, husband and I all got food poisoning despite ordering different things.  My husband ordered the original burger, which he received completely charred despite ordering it medium well.  My father ordered the hot dog, and I had the tuna burger; other members of our party ordered other burgers, and we all shared a bunch of the fries.  To be fair, the friend food tasted mostly okay. My tuna burger was inedible; I expected it to be raw in the middle, but it was inexplicably rubbery and tasteless, too.    Needless to say, any positive experiences we had (the service was fine, and the prices weren't horrible for what's around, I guess) were completely negated by the fact that half of our party spent the rest of our vacation throwing up and unable to get out of bed.  We all got sick within hours of eating at Umami burger, and none of us had eaten anything else questionable that day, so we are pretty sure of the culprit.  Totally ruined our stay in Vegas!

f0Df3IeXzx1L9CUgqQLLkg.text: The. BEST. Garlic. Parmesan. Fries. EVER!  I still dream about those fries. We had the truffle fries too, which were good, but I kept going back to those garlic fries.  The burger was pretty darn good too. I especially loved the check in offer of the free fries.  We got the nachos too, which were good, but I wish I had skipped them and just ate my fries and burger.  My Manly burger was just yummy.  Perfection.  I would definitely go back.  It was reasonably priced for the quality of food.

ntO6Y2eNWTZPKyoSiTNLjQ.text: Good burgers, but very poor service! It took over 15min to get our drinks and another 10min to get a hold of server to order food.  Had to ask for ranch and ketchup 3 times to get it. I was expecting better service from a sbe resturant. Managers were trying to help but they need to reconsider new staff. Transaction#9030022(9/12/14)

e_c6SHcwixeGAs39CvwY6w.text: Very good food. Truffle Fries was amazeballs. My boyfriend managed to get a a 2$ glass of Bud Light. Drinks are pretty good. I ordered the Manly Burger. Service was alright. Overall, a very pleasant experience. Will come back for more next time!

GmJUvP9FehfZFKPNx7XSdQ.text: Server was friendly however our food took forever to come even though there were plenty of empty tables (8pm on a Friday night).  Had the Manly burger and Umami burger. Burgers were good but nothing special. Buns were not toasted. Garlic fries were pretty good.

8DREP24QvWHkIndyEeIqHg.text: They changed their menu very recently. They had such good food and selection last time we went. We just left the place after realizing  what they have done to the menu. Reminds me of a place like Gordon Biersch. .. The change is menu killed that place and they never recovered after that.  Not going to Umami again with their new menu choices. Why do companies do it ...?

KCjAw_m3cCPepMMIRfMVIA.text: Mandy was awesome, helpful and she knows her stuff.  Burgers were awesome!   The truffle fries were amazing.  Check in on yelp and get free beer or fries.  Also look online for the menu as there's more on the menu online.  They have a surprise menu that includes cheesy tater tots!  They took things off the menu and if you ask for them, they might still have them. If I cone back to Vegas, I will come back.

9v7bSBqYWWLYXGDITDuhAw.text: Great burgers! Had a sample plate of 3 different types and all were good. The servers were very quick and I had a nice salad too. If you are in the SLS I would check it out for lunch. You can place a bet in the sports book as well.

FQKmve64krFMA-3VTye4IA.text: Went today because locals pay 1/2 price.  I had a reservation.  Got there at 1:15 and there was a wait for tables, but we were seated right away.  Table was horrible.  Inches away from the next diner and to get up, you basically had to walk a block.  So I saw an empty booth and asked to be moved and they did relocate us.  Ordered the Manly's and garlic fries.  My first comment was that the food was not hot.  Burgers seemed that they were probably par cooked and then finished to medium, but it was truly just luke warm.  The fries were not hot at all.  For half price it was just OK.  If I paid full price I would be unhappy.  On the plus side, being that it was super crowded, the service was very good.  Our food order taken quickly, drinks came right out, and food came out very quickly.  But, I don't think I will return.  Fat Choy, just 3 blocks away is leaps and bounds better.

yg5Nvj3QHt7QyCJApIcAqQ.text: I was staying at the SLS for business about a week ago and this was the perfect place to grab a quick bite in the hotel before an event.  When we told the staff we were in a rush and only had 30 minutes they were very accommodating and made sure we were in and out.  A coworker and I split the manly burger & truffle burger , and also got a side of the truffle fries.  Enjoyed everything. I wish I had more time to finish my stout and truffle fries!

nyfJCkIla1NbWhuL5ePxkQ.text: One cool thing about this place is that they brand a U on your burger. But other than that its mediocore

B3tKduprWzxUb9UdMXcfxA.text: Sat at the bar as it was crowded due NCAA football championship game. Burger was ok, but not worth $13. Truffle fries were good. Beer was warm. Waitresses were obnoxious and never left you alone for long until ordered!  Then they wanted to get me a new beer when mine was only half gone, and wanted to take my food before I was done!  Then suddenly when my beer is empty, I couldn't get on to talk to me!  There are better options not far away.

N_uX07H-Y7VV6UHmMbzedQ.text: Great specials. Truffle fries and a burger. $2 Bud light specials during football game on the TV. Plenty of others on tap. Very bright space with couches and room at the bar. Friendly bartender.

Om1shu4OOFjW9Eaz8lm6Dw.text: We so wanted to eat there?  The menu looked awesome.  Was with my wife and we were seated at our first booth.  Filthy.  Food on seats and floors.  Not crumbs!  We asked to be seated at another booth. Not any better.  I wanted a pretzel so we tried a third?  3 strikes your out!  Dirty seats and white dress on wife means we were out the door.   If the seats are dirty what does the kitchen look like. The dumb hostess had no idea.

wid88SpppZQ4F3vs6MRazA.text: One of my favorite burger places in town. I know they are more on the expensive side, but sometimes you get what you pay for. The truffle burger is a delight. Delicious in all the right ways a burger should be. I really should try some of their other burgers, but when you do it this good... It's hard to order anything else.

photos.caption: Photo of Umami Burger -  SLS Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Truffle burger

2XMCYuyLgyeGeam6kBpMDA.text: Wow, the most amazing vegetarian burger I have ever had. Really. Sit at the bar and hopefully Liz will be your bartender/waitress. Great experience. Super friendly service and reasonably priced.

UWJ_MH98_L91HsUT5keAJQ.text: Arrived and was seated swiftly. The wait person was quite nice and very attentive. The kitchen was very slow.  Now, for the food. My medium hamburger was served raw in the centre and had to be sent back. After waiting an extremely long time to be served they obviously rushed the order and undercooked it. But that makes it all the more disappointing, because then I had to wait around again to get a properly cooked burger. (And let's be realistic, unless the meat is cut on the property, hamburger meat needs to be carefully cooked.) The fried pickles were excellent. The onion rings were obviously dropped into a fryer that was too cold since the batter was exceedingly oily and had little flavour and we only ordered them because so many people rave about them, only to find them almost a total disappointment that we didn't even want to eat.  So basically, good server, bad (slow) service caused by the kitchen. Disappointing onion rings and undercooked burger. What a disappointment... recommended by Thrillist, but maybe they haven't been here lately?

UlcHk3Yo-BcHAGz3BNIRjw.text: I cant imagine my life without Umami Burger. Definitely THE premiere 'upper echelon' burger joint... The atmosphere is sporty but refined, the drinks are delicious but affordable, and the service is immediate yet memorable! Carlos was our guy today, and let me tell you, he was one of the best guys I've had serve me in a LONG time! He treated me like I was one of his oldest friends, maybe we haven't talked since graduation, but once we rekindled, it was like a wildfire! He was astonishing both in punctuality and presence... The food - I can't even begin to explain the exquisiteness that they cook up in this Las Vegas staple!   Definitely the greatest experience I've had in this fine city.. and honestly, all thanks to Carlos! Great great great, beyond great!!

BL1_Eh_FDdb8zzjqBmGRNQ.text: Umami Burger has always been  on my top 3 fave burgers. They only opened yesterday but it felt like they were already opened for quite a while! Our server Ben is super friendly and has answered every single question  that we have! If you have kids with you, you will need to stay on the left side because the sports book and bar is on the right.   As for the burgers...they did not disappoint. Perfect as always!   No need to drive to California for an umami burger fix! Will definitely go back to try the exclusive items they have on the menu!

o6b4UEhiz1Q3szOKUZzvTw.text: Classic Umami Burger joint.  Sports bar inside as well.    The burgers here were cooked well even as of opening day.  They had a hard time getting their logistics together but tried really hard.  Really great service here, especially by their manager Rachel, who went over the top for us here.    Get the regular burger, which is what they are known for.  Do medium rare.  It's juicy, slightly salty and tart, with plenty of beefiness.    Good service, good food - place some sports bets.    And thanks Rachel.

MOzpcbCKBxkDTD_UOwV6ow.text: Extremely slow service and it's really. It busy. Menu is very small too. If you want something other than a burger, go somewhere else. This is not the place to be. With so many options in Vegas, I'd skip this one.

PpE44s3-YMeslyA5ufGadQ.text: Superb burger.  One of the best I've had.  I had the Manly burger, cooked perfectly with lardons and exceptional bun.  A bit heavy handed on the salt, but more than worth the price.  I had the lime-hinted pilsner to drink.  The cynic in me expected it'd be too sweet, but was not at all.  The lime hint was as an aftertaste...perfect.  The hostess was surly and seemed as if her face would crack if she smiled.  Oh well.  We're all broken in some way.  I'll be back.

hSLAwTumvthSUJzZ56fdVg.text: I stay In SLS Las Vegas a night. After day I go to umami burger got my brunch.A waiter Carlos he recommends we try a truffle burger and truffle fries .they are yummy!! And waiter Carlos  he do very nice stuff!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Umami Burger -  SLS Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States

W6WfMsa-r7fElg50DHOwaw.text: Another trendy burger joint in an image, fad following Hotel. To say this is another dime a dozen burger joint is spot on.  As a local, and a foodie in Las Vegas I don't usually subscribe to reviews that I read about restaurants until I experienced it myself. Well, apparently the reviews on this place are spot on. All I have to say is save your time and money and go to Bachi burger for a Wagyu burger for the same price as the smaller truffle burger you get here. Minimal flavor, and the portion sizes are very small. Much better quality at Bachi and the truffle fries are much to be desired. Also I could use a little less of the football Mongoloids at the sports bar. If we don't keep them honest they're are just going to keep churning out mediocre burger joints.  I posted the burgers from this restaurant as well as Bachi burger, and you tell me which one looks better.

photos.caption: Photo of Umami Burger -  SLS Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Umami Burger -  SLS Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States

XpLiss86RWk80CesadEg9A.text: I love Umami burgers, I love sports betting, and I love beer gardens. This place does a bad job with all three. I don't know if it's a lack of process controls from corporate, but the burgers just don't compare with the LA locations. They're either overly greasy and raw..or burnt to a crisp. The sports book is small, the odds board is just a couple of flat screens, and as far as I know they don't give out drink tickets for placed bets. The beer menu is pretty limited for being a "beer garden." The LA locations usually only have 5 draft beers, but at least they are interesting craft selections. And don't get me started on the required minimums to sit down at a table. My group was told that we would have to commit to spending $100 a person in order to be seated. That's a lot of burgers and booze! We refused and they seated us anyway...go figure!  On a separate note, review your bill and credit card bill carefully if you choose to eat here. I don't know if its willful fraud or just lots of billing mistakes in their favor, but I have had overbilling problems at multiple Umami burgers. In previous experience, the Hermosa Beach location billed my card twice on two separate days for the same meal. It took multiple calls and a Visa chargeback to fix the situation. During my visit to Umami Las Vegas, we tried to split a $170 bill (tip included) on 3 credit cards. Each card was charged $90. When we complained to the manager, he claimed that it was a typo and that the waitress had meant to type $60 per person. We signed and left....but just to be clear $60 x 3 does not equal $170.  I like the concept of a restaurant branded sportsbook. I just don't like this one. I'm gonna spend my time at traditional sportsbooks, where I get to watch games with free drinks rather than get overcharged for already overpriced ones.

nJRzks43FhNgKg-RmnTT6A.text: Visited on 8/25/2014  Food: Had the Sloppy Mami. Very delicious vegan burger, although I could have done with a bit less of the onion strings on the burger. Still great. Also received numerous sauces that were all delicious. The waitress did not mind explaining to us what each sauce was again after we forgot the first time.  Service: Our waitress was excellent. She was very friendly, knowledgeable and was very eager to answer any questions we had about the menu.  Decor: Restaurant was very open, with tons of TVs to watch any channel we wanted. We even had our own TV for our booth, which is really nice. The place was also very clean.

photos.caption: Photo of Umami Burger -  SLS Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Sloppy Mami

gpjgSvOGsMslqrFs1TYpwA.text: Umami Burger was very good. Went there for the local Sunday deal and had a great lunch.  I had the Truffle Especial burger and the wife had the Hatch burger because she is from New Mexico. We also order the Umami dog for our daughter, along with everything we order the Onion Rings and Truffle fries.   The burgers were very good the dog was nothing special but good. The Truffle fries were amazing the Onion Rings were good just had some uncooked batter on them still very little but still there.  Pepsi was served in the glass bottles which was cool. The whole place looks great very cool and comfy food was great service was amazing and the local deal was awesome. I will return with like everybody I know.

vuD4GPQdqAJVqoWoZfFfXQ.text: After a long day I was craving a gourmet burger and heard about this place so I decided to give it a try. When I walked in I immediately felt a good vibe and I was not disappointed. I ordered the Hatch burger and it was truly one of a kind. The patty was juicy and filled with Hatch chile flavor. I hadn't had a burger this good in a very long time. I will definitely be returning. Shout out to the staff who was super friendly and very accommodating (hold this ingredient and add that). I am very picky and the staff was attentive to my needs. All in all a very good meal and customer experience. I'll be baaaaaaaaack!

Burger was less than average and priced way too high for the cheap quality and lack of taste. I gave them 2 stars because their customer service was awesome but other than that it would be only a 1 star.

X4pNADI_3UCp43Ocs3UhQg.text: I love the great customer service they offered. Carlos the waiter was excellent! The food came out in a timely manner and it was hot and fresh. If you visit Las Vegas,  make sure you come here!

The avocado fell out but the burger tasty. The truffle fries were the best but the regular fries came in a close second. The atmosphere is designed for watching the game and drinking beer. The chicken fingers were dry and heavily breaded, truffle fries were too saucy, and the burger needed more flavor. The prices for the food and drinks and were too high. Wasnt worth it. The atmosphere was great though. Its a sports book/bar/restaurant in one. There were TVs everywhere with sound. A good place for watching games. I would come back again but not for the food.

vNOdedAfNYpoxjtFpZdYDQ.text: This restaurant has no right to name itself "umami" at all. Please change the name asap. I have dined a few times at LAX location of the same chain restaurant and found their burgers some what "interesting" and don't mind to try them everyone going through LAX. However, the one here in Las Vegas was terrible. Taste is bad, service is bad, and ........  Raw meat in bans are served and don't have any taste to it but just weird feeling to my teeth. I stop eating and waiting for any server to come by. ........ Well, no one come by for another 10 minutes so I decide to leave because I needed to go you know where....... I came back to pay for it but.......

Qlp-0tZ_nYVO2eKkqnq01Q.text: Come on, Yelpers!?!   3.5 stars?!?  Really!?! They have 5 star service (Thanks Sunny for hooking us up!) & 4 stars for their delicious food!  Really, the service along with the food makes this a 5 star rating.    Husband ordered the Throwback and it was a very good burger.  The server recommended adding the Diablo sauce to the burger and it gave it a nice zing. I ordered the Truffle fries and they were soooo yummy!!!  Thin cut fries cooked perfectly with melty cheese and truffle oil.  Yummy!  I did try all the sauces jalapeno ranch, Diablo, garlic aioli & ketchup with truffle oil.  They all tasted good but I ate half the fries without any sauce ... They were that good!  And I'm a sauce person!!!  Finally, the dessert was the perfect ending.  Ice cream cookie!  Cut up so we could share but most importantly, the ice cream was firm!  ... Not runny!  I'm definitely coming back ... Funny because of the Vegas location, I will try out the ones in LA.  LOL!!!

I was not impressed with the fries (which we umami'd) or the BBQ wings. Service was kind lacking too. We couldn't get dude's attention for refills and for the check.

iSfyIZ26paK7QYFrEoJqmQ.text: There a quite a few interesting items on the menu, from truffle burgers and fries, to gourmet sausages.  I went for the Manly Burger and Smothered Fries (short rib and gravy on top of them).  The burger arrived looking anything but Manly.  However, there were large pieces of bacon as advertised.  The fries had a large pile of short rib and a thin coat of gravy.  The burger was cooked perfectly and had a good flavor to it.  The bun was sturdy and overall, except for the size was a very good burger.  The fries were ok but by themselves were nothing to write home about.

w56LeVG-SGogt-r_WN9yog.text: I was really looking forward to this place. Heard great things about their Los Angeles location. It did Not live up to the hype. Ordered my burger medium and it was deliver cold. In addition we waited 25 minutes to be seated in an empty restaurant and couldn't get a booth even though they were all empty and everyone that got seated after us got a booth. Weird level of service. They better get their act together because we have many options for burgers that are actually good.

_OSnEkrygiQHVlp70h_8CA.text: Worst hamburger I have ever had. The bun was so soggy I couldn't eat it. Salad was good, beer was warm, steer clear of this place, there are too many good places to eat in Las Vegas.

h-8mx1O_5Lu46tJjBtJ0ng.text: The signature Umami burger definitely fits the claim of rich and savory flavors. It takes control over everything else in a meal and delivers exactly what is promised. The bar is not quite as well stocked as I would hope and the service was nice enough if a bit slow at times. If you find yourself at or near the SLS, it's definitely worth trying.

zuuHk4QhwTArWKl2HhPbgQ.text: Have not been to Vegas in awhile. Umami Burger was across the street from our hotel.   The burgers were AMAZING! But what was even better was the service. Sunny, our server, was very attentive and a terrific personality.

-SwektpWKtFv4o6YzvRTSw.text: Our first experience here was awful! Great food- I'm obsessed with the Truffle burger!! But the service was so terrible! The manager convinced us to come back and I'm so glad we did! Mandy was great! Beautiful girl and definitely a seasoned server! Great place!

ymjBhNBU8H8HNnIw2PF8rA.text: Umami burger was delicious!!!Mandy l, our server, was awesome. Talked us through the menu and gave great suggestions

peXCc6s1ZtJeaDNRjlkeGw.text: First time at the umami in Las Vegas. As always the food is great. Ordered the Royale, onion rings, and peanut butter ice cream sandwich. The burger was mouthwatering good. If you haven't tried any variation of umami's truffle burgers you are seriously missing out.   I gave this umami 5 stars bc there is more variation of drinks/beers but also AJ was super sweet, attentive, and checked on our table all the time. Customer service is what makes this Umami burger stand out from the other umami's in LA that I've been to.

HXr74HWzdJqKx8IZ2ym7wA.text: Service was great! We just left lunch and were served by Mandy!!! She was the sweetest server ever!   Food is always awesomeeee!!! And if you haven't tried the Estrella Spanish beer- GET IT! (Gluten free and amazing)

l0XAYAogZHCt7fe4WokQ8A.text: I'm familiar with this place from Los Angeles.  I had great service when I came.  They were a little out of sorts/ unorganized but it was opening weekend so I expected some hiccups.  I like the burgers. The manly fries are killer. Ice cream sandwich with mint chip was good as well.   I'm sure you could probably customize some burgers to your liking if the menu items don't tickle your fancy. I will definitely come back.

72RWS6JsXu_BD4nJ49Q5bQ.text: Had an amazing experience here today!  Sunny, our server, was totally attentive and very helpful in picking out a solid set of beers. I had the Umami burger, and, though I was slightly disappointed to have only 1 mushroom, the burger was so perfect in medium rare that I didn't care once I started eating. I'll be back here for sure.

Jwuy9nT1jQ9jhAeghkzB4A.text: Foodwise, this was the best burger I've had in Vegas. We were staying across the street at the Hilton and after finding Unami on Bon Appetit's top 50 burgers list, I knew we had to roll over.  We came with a group of 8 and were easily seated outside at one of the picnic tables. Only disappointment with that is that we were seated on the far left side where there was no light. And it was bout 7pm and so it was dark. Would have been nice to be seated closer to the lit bar, or inside.  Drink specials during football season are amazing and so our beer drinkers were very pleased. I had a tequila/ginger beer cocktail that was delicious and well worth its $13 price tag.  Food wise, I had the cali burger and smothered fries. Everything was beyond delicious. The burger was thick and super juicy. I like the homemade american cheese and the caramelized onions were perfect. The smothered fries were heaven as the short rib was very tender and the gravy was super good. I had some of my cousin's beet salad and that was very good as well.   Service was my main reason for deducting a start as our server wasn't around very much. There would be long stints that she was gone, even though the restaurant was quite empty. She also quickly asked to process our check as she had tickets to a concert that night and wanted to leave as soon as she could. Made us feel really important.  Overall, I would definitely return for the food and atmosphere. This time I'll know better to request not to sit at the far end of the patio and will cross my fingers that there are no concerts going that night.

v1b-XjVJUtO-I1vciyehYw.text: Went on a thursday evening at 10pm and was sat indoors. There were 6 other tables/booths with people eating. I waited 10 minutes before my waitress came to the table to take my drink order. I ordered the pretzle, as that is why I came in the first place but was told they had run out earlier that day. Not quite sure how a restaurant runs out, but would have thought they would have made more instead of a certain quota since that is one item this place is known for. Ordered fried pickles and was disappointed that I only received 11 for $6 and don't expect your burger to come with any sides. My burger was $13 and it came with half a pickle spear. Only 6 oz burgers, but maybe that's before they're cooked as that burger didn't look like 6 oz to me.

L3Zg5MoyWQ3ko34QbkgNHg.text: Took advantage of #socialsundays all locals get 50% off on Sunday's! Best deal ever! My boyfriend wanted to watch the celtics/Cavs game and was looking for a spot to watch the game and enjoy some food. This was such a great choice! Definitely gonna be coming back. Love the atmosphere he loves beer and I love UMAMI burger. Perfect match!!!

OkwVO_nlI64O-MmB633cEw.text: Off the CHAIN! TOP NOTCH service, food, beverage and atmosphere!  It's my GF 1st time to Vegas and I'm a seasoned traveler and we will DEFINITELY be back to Umami Burger at the newly revitalized SLS!!! Special SHOUT OUT to Sunny who was Da BOMB server and made our second trip to Umami a memorable one :-)
